column28: Class A ZID.A; Class C RDU.C
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 9; Flight Attendant Total 9; Flight Attendant Type 75
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WAS AT TIMES OUT OF CTL; VERBALLY ABUSIVE AND DISRUPTIVE TO PAX AND CREW AROUND HIM. LATER HE PHYSICALLY VIOLATED ME; THE FIRST CLASS FLT ATTENDANT; BY PUSHING A PIECE OF COOKIE INTO MY BUTT. LATER; I RESEARCHED HIS HISTORY AND FOUND OUT THAT HE HAD BEEN A PROB PREVIOUSLY ON ANOTHER CARRIER. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: RPTR STATES THAT THE PAX SEEMED TO BE CALMING DOWN TOWARD THE END OF THE FLT; SO SHE DID NOT ASK FOR AN AGENT TO MEET THE FLT. THE PAX BECAME ABUSIVE AGAIN DURING THE STERILE COCKPIT PHASE AND WAS VERBALLY AND PHYSICALLY RUDE AND ABUSIVE TO THE WOMAN SEATED NEXT TO HIM. THE FLT ATTENDANT MOVED THE WOMAN TO A JUMP SEAT TO GET HER AWAY FROM THE PAX. SEVERAL MALE PAX OFFERED ASSISTANCE IF THE FLT ATTENDANT REQUESTED IT. THE RPTR WAS UNABLE TO HAVE THE AGENT DETAIN THE PAX BUT HAD HER CHK THE COMPUTER AND DETERMINE THAT HE HAD BEEN TROUBLESOME ON A PREVIOUS; CONNECTING FLT. HE WAS TRYING TO INTIMIDATE THE FLC ON ANOTHER CARRIER.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING AN ABUSIVE PAX ON BOARD A SUPER 80. HE WAS BOTH VERBALLY AND PHYSICALLY ABUSIVE TO THE FLT ATTENDANT AND OTHER PAX. AGENT DID NOT REMAIN AT THE JETWAY LONG ENOUGH FOR PAX TO BE DETAINED. IT WAS LATER LEARNED THAT HE HAD BEEN TRYING TO INTIMIDATE THE FLC ON A PREVIOUS; CONNECTING FLT WITH ANOTHER CARRIER.

column125: DC10 HAD PAX OUT OF HIS OR HER SEAT DURING PUSHBACK.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 2; Flight Attendant Total 2
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX SAID I WAS PRETTY WHEN HE CAME ON BOARD. I THANKED HIM. THEN HE STARTED HARASSING ME; SAYING THAT HE WOULD WAIT FOR ME OUTSIDE; THAT HE WAS GOING TO MARRY ME. FLT ATTENDANT #4 FOUND HIM POURING WHISKEY FROM HIS OWN PERSONAL BOTTLES. SHE TOOK THE BOTTLES AND INFORMED THE CAPT. THE PLANE WAS MET BY THE POLICE.
column125: DURING BOARDING ON AN MD80 A PAX COMMENTED THAT THE FLT ATTENDANT WAS 'PRETTY.' HE LATER STATED HE WAS GOING TO MARRY HER AND WOULD WAIT FOR HER OUTSIDE. FLT ATTENDANT #4 DISCOVERED HE WAS DRINKING FROM HIS OWN BOTTLES. THE CAPT WAS INFORMED AND CALLED FOR POLICE TO MEET THE ACFT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 41.3; Flight Attendant Total 14.3; Flight Attendant Type 25
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WAS CAUSING A DELAY DURING SECURITY CHK POINT. I WARNED CREW ABOUT PAX AND SAID TO KEEP AN EYE ON HIM. PAX WAS TRAVELING WITH ANOTHER MALE PAX. PAX SLEPT MOST OF THE FLT. I WAS SITTING IN COCKPIT WHEN FLT ATTENDANT #2 CAME IN AND SAID HOW PAX WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE (CALLING HER NAMES AND USING 4 LETTER WORDS) AND LOUD! I WENT UP TO THE PAX AND TOLD HIM TO CALM DOWN OR WE WOULD HAVE SECURITY MEET THE FLT. HE DID NOT CARE AND HE WANTED THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT'S NAME. THE FE CAME TO THE BACK AND ALSO TRIED TO TALK TO THE PAX (THE PAX USED THE SAME LANGUAGE WITH THE FE). FE SAID 'SIR; CALM DOWN OR SECURITY WILL BE WAITING.' PAX DIDN'T CARE. FE WAS ORDERING HIM TO GO BACK TO HIS SEAT; PAX WENT BACK. AS THE PLANE WAS ON FINAL; THE PAX GOT OUT OF HIS SEAT AND CAME BACK TO OUR JUMP SEAT (#2 AND #4). THE PAX WALKS WITH A CANE. I TOLD THE PAX TO GO BACK TO HIS SEAT AND HE SAID HE WANTED TO SEE THE GUYS NOW! I TOLD HIM THE GUYS WERE BUSY AND WE ARE ABOUT TO LAND; GO SIT DOWN! WE LANDED AND SECURITY MET THE FLT AND ARRESTED PAX. JUST A LITTLE NOTE: I TALKED TO THE PAX FRIEND AND ASKED HIM TO PLEASE TALK WITH HIS FRIEND AND HE SAID 'OH WHAT HAS HE DONE NOW' (NO HELP FROM HIS FRIEND).
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING A PAX ON BOARD A B727 WHO CAUSED A DELAY AT SECURITY CHK POINT; THEN BECAME VERY DISRUPTIVE DURING THE FLT. SECURITY WAS CALLED AND PAX WAS ARRESTED AT DEST ARPT.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column106: Flight Crew Multiengine; Flight Crew Commercial; Flight Crew Air Transport Pilot (ATP)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: WHILE BOARDING; THE FIRST FLT ATTENDANT ADVISED ME THAT THE PAX IN SEAT XX HAD A STRONG ODOR OF ALCOHOL ABOUT HIM AND HAD REQUESTED A DRINK. I DIRECTED FLT ATTENDANT NOT TO SERVE HIM ANY ALCOHOL BEVERAGES. A FEW MOMENTS LATER; THE PAX APPEARED IN THE COCKPIT DOOR TO TAKE EXCEPTION TO MY DECISION. AS SOON AS HE STARTED TALKING; I COULD SMELL THE ODOR OF ALCOHOL ON HIS BREATH. I EXPLAINED THE FARS ABOUT ALCOHOL AND INTOXICATION TO HIM; HOWEVER; HE CONTINUED TO BE ARGUMENTATIVE. I EXPLAINED THAT WE WERE VERY BUSY ABOUT 5 MINS BEFORE DEP; AND ASKED HIM TO TAKE HIS SEAT. HE REFUSED AND QUESTIONED MY AUTH TO DENY HIM HIS FREE DRINKS. AT THIS TIME I LEFT COCKPIT AND WENT UP THE JET BRIDGE TO HAVE THE AGENT CALL SECURITY AND HAVE THE PAX REMOVED FROM THE ACFT. THE PAX FOLLOWED ME UP THE JET BRIDGE AND WE WENT THROUGH THE WHOLE DISCUSSION AGAIN AT THE AGENT DESK. I THEN RETURNED TO THE COCKPIT TO PREPARE FOR DEP. THE PAX REBOARDED THE ACFT; TOOK HIS SEAT AND REFUSED TO DEPLANE. WHILE WE WERE WAITING FOR SECURITY TO SHOW UP; THE PAX HAD A CHANGE OF HEART AND CAME FORWARD TO APOLOGIZE. HE EXPLAINED THAT HE HAD BEEN TRAVELING 17 HRS; WAS TIRED; AND HAVING A BAD DAY. HE ASSURED ME THAT HE COULD BEHAVE FOR THE FLT TO ORD AND INTENDED TO SLEEP THE WAY. I DECIDED TO ALLOW HIM TO COME ALONG BECAUSE HE SEEMED SINCERE. HOWEVER; IN RETROSPECT; I SHOULD HAVE LEFT HIM AT SFO. FOR THE FIRST HALF OF THE FLT HE WAS LOUD; OBNOXIOUS AND VERBALLY ABUSIVE; USING PROFANE LANGUAGE. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 429020: JUST BEFORE SECURITY CAME; THE PAX CAME BACK TO THE COCKPIT AND SAID HE WOULD BEHAVE. THE CAPT DECIDED TO LET HIM STAY ON. ONCE IN THE AIR; THE PAX DID NOT DRINK; BUT MADE ALMOST CONTINUAL DEMANDS ON THE FLT ATTENDANT FOR MOST OF THE TRIP TO CHICAGO.
column125: THE CREW OF AN ACR MD80 ALLOWED AN INTOXICATED AND ABUSIVE PAX TO REMAIN ON BOARD AND LATER REGRETTED THAT DECISION.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 7; Flight Attendant Total 7; Flight Attendant Type 98
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: ENRTE TO PARIS; A FEMALE PAX SUMMONED MY ASSISTANCE (MRS X). SEATED NEARBY WAS HER CHILD. APPARENTLY; THE MALE PAX SEATED BEHIND HER WAS PREVENTING HER FROM RECLINING HER SEAT BY PUSHING IT FORWARD. I EXPLAINED TO THE MALE PAX; MR Y; THAT MRS X HAD EVERY RIGHT TO HAVE HER SEAT RECLINED. FURTHERMORE; THAT THE ALLOTTED SPACE WAS PRE-ESTABLISHED AND THAT WE COULD NOT POSSIBLY ACCOMMODATE HIM ANY FURTHER; DUE TO THE FULL CAPACITY OF THE AIRPLANE. AND; THAT I WOULD SUGGEST TO MRS X TO HAVE HER SEAT UPRIGHT DURING THE MEAL SVC; SO THAT HE WOULDN'T BE INCONVENIENCED ANY FURTHER. WELL; MR Y BECAME VERY IRATE; VERBALLY ABUSIVE AND MOTIONED WITH HIS BODY LANGUAGE THAT HE WANTED TO STRIKE ME. IN TURN; I RESPONDED FIRMLY AND ADVISED MR Y THAT HIS BEHAVIOR WAS UNACCEPTABLE ON THE AIRPLANE. THEN; I IMMEDIATELY NOTIFIED THE PURSER OF THE INCIDENT; AS WELL AS THE CAPT. THE CAPT SWIFTLY RESPONDED THAT HE WOULD IMMEDIATELY TURN THE AIRPLANE BACK TO BOSTON AND HAVE HIM ARRESTED; IF MR Y'S BEHAVIOR WOULD NOT IMPROVE. THE PURSER DELIVERED THE MESSAGE TO MR Y. APPARENTLY HE TRIED TO CTL HIS EMOTIONS AND REMAINED IN HIS SEAT WITHOUT FURTHER OUTBURSTS. ON MY PART; I SWITCHED SIDES WITH ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT AND STAYED CLR OF THIS INDIVIDUAL. LATER; INFLT; MRS X THANKED ME FOR MY EFFORTS AND APPRECIATED MY ATTEMPTS FOR TRYING TO REASON WITH MR Y.
column125: A FLT ATTENDANT ON AN AIRBUS 300 FROM BOSTON TO PARIS HAS A PAX WHO BECOMES VERY VERBALLY ABUSIVE AND APPEARS READY TO STRIKE THE FLT ATTENDANT. ALL THIS BECAUSE THE PAX IN FRONT IS TRYING TO RECLINE HER SEAT. THE FLT ATTENDANT NOTIFIES THE PURSER AND THE CAPT WHO INDICATES THAT HE WILL TURN THE ACFT BACK TO BOSTON IF THE PAX DOES NOT BEHAVE. PAX CALMS DOWN.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12.5; Flight Attendant Total 12.5; Flight Attendant Type 70
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PROB: PAX REFUSED TO KEEP HER DOGS IN THEIR CARRIER. COMPANY RULES STATE: 'ONLY 1 PET/CARRIER PER CUSTOMER.' SHE HAD 2. 'PETS MUST REMAIN UNDERNEATH THE SEAT IN KENNEL AT ALL TIMES WHILE ON BOARD THE ACFT.' MS X WAS ASKED MANY TIME (3 TIMES BY MYSELF PERSONALLY) TO PUT THE DOGS BACK IN THEIR CARRIERS BUT SHE REFUSED. SHE TOLD ME 'I KNOW THE RULES.' THE PAX NEXT TO HER HAD TO EAT WITH THOSE DOGS ON HER LAP THE WHOLE FLT. SHE SHOULD NOT BE ALLOWED TO BRING HER DOGS ON BOARD IF SHE CANNOT FOLLOW THE RULES. THE FIRST CLASS FLT ATTENDANT ASKED HER TO PUT THE DOGS UP -- BUT DID NOT FORCE THE ISSUE TO AVOID CONFLICT (I ASSUME). I THINK THAT THERE ARE HEALTH AND SAFETY ISSUES INVOLVED. MANY PEOPLE HAVE SEVERE ALLERGIES. FOOD SVC WITH THOSE DOGS; WHAT IF ONE OF THE DOGS HAD BITTEN SOMEONE?
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING A PAX ABOARD THE S80 WHO REFUSED TO KEEP HER DOGS IN THEIR CARRIERS. SHE WAS ASKED SEVERAL TIMES TO RETURN THEM TO THE CARRIERS BUT WOULD NOT.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Total 0.25
column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: MY CONTACT WITH PAX WAS LIMITED; ALTHOUGH I WITNESSED HIM CONFRONTING FLT ATTENDANT #1. MY EXPERIENCE WITH MR X WAS DURING THE BEVERAGE SVC WHEN HE CAME BACK TO ME AND THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS WORKING IN MAIN CABIN. HE COMMENTED ON OUR SVC IN A NEGATIVE MANNER. HIS COMMENT WAS 'OUR SVC SUCKED!' THE NEXT INCIDENT WAS WITH FLT ATTENDANT #1 IN THE FIRST CLASS GALLEY. HE WAS EXPRESSING HIS OPINION OF COMPANY AND WAS BADGERING THE FLT ATTENDANT TO ADMIT COMPANY WAS &*(%. THE FLT ATTENDANT WAS TRYING TO DISCOVER WHAT MR X WAS ANGRY ABOUT; BUT HE WOULD NOT DISCLOSE ANY INFO ABOUT THE PROB. HE CONTINUED TRYING TO INTIMIDATE THE FLT ATTENDANT TO ADMIT COMPANY WAS &*(%. SEVERAL OF THE FIRST CLASS PAX ATTEMPTED TO INTERFERE AND DEFEND THE FLT ATTENDANTS BY TELLING HIM THERE WAS NO REASON FOR HIS LANGUAGE AND BEHAVIOR. THEY WERE TOLD TO MIND THEIR OWN BUSINESS. HE ALSO WAS ANTAGONISTIC TOWARDS FIRST CLASS PAX NEEDING TO USE THE LAVATORY. HE WAVED THEM ON TO THE LAVATORY WITH COMMENTS LIKE -- THEY COULD USE THE LAVATORY BEFORE HIM BECAUSE THEY WERE FIRST CLASS AND HE WASN'T. THE FLT ATTENDANT #1 FINALLY CALMED HIM ENOUGH TO RETURN TO HIS SEAT BY TELLING HIM THE PROB WOULD BE RESOLVED ON THE GND. HE DID RETURN TO HIS SEAT; HOWEVER; SIGNALED THE FLT ATTENDANTS; WITH THE CALL BUTTON SEVERAL TIMES DURING THE REMAINDER OF THE FLT; THAT HE WISHED TO SPEAK WITH #1 FLT ATTENDANT. WHEN SHE WENT TO HIS SEAT; SHE WAS TOLD HE DIDN'T WANT TO TALK WITH HER. SHE AGAIN TOLD HIM THE PROB WOULD BE RESOLVED ON THE GND. HE EVENTUALLY FELL ASLEEP. NO ALCOHOL WAS SERVED DURING THE COURSE OF FLT; HOWEVER; HE DID ORDER 4 SOFT DRINKS LEADING US TO BELIEVE HE MAY HAVE BEEN MIXING HIS OWN ALCOHOL. NO MISCONDUCT FORM WAS GIVEN TO MR X BECAUSE WE FELT HE WOULD NOT REACT RATIONALLY AND CREATE BEHAVIOR WHICH WE MIGHT NOT HAVE BEEN ABLE TO CTL. I FEEL THE SIT WAS HANDLED IN THE BEST MANNER POSSIBLE CONSIDERING THE STATE OF MIND THE PAX WAS IN.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING AN S80 FLT ON WHICH A PAX BECAME CONFRONTATIONAL AND INTIMIDATING TO THE FLT ATTENDANTS; VERBALLY CHALLENGING THEM ABOUT THE SVC. HE ENTERED FIRST CLASS AREA AND WAS OBNOXIOUS TO THE FIRST CLASS PAX AS WELL.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 27; Flight Attendant Total 27; Flight Attendant Type 50
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX SEATED IN ROW A HAD WORDS WITH PAX IN ROW B. PAX IN ROW A BECAME VERBALLY AND PHYSICALLY ABUSIVE TO PAX IN ROW B. PAX IN ROW A HAD BEEN SUBDUED AND WAS STANDING AT SEAT XA. SHE THEN REACHED IN TO INSERT AND WITHDREW A SILVERWARE KNIFE. SHE HELD KNIFE IN HER FIST AND STARTED TOWARDS PAX IN ROW B. I STEPPED BTWN THEM AND TRIED TO DISARM THIS WOMAN (IN ROW A). MALE #3 FLT ATTENDANT THEN CAME TO ASSIST WITH #8 FLT ATTENDANT. WOMAN IN ROW A SEEMED TO CALM DOWN AND THEN SHE PUSHED PAST BOTH FLT ATTENDANTS AND PUSHED ME BACKWARDS OVER SEATS AT ROW A. FLT ATTENDANT #8 WENT TO COCKPIT AND HAD FO COME BACK. THE FO SUBDUED THE PAX AND TOLD HER TO SIT IN ROW D AND NOT TO GET UP OR SPEAK TO ANYONE OR SHE WOULD BE HANDCUFFED. THE PORT AUTH POLICE MET THE FLT AND ARPT SECURITY. I DON'T THINK THERE WAS ANY WAY TO PREVENT THIS TYPE OF BEHAVIOR. MOST PAX ARE NOT THAT VERBALLY OR PHYSICALLY ABUSIVE. I DON'T THINK I DID ANYTHING WRONG IN STEPPING BTWN THE PAX AND TRYING TO GET THE UTENSIL FROM HER. SHE COULD HAVE DONE SERIOUS DAMAGE TO THE OTHER PAX. MAYBE WE SHOULD ONLY HAVE PLASTIC UTENSILS ON BOARD ACFT INSTEAD OF METAL.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING A PAX WHO BECAME PHYSICALLY AND VERBALLY ABUSIVE TOWARD ANOTHER PAX ABOARD AN A300 ACFT AT CRUISE. SHE TOOK A KNIFE FROM THE CART AND STARTED TOWARDS THE OTHER PAX. THE RPTR STEPPED BTWN THE TWO WHILE ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT DISARMED THE ABUSIVE PAX. POLICE AND ARPT SECURITY MET THE ACFT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 7; Flight Attendant Total 10; Flight Attendant Type 70
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX BECAME VERY UPSET; WANTED OFF THE AIRPLANE. I HEARD A DISTURBANCE IN THE XA L/R DOOR AREA. I GOT OUT OF MY JUMP SEAT. I SAW FLT ATTENDANT #3 TRYING TO KEEP PAX FROM COMING FORWARD TO THE FIRST CLASS CABIN. THIS PAX APPEARED TO HAVE A MENTAL HANDICAP. I THOUGHT THIS SIT PRESENTED A SECURITY ISSUE ON OUR FLT. I ENTERED COCKPIT AND INFORMED THE CAPT. WE DECIDED LNDG AND REMOVING PAX WOULD BE BEST. AFTER THE PAX WAS TOLD THAT WE WERE RETURNING; HE CALMED DOWN AND WAS NOT A THREAT TO CREW OR PAX.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING A PAX ON BOARD A B757-200 WHO DECIDED HE NEEDED TO GET OFF THE ACFT AFTER DEP. THE SEAT BELT SIGN WAS STILL ON BUT HE TRIED TO MOVE FORWARD AND WAS DETAINED BY ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT. CAPT WAS INFORMED AND DECIDED IT BEST TO RETURN AND REMOVE THE PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 30; Flight Attendant Total 30; Flight Attendant Type 90
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: WHILE I WAS PICKING UP TRAYS IN COACH; THE PAX SAID SHE WANTED ANOTHER MEAL. I SAID THAT THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANT WAS JUST ABOUT FINISHED AND THAT I COULD OFFER THEM ANOTHER MEAL. THAT'S WHEN SHE SAID SHE WOULD PAY FOR IT AND STARTED SWEARING AND THREATENING TO HIT ME. THE CAPT WAS RELUCTANT TO BECOME INVOLVED; AND REQUEST THE AUTHS TO MEET THE FLT; UNTIL THE REST OF THE CREW PLEADED AND URGED THAT HE DO SO. HE ASKED IF THE PAX HAD STRUCK ME YET BEFORE HE CONSIDERED HELPING. I WAS COMPLETELY DISILLUSIONED WITH THIS CREW MEMBER; NOT TO MENTION THAT I KNEW I COULD NOT COMPLETELY DEPEND ON THIS MAN IN AN EMER. IF I'VE LEARNED ANYTHING IN THE LAST 10 YRS OR SO; IT IS THAT IT'S BEEN OPEN SEASON ON FLT ATTENDANTS AND THAT IF WE ALLOW PAX TO VERBALLY ABUSE AND THREATEN TO STRIKE US AND NOT FOLLOW UP BY RPTING THE INCIDENT IMMEDIATELY; THEN WE'VE SET THE FLT ATTENDANTS BACK YRS. THE WOMAN INVOLVED THREATENED PHYSICAL VIOLENCE AND WAS VULGAR AND ABUSIVE AND NEVER STOPPED YELLING; EVEN WHEN THE POLICE AND SECURITY QUESTIONED HER. I'D LIKE TO KNOW; WAS I WRONG IN ASSUMING THAT THE CAPT SHOULD HAVE BEEN WILLING TO ASSIST? AND IF I'M NOT; WAS THIS CAPT INFORMED AS MUCH? CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: RPTR STATES THAT THE ENTIRE CREW WAS ANNOYED THAT THE CAPT WOULD NOT ACT. IT SEEMED THAT HE WAS WAITING FOR A FLT ATTENDANT TO BE ACTUALLY PHYSICALLY ATTACKED BEFORE HE WOULD ACT. IT TOOK THE INPUT OF THE CABIN ATTENDANTS TO FORCE HIM TO CONTACT SECURITY. SHE HAS HEARD THAT THIS PAX WILL NO LONGER BE ALLOWED TO FLY ON COMPANY ACFT. THE CAPT LATER APOLOGIZED TO RPTR AND WHEN ASSIGNED ON ANOTHER FLT HE APOLOGIZED AGAIN. RPTR WAS GRATIFIED AT HIS COMMENTS BUT FELT THE SIT WAS VERY DEMEANING; AND A POOR EXAMPLE OF CABIN/COCKPIT RESPECT.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING A PAX WHO BECAME VERY VOLATILE; VERBALLY ABUSIVE AND THREATENED TO HIT THE FLT ATTENDANT. THE CAPT WAS RELUCTANT TO CONTACT AUTHS TO MEET THE PLANE. HE FINALLY DID WHEN THE REST OF THE CABIN CREW PREVAILED UPON HIM.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: WE WERE INFORMED AT COMPLETION OF FLT THAT AN FAA EMPLOYEE; RIDING JUMP; SEAT OBSERVED PEOPLE STANDING DURING PUSH. WE HAD CONFIRMATION FROM FLT ATTENDANT THAT 'ALL SEATED; CABIN SECURE' BUT SOMEBODY WAS IN A LAVATORY AND MOVED BACK TO SEAT DURING THE PUSH.
column125: A B737 DURING PUSHBACK HAD A PAX EXIT THE LAVATORY AND MOVE BACK TO A SEAT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 9; Flight Attendant Total 9; Flight Attendant Type 40
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: THE SIT AROSE WHEN A PAX ON OUR FLT TO CCS BECAME IRATE WHEN HE WAS ASKED TO CHK HIS ROLLER BOARD SUITCASE. WE WERE INFORMED BY THE AFT FLT ATTENDANTS THAT ALL OVERHEAD BINS WERE FULL. HE WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO OUR PURSER; EXTREMELY INSULTING AND WOULD NOT COMPLY WITH HER REQUESTS. WE ENDED UP WANTING HIM REMOVED FROM THE FLT BECAUSE OF HOW SCARY HE BECAME BUT THE CAPT LET HIM PUT HIS SUITCASE UNDER A SEAT AND HE WAS LEFT ON BOARD. WE MOVED OTHER PAX TO ACCOMMODATE HIS SUITCASE. CARRY-ON LUGGAGE SEEMS TO BE OUR #1 PROB WITH PAX. THEY WON'T COMPLY WITH THE RULES WITHOUT A CONFRONTATION FIRST. OUR SOUTH AMERICAN AND CENTRAL AMERICAN PAX SEEM TO BE THE WORST ABOUT UNDERSTANDING AND COMPLYING WITH OUR LUGGAGE REGS. EVERYONE WANTS TO PUT THEIR SUITCASES PILED IN THE CLOSETS OR AT THEIR FEET. THE SIT IS NOT UNDER CTL WHERE CARRY-ON BAGS ARE CONCERNED. EVEN THE '2 BAG ONLY' RULE DOESN'T SEEM TO WORK WHEN PURSES; BRIEFCASES; COMPUTERS; ETC; DON'T COUNT. PEOPLE DON'T WANT TO SEPARATE FROM THEIR BELONGINGS. WHAT DO WE DO WHEN WE ARE LEFT AT FL300 FOR 3 HRS WITH VERBALLY ABUSIVE PAX?
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING A PAX WHO WOULD NOT COMPLY WITH REQUESTS TO CHK HIS ROLLER BOARD SUITCASE. HE INSISTED ON STORING IT UNDER HIS SEAT BECAUSE ALL THE OVERHEAD BINS WERE FILLED. HE WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE AND FLT ATTENDANTS REQUESTED THAT HE BE REMOVED FROM THE FLT. THE CAPT WOULD NOT DO SO AND OTHER PAX HAD TO BE MOVED TO ACCOMMODATE HIM.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 6; Flight Attendant Total 6; Flight Attendant Type 10
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX STOLE ALCOHOL OUT OF FIRST CLASS AND THEN WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO CREW.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPTR CAUGHT VERBALLY ABUSIVE PAX STEALING LIQUOR OUT OF FIRST CLASS.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 11; Flight Attendant Total 11; Flight Attendant Type 90
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX A AND PAX B WERE COMING DOWN THE JETBRIDGE WITH MANY SHOPPING BAGS EACH -- PROBABLY 4 EACH. WE WERE VERY CLOSE TO DEP TIME. THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT HAD ALREADY CALLED THE GATE AGENTS TWICE TO TELL THEM WE HAVE NO MORE STOWAGE EXCEPT UNDERSEAT STOWAGE; PRIOR TO THESE 2 PAX COMING DOWN THE JETBRIDGE. AS THEY ARE COMING DOWN THE JETBRIDGE WITH THE AGENT; I AGAIN INFORMED EVERYONE 'WE HAVE NO STOWAGE LEFT EXCEPT UNDER SEAT.' I AM NOW STANDING IN FORWARD AREA WITH FLT ATTENDANT #1 AND WE ARE HEARING THESE 2 WOMEN SCREAMING AT THE TOP OF THEIR LUNGS (SOMETIMES ITALIAN; SOMETIMES ENGLISH). BOTH WOMEN PROCEEDED TO TOSS ALL THEIR BAGS IN THE FORWARD ENTRY AREA CLOSET. I SAID TO BOTH OF THEM; 'YOU CAN'T STOW THOSE BAGS IN THERE; WE CAN'T STACK BAGS.' THEN MS A CUTS ME OFF SAYING SOMETHING TO THE EFFECT OF; 'WE DON'T HAVE TO LISTEN TO YOU; WE'RE NOT CHKING THESE BAGS; THEY'RE BREAKABLE.' THEN MS A INSTRUCTS MS B TO LEAVE HER BAGS IN THE CLOSET AND SHE (MS B) DOESN'T HAVE TO LISTEN TO US. THEY WANTED TO PROCEED TO THEIR SEATS. I TOLD THEM THEY WEREN'T LISTENING TO WHAT I WAS SAYING. THEY (ESPECIALLY MS A) WERE OVERTALKING; SHOUTING AT ME AND THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT. A MALE AGENT WAS STANDING BEHIND MS B AND THE AGENT SAID SOMETHING TO HER. THE NEXT THING I KNOW; MS B SCREAMS AT THE AGENT 'DON'T TOUCH ME' AND SHOVES THE MALE AGENT. THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT AND I CALLED TO THE CAPT AT THE SAME TIME. AS SOON AS MS A SAW THE CAPT THERE WAS A TRANSFORMATION IN ATTITUDE. I LEFT THE SCENE AFTER I TOLD THE CAPT THEY BOTH SHOULD BE REMOVED; THEY INTERFERED WITH FLT ATTENDANT DUTIES AND WERE VERBALLY OUT OF CTL. THE CAPT ALLOWED MS A TO STAY ON ACFT WITH HER 4 BAGS AND HAD TO HAVE AGENTS CALL POLICE TO HAVE MS B REMOVED.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING 2 PAX WHO WERE BOARDING CLOSE TO DEP WHEN NO OVERHEAD SPACE WAS LEFT. THEY BOTH CARRIED ABOUT 4 SHOPPING BAGS AND SCREAMED THAT THEY WOULD NOT ALLOW THEM TO BE CHKED AS THEY WERE BREAKABLE. A GATE AGENT SAID SOMETHING TO ONE OF THEM AND SHE SHOUTED 'DON'T TOUCH ME' AND SHOVED HIM. THE CAPT WAS CALLED AND HE ALLOWED ONE TO STAY AND REMOVED THE OTHER PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 9; Flight Attendant Total 9; Flight Attendant Type 95
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FLT ATTENDANT #1 WAS DOING OUR SECOND SVC. I HAD JUST GIVEN THE PAX HIS MEAL BECAUSE I WAS IN FRONT OF XXX. I WAS A COUPLE OF ROWS IN FRONT OF HER WHEN SHE SAID; '...I NEED YOUR HELP;' SO I TURNED AROUND TO SEE WHAT SHE NEEDED. SHE STARTED TELLING ME SHE WAS HAVING A PROB WITH THIS PAX. SHE TOLD ME THAT SHE ASKED HIM WHAT HE WANTED TO DRINK AND HE TOLD HER SHE NEEDED TO SPEAK TO HIM IN ENGLISH. AS I'M STANDING THERE; HE WAS SAYING THAT SHE WAS NOT A GOOD FLT ATTENDANT AND THAT SHE SHOULDN'T BE DOING THIS JOB AND HE WAS GETTING LOUD. I TOLD HIM THAT HE SHOULDN'T SPEAK TO HER THAT WAY. HE TOLD ME HE WANTED MY NAME AND I TOLD HIM I WOULDN'T GIVE HIM MY NAME. I WENT AND TORE THE ADDRESS OUT OF THE MAGAZINE; IF HE HAD A COMPLAINT HE COULD WRITE ACR X; BUT I WOULD NOT GIVE HIM MY NAME.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPTR ON B767-300ER FROM GRU-JFK RPTED INCIDENT WITH LOUD PAX UPSET WITH FLT ATTENDANT FOR NOT SPEAKING ENGLISH.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12; Flight Attendant Total 12; Flight Attendant Type 40
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX CAME TO AFT GALLEY DURING BOARDING PROCESS TO PURCHASE AN ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE. I INFORMED HIM THAT WE DON'T SELL ALCOHOL ON THE GND DURING BOARDING; BUT I DID OFFER WATER OR SODA. HE DECLINED OFFER; STARTED GIVING ME A HARD TIME ABOUT NOT GIVING HIM A DRINK -- WAS CALLING ME NAMES. I ADVISED HIM THAT THIS WAS OUR PROC; AND THAT IF HE DIDN'T LIKE IT THAT HE COULD GET OFF THE PLANE AND FIND ANOTHER WAY TO HIS DEST. HE SMELLED STRONGLY OF ALCOHOL; AND I NOTICED THAT HIS SEAT WAS THE 'F' SEAT (WINDOW) AT THE EMER EXIT ROW. I INFORMED THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT; WHO INFORMED CAPT. CAPT CALLED ME ON CREW INTERPHONE AND ASKED ME TO HAVE PAX COME TO FORWARD BOARDING DOOR; WHERE CAPT WOULD BE WAITING FOR HIM. WHEN I WENT TO PAX'S SEAT; HE REFUSED TO GO TO FRONT OF PLANE. I ADVISED CAPT OF THIS. HE ASKED ME TO TELL PAX THAT HE COULD COME FORWARD ON HIS OWN OR HE WOULD BE PHYSICALLY REMOVED FROM SEAT. PAX WENT FORWARD TO SPEAK WITH CAPT. CAPT ORIGINALLY TOLD PAX HE COULD REMAIN ON PLANE; BUT THAT HE WOULD BE SERVED NO ALCOHOL; AND THAT IF HE HARASSED FLT ATTENDANTS HE WOULD BE REMOVED. PAX CLAIMED CAPT WAS PICKING ON HIM; HE ONLY WANTED TO GO TO VANCOUVER AND 'NOT BRING A BOMB ON PLANE.' WITH THIS COMMENT; CAPT HAD PAX REMOVED. WHEN AGENT SAW PAX; SHE COMMENTED THAT PAX HAD GIVEN HER A HARD TIME AT BOARDING GATE. PAX SHOULD NEVER HAVE BEEN ALLOWED ON PLANE.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING A PAX WHO BOARDED THE ACFT AND REQUESTED AN ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE. WHEN TOLD THAT WAS NOT POSSIBLE HE STARTED TO GIVE THE FLT ATTENDANT A BAD TIME AND CALLING HER NAMES. HE SMELLED STRONGLY OF ALCOHOL AND HIS SEAT ASSIGNMENT WAS AT AN EMER EXIT. WHEN CAPT WAS INFORMED HE REQUESTED THE PAX TO COME FORWARD TO SPEAK WITH HIM. DURING THEIR DISCUSSION THE PAX STATED 'WELL IT IS NOT LIKE I AM BRINGING A BOMB ON THE PLANE.' THE PAX WAS REMOVED.

column94: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WAS DRUNK; TRIED TO STEAL FROM FLT ATTENDANT'S BAG AND LIQUOR CART. REFUSED TO SIT DOWN; WANDERED THE CABIN. TRIED TO STRIKE FLT ATTENDANT (ME); DEFECATED ON HERSELF. CAUSED A PROB THROUGHOUT FLT.
column125: PURSER'S RPT ON DRUNK; PHYSICALLY ABUSIVE PAX WHO INTERFERED WITH FLT ATTENDANT DUTIES AND WAS CAUGHT STEALING.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model

column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: 2 PAX BEGAN FIST FIGHTING WHILE IN THEIR SEATS DURING DSCNT AND TAXI IN. PAX AROUND THEM TRIED TO RESTRAIN THEM. A FLT ATTENDANT FINALLY CALMED THEM DOWN AND REMAINED WITH THEM UNTIL AUTHS ARRIVED.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPTED ON S80 THAT ON LNDG IN CHM; 2 PAX HAD A FIST FIGHT AND WERE DETAINED BY CABIN ATTENDANTS FOR AUTHS.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 9; Flight Attendant Total 9; Flight Attendant Type 75
column105: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Other / Unknown; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column118: General None Reported / Taken; General Physical Injury / Incapacitation
column121: PAX WAS DRINKING BEFORE INCIDENT. WHILE I WAS IN THE GALLEY; PAX CAME BACK TO AISLE FOR WINE. I TOLD HER WE WERE OUT. SHE REMAINED IN THE GALLEY; AND PROCEEDED TO GO THROUGH OUR BEVERAGE CARTS. I STEPPED OUT OF THE GALLEY INTO THE AISLE FOR A MIN; AND RETURNED TO THE GALLEY TO FIND THE PAX GOING THROUGH MY TOTE BAG. I BELIEVE ALCOHOL WAS THE CONTRIBUTING FACTOR; AND THE FACT THAT WE HAD A FULL FLT. IT WAS DIFFICULT FOR THE CREW TO REALLY KEEP TABS ON WHO WAS DRINKING EXCESSIVELY. THIS PAX ASKED THE FLT ATTENDANTS FOR DRINKS ON BOTH AISLES; AND UNTIL SHE WAS REALLY INTOXICATED SHE STOOD OUT FROM THE REST. I KNOW THAT THE PURSER CAME TO SPEAK WITH THIS PAX; AND SHE WAS SHOVED AGAINST A CART. AS A CREW MEMBER I WAS DISAPPOINTED THAT THE SECURITY PERSONNEL WHO MET THE FLT IN MADRID WERE UNABLE TO DO ANYTHING; AND EVEN BOARDED HER IN THE SAME BUS AS ALL OF US CREW MEMBERS.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT ON AN AGGRESSIVE; INTOXICATED PAX; MIA; FL-MAD; SPAIN; TRYING TO STEAL LIQUOR AND SHOVING PURSER AGAINST CART. NO ARREST MADE.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12.5; Flight Attendant Total 12.5; Flight Attendant Type 30
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I HAD FINISHED TAKING THE PAX'S TICKET AT THE GATE; AND BOARDED THE PLANE FOR OUR FLT TO LGA. I WAS CLOSING THE FORWARD COAT CLOSET; WHEN A PAX CAME FORWARD FROM COACH AND ASKED ME TO HANG HIS COAT BECAUSE 'IT WAS WORTH MORE THAN OUR SALARIES.' HE RETURNED TO COACH; CONTINUING TO STAND UP; TAKING HIS TIME SITTING DOWN. THE AGENT WAS WAITING TO CLOSE THE DOOR AND HE WAS OBVIOUSLY DELAYING THE FLT. HE MADE A COMMENT TO FLT ATTENDANT #3; A MALE FLT ATTENDANT; ASKING A VERY RUDE QUESTION. THE FLT ATTENDANT #3 RESPONDED BY SAYING; 'THAT'S IT -- YOU'RE OFF THE PLANE.' THE CAPT WAS NOTIFIED OF THE SIT AND REMOVED THE PAX FROM THE ACFT. THE FIRST CLASS PAX SAID HE WAS 'CAUSING PROBS' IN THE TERMINAL ALSO; BECAUSE HE WAS UNABLE TO GET A FIRST CLASS SEAT ON THE FLT TO LGA. THE PAX SVC REPRESENTATIVE CAME ON BOARD THE ACFT; AND REMOVED HIM FROM THE FLT. AS THE PAX LEFT THE ACFT; HE TOLD US TO NOT 'CHEW TOO MANY PILLOWS!' I HAVE NO IDEA WHAT HE MEANT; BUT WE WERE ALL GLAD HE WAS TAKEN OFF THE FLT. THE FLT CONTINUED ON WITH NO FURTHER INTERRUPTIONS.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT ON VERBALLY ABUSIVE PAX THAT CAPT HAD GND AGENT REMOVE ON BOARDING IN DFW.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 16; Flight Attendant Total 16; Flight Attendant Type 75
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: WE HAD A PAX CARRYING SHOTGUN SHELLS. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: RPTR STATES THAT THE PAX SEEMED A BIT 'LOONY' AND CLAIMED HE WAS A PREACHER. THERE WAS A 'CRAZY WOMAN' ON THE FLT GIVING THE FLT ATTENDANTS A DIFFICULT TIME AND THE PREACHER OFFERED TO PRAY FOR HER. HE WAS ACTUALLY INTERFERING WITH THE HANDLING OF THE OTHER DIFFICULT PAX; WANTING TO PRAY FOR HER. THE RELIEF OFFICER CAME OUT TO TALK TO THE WOMAN AND HER HUSBAND WHEN THE FIRST PAX REACHED INTO HIS POCKET FOR HIS CROSS AND PULLED OUT SOME SHOTGUN SHELLS. THIS IS WHEN IT WAS DECIDED TO HAVE SECURITY MEET THE ACFT. AMONG ALL THE OTHER DIFFICULTIES HAPPENING ON THIS FLT WAS THE QUESTION OF HOW THIS PAX GOT THROUGH SECURITY WITH THESE SHELLS. SECURITY MET THE ACFT AND THE WOMAN BECAME EVEN MORE AGGRESSIVE. RPTR DOES NOT KNOW WHAT FOLLOWED REGARDING THE PAX OR IF THE COMPANY HAS FOLLOWED UP. SHE WAS ADVISED OF THE FAA HOTLINE.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING A B767 ON WHICH THERE WERE SOME STRANGE PAX WHO MADE THEIR WORK VERY DIFFICULT. ONE PAX HAD SHOT GUN SHELLS IN HIS POCKET. THESE WERE SEPARATE INCIDENTS BUT BOTH TROUBLESOME AND SECURITY WAS CALLED TO MEET THE ACFT.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 0.7; Flight Attendant Total 37; Flight Attendant Type 90
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WAS IN THE AFT PORTION OF THE ACFT WHEN PAX WERE BOARDING. AFTER A FEW MINS; AN ODOR OF ALCOHOL BEGAN TO FILTER THROUGH THE CABIN AREA. I CHKED TO SEE IF IT WAS THE PAX SITTING NEAR THE GALLEY; BUT IT WAS NOT. I BEGAN TO WALK TO THE FRONT OF THE ACFT; NOTICING ALONG THE WAY THE ODOR GETTING STRONGER. I MENTIONED TO THE OTHER 2 FLT ATTENDANTS THAT EITHER MY NOSE WAS BEGINNING TO BE REAL SENSITIVE; OR WE HAVE SOME INEBRIATED PAX ON BOARD. THEY AGREED THERE WAS A PENETRATING ODOR. AT THAT TIME THE CAPT HEARD MY COMMENT; AND SAID THAT HE WOULD NOT BE INTERESTED IN DEALING WITH PEOPLE WHO HAD BEEN DRINKING. I DECIDED I BETTER CHK ONE MORE TIME. AS I PASSED BY XXX SEATS; THE PAX APPEARED TO HAVE A STARE THAT CAUSED ME TO STOP AND ASK IF THEY NEEDED ANYTHING. THEY SAID NO AND APOLOGIZED FOR BOTHERING ME. I TURNED TO GO BACK TO THE FRONT AND NOTIFY THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT THAT I WOULD RECOMMEND PAX IN SEATS XXX NOT HAVE ANY ALCOHOL. SHE AGREED. I AGAIN WALKED PAST SEATS XXX; I NOTICED THE ALCOHOL ODOR AGAIN; AND NOTICED THEY HAD THE SAME STARE. I MADE MY WAY BACK TO MAIN CABIN TO TURN BACK AND NOTIFY THE CAPT OF THE SIT. I EXPLAINED THE SIT AFTER WHICH HE DECIDED THAT HE HAD BETTER TALK WITH THEM. THE COUPLE MET THE CAPT ON THE JETBRIDGE AT WHICH TIME HE GAVE STRICT INSTRUCTIONS REGARDING BEHAVIOR WHILE ON BOARD; THAT THEY WILL NOT BE SERVED ANY MORE ALCOHOL; AND THAT DRINKING AND TAKING MEDICATION IS DANGEROUS. THEY AGREED. AS THEY TURNED TO GO BACK TO THEIR SEATS; THE GENTLEMAN SWAYED IN HIS WALK AS THE CAPT AND I STOOD BY. AT THAT TIME THE CAPT WENT TO GET THE AGENT. THE AGENT SPOKE WITH THE PAX; AND GAVE THEIR ASSURANCE THAT THEY WOULD NOT CAUSE A PROB. UNFORTUNATELY; THE CAPT WAS STILL UNEASY; AND THE AGENT CALLED COMPANY TO GAIN DIRECTION. AGAIN; THE DECISION WAS LEFT TO THE CAPT. HE APPEARED VERY UNEASY TO TAKE THE PAX. AT THAT TIME I ADVISED THE CAPT OF MY CONCERN; WHICH WAS THE LADY WAS DRINKING AND TAKING MEDICATION; WOULD BE ON AN AIRPLANE FOR 3 1/2 HRS AT FL330. I MENTIONED TO HIM THAT COMPLICATIONS COULD ARISE MIDAIR; AND THEN WE WOULD REALLY BE IN A FIX! I SAID I WAS NOT COMFORTABLE WITH THAT IDEA. AT THAT TIME; THE CAPT MADE HIS DECISION TO HAVE THEM REMOVED.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING THE BOARDING OF AN MD80 WITH 2 INTOXICATED PAX WHO SMELLED STRONGLY OF ALCOHOL. FLT ATTENDANT SPOKE TO THEM AND THEY HAD A STRANGE STARE WHICH LED THE FLT ATTENDANT TO BELIEVE THEY MIGHT ALSO BE ON DRUGS OR SOME KIND OF MEDICATION. AFTER DISCUSSION WITH THE CAPT AND COMPANY; THEY WERE REMOVED FROM THE FLT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 8; Flight Attendant Total 8; Flight Attendant Type 10
column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: WE HAD BEEN SENT TO THE 'PENALTY BOX' TO AWAIT THE OPENING OF OUR GATE. SEVERAL PA'S HAD BEEN MADE TO REMAIN SEATED AND KEEP THE AISLES CLR OF CARRY-ON LUGGAGE. A PAX GOT OUT OF HER SEAT AND OPENED A BIN AND RETRIEVED HER LUGGAGE; WHICH WAS THEN PLACED IN THE AISLE. I SAW THIS TAKE PLACE; SO I PROCEEDED UP THE AISLE TO CLOSE THE BIN AND GET THE LUGGAGE OUT OF THE AISLE. THE PAX REFUSED TO MOVE THE BAG; SO I BENT DOWN TO PICK IT UP AND PLACE IT IN THE BIN. AT THIS POINT; SHE YELLED AT ME AND SNATCHED THE BAG OUT OF MY HANDS. I WARNED THE WOMAN THAT INTERFERING WITH MY SAFETY RELATED DUTIES WAS NOT ACCEPTABLE. I REMOVED MYSELF FROM THE SIT TO RETRIEVE A WRITTEN WARNING CONCERNING HER BEHAVIOR. WHEN I HANDED IT TO HER SHE CRUMPLED THE PAPER AND THREW IT AT ME. SHE SAID; AND I QUOTE; 'YOU WILL NOT TELL ME WHEN I CAN OR CAN'T GET IN THE BINS OR WHAT I CAN OR CANNOT DO WITH MY LUGGAGE.' AUTHS MET THE FLT -- NO CHARGES WERE FILED.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT ON PAX REFUSING TO STOW BAG ON TAXI IN TO ORD ON B767-200 (SFO-ORD).

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 0.25; Flight Attendant Total 0.25; Flight Attendant Type 25
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: ON MAR/XA/99 ON FLT FROM JFK TO LAX; A FLT ATTENDANT FROM MAIN CABIN CAME UP TO THE SVC CTR BTWN FIRST CLASS AND BUSINESS CLASS ON THE MD DC10 AND TOLD THE PURSER THAT SHE HAD CAUGHT A MAN SMOKING IN THE LAVATORY. SHE RPTED THAT HE HAD SMOKED AGAIN AFTER SHE HAD WARNED THE 2 GUYS. THE PURSER WENT BACK TO WARN THEM. SHE SAID THEY LAUGHED AT HER AND SHE WENT UP TO THE COCKPIT TO HAVE SOMEONE MEET THE FLT. I SAW NOTHING; SINCE I WAS WORKING IN BUSINESS CLASS. I ONLY OVERHEARD THE CONVERSATION BTWN THE MAIN CABIN FLT ATTENDANT AND THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT ON PAX SMOKING IN LAVATORY ON DC10 JFK-LAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12; Flight Attendant Total 12; Flight Attendant Type 99
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING BOARDING; A FOREIGN PAX DEMANDED A SMOKING SEAT. Y CLASS FLT ATTENDANTS EXPLAINED THERE WAS NO SMOKING PERMITTED. HE RAISED HIS VOICE IN DISAPPROVAL AND DEMANDED HIS SEAT BE CHANGED FOR A SMOKING AREA. WE FURTHER EXPLAINED THERE WAS NO SMOKING ANYWHERE ON THE PLANE. I WAS CALLED TO HANDLE THE SIT. I REPEATED WHAT HE HAD HEARD BEFORE AND WITH THAT HE BEGAN YELLING IN THE MIDDLE OF THE Y CLASS WHAT A HORRIBLE AIRLINE WE WERE. HIS ACTIONS WERE NOT THAT OF A NORMAL PERSON AND I GOT CLOSE ENOUGH TO SMELL HVY ALCOHOL ON HIS BREATH. I HAD THE AGENTS ESCORT HIM OFF THE PLANE. ON THE JETBRIDGE; I EXPLAINED THAT HIS ACTIONS DEMONSTRATED THAT HE WAS INTOXICATED AND IT WAS AGAINST THE LAW TO TRANSPORT A PAX KNOWN TO BE INTOXICATED. I EXPLAINED TO HIM THAT IT WAS FOR HIS PROTECTION THAT I WAS REFUSING HIM. I EXPLAINED THAT IF HIS ACTION CONTINUED THAT WAY INFLT WE WOULD HAVE TO HAVE HIM ARRESTED. WITH THAT HE BEGAN TO REMOVE HIS JACKET AND WANT TO FIGHT ME. I ASKED THE AGENTS TO ESCORT HIM OFF THE JETBRIDGE. BEFORE HE LEFT; HE SAID HE HOPED THE PLANE WOULD GO DOWN. I TOLD HIM THAT HIS STATEMENT WAS FURTHER PROOF THAT IT WAS SAFER FOR HIM TO GO TO A HOTEL RATHER THAN BE ARRESTED ON THE PLANE. WE LEFT WITH NO DELAY AND NO FURTHER PROBS.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING A PAX WHO BOARDED INTOXICATED AND DEMANDED A SEAT IN THE SMOKING SECTION. HE BECAME VERY VERBAL AND VERY LOUD AND WAS ESCORTED TO THE JETBRIDGE. HE WAS INFORMED OF THE LAW ABOUT TRANSPORTING AN INTOXICATED PAX; THEN TOOK OFF HIS JACKET TO FIGHT THE FLT ATTENDANT. HE WAS REMOVED.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 1.2; Flight Attendant Total 1.2; Flight Attendant Type 80
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other Bomb Threat
column121: A PAX IN FIRST CLASS JOKINGLY DECLARES HE HAS A BOMB IN HIS SUITCASE AT HIS FEET AND THAT IS HIS REASON FOR NOT STOWING HIS 'ROLLER BOARD' AFTER BEING INSTRUCTED BY 3 DIFFERENT FLT ATTENDANTS TO DO SO. (HIS INTERPRETER RELAYS HIS MESSAGE TO US.) THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT RPTS THE 'JOKE' TO THE COCKPIT. THEY CONTACT AUTHS. THE PAX BAGS ARE SEARCHED. THE PAX BAGS FROM BELOW; IN BAGGAGE; ARE REMOVED AND X-RAYED. THE PAX; HIS BELONGINGS; AND HIS INTERPRETER ARE REMOVED FROM THE FLT. WHAT BOTHERS ME IS THE WAY IT WAS HANDLED. WHOMEVER THE AUTHS WERE THAT SEARCHED HIS BAGS WERE -- THEY OPENED HIS BAGS ON THE JETBRIDGE AND TOOK EVERYTHING OUT -- AT THE OPENED ENTRY DOOR! IF THEY TRULY THOUGHT THIS AS A SERIOUS THREAT; WHY WOULD THEY SEARCH THE BAGS RIGHT NEXT TO A FULL FLT OF PAX? WAS THEIR SAFETY AND THE ENTIRE CREWS' SAFETY NOT AT RISK HERE? I MENTIONED THIS OBSERVATION AND RECEIVED NO EXPLANATION! I WAS LOOKED AT BRIEFLY AND MY QUESTION WAS IGNORED! CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: RPTR STATES THAT SHE DID NO FURTHER FOLLOW UP WITH THE COMPANY AFTER THE FLC BLEW HER OFF WHEN SHE QUESTIONED THE SIT. SHE HAS NO IDEA WHAT WAS FOUND WHEN THE PAX BAGGAGE WAS X-RAYED; BUT THAT IS WHEN THE DECISION TO REMOVE THE PAX WAS MADE. RPTR WAS ADVISED OF THE HOTLINE SINCE SHE IS STILL FRUSTRATED BY THE HANDLING OF THE INCIDENT BY SECURITY.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT REGARDING A PAX WHO JOKED ABOUT HAVING A BOMB IN HIS CASE AT HIS FEET. HE HAD BEEN ASKED TO PLACE IT IN THE OVERHEAD AND THAT WAS HIS EXCUSE FOR NOT STOWING IT. HIS BAG WAS TAKEN AND CHKED; BUT RIGHT IN THE JETWAY. HIS BAGGAGE FROM THE CARGO HOLD WAS REMOVED AND X-RAYED. PAX WAS THEN REMOVED FROM THE ACFT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 13; Flight Attendant Total 13; Flight Attendant Type 50
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX CHKED 2 BAGS/BOXES FOR 2 PAX HE DID NOT KNOW. AFTER TKOF HE COULD NOT FIND THE PAX ON BOARD. FLT ATTENDANT WAS NOTIFIED; CAPT WAS NOTIFIED; AND WE DIVERTED TO MBJ. ALL BAGS TAKEN OFF ACFT; PAX CLAIMED THEIR BAGS AND THE 2 CHKED BAGS WERE FOUND AND TAKEN TO A SECURE AREA.
column125: ARPT SECURITY PROB AT KINGSTON; JAMAICA; WHICH ALLOWED UNIDENTED CHKED BAGS TO GO ON AIRPLANE; WHICH CAUSED A DIVERSION TO MBJ.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 7; Flight Attendant Total 7; Flight Attendant Type 30
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WAS IN UNASSIGNED SEAT. WHEN ASSIGNED PAX ARRIVED UNASSIGNED PAX GOT A LITTLE VERBAL AND I CHKED TO SEE WHAT THE PROB WAS. SHE SAID SHE HAD MADE THESE RESERVATIONS LAST JUL/98 AND WAS ASSIGNED SEATS TOGETHER. WHEN SHE ARRIVED AT THE GATE SHE AND HER HUSBAND WERE REASSIGNED TO AFT ROWS XX AND XY AND SEPARATED. I TOLD HER TO PLEASE COME FORWARD AND WE WOULD TAKE CARE OF HER PROB WITH THE AGENT. SHE CAME FORWARD AND I TURNED HER OVER TO THE AGENT AND WENT BACK TO MY BOARDING DUTIES. THAT WAS THE END OF MY INVOLVEMENT WITH THE INCIDENT. IF THE AGENTS WERE AWARE OF THE PROB PRIOR TO BOARDING; THE PROB SHOULD HAVE BEEN RESOLVED BEFORE LETTING THE PAX BOARD. I AM ASSUMING THEY WERE NOT; IN WHICH CASE; AFTER HEARING WHAT HAPPENED; IT WAS HANDLED EXACTLY AS IT SHOULD HAVE BEEN.
column125: ON BOARDING IN CCS; PAX CONFLICT WITH FLT ATTENDANT RPTR ON PRIOR SEAT ASSIGNMENT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 7; Flight Attendant Total 7; Flight Attendant Type 60
column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Hazardous Material Violation; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column118: General None Reported / Taken; General Maintenance Action
column121: PAX WAS RUDE THROUGH ENTIRE FLT. HE WOULD NOT LISTEN TO CREW INSTRUCTION (STOW CARRY ON LUGGAGE). HE AND HIS WIFE BOTH ENTERED THE LAVATORY TOGETHER AND SMOKED CIGARETTES. I WARNED HIM THAT SMOKING WAS NOT ALLOWED. HE GOT UPSET AND LATER BROKE THE ARMREST FROM SEAT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE CUSTOMER REFUSED TO STOW HIS BAG AFTER THE PLANE HAD LEFT THE GATE. THE PAX AND HIS WIFE WERE DRINKING FROM THEIR OWN LIQUOR; AS WELL AS THE AIRLINE'S LIQUOR WHEN THE FLT ATTENDANT TOOK THEIR PVT SUPPLY AWAY. THAT'S WHEN THEY BECAME BELLIGERENT AND WENT INTO THE LAVATORY TOGETHER AND SMOKED; BUT DID NOT SET OFF THE SMOKE ALARM. LATER; IN A RAGE; THE PAX BROKE THE ARMREST. 30 MINS FROM LNDG; THE PURSER TRIED TO GET THE CAPT TO HAVE AUTHS MEET THE AIRPLANE AND ARREST THE MAN. THE CAPT RPTEDLY SAID; 'THAT IT WASN'T A GOOD IDEA AT THIS TIME;' AND SUGGESTED THAT MAYBE THE PAX WOULD CALM DOWN AFTER LNDG. THE RPTR CALLED FOR AUTHS TO ARREST THE PAX; BUT THE PROPER AUTHS EVENTUALLY RELEASED THE MAN AT THE GATE; WITHOUT CHARGING HIM. THE RPTR WAS OUTRAGED BY THIS LACK OF ENFORCEMENT OF FARS BY THE CAPT AND THE AUTHS.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPTED AN UNRULY; INTOXICATED AND NON COMPLIANT PAX AND WIFE BROKE SAFETY FARS AND DELIBERATELY BROKE SEAT'S ARMREST.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 10; Flight Attendant Total 10; Flight Attendant Type 10
column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX CAME ON AT END OF BOARDING ASKED ME IF HE COULD PUT HIS BAG IN FIRST CLASS. I ASKED THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT AND SHE SAID 'NO.' THERE WAS A BAG ON THE FLOOR ALREADY. I TOLD THE PAX THAT THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT SAID NO. HE HUFFED OFF SAYING 'HE WAS A FIRST CLASS PAX ON A FULL FARE TICKET AND DIDN'T WANT TO LISTEN TO HER RULES.' I TOLD THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT AND SHE WENT BACK TO TELL HIM THAT THEY WERE NOT HER RULES; BUT FAA'S. SHE WENT BACK AND THEN CAME BACK TO FIRST CLASS AND STRAIGHT TO THE COCKPIT. SHE WAS UPSET; AFTER BEING TOLD THAT HE WAS BEING REMOVED FROM THE FLT. HIS TRAVELING PARTNER (A WOMAN) CAME AND GOT INTO HER FACE AND CALLED HER A LIAR AND CALLED HER A 'LITTLE MISS.'
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT CAPT AND FLT ATTENDANTS AUTH PAX REMOVAL FROM B757 FOR REFUSING TO STORE CARRY-ON BAG IN FAA APPROVED SPACE.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FIRST CLASS PAX THREATENED FLT ATTENDANT WITH 'I'LL BREAK YOUR NECK!' FOR 'BIN CHKING' A 'CARRY-ON' BAG; AND PAX WERE REMOVED FROM ACFT BY GND PERSONNEL. NO PHYSICAL VIOLENCE; BUT FLT ATTENDANTS WERE INTIMIDATED AND FELT THE PAX COULD POSE SAFETY ISSUE IF LEFT ON ACFT.
column125: DURING BOARDING PROCESS; PAX ON ACR FLT THREATENED FLT ATTENDANT WITH PHYSICAL VIOLENCE.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column94: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 6.5; Flight Attendant Total 6.5; Flight Attendant Type 60
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Smoke / Fire / Fumes / Odor
column121: FLT ATTENDANT #4 CAME UP TO FIRST CLASS TO TELL ME THAT SHE SUSPECTED A YOUNG FEMALE PAX HAD BEEN SMOKING IN THE AFT LAVATORY. (NOT SURE WHICH SIDE.) SHE APCHED THE YOUNG WOMAN AND ASKED HER IF SHE HAD BEEN SMOKING. THE PAX SAID YES; BUT ONLY A LITTLE! FLT ATTENDANT #4 FOUND THE CIGARETTE BUTT IN THE ASHTRAY OF THE LAVATORY AND CAME TO TELL ME. AS FLT ATTENDANT #1; I FILLED OUT A PAX INCIDENT RPT (SMOKING INCIDENT) AND HAD THE PAX COMPLETE IT WITH HER NAME; ADDRESS AND DRIVERS LICENSE NUMBER. (I'M SORRY THAT I DO NOT HAVE A COPY OF THIS RPT.) WE EXPLAINED HOW DANGEROUS IT WAS TO SMOKE ON AN ACFT AND THAT THERE WAS A HUGE PENALTY IF SHE HAS A SECOND OCCURRENCE. THE RPT WAS FILED WITH AIRLINE THAT EVENING.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; MD80; ORD-LAX; PAX SMOKED IN LAVATORY.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WAS THE PURSER ON THE FLT FROM SJU TO BDL. THE SIT HAPPENED IN THE BACK; THE FLT ATTENDANT #6 WAS DIRECTLY INVOLVED BUT A PAX; WHO WAS APPARENTLY A DISTURBED PERSON; SAID THAT SHE WAS GOING TO SMOKE. WE SAID THAT WAS NOT PERMITTED AND THAT SHE COULD BE ARRESTED FOR THAT; SO SHE PROMISED THAT SHE WAS NOT GOING TO AND THEN SHE LOCKED HERSELF IN THE BATHROOM AND ONCE SHE WAS OUT; WE COULD SMELL THE SMOKE. SO WE TALKED TO HER. SHE GOT REALLY UPSET WHEN WE TOLD HER THAT SHE WAS GOING TO HAVE TO PAY A FINE FOR SMOKING IN THE BATHROOM. THE CAPT FILED A RPT AND SHE WAS ESCORTED OFF THE PLANE. SHE ALSO WAS GETTING INTOXICATED SO WE DID NOT SERVE HER ANY MORE ALCOHOL; AND THAT REALLY UPSET HER DURING THE FLT. I WAS NOT DIRECTLY INVOLVED; BUT THE FLT ATTENDANT DIRECTLY INVOLVED HANDLED IT VERY WELL.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT ON INTOXICATED PAX SMOKING IN LAVATORY ON B757; SJU-BDL.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column106: Flight Crew Instrument; Flight Crew Multiengine; Flight Crew Commercial
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING DSCNT INTO ORD THE FLT ATTENDANTS CAME INTO THE COCKPIT TO EXPRESS THEIR CONCERN THAT PAX IN SEAT WAS CAUSING A VIOLENT DISTURBANCE IN THE CABIN. HE WAS NOT FOLLOWING ANY OF THE SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS. WAS SWEARING AND THREATENING BODILY HARM TO THE FLT ATTENDANTS. USING HIS CELL PHONE; AND WALKING AROUND THE CABIN IMMEDIATELY AFTER LNDG AND DURING TAXI IN. HE ALSO WOULD NOT GIVE UP HIS ALCOHOLIC DRINK PRIOR TO LNDG. I CALLED RAMP 25-30 MIN OUT TO MAKE SURE THAT NOT JUST AN AGENT MEET THE ACFT BUT THE POLICE AS WELL. UPON ARR ONLY SUPVR AGENTS WERE ON HAND AND THE PAX RAN AWAY BUT WAS LATER APPREHENDED. ONCE AGAIN OUR COMPANY RAMP PERSONNEL DO NOT FOLLOW THROUGH ON OUR REQUESTS FOR ASSISTANCE. THEY HAVE DONE THIS IN THE PAST. I'VE WRITTEN IT UP AND AM TOLD THAT THE COM BARRIERS ARE FIXED. COMPANY RAMP PERSONNEL STILL DO NOT TAKE PAX MISCONDUCT ISSUES SERIOUSLY. THEY DO NOT WISH TO OFFEND THE PAX FOR FEAR THAT THEY WILL NOT RETURN. THIS IS WHAT AGENTS TELL ME IS THE REASON THE POLICE ARE NOT AUTOMATICALLY CALLED. SEVERAL OTHER PAX ASKED ME IF I WANTED THEM AS WITNESSES. I HAVE THEIR NAMES AND BUSINESS CARDS.
column125: UNRULY PAX DISOBEYS SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS AND THREATENS BODILY HARM TO THE FLT ATTENDANTS.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 11; Flight Attendant Total 11
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO FLT ATTENDANTS. IT STARTED WHEN SHE WANTED ANOTHER PAX'S SPECIAL MEAL. SHE WAS ANGRY BECAUSE SHE COULDN'T HAVE IT AND ARGUED ABOUT THIS WITH GALLEY FLT ATTENDANT; MYSELF AND FLT ATTENDANT #8. SHE THEN ARGUED ABOUT HER BEVERAGE WITH FLT ATTENDANTS WORKING ON L AISLE. PAX WANTED FLT ATTENDANT TO ARGUE WITH HER EVERY TIME ONE OF US PASSED BY. PAX CALLED ME A 'BITCH.' SHE ALSO CALLED FLT ATTENDANT #8 A 'RACIST BITCH.' WE WERE TOLD BY A PAX SEATED IN FRONT OF HER THAT THE DISRUPTIVE PAX SAID SHE COULD GET A FREE TICKET OUT OF THIS FLT. THE PAX KEPT THE FLT ATTENDANTS FROM PERFORMING OUR DUTIES IN A NORMAL AMOUNT OF TIME. SHE MADE PAX SEATED AROUND HER UNCOMFORTABLE.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; A300; SJU-MIA; ON UNRULY PAX; DISRUPTED FLT DUTIES.

column96: Flight Crew Last 90 Days 245; Flight Crew Total 23500; Flight Crew Type 15750
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PLT (OBSERVING PLT; ANOTHER AIRLINE) REQUESTED JUMP SEAT. HE PRESENTED PROPER IDENT. I TOLD HIM HE COULD SIT IN BACK IF HE LIKED AND HE PROCEEDED TO PAX CABIN. HE DID NOT APPEAR TO BE INTOXICATED. DURING FLT TO DAL; FLT ATTENDANT STATED THAT HE KEPT STANDING UP AND MAKING SEXUAL COMMENTS AND BEGAN TOUCHING FLT ATTENDANTS #2 AND #3 INAPPROPRIATELY. DALLAS RESOLUTION COMPLAINT CTL CTR WAS NOTIFIED AND MET ACFT ALONG WITH DALLAS POLICE. THE FLT ATTENDANT LATER STATED THAT HE APPEARED TO BE INTOXICATED. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE JUMP SEATING PLT WAS FROM ANOTHER AIRLINE; AND SHOWED HIS PROPER IDENT WHILE THE CAPT WAS IN HIS JUMP SEAT; THEREFORE HE WASN'T CLOSE ENOUGH TO SMELL THE ALCOHOL ON THE JUMP SEATER'S BREATH. THE RPTR STATED THAT THE OBSERVER WAS IN THE GALLEY WHEN THE SEATBELT SIGN WAS ON AND REFUSED TO SIT DOWN. IN THE GALLEY; THE PLT WAS SEXUALLY GRABBING THE FLT ATTENDANTS. THE RPTR DOESN'T THINK THE FLT ATTENDANTS HAD EVER SERVED HIM LIQUOR; BUT WAS INTOXICATED WHEN HE BOARDED. DALLAS POLICE AND THE FAA MET THE FLT. THE FAA IMMEDIATELY TOOK HIS LICENSE AWAY; AND CHARGES WERE FILED.
column125: PLT RPT ON INTOXICATED JUMP SEATING PLT IN CABIN.

column121: FLT DEN-LAX. TAXIING IN TO GATE; THE MECH SIGNALED US THAT WE WOULD BE TOWING THE REMAINING 30 FT IN TO THE GATE. THE CAPT MADE A PA ANNOUNCEMENT TO THE PAX FOR THEM TO 'REMAIN SEATED UNTIL WE ARE ALL THE WAY IN TO THE GATE AND THE SEATBELT SIGN IS TURNED OFF.' WE KEPT THE SEATBELT SIGN ON; RAN OUR TOW-IN CHKLIST; AND THE MECH TOWED US IN TO THE GATE UNEVENTFULLY. AS THE PAX WERE DEPLANING; A MAN IDENTED HIMSELF AS AN FAA INSPECTOR AND THAT WE HAD VIOLATED THE FARS BY TOWING THE ACFT WITH PAX STANDING. WE HAD NO WAY TO KNOW THIS; HOWEVER; BECAUSE THE COCKPIT DOOR WAS CLOSED. THE FLT ATTENDANTS SAID THEY WERE BUSY TRYING TO GET EVERYONE SEATED AND COULD NOT CALL US AND TELL US PEOPLE WERE UP. IN THE FUTURE; I WILL DOUBLECHK WITH THE FLT ATTENDANTS EVERY TIME WE STOP SHORT OF THE GATE TO MAKE SURE EVERYONE IS STILL SEATED. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: RPTR SAID THAT HE HAD NOT HEARD FROM THE FAA OR THE COMPANY REGARDING THIS EVENT AND DOESN'T EXPECT TO. HE FELT THAT THE FAA INSPECTOR WAS NOT ACTING IN A MANNER THAT WOULD ENHANCE THE SOLUTION OF ANY PARALLEL PROBS IN THE FUTURE. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 435081: AN FAA INSPECTOR TOLD THE CAPT HE JUST COST THE COMPANY A FINE. A FLT ATTENDANT SHOULD HAVE TOLD THE COCKPIT THAT PEOPLE WERE STANDING. WE MAKE NO LESS THAN 1/2 DOZEN ANNOUNCEMENTS DURING A FLT ABOUT THE SEATBELT SIGN; BUT UNTIL THE PUBLIC IS HELD ACCOUNTABLE FOR DISREGARDING THE SIGN AND CREW'S ANNOUNCEMENTS; THEY WON'T CHANGE.
column125: AN ALLEGED FAA INSPECTOR ALERTS THE FLC OF A B727 THAT THE COMPANY FACES A FINE OF $11000 FOR TOWING THE ACFT IN TO THE GATE WITH PAX STANDING.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 29; Flight Attendant Total 29; Flight Attendant Type 95
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: AFTER COMPLETING OUR BEVERAGE AND MEAL SVC; WE HIT TURB. FLT ATTENDANTS #3; #4; AND #7 WERE IN THE VICINITY OF THE AFT GALLEY. WE IMMEDIATELY RAN FOR EMPTY PAX SEATS AND BUCKLED OUR SEATBELTS. DURING THIS TIME WE HEARD A MALE PAX SCREAMING IN THE LAVATORY. WE ALL JUMPED UP AND RAN TO THE LAVATORY. FLT ATTENDANT #3 KEPT ASKING 'ARE YOU ALL RIGHT?' BUT HE KEPT SCREAMING. FLT ATTENDANT #3 TRIED TO OPEN THE DOOR FROM THE OUTSIDE WITH HER COCKPIT KEY; BUT THE PAX WAS LEANING AGAINST THE DOOR. FLT ATTENDANT #4 AND I PUSHED IN ON THE DOOR WHILE FLT ATTENDANT #3 OPENED THE DOOR WITH HER COCKPIT KEY. ONCE WE ESTABLISHED THE PAX WASN'T HURT; FLT ATTENDANT #4 AND I SAT DOWN. FLT ATTENDANT #3 WAS THE CLOSEST AND SPOKE TO HIM TO MAKE SURE HE WAS OK. WHEN FLT ATTENDANT #3 SHUT THE DOOR HE YELLED 'OF COURSE I'M OK YOU STUPID BITCH.' FLT ATTENDANT #3 PUSHED THE DOOR OPEN AND SAID 'WHAT DID YOU SAY?' THE PAX SAID NOTHING. FLT ATTENDANT #3 EXPLAINED WE ALL HEARD HIM SCREAM AND WE THOUGHT HE WAS INJURED AND FELL AGAINST THE DOOR WHEN WE COULDN'T OPEN IT. FLT ATTENDANT #3 RETURNED TO HER SEAT. WHEN THE MALE PAX CAME OUT OF THE LAVATORY; HE STOPPED IN THE AISLE L-HAND SIDE AND HE FONDLED HIS GENITALS AND HE KEPT SAYING OVER AND OVER 'IT'S A HAITIAN THING.' WE ALL TOLD HIM TO SIT DOWN AND FASTEN HIS SEATBELT; IT'S TURBULENT; BUT HE JUST STOOD THERE FONDLING HIMSELF AND TELLING US 'IT'S A HAITIAN THING.' YES; HE WAS DRINKING OUT OF HIS OWN BOTTLE. YES; THE FLT SVC DIRECTOR TOLD HIM TO PUT IT AWAY OR IT WOULD BE TAKEN AWAY. THE PURSER AND SEVERAL FLT ATTENDANTS TOLD HIM THE SAME SO HE GAVE IT TO ANOTHER PAX AND THEY BOTH DRANK. YES; ALCOHOL WAS THE PROB.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; A300; PAP-JFK; SEATBELT SIGN; TURB; INTOXICATED PAX IN LAVATORY; FONDLING HIMSELF IN LAVATORY AND IN AISLE.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 1; Flight Attendant Total 1; Flight Attendant Type 5
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX APPEARED INTOXICATED AND WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO AGENT. AGENT #1 ALLOWED HIM TO BOARD. I WAS RUNNING ELECTRONIC GATE READER UNAWARE OF INCIDENT. AGENT #1 INFORMED ME AFTER ALL PAX WERE PAST THE ELECTRONIC GATE READER. I INFORMED THE CAPT. HE ORDERED THAT THE PAX BE REMOVED FROM ACFT. A DIFFERENT AGENT #2 AGREED; BUT THE PAX WAS NOT IN HIS SEAT. AFTER FIRST AGENT IDENTED PAX (HE WAS IN A BACK ROW OR SECOND TO LAST ROW IN MAIN CABIN); THE SECOND AGENT APCHED AND ASKED THE PAX ABOUT THE INCIDENT. HE APPEARED TO BE INTOXICATED. I CANNOT QUOTE PRECISELY; BUT THESE WORDS WERE USED. HE REPLIED; 'WELL; SHE PISSED ME OFF; BUT SHIT; I WASN'T SWEARING.' AGENT #2 ESCORTED PAX OFF PLANE. THE PROB AROSE AT THE GATE. THE INFO ABOUT THE PAX WAS NOT SHARED UNTIL AFTER BOARDING. THE FIRST AGENT PERCEIVED THE PAX APPEARED INTOXICATED AND EXPERIENCED HIS ABUSIVE BEHAVIOR; BUT FAILED TO ACT AND DENY BOARDING. THE AGENT COULD HAVE ENLISTED ANOTHER AGENT OR MGR FOR HELP. PERHAPS SHE WAS INTIMIDATED OR AFRAID OF A CONFRONTATION. AGENTS HAVE A HARD JOB BALANCING CUSTOMER SVC IN A TIMELY MANNER; WHILE SCREENING FOR POTENTIAL SAFETY PROBS. SAFETY CONSIDERATIONS MUST COME FIRST.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; B727; DFW-LGA; GATE AGENT BOARDED INTOXICATED PAX. CAPT HAD HIM REMOVED.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 0.50; Flight Attendant Total 0.67; Flight Attendant Type 2
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING BOARDING; THE PAX SEATED IN XD PLACED HIS BAG UNDER THE LAST SEAT OF FIRST CLASS WHERE THE BAG BLOCKED EMER EQUIP. THE #3 FLT ATTENDANT NOTICED THIS AND WAS GETTING READY TO HAVE HIS BAG GATE CHKED; BUT I WAS IN THE REAR OF THE ACFT AND TOLD HER THERE WAS AN EMPTY BIN AT ABOUT ROW 17. THE PAX PUT HIS BAG IN THE BIN AND SEEMED ANNOYED THAT THE BIN WAS SO FAR FROM HIS SEAT. AFTER THE BEVERAGE SVC AND JUST BEFORE THE CAPT SAID 'PREPARE FOR LNDG' FLT ATTENDANT #3 NOTICED HIS BAG WAS BACK IN THE SPOT WHERE IT BLOCKED EMER EQUIP. I TOLD THE PAX THAT FOR LNDG; THE BAG NEEDS TO GO BACK IN THE OVERHEAD BIN. HE TOLD ME THE BAG WAS FINE WHERE IT WAS; AND THAT HE DOESN'T WANT TO WAIT TO GET HIS BAG. FLT ATTENDANT #3 TRIED TO ASSIST ME IN TELLING THE PAX THE BAG BLOCKED EMER EQUIP; BUT THE PAX INSISTED ON LEAVING HIS BAG UNDER THE SEAT. THE DEADHEADING CAPT SEATED IN FIRST CLASS TOLD US (MYSELF AND FLT ATTENDANT #3) TO JUST LET IT BE AND GET SECURITY WHEN WE GOT ON THE GND.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; F100; ORD-RST; PAX REFUSED TO STOW BAG FOR LNDG; SECURITY CALLED UPON ARR.

column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Smoke / Fire / Fumes / Odor
column121: PAX WAS SMOKING THE AFT LAVATORY AND AS SOON AS HE CAME OUT THE LAVATORY; ANOTHER CREW MEMBER AND MYSELF SMELLED THE CIGARETTE SMOKE. THE PURSER APCHED THE PAX ASKING HIM IF HE WAS SMOKING. THE PAX DENIED THE WHOLE SIT; STATING THAT HE DID NOT SMOKE. ON OUR ARR IN SJU; PAX SVC MET THE FLT AND CONFRONTED THE PAX; MEANWHILE THE PAX DENIED THE WHOLE SIT. ALSO UPON LNDG; DURING ACTIVE TAXI-IN; THE PAX STOOD UP AND PROCEEDED TO OPEN OVERHEAD BIN; ENDANGERING THE LIVES OF OTHER PAX. ALSO; HIS FRIEND PROCEEDED TO COMPLAIN TO THE PURSER THAT HE WAS 'RUINING' THEIR VACATION BY CAUSING TROUBLE. THE PAX'S FRIEND ALSO CALLED THE PURSER A '%$&#@ SCUMBAG.' I PERSONALLY THINK THIS PAX SHOULD BE PRESSED WITH CHARGES; DUE TO THE FACT THAT HIS ATTITUDE WAS VERY OFFENSIVE AND WAS VERY RUDE TO THE PURSER. APPARENTLY; I THINK THE PAX EITHER HID THE CIGARETTES OR GAVE THEM TO ONE OF HIS FRIENDS. OUR MAIN CONCERN WAS THE FACT THAT HE COULD HAVE THROWN THE CIGARETTE ANYWHERE IN THE LAVATORY; WHICH COULD HAVE CAUSED FIRE IF IT WAS NOT PUT OUT PROPERLY. ALSO; THE SMOKE DETECTOR DID NOT WORK; SINCE THE LAVATORY WAS SMOKY ONCE HE CAME OUT OF THE LAVATORY. MY WHOLE CONCERN WAS HIS RUDE; BETTER THAN THOU; YOU CAN'T DO ANYTHING TO ME ATTITUDE. P.S. IF WE ARE GOING TO ENFORCE RULES WE MUST HAVE THE PROPER CHANNELS TO BACK US UP.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; A300; JFK-SJU; PAX SMOKING IN LAVATORY; ABUSIVE LANGUAGE TOWARD CABIN CREW.

column121: I WAS #2 ON FLT AND BECAUSE I WAS SETTING UP FOR THE INFLT SVC IN THE AFT PORTION OF THE ACFT; I PERSONALLY DID NOT WITNESS ANY PART OF THE SIT. HOWEVER; I WAS AWARE THAT THERE WAS A PROB WITH AN IRATE PAX IN FIRST CLASS; BECAUSE WE TOOK A DELAY AND I HAD CALLED FIRST CLASS FLT ATTENDANTS TO FIND OUT WHY WE HAD NOT DEPARTED. I WAS INFORMED THAT THEY WERE HAVING PROBS WITH A MAN IN THE FIRST CLASS CABIN.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT ON DELAYED DEP FROM SJU ON B757 DUE TO IRATE PAX IN FIRST CLASS.

column121: WHEN THE PROB BEGAN; I WAS IN THE BACK. ALL I KNOW IS THE GENTLEMAN TRIED TO SIT IN FIRST CLASS WITHOUT PAYING. THE AGENT ASKED HIM TO MOVE TO THE BACK; AND HE REFUSED. HE CONTINUED TO REFUSE. THE CAPT GOT INVOLVED AND GOT HIM TO MOVE TO THE BACK. THE PAX CALLED THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT A 'SMART ASS.' THE CAPT TOLD HIM TO GET OFF. HE REFUSED. SECURITY AND COPS CAME; AND FINALLY GOT HIM OFF THE PLANE. MAN SEEMED TO HAVE RATHER STRANGE BEHAVIOR.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; MD80; LGA-YYZ; PAX ORDERED OFF PLANE ON BOARDING BY CAPT AND REMOVED BY ARPT POLICE.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other PAX CONDUCT-ALCOHOL
column121: I WAS NOT MUCH INVOLVED IN THIS SIT; BUT HERE ARE THE DETAILS AS BEST AS I RECALL. I WAS FLT ATTENDANT #1 ON A B757. DURING BOARDING; I WAS SETTING UP THE FIRST CLASS GALLEY. ABOUT 5 MINS BEFORE DEP; FLT ATTENDANT #2 CALLED FROM THE AFT GALLEY AND SAID; 'THERE'S A GUY BACK HERE ABOUT TO HAVE A COW; BECAUSE I WON'T SERVE HIM A DRINK. I CAN SMELL ALCOHOL ON HIM. AND I DON'T THINK I WANT TO GO ON A 3 HR FLT WITH HIM IF HE CAN'T WAIT TILL AFTER TKOF FOR A DRINK.' I RELAYED THE MESSAGE TO THE CAPT IN THE COCKPIT; WHO CALLED FOR ATTENDANT #2. AS THEY TALKED; I STEPPED BACK INTO THE GALLEY AND CONTINUED SETTING UP. ABOUT 1 MIN LATER; THE CAPT STEPPED INTO THE ENTRY AREA AND SAID TO ONE OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS; 'TELL HIM TO COME UP HERE AND TALK TO ME. I DON'T WANT TO GO BACK THERE -- IT MIGHT EMBARRASS HIM.' A FEW MINS LATER; A MAN STEPPED INTO THE GALLEY LOOKING FOR THE CAPT. I POINTED OUT THE CAPT WHO WAS STANDING ON THE JETBRIDGE. THEY BEGAN TALKING; BUT I DID NOT HEAR WHAT THEY WERE SAYING. EVERY NOW AND THEN; THEY RAISED THEIR VOICES; BUT I STILL COULD NOT UNDERSTAND WHAT THEY WERE SAYING. DURING THIS TIME; THE GATE AGENT STEPPED ON THE PLANE AND SAID; 'I REMEMBER THAT GUY. HE GAVE ME A HARD TIME WHEN I CHKED HIM IN; BUT I WAS TOO BUSY TO DO ANYTHING ABOUT IT.' EVENTUALLY; A MAN IN A SUIT AND 2 POLICEMEN SHOWED UP AND BEGAN TALKING WITH THE PAX. THE CAPT STEPPED BACK ON THE PLANE AND WE DEPARTED.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; B757; DFW-YVR; REGARDING PAX THAT WAS TAKEN OFF PLANE DUE TO INTOXICATION.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column106: Flight Crew Multiengine; Flight Crew Instrument; Flight Crew Commercial
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: APPROX 30 MINS OUT FROM LNDG FAT; FLT ATTENDANT NOTIFIED ME OF AN ABUSIVE; FOUL-MOUTHED PAX. I ADVISED FLT ATTENDANT TO GET NAMES OF WITNESSES AND PAX'S NAME. AS WE WERE STARTING OUR DSCNT; FLT ATTENDANT RETURNED AND STATED PAX WOULD NOT GIVE HER NAME AND WAS STILL A PROB. WE WERE ISSUED SEVERAL INSTRUCTIONS FROM ATC AT THIS TIME AND I ELECTED TO DEAL WITH THE PROB ON THE GND. INSTRUCTED FLT ATTENDANT TO INFORM ME IF PAX WOULD NOT TAKE HER SEAT AND HAD FO CALL FAT OPS AND HAVE POLICE MEET THE ACFT TO ESCORT THE PAX OFF. AFTER PARKING THE ACFT; I MET WITH POLICE; PAX AND THE FLT ATTENDANT. INFORMED THE PAX THAT HER ACTIONS INTERFERED WITH MY PRIMARY DUTIES; DISTRACTED ME FROM FLYING AND CREATED A SERIOUS SAFETY VIOLATION. SHE APPEARED INDIFFERENT. I CALLED DISPATCH AND EXPLAINED THE INCIDENT. TALKED TO DISPATCH WHO WAS NO HELP AND SOMEWHAT CONFRONTATIONAL. EXPLAINED INCIDENT TO POLICE. NAMES; ADDRESSES AND FURTHER INFO CAN BE OBTAINED FROM FLT ATTENDANT AND POLICE RPT. AS AN ADDITIONAL NOTE; HAD WE BEEN ANY FARTHER OUT; I WOULD HAVE DIVERTED THE ACFT AND HAD THE PAX REMOVED. WITH REF TO PART ONE; THIS INCIDENT WAS SUFFICIENT TO DISTRACT MYSELF AND THE FO AND A FLT ATTENDANT FROM OUR PRIMARY DUTIES. I WOULD HAVE SENT THE FO TO THE CABIN OR GONE MYSELF HAD WE BEEN ANY FARTHER AWAY FROM LNDG.
column125: AN S80 PIC LNDG AT FAT CALLED THE POLICE AFTER HEARING THAT THE FLT ATTENDANT WAS DISTRACTED BY A FOUL MOUTHED PAX IN THE CABIN.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 28; Flight Attendant Total 28; Flight Attendant Type 90
column107: Flight Attendant Airline Total 24; Flight Attendant Total 24; Flight Attendant Type 50
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other STOWAWAY
column121: ON APR/XA/99 ON ACFT X FROM HNL-DFW; I WALKED BACK ON THE PLANE AFTER WORKING THE BOARDING. AS I WENT DOWN THE R-HAND SIDE OF THE ACFT; I MET A YOUNG BOY WALKING TOWARD ME IN THE AISLE. HE CARRIED A BACKPACK AND A LARGE SKATEBOARD. I ASKED HIM IF HE NEEDED HELP STOWING THE SKATEBOARD. HE SAID HE WAS LOOKING FOR HIS PARENTS. I OFFERED TO HELP HIM LOCATE HIS FAMILY. AS WE WALKED DOWN THE AISLE; A LADY SEATED ON THE AISLE STOPPED ME AND TOLD ME THAT SHE DIDN'T THINK HE BELONGED ON THIS FLT BECAUSE HE WAS SITTING IN HER SEAT WHEN SHE BOARDED. WHILE I TALKED TO HER; HE WALKED AHEAD OF ME AND WHEN I CAUGHT UP WITH HIM HE WAS TRYING TO GO INTO LAVATORY H (AFT NEAR DOOR 4L). I GRABBED THE DOOR AND ASKED HIM WHERE WAS HIS BOARDING PASS. HE SAID HE WAS LOOKING FOR HIS PARENTS. I GOT ON THE PHONE AND CALLED THE PURSER TO TELL HIM THAT WE HAD A POSSIBLE STOWAWAY. HE WALKED AWAY FROM ME AGAIN AND TRIED TO SIT IN SEAT XX; THE ONLY EMPTY SEAT ON THE AIRPLANE. ONE OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS FROM UP FRONT CAME BACK AND ASKED HIM AGAIN WHERE WAS HIS BOARDING PASS. HE TOLD HER HE HAD TO FIND HIS SISTER. WE GOT HIM OUT OF THE SEAT AND TOOK HIM TO THE BOARDING DOOR AND GAVE HIM TO THE AGENT. HE REFUSED TO TELL ANYONE HIS NAME. MEANWHILE; FLT ATTENDANT #2 AND FLT ATTENDANT #3 (WHO WERE IN THE MAIN CABIN) SAID HE WAS THE FIRST PAX ON BOARD IN THE MAIN CABIN. WHEN FLT ATTENDANT #3 AND I WENT OUT TO BOARD THE PAX; THE FIRST TO BOARD AT MY ELECTRONIC TICKET READER WERE 2 FIRST CLASS PAX AND A LADY WALKING ON A CANE. THE PAX SEATED IN SEAT YY SAID THE BOY PUSHED THEM ASIDE TO BOARD THE AIRPLANE. I NEVER SAW HIM IN THE BOARDING AREA AT THE GATE. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR RE-EMPHASIZED HER CONTENTION OF PUTTING A 10TH FLT ATTENDANT ON THE DC10; BECAUSE OF LACK OF CABIN COVERAGE. SHE STATED THAT THE LITTLE BOY HAD EVADED POLICE TWICE THAT DAY AND HAD ATTEMPTED TO STOW AWAY ON ANOTHER FLT BOUND FOR DETROIT. SHE SAID THE BOY CARRIED AN 'EMPTY BACKPACK' AND A SKATEBOARD. THE MAIN REASON THEY DISCOVERED THEY HAD A STOWAWAY WAS THAT HE TRIED TO SIT IN THIS LADY'S ASSIGNED SEAT; AND SHE NOTIFIED A FLT ATTENDANT.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT MULTIPLE RPT ON A STOWAWAY BOY ON DC10 HNL-DFW CAUGHT ON BOARDING IN HNL.

column121: A PAX BOUGHT A BOTTLE OF VODKA FROM THE DUTY FREE CART. HE DRANK 1/2 OF THE BOTTLE AND BECAME ABUSIVE TO THE FLT ATTENDANTS AND OTHER PAX.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; B767; MIA-LGW; REGARDING AN INTOXICATED AND ABUSIVE PAX.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX #1 CONNECTED FROM A LONG FLT VIA ENGLAND AND WAS STRESSED BECAUSE HER FLT WAS 45 MINS LATE. SHE WAS CONTINUING ON MY FLT TO TUS; AND SHE WAS RELIEVED THAT HER FLT WAS STILL AT THE GATE IN DFW. ON BOARDING; SHE WAS TERRIBLY ANGERED THAT HER SEAT WAS IN THE BACK ROW. SHE EXPRESSED IT VOCALLY FROM ROW XX AND CONTINUING ON THROUGH SAFETY DEMONSTRATION. ONCE I RETURNED TO THE REAR TO BE SEATED IN JUMP SEAT; SHE THEN BECAME VERY AGITATED AND BEGAN SCREAMING AT ME AND THEN DEMANDED TO MOVE RIGHT NOW. BY THEN THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANT #2 TRIED TO SETTLE HER DOWN WHILE I CALLED THE CAPT (ON AIRPLANE X). HE ALSO TOLD HER THAT WE COULD NOT MOVE HER NOW; BECAUSE WE WERE TAKING OFF BUT ONCE WE WERE AIRBORNE WE COULD HELP HER. SHE (PAX) BEGAN POINTING HER FINGER AND SAYING WE CONVENIENTLY MOVED HER SEAT AND THAT SHE WAS THE CLIENT AND WE HAD BETTER LISTEN TO HER. FLT ATTENDANT #2 THEN WENT TO THE COCKPIT WHILE I WAS STILL ON THE INTERPHONE. THE CAPT ASKED IF WE SHOULD TAKE HER BACK TO THE GATE? WE AGREED; BECAUSE ALREADY SHE DID NOT RESPECT OUR PLAN OF ACTION TO MOVE HER ONCE AIRBORNE; AND SHE HAD EVERYONE (OTHER PAX) UPSET AND UNCOMFORTABLE. WE WERE UNABLE TO APPEASE HER ON THE GND; WE THOUGHT HER ACTIONS WOULD BE UNPREDICTABLE IN THE AIR. WE RETURNED TO THE GATE WHERE AIRLINE X REPRESENTATIVES; AS WELL AS THE LCL POLICE; HAD HER REMOVED. PAX X WANTED HER (3) DAUGHTERS TO REMAIN ONBOARD; BUT THEY BEGAN SCREAMING; AND SO THEY WERE ALLOWED TO DEPLANE AS WELL. THE FLT CONTINUED ON WITHOUT FURTHER INCIDENCE.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; S80; DFW-TUS; TAXI BACK TO GATE TO REMOVE BELLIGERENT PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 10; Flight Attendant Total 10; Flight Attendant Type 40
column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: 10 MINS INTO BOARDING; I NOTICED THE PAX IN SEAT XX PLACING 2 LARGE SUITCASES INTO THE OVERHEAD BIN WIDTHWISE. THE LUGGAGE PROHIBITED THE OVERHEAD BIN FROM CLOSING. I WENT TO THE PAX AND ASKED HIM TO PLACE 1 BAG IN THE EMPTY BIN BEHIND HIM AND I WOULD SHIFT THE OTHER BAG; SO THE BIN WOULD SHUT. HE IGNORED ME. A FEW MINS LATER; FLT ATTENDANT #1 ASKED HIM TO DO THE SAME THING. I SAW THE PAX REFUSE AND BECOME ANGRY. FLT ATTENDANT #1 ATTEMPTED TO KEEP THE PAX CALM; BUT WHEN THE SIT BECAME THREATENING; FLT ATTENDANT #1 CAME BACK TO ME AND ASKED ME TO GET PAX SVC. I WENT OUT TO GATE AREA AND HAD THE AGENT CALL FOR THE MGR ON DUTY. WHEN THE MGR ARRIVED; I EXPLAINED THAT THE PAX AND HIS TRAVELING COMPANION WERE NOT COMPLYING WITH CREW MEMBER INSTRUCTIONS AND WERE INTIMIDATING AND THREATENING TO US (FAR PART 91.11). WE ASKED TO HAVE THEM REMOVED FROM THE ACFT FOR THAT REASON. PAX SVC REMOVED THEM FROM ACFT. FLT SVC MOD CAME AND WE EXPLAINED THE SIT. CAPT (ACFT X) WAS INFORMED OF THE PROB AND ALLOWED US TO HANDLE THE PROB. PAX AND WITNESS CAME UP TO ME IN FRONT OF THE MOD FROM FLT SVC (MGR) SAYING THE PAX REMOVED WAS RUDE AND VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO US. IN ADDITION; PAX SAID WE HANDLED THE PROB PROFESSIONALLY.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; B757; LAX-MIA; PAX REMOVED AFTER BOARDING DUE TO REFUSAL TO OBEY FARS; VERBALLY ABUSIVE.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 1; Flight Attendant Total 1
column97: Service; Safety Related Duties; Deplaning; Boarding
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Smoke / Fire / Fumes / Odor; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: ON DSCNT I HAD JUST FINISHED PICKING UP TRASH IN THE MAIN CABIN AND ON MY WAY BACK TO THE MAIN CABIN GALLEY; I SAW A PAX COME OUT OF THE RESTROOM -- HE SMELLED OF CIGARETTE AND THE BATHROOM WAS VERY SMOKY. WE ALL KNEW RIGHT AWAY HE HAD GONE INTO THE LAVATORY TO HIDE AND SMOKE A CIGARETTE. WE APCHED HIM ABOUT THE INCIDENT AND HE COULD NOT SPEAK ANY ENGLISH; OR SO HE PRETENDED. HE WOULD NOT GIVE US HIS NAME AND SEEMED TO IGNORE US -- OR MAYBE HE COULDN'T UNDERSTAND OUR VERBAL WARNINGS. THEN HIS TRAVEL COMPANION; POSSIBLY HIS WIFE; CAME TO THE GALLEY TO SPEAK WITH US ABOUT THE INCIDENT. SHE SPOKE VERY GOOD ENGLISH AND TOLD US HER BOYFRIEND/HUSBAND(?) DIDN'T KNOW HE WAS NOT ALLOWED TO SMOKE ON BOARD THE ACFT. ALSO; BY THIS TIME; ONE OF THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS HAD REACHED INTO HIS SHIRT POCKET AND GRABBED HIS TICKET SO WE THEN KNEW HIS NAME; SEAT NUMBER; ETC. WE FELT THESE PAX WERE LYING. IT WAS OBVIOUS THAT THIS MAN WOULD HAVE STAYED IN HIS SEAT TO SMOKE IF HE THOUGHT THAT IT WAS ALLOWED INSTEAD OF GOING INTO THE LAVATORY TO HIDE.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT ON PAX SMOKING IN LAVATORY ON DC10 JFK-LAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 11.5; Flight Attendant Total 11.5; Flight Attendant Type 95
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A PAX (MALE) WAS ANNOYED BECAUSE OF A SHORT (25 MIN) DELAY. DURING OUR SVC; HE OPENED AND WAS DRINKING HIS OWN BEER. WE ADVISED HIM TO EITHER HAND IT OVER TO US; OR PUT IT AWAY; AND THAT IT WAS AN FAA REQUIREMENT TO DO SO. HE IGNORED US. WE ADVISED PAX THAT SECURITY MAY MEET HIM IN BNA. DURING PICKUP; HE OPENED ANOTHER BEER IN FRONT OF US. WE ADVISED THE COCKPIT CREW OF THE SIT AND THE FO WENT TO THE MAIN CABIN TO TALK TO THE PAX. PAX DISMISSED THE FO; BUT HAD NOT OPENED ANY OTHER BEER. ON DSCNT; THE PAX IGNORED MY SAFETY PROCS (SEAT BACK UPRIGHT AND HE WAS SITTING IN THE EXIT ROW). WE LANDED WITH NO FURTHER INCIDENT FROM THE PAX. AT THE GATE; BNA SECURITY WAS WAITING FOR THE PAX. HE WAS ASKED A FEW QUESTIONS; AND THEY WERE GOING TO RELEASE HIM. AS HE WAS WALKING AWAY; HE MADE A SARCASTIC REMARK TO THE CREW AND SECURITY ARRESTED HIM.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT OF PAX REFUSAL TO OBEY ALCOHOL FARS; ARRESTED ON ARR AT BNA.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 20; Flight Attendant Total 20; Flight Attendant Type 60
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX 'APPEARED' TO BE HIGHLY INTOXICATED. HE DISTURBED OTHER PAX AROUND HIM DURING SEATING ON PRE-DEP. HE WAS RPTED TO US BY OTHER PAX IN THE COACH CABIN. POSSIBLE FUTURE SOLUTIONS: GND PEOPLE (TICKET AGENTS; GATE AGENTS) TO BE MORE AWARE OF THESE TYPES OF CONDITIONS. THIS PAX SHOULD NOT HAVE MADE IT AS FAR INTO THE BOARDING PROCESS AND ONTO THE PLANE. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE ANALYST LEARNED THAT THE INTOXICATED PAX SAT IN BACK OF THE DC10; AND PRACTICALLY HELD THE PAX AND THE AFT GALLEY FLT ATTENDANT HOSTAGE TO HIS DRUNKEN ACTIONS. THE RPTR WAS CALLED TO THE BACK BY THE AFT GALLEY FLT ATTENDANT; WHO WAS BUSY SETTING UP THE GALLEY. SHE WAS AFRAID TO BE ALONE WITH THE PAX. WHEN THE RPTR CAME BACK TO HELP HER; THE DRUNK WAS HARASSING THE CHILDREN OF A FAMILY OF 4. THE FLT ATTENDANT MOVED THE FAMILY TO DOOR XX; UNTIL THE DRUNK COULD BE TAKEN OFF. THE CAPT DID HAVE PAX SVC REMOVE HIM; BUT ON THE JETWAY; THE PAX STARTED SHOVING THE AGENT. THE AGENT CALLED THE POLICE; WHO HAND CUFFED THE GUY AND TOOK HIM AWAY. THE POLICE FOUND A WHOLE LIST OF 'PRIORS' ON THE MAN. THE RPTR ALSO STATED THAT HIS AIRLINE HAS SPECIFIC TRAINING FOR FLT ATTENDANTS ON DEALING WITH INTOXICATED AND BELLIGERENT DRUNKS. HE; ALSO; WANTS THE SAME TRAINING FOR THE GND AGENTS.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; DC10; HNL-DFW; INTOXICATED PAX BOARDED IN HNL; REMOVED PER FLT ATTENDANT REQUEST.

column97: Service; Safety Related Duties; Deplaning; Boarding
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FLT ATTENDANT #2 ADVISED ME THAT A MALE PAX IN ROW XX WAS ACTING VERY AGGRESSIVELY TOWARDS HIM. I WAS ALREADY FAMILIAR WITH THE WOMAN IN ROW XX; SEAT XXA. SHE GAVE ME A HARD TIME WHEN I ASKED HER TO REMOVE HER BAG OR PURSE OFF THE FLOOR; DUE TO SEATING IN EMER EXIT. SHE WAS UPSET AND LOOKED AT PAX SEATED IN XXB. WHEN I WENT TO COACH CABIN TO IDENT THE MALE PAX; I NOTICED THAT THE ANGRY WOMAN WITH PURSE HAD MOVED TO SEAT XXB. WHEN DEPLANING I PURPOSELY POSITIONED MYSELF ACFT L AFT OF FIRST CLASS. I WANTED TO BE DIRECTLY ACROSS FROM #2 FLT ATTENDANT TO PROTECT AND WITNESS ANY SITS THAT MAY OCCUR. WHEN THE WOMAN WENT BY I SAID 'GOODBYE HAVE A NICE DAY' SHE SAID 'YEAH RIGHT! HAVE A NIGHT DAY' AND STARTED MUMBLING VERY ANGRILY AND LEFT. NOW I KNEW THIS WAS THE COUPLE; SO I WATCHED THE MALE PAX. HE WENT TOWARDS #2 FLT ATTENDANT; HIS FACE WAS VERY RED. (I THOUGHT HE WAS GOING TO HIT HIM.) SO I STEPPED FORWARD TOWARDS #2 FLT ATTENDANT THE MAN TURNED TOWARDS ME. I SAID 'BYE; BYE.' HE WAS BREATHING HVY AND LEFT THE PLANE. I LATER PULLED UP THE SEAT NUMBERS AND THEN THE PAX ITINERARIES. THIS INCIDENT SUPPOSEDLY BEGAN OVER #2 FLT ATTENDANT ADVISING THE WOMAN THERE WAS MEAT ON THE PASTA. NONE OF THE RECORDS SHOWED PAX SVC REMARKS FOR SPECIAL MEAL ORDERS. ALSO THEY WERE ALL DONE BY TRAVEL AGENCIES. I HAVE 20 YRS EXPERIENCE BTWN 2 AIRLINES. WHILE WORKING AT THE TICKET COUNTER FOR X AIRLINE; I AM VERY AWARE OF CUSTOMER/PAX AGGRESSION OR VIOLENCE. I STRONGLY BELIEVE THIS PAX WOULD HAVE STRUCK #2 FLT ATTENDANT HAD I NOT BEEN STANDING DIRECTLY ACROSS FROM HIM.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; B757; PAX AGGRESSION.

column121: PAX ATTACHED (TO SET HEADSET JACK) HEADSET LAYING IN AISLE. IT CAUGHT MY ANKLE. I TRIPPED; FELT SOMETHING PULL IN MY L KNEE. PAX NEVER APOLOGIZED. WHEN I HANDED HER HEADSET BACK TO HER SHE WAS AWAKE AND WITNESSED IT OCCUR.

column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT ON PAX SMOKING IN LAVATORY ON B757; SFO-MIA.

column121: I WAS IN THE FIRST CLASS GALLEY ASSISTING THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT WHEN OUR #2 FLT ATTENDANT CAME UP FRONT AND TOLD US THAT A PAX HAD CORNERED HER IN THE BATHROOM AND THE BACK OF THE ACFT. THE PAX ALSO USED A LOT OF PROFANITY WITH THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT (AS SHE TOLD US). THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT FILLED OUT A RPT ABOUT THE PAX AND ASKED THE PAX FOR HER NAME; WHICH SHE REFUSED TO GIVE (I WITNESSED THIS). WE THEN LOOKED IT UP IN THE PAPERWORK. THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT INFORMED THE CAPT OF THE SIT AND HE CALLED AHEAD FOR SECURITY. WHEN WE GOT THERE; I SHOWED SECURITY TO THE PAX SEAT AND HE TOOK HER OFF THE PLANE. (ALL OTHER PAX REMAINED SEATED.) IN THE TERMINAL SECURITY; THE PAX AND THE #4 FLT ATTENDANT SPOKE ABOUT THE SIT. THERE WERE SEVERAL OTHER PAX THERE TOO WHO WITNESSED THE PAX MISCONDUCT. THEY GAVE THEIR PERSONAL INFO TO THE  SECURITY PERSON AND THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT. THE PAX FINALLY LEFT WITH NOTHING RESOLVED. I WOULD ALSO LIKE TO MENTION THAT THE PAX HAD SEVERAL ALCOHOLIC DRINKS AND WAS RUDE AND DEMANDING THE ENTIRE FLT.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; S80; DFW-FAT; PAX AGGRESSION; INTERFERE WITH FLT ATTENDANT'S DUTY. SECURITY REMOVED PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 7; Flight Attendant Total 7; Flight Attendant Type 80

column121: 2 MEN BOARDED WHO WERE TOTALLY INTOXICATED. THEY WERE CURSING AND ACTING VERY RUDELY. ONE OF THE MEN STARTED YELLING AT ME AND SAID 'THIS IS YOUR FAULT.' I ASKED 'FOR WHAT?' AND HE STUMBLED OVER HIS WORDS. I THEN PROCEEDED TO ASK THE CAPT IF HE WANTED THESE 2 DRUNK MEN ON HIS FLT. HE SAID HE DIDN'T CARE; BUT WE HAD TO MAKE THE CURFEW TO LAYOVER IN BERMUDA; SINCE HE NEVER LAID OVER THERE BEFORE AND SAID IT WAS UP TO THE GATE AGENT. THE REST OF THE CREW PROCEEDED TO TELL THEM TO LEAVE THE ACFT; AND THE SPECIAL SERVICES WOMAN CALLED SECURITY.
column125: FLT ATTENDANT RPT; B757 JFK-BDA; INTOXICATED PAX REMOVED FROM ACFT ON BOARDING.

column121: PAX TRIED TO SIT IN FIRST WITHOUT A PROPER PASS. WAS TOLD TO SIT IN COACH WHERE HE BELONGED. HE THREATENED TO WRITE UP THE CABIN CREW. THEY DID NOTHING WRONG AND THIS PAX COMPLAINT SHOULD BE IGNORED.
column125: PLT RPT ON S80 DFW-BOS OF PAX AGGRESSION WHERE MOVE TO FIRST CLASS FROM COACH DENIED.
