column121: PAX WENT INTO FIRST CLASS LAVATORY (ACROSS FROM FIRST CLASS GALLEY; WHERE I WAS WORKING). AS I TURNED TO GO BACK OUT INTO THE FIRST CLASS CABIN; PAX CAME OUT OF LAVATORY SMELLING OF CIGARETTE SMOKE AND LAVATORY WAS 'CLOUDY' AND SMELLING VERY STRONG OF CIGARETTE SMOKE. THERE WAS ANOTHER PAX; THE WITNESS; STANDING IN THE AISLE WAITING FOR THIS LAVATORY AND HE SAID; 'OH -- NOT AGAIN.' THE WITNESS TOLD ME THAT THIS SAME PAX ON THE FLT FROM LGA TO DFW HAD BEEN SMOKING ON THAT PLANE AS WELL AND THAT THE WITNESS HAD FOUND HIS WALLET IN THE LAVATORY AND WHEN RETURNING IT; HE SMELLED THE 'SMOKE ODOR' ON HIM. I FOLLOWED THE PAX TO MAIN CABIN TO SEE WHERE HE WAS SITTING AND THE OTHER 2 FLT ATTENDANTS WERE AT HIS SEAT DOING ANOTHER BEVERAGE SVC. I INFORMED THEM THAT THE PAX HAD JUST COME FROM THE LAVATORY AND SMOKE FOLLOWED HIM. THE PAX HEARD ME AND GIGGLED AND TOLD FLT ATTENDANT #4 THAT IT HAD BEEN 6 HRS SINCE HIS LAST CIGARETTE AND HIS HEAD WAS BEGINNING TO FEEL FUNNY; AND HE JUST HAD TO TAKE ONE BIG PUFF -- THAT WAS ALL -- JUST ONE BIG PUFF. WE ALL 3 COMMENTED TO HIM FROM THE SMELL IT WAS MORE THAN ONE PUFF. I THEN INFORMED THE CAPT (WHO WAS DOING A CHK RIDE FOR THE FO). I TOLD HIM WHAT I OBSERVED AND WHAT THE WITNESS HAD SAID. I FILLED OUT THE PAPERWORK AND THE CAPT CAME OUT INTO THE FIRST CLASS GALLEY AND FLT ATTENDANT #2 TOLD THE PAX THE CAPT WANTED TO SPEAK WITH HIM. THE PAX BEGAN ACTING LIKE HE DIDN'T UNDERSTAND ENGLISH; AND WHEN THE CAPT ASKED FOR HIS IDENT; HE WALKED OFF. THE CAPT STOPPED AND THREATENED TO HAVE HIM ARRESTED IF HE DIDN'T COOPERATE. HE FINALLY GOT OUT HIS TRAVEL VISA; AND THE CAPT TOLD HIM I HAD TO FILE AN INCIDENT RPT ON HIM AND THE SIT. THE CAPT WENT BACK INTO THE COCKPIT AND THE PAX ASKED ME TO TEAR THE PAPERWORK UP AND NOT TO TURN HIM IN. I ASKED HIM OR REMINDED HIM HE DIDN'T UNDERSTAND ENGLISH BEFORE; BUT NOW WAS BEGGING FOR REDEMPTION AND TO GO BACK TO HIS SEAT AND SIT DOWN. HE ARGUED FOR A WHILE AND FINALLY SAT DOWN. UPON LNDG IN PHX; THE CAPT HAD MAINT CHK SMOKE DETECTORS -- THEY HAD NOT BEEN TAMPERED WITH. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT AFTER THE CONFRONTATION BTWN THE CAPT AND THE SMOKER; THE MAN; LITERALLY CORNERED HER AGAINST THE FUSELAGE AND SAID; 'YOU HAVE TO SWEAR THAT YOU SAW ME SMOKING. CAN YOU SWEAR TO THAT?' SHE REPLIED; THAT SHE DIDN'T HAVE TO SWEAR TO ANYTHING AND CALLED THE CAPT TO RPT THE CONFRONTATION. THIS IS WHEN THE CAPT CALLED FOR SECURITY TO MEET THE FLT; BUT SHE DOESN'T KNOW WHAT HAPPENED TO HIM AFTER THEY LED HIM OFF. AFTER THE LAVATORY CHK; THE MECHS TOLD HER THAT THE MAN HAD PROBABLY COVERED UP THE SMOKE ALARM WITH A WET PAPER TOWEL.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; MD80; DFW-PHX; PAX SMOKING IN LAVATORY; SMOKE ALARM DIDN'T GO OFF. SECURITY MET FLT. NO EVIDENCE OF TAMPERING WITH SMOKE ALARM.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX HAD MAIN CABIN BOARDING PASS; BUT INSISTED ON SITTING IN FIRST CLASS SEAT; WHEN I ASKED HIM TO MOVE BACK TO HIS SEAT IN THE MAIN CABIN; HE REFUSED 3 TIMES; THEN HE STOOD UP AND SLOWLY PUT ON HIS COAT AND REACHED FOR HIS BAG OVERHEAD. I WENT TO THE COCKPIT TO TELL THE CAPT THAT THE PAX WAS UP -- DO NOT TAKE OFF. THE PAX FOLLOWED ME TO COCKPIT DEMANDING MY NAME. CAPT RETURNED TO GATE; PAX WAS REMOVED.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; FLL-LGA; ON BOARDING AND TAXI; PAX REFUSED TO SIT IN ASSIGNED SEAT; STOOD UP ON TAXI; INSISTING ON FIRST CLASS SEAT. CAPT RETURNED TO GATE; PAX REMOVED.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 30.1; Flight Attendant Total 30.1; Flight Attendant Type 30
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column118: Flight Crew Diverted; Flight Crew Landed As Precaution
column121: PAX BECAME INTOXICATED AND BEGAN USING FOUL LANGUAGE IN A LOUD TONE OF VOICE; HITTING THE PAX'S SEAT IN FRONT OF HIM. HE WAS TOLD HE WOULD NOT BE SERVED ANY MORE ALCOHOL. HE INFORMED THE FLT ATTENDANT HE HAD HIS OWN BOTTLE AND HAD BEEN DRINKING FROM IT ALREADY. HE WAS TOLD HE COULDN'T DO THAT. WHEN HE BECAME MORE ABUSIVE; THE PURSER WAS CALLED BACK TO SPEAK TO HIM. SHE TOOK HIS BOTTLE FROM HIM AND HE WAS TOLD TO REMAIN IN HIS SEAT AND TO CTL HIS LANGUAGE. HE BECAME MORE ABUSIVE USING MORE AGGRESSIVE BEHAVIOR AND LANGUAGE. HE CALLED THE PURSER A 'XXXXXXX XXXXX.' VERY ABUSIVE LANGUAGE AND PUSHING HIM. PAX IN FIRST CLASS COULD HEAR THIS EXCHANGE AS WELL AS THOSE IN THE REAR OF THE ACFT. PAX AROUND THE MAN BECAME UPSET AND FEARFUL OF HIS ACTIONS. AT ONE POINT; THE PURSER AND A MALE FLT ATTENDANT WERE IN THE BUSINESS GALLEY AND I FELT HE WAS GOING TO HIT THE PURSER. HOWEVER; THE MALE FLT ATTENDANT STEPPED BTWN THEM. AS A RESULT OF THIS CONTINUED BEHAVIOR; THE CAPT MADE A DECISION TO LAND IN BOS AND HAVE THE MAN REMOVED FROM THE FLT. THE AIRPLANE WAS MET BY THE STATE POLICE AND THE PAX WAS REMOVED. WE THEN CONTINUED ON OUR RTE TO EGKK. THE PAX SHOWED NO SIGN OF BEING A PROB ON BOARDING AT DFW. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THEY WERE ALREADY OVER MONTREAL WHEN THE CAPT FINALLY MADE THE DECISION TO GET THE MAN OFF ASAP AND DECIDED TO GO TO BOS. THE CAPT'S DECISION WAS MADE AFTER HE FOUND OUT THAT THE MAN HAD SHOVED THE MALE FLT ATTENDANT. THE FAA IS INVESTIGATING; AND SUBSEQUENTLY HAS INTERVIEWED THE MALE FLT ATTENDANT. THE RPTR DOESN'T KNOW THE OUTCOME OF THE INCIDENT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT. B767-300; DALLAS TO GATWICK; ENGLAND. INTOXICATED PAX BECAME PHYSICALLY AND VERBALLY ABUSIVE. CAPT DIVERTED TO BOS TO HAVE PAX REMOVED.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 9; Flight Attendant Total 9; Flight Attendant Type 80
column105: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Smoke / Fire / Fumes / Odor; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WAS TOLD THAT SMOKING WAS NOT ALLOWED. PAX WENT INTO AFT LAVATORY AND SMOKED ANYWAY. WHEN SHE CAME OUT SHE SAID IT WAS 'NO BIG DEAL;' SHE DID IT ON HER LAST FLT. THE ONLY WAY TO STOP THIS IS FOR SECURITY TO ACTUALLY MEET THE FLTS WHEN THEY ARRIVE. TOO OFTEN THE PAX JUST WALKS OFF THE ACFT WITH NO PENALTY BECAUSE SECURITY AND ARPT MGR DO NOT ENFORCE THE LAW. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT SHE DOESN'T KNOW IF THE CAPT CALLED FOR SECURITY TO MEET THE FLT; HOWEVER; THE PURSER GAVE THE PAX PASSPORT TO THE GND AGENTS UPON ARR. SHE KNOWS OF NO FURTHER CONSEQUENCES.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT. B727; MIA-SDQ. PAX SMOKED IN LAVATORY DESPITE BEING TOLD SHE COULDN'T PURSER HANDED PAX PASSPORT TO GATE AGENTS IN SANTA DOMINGO.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 17; Flight Attendant Total 17; Flight Attendant Type 99
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: AT DEP TIME; FLT ATTENDANT #5 INFORMED ME THERE WAS AN UNACCOMPANIED SUITCASE SITTING ON THE FLOOR IN FRONT OF ROW X. I TOOK THE SUITCASE TO THE AGENTS AT THE GATE IN TERMINAL. WE VERIFIED THAT THE SUITCASE BELONGED TO ONE OF OUR PAX SITTING IN ECONOMY ROW XX. IT WAS AN OVERSIZED 'ROLLABOARD' AND VERY HVY. KNOWING IT WOULDN'T FIT IN AN OVERHEAD AND THAT WE WERE AT DEP; WE CHKED THE BAG AND I PAGED THE NAME ON THE LUGGAGE TAG. NO RESPONSE. THE PAX WAS STANDING BY HER SEAT FOR THE FIRST TIME; DEMANDING TO KNOW WHO TOOK HER LUGGAGE. I EXPLAINED WHAT HAD HAPPENED. SHE SAID THAT THERE WERE BREAKABLES INSIDE AND THAT IT HADN'T BEEN LOCKED. I SUGGESTED SHE CHK WITH THE 2 AGENTS; JUST IN CASE IT WAS STILL THERE. I BEGAN CLRING MY CABIN AND DOING COMPLIANCE CHKS; WHEN SHE YELLED OUT TO ME ACROSS THE FIRST CLASS CABIN THAT SHE WANTED MY NAME AND THAT I WOULD BE HELD PERSONALLY RESPONSIBLE FOR ANYTHING STOLEN OR BROKEN IN HER BAG. SHE DEMANDED MY NAME AND ASKED FOR MY PERSONAL INFO. I TOLD HER WE WERE PAST DEP AND THAT I WOULD GET HER THAT INFO AFTER TKOF. SHE DIDN'T MOVE. THE 2 AGENTS BOTH INSISTED SHE STEP AWAY FROM THE DOOR AND BE SEATED. AS I WALKED OVER TO 1R TO ARM IT; PAX YELLED OUT TO ME 'ARE YOU GOING TO COME OVER HERE TODAY OR SOMETIME NEXT WK OR WHAT? GET OVER HERE NOW!' SHE WAS YELLING LOUDLY AND VERBALLY THREATENING ME. I QUICKLY WALKED OVER TO HER SEAT; WITHOUT EVEN GIVING A 'PREPARE FOR DEP' TO MY CREW AS IS PROC AT DOOR CLOSURE TIME BECAUSE SHE WAS GETTING HYSTERICAL. I KNELT DOWN IN FRONT OF HER AND WROTE MY NAME ON A PIECE OF PAPER. SHE INSISTED ON MY ADDRESS AS WELL. SHE BEGAN THREATENING ME AGAIN ABOUT HER CHKED LUGGAGE. I QUIETLY SAID 'WE'RE GOING TO BE ON THIS FLT FOR 5 1/2 HRS; AND YOU AND I NEED TO COME TO AN UNDERSTANDING AND A LEVEL OF RESPECT. RIGHT NOW YOU ARE INTERFERING WITH MY DEP DUTIES AS A FLT ATTENDANT AND PURSER. I'M SORRY THAT YOU DID NOT HEAR THE PAGE; BUT FROM THIS POINT ON I HAVE A RESPONSIBILITY TO YOU AND EVERYONE ELSE HERE TODAY.' I EXCUSED MYSELF AND ASKED THE CAPT TO HAVE HER REMOVED FROM THE FLT; BECAUSE SHE CONTINUED TO INTERFERE WITH CREW MEMBER DUTIES AND VERBALLY THREATENED WITH NO END IN SIGHT. THE PAX SVC AGENT ESCORTED HER OFF. MUCH TO OUR DISBELIEF; WE DISCOVERED THAT SHE WAS TRAVELING WITH HER 2 VERY YOUNG CHILDREN WHO WERE BOTH SITTING ALONE IN ECONOMY SEATS. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE AGENTS WERE CERTAIN THAT THE WOMAN WAS ON BOARD (HAVING REMEMBERED HER RUDENESS); EVEN THOUGH SHE HADN'T RESPONDED TO THE PURSER'S PAGE; AND THEY HAD SEEN NO ONE GET OFF THE PLANE. THAT WAS WHY THE PURSER DECIDED TO CHK THE OVERSIZED BAG IN CARGO. AS IT TURNED OUT; THE WOMAN HAD BEEN IN BACK OF THE PLANE WITH HER CHILDREN AND CLAIMED SHE DIDN'T HEAR THE PAGE. THE CAPT HAD HEARD THE WOMAN LITERALLY SCREAMING AT THE PURSER AND AGREED TO HAVE THE WOMAN AND CHILDREN REMOVED.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-300; JFK-LAX; ON BOARDING; VERBALLY ABUSIVE PAX UPSET OVER CHKED LUGGAGE AND INTERFERED WITH PURSER'S DUTIES. CAPT HAD PAX REMOVED.

column94: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 26.5; Flight Attendant Total 26.5; Flight Attendant Type 95
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX X SEATED IN XX WAS INTOXICATED. HE WAS REFUSED MORE LIQUOR. HOWEVER; HE OPENED A BOTTLE HE HAD PURCHASED FROM DUTY FREE. FLT ATTENDANT TOOK THE BOTTLE FROM HIM. HE PROCEEDED TO WALK UP AND DOWN THE AISLE; BEING LOUD AND TAKING HIS SHIRT OFF. FLT ATTENDANT #2 WAS THE MAIN FLT ATTENDANT WHO CAME IN CONTACT WITH THE PAX. APPARENTLY; THE PAX THREATENED FLT ATTENDANT #2. I DID NOT WITNESS THIS. HOWEVER; I DID GO TALK TO THE PAX AND EXPLAINED TO HIM IF HE DIDN'T QUIET DOWN WE WERE GOING TO LAND. UPON LNDG IN ZZZ; THE POLICE BOARDED THE ACFT AND TOOK THE PAX OFF. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID THAT SHE HEARD SECOND-HAND THAT THE MALE FLT ATTENDANT; WHO DEALT THE MOST WITH THE PAX; WAS ACTUALLY PERSONALLY THREATENED BY HIM. SHE FELT THE FLT ATTENDANT'S GENDER MAY HAVE HAD SOMETHING TO DO WITH HIS LOUD BEHAVIOR; BECAUSE WHEN SHE CAME BACK TO TALK TO HIM; HE QUIETED DOWN AND THEN HE PUT A BLANKET OVER HIS HEAD. THEY HAD TO MOVE A PAX SITTING IN FRONT OF HIM TO BUSINESS CLASS TO GET AWAY FROM THE SCENE. WHEN THEY GOT TO THEIR DEST; THE POLICE (WHO MET THE FLT) HAD EVERYONE STAY IN THEIR SEATS UNTIL THEY CAME ON BOARD AND TOOK HIM OFF; STILL WITH THE BLANKET COVERING HIS HEAD.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B777; NRT-ZZZ; US; VERBALLY ABUSIVE PAX DRINKING FROM OWN BOTTLE; THREATENED CABIN ATTENDANT #2. POLICE TOOK PAX OFF IN ZZZ.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 29; Flight Attendant Total 29; Flight Attendant Type 90
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: JUST BEFORE TOUCHDOWN; I HEARD A MUFFLED SHOUT. I WAS NOT SURE WHERE IT WAS COMING FROM; BUT THE FLT ATTENDANT #2 ALSO HEARD IT; AS WELL AS FLT ATTENDANTS #9 AND #10. WE HEARD SEVERAL SHOUTS; THEN QUIET. WE LANDED AND BEGAN HEARING IT AGAIN. THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT GOT UP AND LOOKED OUT IN THE CABIN. SHE DETERMINED THAT THE PAX IN ROW X WAS YELLING. SHE WENT TO HIS SEAT AND ASKED HIM TO PLEASE STOP. SHE WAS FIRM; BUT VERY COURTEOUS. HE KEPT ON AND OFF UNTIL EVERYONE WAS DEPLANED AND AN AIRLINE REPRESENTATIVE CAME ON BOARD. THIS PAX HAD HAD 5-6 BEERS; I THINK; THROUGHOUT THE FLT. HE HAD EATEN BOTH MEALS AND HAD BEEN VERY QUIET. I DON'T KNOW WHAT PRECIPITATED HIS BEHAVIOR. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE MAN WAS FINE DURING THE FLT; WHICH IS WHY HIS BEHAVIOR ON LNDG WAS SO ABNORMAL. SHE DOESN'T KNOW EXACTLY WHAT HE WAS YELLING ON TOUCHDOWN; BUT THE OTHER PAX WERE QUITE DISTURBED BY HIS CONTINUOUS OUTBURSTS. HE WAS NOT EASILY UNDERSTOOD. BUT ON THE GND; AS PEOPLE WERE STANDING UP TO GET READY TO LEAVE; HE STARTED YELLING 'YOU *&^%$ BRITISH; YOU *&^%$ BRITISH.' ONE PAX INSISTED THE RPTR DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT. SHE REPLIED THAT THE AIRLINE AUTHS WERE COMING ON BOARD TO HANDLE THE SIT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-300ER; BIRMINGHAM; ENGLAND TO ORD; IL. ON TOUCHDOWN AND TAXI; PAX BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE AND DISRUPTIVE TO OTHERS. ESCORTED OFF BY AGENT.

column121: PAX APPEARED SOMEWHAT INTOXICATED AND WAS RPTED BY ANOTHER PAX TO HAVE BEEN TALKING ABOUT THE BOMBING IN OKC. PAX TOLD ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT ABOUT IT; WHO RPTED IT TO ME. I THEN RPTED IMMEDIATELY TO THE CAPT. PAX SVC WAS INVOLVED AND PAX WAS REMOVED FROM ACFT. CRISIS CTL WAS CALLED! CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE 'BOMB' THREAT WAS OVERHEARD BY AN EMPLOYEE ON A PASS IN THE SMOKING LOUNGE AT STL ARPT. HE REPORTEDLY SAID THAT 'THIS MAY NOT BE THE LAST OF THE BOMBS' (OR BOMB THREATS). WHEN THE SAME INTOXICATED MAN GOT ON THE PLANE; THE EMPLOYEE TOLD THE FLT ATTENDANTS ABOUT HIS STATEMENT. SHE THOUGHT THAT MAYBE THE INFORMANT WAS TRYING TO FEEL SELF-IMPORTANT AND COULD HAVE BEEN EXAGGERATING THE POSSIBLE THREAT. THE CAPT TOOK THE MENTION OF 'BOMB' SERIOUSLY; AND HAD THE PAX REMOVED.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; S80; STL-ORD; PAX EMPLOYEE OVERHEARD BOMB THREAT BY INTOXICATED PAX. CREW NOTIFIED. CAPT HAD PAX REMOVED.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID SHE DIDN'T WRITE A NARRATIVE BECAUSE SHE DIDN'T WITNESS THE INCIDENT. SHE SAID A MAN AND HIS FIANCE GOT TO THE GATE 10 MINS BEFORE DEP; AND THE AGENTS HAD GIVEN THEIR SEATS AWAY. THE MAN WAS FURIOUS WHEN HE GOT ON BOARD AND DEMANDED THE FLT ATTENDANTS DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT. 2 DIFFERENT FLT ATTENDANTS ASKED A COUPLE; SITTING IN THEIR SEATS; IF THEY COULD MOVE FOR THE IRATE COUPLE. BOTH TIMES; THEY SAID 'NO.' THEN THE GUY WENT BALLISTIC AND STARTED SCREAMING AT THE FLT ATTENDANTS TO 'SHUT UP!' HE CARRIED ON IN A TEMPER TANTRUM AND INTERFERED WITH THE CABIN CREW'S SAFETY CHKS; SO FINALLY THE PURSER TOLD THE CAPT ABOUT IT; AND THAT SHE DIDN'T WANT TO BE DEALING WITH HIM AT FL330. THE CAPT HAD THEM REMOVED. HALFWAY DURING THE FLT; THE CAPT FOUND OUT THAT THE AIRLINE HAD BOARDED THE COUPLE ON THE NEXT FLT; LEAVING AN HR LATER. THIS WAS SUPPOSED TO BE AGAINST THE COMPANY'S PROTOCOL; WHICH IS SUPPOSED TO PUT SUCH PAX ON ANOTHER CARRIER TO COOL OFF.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767; JFK-LAX. DURING BOARDING; IRATE PAX WOULDN'T TAKE A SEAT; INTERFERED WITH CABIN CREW DUTIES. CAPT HAD HIM REMOVED.

column121: A PAX SEATED IN YY IN EXIT ROW REFUSED TO PLACE DOG IN A CARRIER DURING THE FLT AND LNDG. THE PAX WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO CREW. SHE ALSO JEOPARDIZED PAX AND CREW SAFETY BECAUSE OF DOG AT EXIT ROW NOT PROPERLY CONTAINED. FLT ATTENDANT #1 TOOK DOG AND PLACED IN PAX LAP 2 ROWS BACK JUST BEFORE TOUCHDOWN. FLT WAS MET BY SHERIFF'S DEPT AT SMF. FAA WAS NOTIFIED. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE WOMAN WITH THE DOG ACTED LIKE A SPOILED BRAT; AND REALLY UPSET THE CABIN CREW. THE LCL SHERIFF DETAINED THE PAX FOR QUESTIONING AT THE SACRAMENTO ARPT; BUT DECIDED IT WAS UNDER FEDERAL JURISDICTION; SO THEY KEPT HER THERE TILL THE FBI ARRIVED. THE RPTR DID NOT KNOW OF ANY FURTHER ACTIONS TAKEN AGAINST THE LADY.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; MD80; DFW-SMF; PAX SITTING IN EXIT ROW WOULD NOT PUT DOG IN KENNEL DURING FLT AND FOR LNDG. PAX DETAINED BY SHERIFF AND FBI.

column118: Flight Crew Diverted; Flight Crew Landed As Precaution
column121: A PAX BECAME DISRUPTIVE; SCARING OTHER PAX WITH FURTIVE MOVEMENTS AND THREATENING WORDS. THE PAX WAS SUBDUED BY FLT ATTENDANT AND PAX; AND DEPLANED IN BDA. MORE ATTN NEEDS TO BE PAID BY GND PERSONNEL TO PAX IN THE BOARDING AREA. MORE FOCUS AND ATTN NEEDS TO BE PAID TO SECURITY IN THE AIR. BDA CUSTOMS/POLICE VERY HELPFUL IN DEPLANING/SUBDUING PAX. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE MAN HAD BEHAVED VERY ERRATICALLY IN THE BOARDING AREA AND APPARENTLY HAD JUST COME IN FROM SOUTH AMERICA. ONCE THEY WERE INFLT; HE WAS TRYING TO OPEN ALL THE EXIT DOORS; STARTED GOING IN AND OUT OF LAVATORIES; SITTING IN OTHER PAX'S SEATS AND SPEAKING IN INCOHERENT SPANISH. AS FAR AS THE RPTR KNEW; NO ONE HAD SERVED HIM ANY LIQUOR. THE CREW WONDERED IF HE WAS DOING DRUGS IN THE LAVATORIES. IT TOOK 5 PAX AND 1 FLT ATTENDANT TO SUBDUE THE MAN. ONCE IN BERMUDA; THEY HAD A 3 HR DELAY FOR THE WITNESSES TO FILL OUT THE POLICE RPTS AND FOR SECURITY TO CHK OUT ALL THE LAVATORIES.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; A300; SJU-JFK; UNRULY PAX WAS SUBDUED BY PAX'S AND FLT ATTENDANTS. DIVERTED TO BDA. POLICE TOOK PAX OFF.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 8; Flight Attendant Total 11; Flight Attendant Type 20
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other Passenger -- Abusive Language
column121: A PAX GOT VERBALLY ABUSIVE; BECAUSE I ASKED HIM TO REMOVE HIS BAGS FROM FIRST CLASS OVERHEAD BIN; WHEN I NOTICED HE WAS CONTINUING BACK TO COACH CLASS. I KNEW FIRST CLASS WAS GOING TO BE A FULL CABIN AND WE ALWAYS NEED ALL OVERHEAD BIN SPACE. HE PULLED HIS BAG DOWN (SUITCASE WITH WHEELS) AND YELLED AT ME TO FIND A PLACE FOR IT. WHEN I SAID THERE WAS OVERHEAD BIN SPACE IN THE BACK; HE POINTED AT THE R SIDE AND SAID IT WAS FULL! THEN; JUST PUT HIM UP IN FIRST CLASS! I TOLD HIM HE NEEDED TO SPEAK TO THE AGENT OUTSIDE IF HE WANTED TO SIT IN FIRST CLASS. THAT'S WHEN HE REALLY STARTED SCREAMING LOUDLY; THAT I WAS OF NO HELP; A FEW TIMES. I WALKED OVER TO THAT SAME OVERHEAD BIN AND CLRED SPACE AND HE THREW HIS BAG UP THERE. THERE WERE ONLY 37 PAX IN COACH SO THERE WAS NO NEED TO BE OBNOXIOUS OR LOUD AND RUDE. I LOOKED UP HIS STATUS AND HE WAS ONE OF THE AIRLINE'S FREQUENT PAX. MAYBE THIS WAS HIS WAY OF GETTING A FULL UPGRADE. MOST FIRST CLASS PAX EVEN BRING ON MORE THAN 2 PIECES AND WE HAVE TO FIND ROOM FOR THEIR BAGS.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; ORD-YYZ. BOARDING PROCESS. PAX VERBALLY ABUSED CABIN ATTENDANT OVER STOWAGE OF BAGS IN OVERHEAD BINS.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WAS UPSET WITH HIS AND HIS GIRLFRIEND'S SEATS. HE DEMANDED NEW SEATS SUCH AS FIRST CLASS SEATS OR CLR OTHER PAX OUT OF A MAIN CABIN ROW; SO HE COULD SLEEP. THIS SHOULD BE DONE BECAUSE HE WAS A FREQUENT FLIER CLUB MEMBER. MAIN CABIN FLT ATTENDANTS DID NOT ACT ON HIS DEMANDS. (FIRST CLASS WAS ALMOST FULL.) FROM THAT POINT; HE STOPPED EVERY FLT ATTENDANT HE SAW; OR RANG HIS CALL LIGHTS TO COMPLAIN. HE COMPLAINED ABOUT AIRLINE; FOOD; PAX SVC. HE DID THIS OVER AND OVER AND PREVENTED THE FLT ATTENDANTS TO DO THEIR OTHER INFLT DUTIES. AFTER I; THE PURSER; WENT BACK AND LISTENED TO HIM; AFTER HE FINALLY GOT A ROW CLRED; HE STILL HARASSED THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS. FINALLY; THE CAPT HAD TO COME BACK AND TALK TO HIM. AFTER CAPT WENT BACK TO THE COCKPIT; HE CONTINUED HARASSING THE FLT ATTENDANTS AND RINGING HIS CALL LIGHT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE CAPT TOLD THE MAN THAT HE WAS IN VIOLATION OF THE FAR OF INTERFERING WITH CREW MEMBER DUTIES; ESPECIALLY SINCE HE HAD TO LEAVE THE COCKPIT TO TALK TO HIM. THE MAN STILL WOULDN'T QUIT WALKING AROUND AND STOPPING FLT ATTENDANTS. THE CAPT THEN CALLED FOR THE FAA TO MEET THE FLT. WHEN THEY LANDED; THE FAA AND SECURITY GOT ON BOARD AND TOOK THE MAN OFF BEFORE OTHER PAX DEPLANED. THEY INTERROGATED THE MAN; BUT HE KNEW THAT THEY COULDN'T' REALLY DO ANYTHING TO HIM BECAUSE HE HAD NOT THREATENED OR PHYSICALLY ASSAULTED THE CREW. AFTERWARDS; THE FAA HELD A DEBRIEFING WITH THE WHOLE CREW ON THE PLANE.
column125: MULTIPLE CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; DC10; ORD-HNL; PAX INTERFERED WITH CREW DUTIES. FAA MET THE FLT AND DETAINED THE PAX.

column121: MALE PAX SEATED IN FIRST CLASS; SEAT XX; SLAMMED THE OVERHEAD BIN. SAME PAX THREW BRIEFCASE. SAME PAX RAISED HIS HAND; AS IF TO STRIKE ME; HAD NOT A MALE FLT ATTENDANT STEPPED BTWN US. SAME PAX REFUSED TO COOPERATE WITH CREW MEMBERS. SAME PAX MADE VERBAL THREATS TO CABIN CREW MEMBERS. SAME PAX WAS ENRAGED; SCREAMING AND YELLING OBSCENITIES. SAME PAX OFFENDED OTHER PAX WITH HIS BEHAVIOR. 3 FLT ATTENDANTS AND SEVERAL OTHER PAX WANTED ENRAGED PAX REMOVED.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; VVI-MIA; ON BOARDING; A PAX VERBALLY ABUSED AND PHYSICALLY THREATENED CREW MEMBERS.

column121: PAX LOCKED HIMSELF IN AFT LAVATORY DURING LNDG. HE REFUSED TO COME OUT. FLT ATTENDANT COULD NOT GAIN ACCESS; BECAUSE HE WAS HOLDING DOOR. THE PAX BEGAN TO CHANT 'KINGDOM; PWR; GLORY' AT TIME WE WERE AT FINAL; SO I NOTIFIED COCKPIT AFTER WE BRAKED AND IT WAS SAFE TO GET UP AND GIVE THEM INFO. NEW YORK CITY POLICE MET FLT. THE PAX CAME OUT AFTER WE HAD STOPPED AND TOLD A FLT ATTENDANT HE WAS SCARED. THE PAX WAS QUESTIONED BY POLICE. HE WAS A 19 YR OLD MALE. HIS PARENTS WERE NOTIFIED. AFTER ABOUT 45 MINS OF QUESTIONING; HE WAS RELEASED BY SOC [AIRLINE'S SECURITY OPS] AND FAA. PAX WAS RELEASED TO HIS OWN CUSTODY. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID THAT SHE WAS THE PURSER; SO SHE HADN'T SEEN THE BOY UNTIL AFTER THEY LANDED AND HE HAD COME OUT OF THE LAVATORY. THE BOY SEEMED TO BE EITHER RETARDED OR SLOW AND APPEARED TO BE A RUNAWAY; BECAUSE HE HAD NO LUGGAGE. THE POLICE AND THE FAA CONTACTED THE BOY'S UNCLE; AND AFTER TALKING TO HIM; THEY RELEASED HIM.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767; LAX-JFK; PAX LANDED IN LAVATORY; REFUSED TO COME OUT AFTER PLANE HAD STOPPED. DETAINED BY FAA AND POLICE AND RELEASED.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: CONCERNING THIS MATTER OF PAX MISCONDUCT; DURING THE BOARDING PROC; I WAS PULLING TICKETS AND ALREADY APPROX 10 MINS INTO PROCESS; WITH A RANGE OF 30-40 PAX ALREADY IN LINE; A PAX APCHED ME FROM BEHIND; EXPECTING TO BE LET INTO LINE AHEAD OF EVERYONE ELSE WHO WAS IN AN ORDERLY LINE; CAUSING ME TO TURN OVER MY SHOULDER WHILE STILL PROCEEDING WITH THE BOARDING PROCESS. INFORMED THIS PAX; RESPECTFULLY; THAT HE NEEDED TO FILE IN ORDER WITH THE REST OF THE PAX AND I WOULD NOT PERMIT HIM TO BE IN FRONT OF EVERYONE ELSE WHO WAS ALREADY IN LINE. THE PAX DID NOT AGREE THAT HE HAD TO CONFORM IN LINE LIKE EVERYONE ELSE. AFTER SEVERAL ATTEMPTS OF PERSISTING AND CAUSING DELAYS WITH THE BOARDING PROCESS; HIS ATTEMPT WAS EXHAUSTED. SEVERAL MINS LATER HE ARRIVED IN FRONT OF ME IN LINE. WITH MUCH ATTITUDE AND MORE ARROGANCE; HE PRESENTED HIS TICKET; GRABBED IT BACK VIOLENTLY. AS HE ENTERED THE JETBRIDGE DOOR. HE THEN TURNED AROUND AND YELLED TELLING ME TO 'KISS HIS XYZ.' WITH THAT VERBAL THREAT; I STOPPED BOARDING; APCHED HIM FOR HIS TICKET; WHICH HE ONCE AGAIN WAVED ANGRILY IN FRONT OF ME. I RETRIEVED HIS TICKET AND PROCEEDED TO INFORM THE CAPT OF THIS PAX'S VERBAL THREAT. THE CAPT IMMEDIATELY DECIDED TO REMOVE THIS PAX. ALTHOUGH THIS PAX SAT IN FIRST CLASS THE ENTIRE REST OF THE BOARDING PROCESS; WHICH I BELIEVE WAS A REWARD FOR NOT SWIFTLY REMOVING HIM FOR HIS ACTIONS; HE WAS THEN REMOVED QUIETLY AND PACIFYING IN SUCH A MANNER THAT PERHAPS TO NOT BRING ABRUPT ACTIONS TO HIS INAPPROPRIATE ACTIONS.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; MCO-DFW. PAX VERBALLY ABUSED THE TICKET-TAKING CABIN ATTENDANT. CAPT HAD PAX REMOVED ON BOARDING.

column94: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 1; Flight Attendant Total 16; Flight Attendant Type 60
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A PAX'S WIFE LEFT HER PURSE IN TERMINAL. THE PAX TRIED TO FORCE HIS WAY OFF THE ACFT TO RETURN TO THE TERMINAL. THE CAPT WAS CALLED VIA INTERPHONE. OPS WAS CALLED TO LOOK FOR THE LOST PURSE. WHEN THE PURSE COULD NOT BE FOUND; THE PAX WAS ADVISED. AT THAT TIME; THE PAX GRABBED THE FLT ATTENDANT BY THE ARMS (FROM BEHIND); CURSED AND PUSHED THE FLT ATTENDANT ASIDE. POLICE WERE CALLED AND THE PAX WAS REMOVED FROM ACFT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID THAT THE BOARDING DOOR ON THIS PARTICULAR ACFT IS IN THE REAR. THE PAX WAS INCENSED AT THE RPTR WHEN SHE TOLD HIM THAT THE AIRLINE'S CUSTOMER SVC AGENT COULD SEND THE LOST PURSE ON THE NEXT FLT. HE CALLED HER A FEW NAMES AND SAID THAT 'YOUR *&^% AIRLINE CAUSED A DELAY; SO THEY CAN *&^% WAIT TILL I FIND MY WIFE'S PURSE.' THE COUPLE WERE ON THEIR HONEYMOON. WHEN HE GRABBED THE RPTR'S ARMS STRAIGHT BACK; HE TORE HER ROTATOR CUP. THE POLICE TOOK THE PAX AND HIS WIFE OFF. THE RPTR HAS BEEN INTERVIEWED TWICE BY THE FBI.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; ATR42; MAX-MIA; ON BOARDING; PAX ASSAULTED AND INJURED THE CABIN ATTENDANT. POLICE REMOVED PAX AND WIFE.

column121: PAX X ASKED FOR HELP WITH HER BAG. I TOLD HER I COULD NOT LIFT IT ON MY OWN; BUT WOULD BE HAPPY TO HELP HER. SHE TOLD ME I WAS RUDE AND WHAT GOOD WAS I. I WENT PAST HER TO LEAVE HER ON HER OWN AND TOUCHED HER ARM WHEN I PASSED. SHE SAID I SHOVED HER. I HAD OTHER PAX WITNESS THE INCIDENT AND I WAS NOT AT FAULT. SHE WAS REMOVED FROM THE FLT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; S80; MCO-BOS; PAX REMOVED ON BOARDING DUE TO DISPUTE WITH CABIN ATTENDANT OVER STOWING A LARGE BAG.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 35; Flight Attendant Total 35; Flight Attendant Type 10
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: THIS MAN CAME BACK TO THE GALLEY AND STARTED SCREAMING AT ME INCOHERENTLY. AT FIRST I HAD NO IDEA WHAT HE WAS TALKING ABOUT. APPARENTLY; THE PURSER ASKED HIM TO TAKE HIS SEAT; SINCE THE SEATBELT SIGN WAS ON AND IT WAS BUMPY. SHE WAS ON HER WAY BACK TO FIRST CLASS. IT BECAME APPARENT HE WAS INTOXICATED TO HAVE SUCH A CHANGE IN DISPOSITION; AND HE BECAME IRATE OVER BEING TOLD THE SEATBELT SIGN WAS ON; SAID HE DIDN'T HAVE TO SIT DOWN; THAT WE OBVIOUSLY DIDN'T HAVE CHILDREN; THAT HE HAD LIVED IN FT WORTH FOR 16 YRS; AND CONTINUED SCREAMING AT ME; WHEN I SAID THE PURSER WAS JUST DOING HER JOB TO ADVISE HIM OF THE SEATBELT SIGN. HE WASN'T EVEN COHERENT! I CALLED THE COCKPIT TO SEE IF THEY COULD CALM HIM DOWN AND EXPLAIN WHY HE NEEDED TO BE SEATED. ALSO; I WAS SCARED BACK THERE BY MYSELF. ABOUT THE TIME I TRIED TO GET HIM TO TALK TO THE CAPT; ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT CAME BACK; THEN HE STARTED SCREAMING AT HER. THE CAPT TOLD ME TO 'WAKE UP THE COCKPIT MEMBER ON BREAK AND GET HIM TO COME BACK.' WHEN I LEFT TO GET HIM; HE REALLY STARTED IN ON THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANT AND SHE THOUGHT HE WAS GOING TO HIT HER. THE COCKPIT CREW BROUGHT A MALE FLT ATTENDANT BACK WITH HIM; AND HE TOLD THE MAN TO SIT DOWN; NOT SAY ANOTHER WORD; AND NOT TO GET OUT OF HIS SEAT TILL WE WERE IN DFW. HE COMPLIED WITH THE CAPT'S ORDERS. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 460233: THE FLT ATTENDANTS SERVING HIM SAID HE HAD A LOT OF WINE AND HAD TO TAKE A BOTTLE FROM HIM THAT HE HAD BROUGHT ON BOARD. FOR THE FIRST TIME IN 30 YRS OF BEING A FLT ATTENDANT; I REALLY HAD A FEELING I WAS GOING TO BE HIT. A YOUNG MALE PAX HEARD IT ALL. HE GAVE US HIS NAME AS A WITNESS. FLT ATTENDANTS SERVING HIM DID NOT KNOW UNTIL LATER IN THE FLT THAT HE HAD HIS OWN BOTTLE.
column125: MULTIPLE CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B777; LGA-DFW; INTOXICATED PAX; DRINKING FROM OWN BOTTLE; WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO CABIN ATTENDANT. PLT HAD TO COME BACK AND WARN HIM.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 0.6; Flight Attendant Total 0.6
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING TKOF; I NOTICED A LITTLE BOY WAS VERY UPSET WITH THE ADULT THAT HE WAS WITH. I SAW THE AUNT SLAP THIS BOY ON THE ARM BECAUSE OF HIS BEHAVIOR. LATER INFLT; A PAX ASKED TO FILE A COMPLAINT BECAUSE OF WHAT SHE HAD BEEN WATCHING GO ON. THROUGHOUT THE FLT; ALL FLT ATTENDANTS TOOK THIS BOY FROM THE AUNTS AND HE STAYED WITH US THROUGHOUT THE FLT AND HE WAS VERY CALM. DURING OUR DSCNT; HE JUMPED OUT OF HIS SEAT; AND I HAD TO JUMP OUT OF MINE AND GRAB HIM TO PROTECT HIM. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT DURING THE BOARDING PROCESS; THE BOY WAS KICKING AND SCREAMING AT THE TOP OF HIS LUNGS. HIS 2 AUNTS WERE TRYING TO SMOTHER HIS SCREAMS WITH A PILLOW OVER HIS FACE. ONE THEN PROCEEDED TO HIT HIM WITH HER FIST TO HIS UPPER BODY. SHE FOUND OUT THAT THEY HAD COME IN FROM LIMA; PERU; AND THAT HIS MOTHER WAS MEETING THEM IN BOSTON. AS THE CREW STARTED THEIR COCKTAIL SVC; THE BOY WAS OUT OF CTL; SO A STEWARD PICKED HIM UP AND PUT HIM ON TOP OF THE COCKTAIL CART; AND HE STOPPED CRYING. THE CREW HAD HIM ASSIST IN THEIR SVC. WHEN THE OTHER PAX WANTED TO FILE A CHILD ABUSE COMPLAINT; THE CREW HAD NO CHOICE AND GAVE THEM A FORM. THE CAPT WAS THEN OBLIGATED TO CALL FOR THE POLICE TO MEET THE FLT. ON TOUCHDOWN; THE RPTR HAD TO LEAVE HER JUMP SEAT AND GRAB THE RUNNING BOY; AND SHE SAT WITH HIM IN A PAX SEAT FOR TAXI IN. WHEN THE POLICE ESCORTED THEM OFF THE PLANE; ONE OF THE AUNTS ATTACKED A POLICEMAN; SO THEY ARRESTED HER ON THE SPOT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-300; MIA-BOS. PAX INTERVENTION; RPTED CHILD ABUSE. CABIN CREW MOVED BOY TO JUMP SEAT AREA. CABIN ATTENDANT LEFT JUMP SEAT ON LNDG TO GRAB BOY.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 0.7; Flight Attendant Total 0.7; Flight Attendant Type 20
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Smoke / Fire / Fumes / Odor
column121: A PAX WAS CAUGHT SMOKING IN THE LAVATORY. FLT ATTENDANT #2 CONFRONTED THE PAX AND TOLD HIM TO STOP SMOKING. THE PAX THREATENED FLT ATTENDANT #2 BY SAYING IF HE SAID HE WAS SMOKING AGAIN; HE WOULD PUNCH HIM IN THE FACE. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID THAT THE PAX WAS QUITE ANXIOUS ABOUT NOT BEING ABLE TO SMOKE AND KEPT COMING BACK TO THE GALLEY AND ASKING ABOUT WHICH FLTS HE COULD SMOKE ON; EG; INTL; ETC. HE ALSO CAME BACK TO THE GALLEY AT LEAST 5 TIMES; ASKING FOR EXTRA CHOCOLATES FROM THEIR SNACK SVC. THE RPTR THOUGHT THAT THE CHOCOLATES WERE TO CURB HIS CRAVING TO SMOKE. HE WAS IN THE LAVATORY AND BILLOWS OF SMOKE WERE COMING OUT. FLT ATTENDANT #2 KEPT KNOCKING ON THE LAVATORY DOOR AND SHOUTING FOR THE PAX TO QUIT SMOKING. IN A RAGE; THE PAX CAME OUT OF THE LAVATORY AND THREATENED THE FLT ATTENDANT. THE FLT ATTENDANT WENT UP TO THE COCKPIT AND INFORMED THE CAPT; WHO GAVE HIM A FORM WITH A WRITTEN WARNING OF THE FARS THE MAN HAD VIOLATED. THE MAN WAS QUIET THE REST OF THE FLT. NO AUTHS WERE CALLED TO MEET THE FLT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-200; BOS-LAX. PAX CAUGHT SMOKING IN LAVATORY; THREATENED TO PUNCH CABIN ATTENDANT #2 IN THE FACE.

column118: Flight Crew Landed As Precaution; Flight Crew Diverted; General Physical Injury / Incapacitation
column121: ON JAN/XA/00; I WAS THE LEAD ATTENDANT ON ACR FLT KONA-HONOLULU BOUND AT XA35. AFTER THE FLT WAS AIRBORNE; FLT ATTENDANT #2 PAGED ME USING THE CALL BUTTON. SHE CAME TO THE FORWARD CABIN AND INFORMED ME THAT THERE WAS A PAX IN THE AFT CABIN BOTHERING OTHER PAX; AND SHE NEEDED SECURITY TO MEET OUR ACFT UPON ARR IN HNL. I NOTIFIED CAPT X OF THE SIT AND MADE THE REQUEST; THEN PROCEEDED TO THE AFT. THE CAPT TOLD ME IF THE SIT WARRANTS IT; THE FLT COULD BE DIVERTED TO MAUI TO OFFLOAD THE PAX. AS I APCHED THE REAR OF THE ACFT; A MALE WAS STANDING IN HIS ROW (XX) HALF TURNED; FACING AN AGITATED MALE WHO WAS IN THE LAST ROW OF SEATS. THE XX MALE WAS YELLING THREATS AND SWEARING AT THE XY MALE. THE XX MALE WAS YELLING; SWEARING AND READY TO SWING A FIST AT THE XY MALE. I QUICKLY INTERVENED; TELLING EVERYONE TO SIT DOWN; THEN GRABBED THE MAN'S RIGHT ARM AND WRIST AND PINNED IT BTWN MY ARM AND MY SIDE. HE WAS UNABLE TO STRIKE THE XY MALE; BUT THE XY MALE STRUCK THE MAN XX MALE HITTING THE OTHER MALE ON THE FOREHEAD. FLT ATTENDANT #2 AND I REPEATEDLY TOLD EVERYONE TO SIT DOWN AS THINGS WERE ESCALATING. THE UNRULY MAN XX BECAME MORE VIOLENT AND ABUSIVE VERBALLY; REPEATING THAT HE WANTED TO KILL THE XY MALE. HE YELLED THE MALE HAD HIT HIM AND HE WANTED TO RETURN THE BLOW. HE SEEMED TO WANT TO CHALLENGE ANY MALE. HE CONTINUED TO HOLD THE MALE'S ARM ALL THE WHILE SPEAKING CALMLY AND TRYING TO DEFUSE THE SIT. WE WERE ABLE TO GET THE XY MALE TO HIDE IN THE AFT CLOSET; TO TRY TO KEEP HIM AWAY FROM THE PAX XX; WHO KEPT REPEATING THAT HE WAS GOING TO KILL HIM. AS I WAS TRYING TO CALM THE PAX DOWN; A PAX ON THE R SIDE OF ME; SEAT XXY; -- A MALE -- KEPT TRYING TO STAND; YELLING AT ME 'YOU'RE NOT HANDLING THIS.' HE WAS TRYING TO TAKE A PUNCH AT THE UNRULY MALE. ANOTHER MALE IN SEAT XXYY ALSO WANTED TO PUNCH THE UNRULY MALE. I USED MY R ARM TO BLOCK XXYY TO KEEP HIM FROM HITTING XX. I CONTINUED TO HOLD THE THREATENING; SWEARING MAN WHILE TRYING TO CALM HIM. HE CONTINUED TO THREATEN ANOTHER PAX IN YY. FLT ATTENDANT #3 WAS ABLE TO MOVE SOME OF THE PAX AROUND AND HAVE THE CAPT LAND IN MAUI. WE WERE ABLE TO MOVE THE XX MALE TO THE REAR JUMP SEAT; HOLDING HIM DOWN TO THE SEAT. THE MAUI SECURITY BOARDED THE ACFT AND DEPLANED THE MALE; USING THE AFT STAIR RAMP. THE WHOLE SIT WAS VERY EXPLOSIVE; AS THE MALE HAD THREATENED SEVERAL PAX; CREATING A VOLATILE SIT ON BOARD. THE UNRULY PAX CAUSED A VERY DANGEROUS SIT ON BOARD THE ACFT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B737-200; KOA-HNL. FIST FIGHT DEVELOPED AMONG MALE PAX. DIVERTED TO MAUI TO TAKE THE MOST AGGRESSIVE PAX OFF BY SECURITY.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: SHORTLY AFTER TKOF; PAX XX (ROW X) RANG HER CALL LIGHT. AS FLT ATTENDANT #4; I ANSWERED. SHE ASKED ME WHICH LAVATORY SHE SHOULD USE. I TOLD HER TO USE THE MAIN CABIN LAVATORY IN BACK FOR NUMEROUS REASONS; INCLUDING THE FACT SHE WAS IN MAIN CABIN. WE WERE PREPARING FOR OUR BEVERAGE/MEAL SVC. SHE ARGUED WITH ME; WANTING TO USE FIRST CLASS LAVATORY. I TOLD HER IT WOULD BE BEST TO USE THE MAIN CABIN LAVATORY. SHE WAS DEFIANT WITH ME AND THEN TOOK OFF TO FIRST CLASS. SHE SEEMED TO HAVE AN ARROGANT ATTITUDE. WE BROUGHT THE BEVERAGE CART UP TO ROW Y (AS USUAL) TO BEGIN THE MAIN CABIN SVC; WAITING FOR THE MEAL CART BEFORE MOVING BACK. THE PAX RETURNED AND NOW THE CART BLOCKED HER FROM HER SEAT. I WAS TRYING TO AVOID THIS; BUT SHE WOULD NOT FOLLOW MY DIRECTIONS. THERE IS VERY LITTLE MANEUVERING ROOM IN THIS AREA AND WE TRY TO KEEP THE CARTS OUT OF FIRST CLASS. I TOLD HER SHE WOULD HAVE TO WAIT FOR THE CARTS; BECAUSE SHE WENT UP TO FIRST CLASS (LAVATORY) INSTEAD OF MAIN CABIN. SHE THEN BEGAN TO GIVE ME ORDERS; TELLING ME 'LOOK; YOU JUST DO YOUR JOB!' I SAID 'JUST WAIT A MIN; AND DON'T TELL ME WHAT TO DO.' THEN SHE TOOK A STEP TOWARD ME; SO SHE WAS STANDING ABOUT 8-9 INCHES FROM MY FACE -- MUCH TOO CLOSE FOR COMFORT -- BASICALLY 'IN MY FACE.' THEN SHE PUSHED ME WITH HER HAND; LIKE SOMEONE DOES STARTING A FIGHT. THIS STARTLED ME AND MADE ME NERVOUS. I NEVER PUSHED HER BACK OR TOUCHED HER WHATSOEVER. I SAID 'THAT'S IT' AND LEFT THE SCENE AND WENT TO THE COCKPIT TO INFORM THE CAPT. I ALSO WANTED TO AVOID THE POSSIBILITY THAT THIS WOMAN WOULD DO ANYTHING FURTHER. SHE SEEMED TO HAVE A PROB WITH AUTH; TAKING ANY DIRECTIONS FROM A CREW MEMBER AND HAD A DEFIANT ATTITUDE. THE PAX WAS MET BY A REPRESENTATIVE; AND SHE ADMITTED TO HIM THAT SHE PUSHED/SHOVED ME ON THE FLT. LATER; WHEN SHE WAS ASKED TO FILL OUT HER INFO ON A RPT; SHE DID SO AND THEN SCRIBBLED OVER THE ENTIRE AREA; MAKING IT UNREADABLE. I VERIFIED HER NAME ON THE MANIFEST. THIS WOMAN IS NOT IN HER RIGHT MIND; DOING SOMETHING LIKE THIS.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; S80; LAS-DFW; VERBALLY ABUSIVE PAX SHOVED CABIN ATTENDANT. CAPT HAD AUTHS MEET FLT. RPT FILED; BUT PAX MADE IT UNREADABLE.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 34.5; Flight Attendant Total 34.5; Flight Attendant Type 100
column107: Flight Attendant Airline Total 31; Flight Attendant Total 31; Flight Attendant Type 90
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Smoke / Fire / Fumes / Odor
column121: I WORKED FIRST CLASS AND MOST THINGS ARE HEARSAY. I DID WORK THE DUTY FREE CART AFTER THE MEAL SVC AND TOLD THESE 2 GUYS THAT THEY WERE LOUD. THEY WERE IN THE LAST ROW OF COACH; L SIDE; BUT SEEMED TO BE WITH A GROUP OF PERHAPS 6-8 YOUNG MEN -- ALL LOUD; DRINKING; SPREAD AROUND THE LAST FEW ROWS OF COACH. THESE 2 ASKED ME FOR DRINKS; BUT I'D ALREADY BEEN TOLD THEY'D BEEN 'CUT OFF' FOR A WHILE BY COACH FLT ATTENDANTS. LATER; I WAS ON BREAK AND NOT TOLD OF OFFENSES; BUT THE FO AND CAPT WERE MAKING DECISIONS AND THE FO WENT BACK A FEW TIMES. IT WAS RPTED THAT THEY HAD THEIR OWN LIQUOR; SMOKED IN LAVATORY; AND REFUSED TO MOVE THEIR FEET FROM THE AISLE FOR OTHERS TRYING TO PASS IN AISLE. 1 BOTTLE OF LIQUOR WAS GIVEN TO FLT ATTENDANTS BY THE PAX IN FRONT OF THEM; AFTER IT HAD ROLLED UNDER SEAT. THESE 2 WERE YOUNG; APPEARED TO NOT BE AWARE OF GRAVITY OF SIT; BUT WERE VERY REMORSEFUL AFTER SOME SLEEP; LNDG; AND BEING GREETED BY SECURITY AND FBI. I NOTICED SEVERAL PAX VOLUNTEERED TO FILE A COMPLAINT TO OFFICERS AS THEY DEPLANED. I COORDINATED WITH CAPT; BUT WAS NOT DIRECTLY INVOLVED IN THEIR OFFENSIVE ACTIONS WITH PAX. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID THAT THE FBI DIDN'T INTERVIEW HER OR THE REST OF THE CREW; AS FAR AS SHE KNOWS. SHE DIDN'T REMEMBER WRITING THE RPT; SO COULD OFFER NO NEW DETAILS. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 459873: 3 PAX WENT TO THEIR OWN BOTTLES OF LIQUOR; PURCHASED AT DUTY FREE IN LHR. ONE OR MORE SMOKED IN THE AFT LAVATORY. THEY WOULDN'T TURN OVER THE LIQUOR TO CABIN OR COCKPIT CREW MEMBER. THEY INTERFERED WITH ALL LEVELS OF CABIN SVC. THEY WERE BELLIGERENT AND DEFIANT EVEN WITH POLICE MEETING THE FLT IN LAX. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID THAT THERE WERE ONLY 3 YOUNG MEN INVOLVED AND NOT THE 8 MENTIONED IN THE PURSER'S RPT. THE SMOKE ALARMS NEVER SOUNDED. SHE CONFIRMED THAT THE CREW WAS NOT INTERVIEWED BY THE FBI AND BELIEVES THEY DIDN'T MEET THE PLANE; BUT THAT LOS ANGELES THE POLICE DID.
column125: MULTIPLE CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-300; LHR-LAX; INTOXICATED; VERBALLY ABUSIVE PAX SMOKED IN LAVATORIES; REFUSED TO QUIT DRINKING FROM OWN BOTTLE. POLICE MET FLT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 31; Flight Attendant Total 31; Flight Attendant Type 100

column121: A PAX IN COACH SECTION OF ACFT BEGAN TO SMOKE A CIGARETTE; REFUSED TO EXTINGUISH IT; WAS IRASCIBLE; ANGRY; AND UNCOOPERATIVE. THE PAX AGAIN LIT A CIGARETTE AND WAS AGAIN REQUESTED TO EXTINGUISH IT. THE PAX WAS INTOXICATED AND TRAVELING WITH HIS WIFE. PAX HAD TO BE WATCHED ALL NIGHT TO PREVENT HIM FROM FURTHER SMOKING.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-300; EZE-JFK. PAX SMOKED IN CABIN REFUSED TO EXTINGUISH CIGARETTE; BECAME DRUNK AND DISORDERLY. PAX HAD TO BE GUARDED BY CABIN ATTENDANT FOR REST OF FLT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 1.5; Flight Attendant Total 1.5; Flight Attendant Type 2
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING THE LNDG PHASE; A PAX SITTING IN ROW X STOOD UP AT HIS SEAT. I WENT TO HIS SEAT AND TOLD HIM TO SIT DOWN AND FASTEN SEATBELT. HE CUSSED AT ME AND REFUSED TO COMPLY. HE SEEMED INTOXICATED AND INCOHERENT. AFTER I CAME BACK TO MY JUMP SEAT; FLT ATTENDANT #3 TOLD ME THAT A PAX SITTING NEXT TO HIM HAD TOLD HER THAT HE (THE MAN) MOLESTED HER; BY TOUCHING HER UNDER HER SKIRT. FLT ATTENDANT #3 MOVED HER TO FIRST CLASS DURING THE FLT. HE WAS TALKING TO HIMSELF LOUDLY AND INCOHERENTLY MOST OF THE FLT. AFTER LNDG; I TOLD CAPT ABOUT THE INCIDENT AND HE ARRANGED FOR AUTHS TO MEET THE FLT. THE CAPT TOLD ME AFTERWARD; THAT THE PAX HAD IN HIS POSSESSION 1/3 OF AN EMPTY VODKA BOTTLE AND SMELLED OF ALCOHOL. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE MAN WAS STILL STANDING UP FOR LNDG WHEN SHE WENT BACK TO HER JUMP SEAT; BUT MAY HAVE SAT DOWN AFTER SHE LEFT THE SCENE. THE MAN HAD ALLEGEDLY TOUCHED THE GIRL; SITTING NEXT TO HIM; A LOT EARLIER IN THE FLT; AND THE RPTR ONLY HEARD ABOUT IT ON LNDG WHEN SHE SAT DOWN IN THE SAME JUMP SEAT AS THE FLT ATTENDANT WHO HAD MOVED THE GIRL TO FIRST CLASS. THE AUTHS; WHO MET THE FLT; INTERVIEWED THE PAX WITNESSES; WHO WERE SITTING BEHIND THE MAN AND THE GIRL (THAT HE ALLEGEDLY MOLESTED). SHE DOESN'T KNOW WHAT HAPPENED TO HIM AFTER THAT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B727; MIA-SAN PEDRO; HONDURAS. INTOXICATED PAX INAPPROPRIATELY TOUCHED GIRL; REFUSED TO SIT FOR LNDG; MET BY HONDURAN AUTHS.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 14; Flight Attendant Total 14; Flight Attendant Type 60
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: AT APPROX XA50 (DURING BOARDING) A PAX BOARDED THE ACFT AND APPEARED TO BE INTOXICATED. I LOOKED AT FLT ATTENDANT #7; WHO WAS DIRECTING PAX TO THEIR SEATS; AND COMMENTED TO HIM THAT THE MALE PAX SEEMED INTOXICATED. I LOOKED DOWN THE AISLE TO SEE HIM STAGGER INTO A BULKHEAD WALL. SEVERAL MINS LATER; I WALKED TO THE COACH GALLEY TO RETRIEVE SOME SUPPLIES. AS I WAS WALKING BY HIS SEAT WITH FLT ATTENDANT #5; I SMELLED ALCOHOL. I LOOKED AT THE PAX AND HE HAD A STYROFOAM CUP WHICH APPEARED TO BE SCOTCH OR BOURBON. HE WAS ALSO SLUMPED IN HIS SEAT NEXT TO HIS WIFE. I IMMEDIATELY RPTED THE SIT TO FLT ATTENDANT #1; WHO IMMEDIATELY RPTED TO THE GATE AGENTS. THE GATE AGENTS THOUGHT THE PAX WAS OK WHEN THEY SPOKE WITH HIM AND DELAYING THE MATTER. I THEN SPOKE WITH THE CAPT; WHICH RESULTED IN REMOVAL OF THE PAX AND A 15 MIN DELAY. ABOUT 2 HRS INTO THE FLT; THE CAPT RECEIVED WORD THAT THE PAX WAS PUT ON ANOTHER FLT (45 MINS LATER). I BELIEVE THE ENTIRE ISSUE OF THE GATE AGENTS NOT REMOVING THE PAX IMMEDIATELY; RESULTED IN MAKING MYSELF; THE CAPT; AND OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS LOOK LIKE THEY SHOWED POOR JUDGEMENT; AND DELAYING THE FLT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; MD11P; MIA-EZE; CAPT HAD INTOXICATED PAX REMOVED ON BOARDING. AIRLINE PUT PAX ON ANOTHER FLT LEAVING 45 MINS LATER.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 10; Flight Attendant Total 10; Flight Attendant Type 50
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FLT WAS DELAYED IN CHICAGO BY 3 HRS BECAUSE OF SNOWY CONDITIONS AND MANY PAX WERE UPSET AT THE INCONVENIENCE. DURING THE DINNER SVC PHASE OF THE FLT; I WAS RETRIEVING AN ITEM FROM THE AFT GALLEY AND NOTICED PAX USING HIS CELL PHONE. IT WAS ILLUMINATED (ON) AND HE WAS PUNCHING IN NUMBERS AS IF MAKING A CALL. I POINTED TO THE PHONE AND SAID 'NO; NO; NO. YOU CAN'T USE THAT PHONE ON THIS PLANE.' PAX BEGAN YELLING AT ME AND STATED HE WAS ONLY PROGRAMMING NUMBERS INTO THE PHONE. I SAID IT DIDN'T MATTER; PLEASE TURN IT OFF. HE BECAME VERY ANGRY AND SAID HE WOULDN'T TURN IT OFF BECAUSE THERE WAS NO HARM IN IT. I PHONED THE CAPT AND HE SAID TURN IT OFF. RELAYING THIS TO PAX; HE THEN TURNED IT OFF; STILL ANGRY; STILL DEBATING. THEN A PAX BEHIND HIM SAID HE COULD USE IT JUST TO PROGRAM NUMBERS AND I PHONED CAPT AGAIN RELAYING THIS INFO. HE SAID TO ALLOW PAX TO USE HIS PHONE; BUT IF PROBS AROSE; WE WOULD COME TO HIM FIRST. PAX CONSIDERED THAT A 'THREAT' AND BECAME ANGRY ONCE AGAIN. HE STOPPED USING PHONE ON HIS OWN AFTER I SHOWED HIM OUR PA CARD WHICH STATES 'CELL PHONES MUST BE TURNED OFF INFLT.' AFTER INCIDENT WAS OVER; I ASKED FOR PAX'S NAME FOR MY RPT AND ALSO GOT 2 WITNESSES' INFO (NAME; PHONE; ADDRESS). SOME PEOPLE HAVE TOLD ME THAT A CELL PHONE CAN STILL PICK UP RANDOM SIGNALS WHEN TURNED ON FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROGRAMMING NUMBERS DURING A FLT. THIS NEEDS TO BE CLARIFIED. EVEN IF NOT; IT APPEARS AS IF A CALL IS BEING MADE WHEN THIS IS BEING DONE; AND BECAUSE OF THE SEVERITY OF ACFT SYS INTERFERENCE; IT IS RATHER UNNERVING FOR A CREW MEMBER TO COME ACROSS.
column125: PAX USED CELL PHONE INFLT.

column121: I DID NOT WITNESS THE EVENT. FROM OTHER PAX; I LEARNED THAT TWO OUT OF OUR FIRST CLASS PAX HAD GOTTEN INTO A VERBAL EXCHANGE OVER A CARRYON BAG AND THE OVERHEAD BIN SPACE. ONE SLAPPED THE OTHER ON THE BACK OF THE NECK AND THREATS OF LAWSUITS FOLLOWED. BOTH PAX WERE REMOVED FROM THE ACFT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B737; ORD-SAN. 2 FIRST CLASS PAX GOT IN PHYSICAL FIGHT OVER OVERHEAD BIN SPACE. PAX REMOVED FROM FLT.

column95: Flight Crew Air Transport Pilot (ATP); Flight Crew Flight Engineer

column121: JUST PRIOR TO SCHEDULED PUSHBACK; A FLT ATTENDANT CAME UP TO THE COCKPIT TO RELATE THIS INCIDENT. THE FLT ATTENDANT SAID THAT A PAX IN THE BULKHEAD ROW; WHEN ASKED ABOUT CONTENTS OF BAG; THAT IT HAD TO BE PUT IN THE OVERHEAD BIN; REPLIED 'A BOMB.' PAX HAD BEEN DRINKING. AFTER TALKING WITH GATE AGENT; I DECIDED TO HAVE THE PAX AND BAGS REMOVED. HIS TRAVELING COMPANION ALSO ELECTED TO DISEMBARK. ARPT SECURITY GOT INVOLVED.
column125: CAPT RPT; B757; BOARDING IN PHOENIX; PAX MADE JOKE ABOUT BOMB IN HIS LUGGAGE. CAPT HAD HIM AND BAG REMOVED BY SECURITY PERSONNEL.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 29; Flight Attendant Total 31; Flight Attendant Type 95
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column118: Flight Crew Diverted; Flight Crew Landed As Precaution
column121: FOREIGN PAX IN COACH STARTED TO INTERFERE WITH CREW DUTIES; WAS RESISTANT TO CREW AUTH AND WHEN I TOLD HIM THAT I WOULD GO TO TALK TO THE CAPT; HE TOLD ME; HE COULD WALK INTO THE COCKPIT ANYTIME HE PLEASED. WHEN I TOLD HIM THAT WAS AGAINST UNITED STATES RULES; HE WAS DEFIANT. THE CAPT SPOKE WITH HIM; BUT COULD NOT GET COMPLIANCE. HE FINALLY DECIDED TO LAND IN MSP TO DEPLANE PAX. NO ARREST OR CHARGES WERE BROUGHT AGAINST HIM. OTHER PAX SEEMED HAPPIER THAT HE WAS OFF THE FLT. OUR NEXT 8 HRS OVER TO FRANCE WAS FINALLY PEACEFUL. THIS PAX WOULD HAVE BEEN A THREAT TO A SMOOTH OP OF THE FLT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THE TROUBLE STARTED ON BOARDING; WHEN THE PAX WOULDN'T PUT HIS OVERWT BAG AWAY. SHE SAID THAT HE SEEMED VERY ODD AND DISTURBING TO THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS AND PAX. ALTHOUGH THIS WAS A NO SMOKING FLT; HE BRAZENLY DISPLAYED A PACK OF CIGARETTES ON THE TRAY TABLE NEXT TO HIM. AT ONE POINT; HE SHOVED A FLT ATTENDANT OUT OF THE AISLE. AT NO TIME DID THE MAN CONSUME ALCOHOL. THE POLICE MET THE FLT IN MINNEAPOLIS AND TOOK HIM OFF THE PLANE. OUTSIDE IN THE BOARDING AREA; THE POLICE WERE HOLDING HIM; AND THE CAPT AND THE RPTR CAME OUT TO TALK TO THE POLICE. THE MAN STARTED THREATENING THE RPTR AND THE CAPT WITH RETALIATION; AND THEN; HE LUNGED AT THE CAPT TO STRIKE HIM. THE CREW DECIDED NOT TO PRESS CHARGES WITH THE POLICE OR FBI; BECAUSE THEY DIDN'T THINK THEY HAD ENOUGH EVIDENCE TO PROSECUTE. THE PAX WITNESSES; THE RPTR AND THE FLT ATTENDANT HE SHOVED; WERE ALL SCARED FOR THEIR LIVES. AFTERWARDS; SHE UNSUCCESSFULLY TRIED TO FIND OUT WHAT HAPPENED TO HIM.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-300; LAX-PARIS; DEFIANT PAX IGNORED FAA REG. SHOVED A CABIN ATTENDANT. DIVERT TO MSP TO REMOVE PAX. POLICE MET FLT; BUT NO CHARGES FILED BY CREW.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 23; Flight Attendant Total 23; Flight Attendant Type 10
column105: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WAS CALLED ON THE INTERPHONE BY FLT ATTENDANT #1 TO FORWARD GALLEY FOR MY OPINION. A COACH PAX WAS IN FIRST CLASS GALLEY CRYING AND SAID SHE WAS SLEEPING AND WOKE UP WITH A PAX SEATED NEXT TO HER; WITH HIS HANDS BTWN HER LEGS. I KNOW THAT THAT WAS NOT HIS ORIGINAL SEAT. I HAD HELPED HIM STOW HIS LUGGAGE PREFLT. SHE SEEMED GENUINELY TRAUMATIZED AND WE DECIDED TO HAVE THE AUTHS MEET THE FLT IN SJU. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID THAT THE YOUNG WOMAN HAD HAD THE WHOLE ROW TO HERSELF WHEN SHE WENT TO SLEEP. SHE WOKE UP TO SEE HIM SITTING RIGHT NEXT TO HER ON AN EMPTY FLT. SHE SHRUGGED IT OFF AND WENT BACK TO SLEEP. WHEN SHE WOKE UP AGAIN; THE MAN HAD HIS HANDS UP HER SKIRT. SHE IMMEDIATELY JUMPED UP AND RAN TO THE GALLEY; SOBBING. SHE WAS REALLY TRAUMATIZED BY THE INCIDENT. AFTER THE CREW CONSOLED HER AND THE CAPT HAD OFFERED TO GET THE POLICE TO MEET THE FLT. THE WOMAN WAS TOO SHOOK UP TO MAKE THE DECISION TO HAVE HIM ARRESTED; SO SHE CALLED HER HUSBAND FROM THE PLANE TO ASK FOR HIS ADVICE. HE SAID HE'D BE AT THE ARPT TO MEET HER AND THAT HE'D MAKE SURE THE POLICE WERE THERE TO ARREST THE GUY. THE CREW MOVED THE WOMAN UP TO FIRST CLASS FOR LNDG; SO SHE'D BE OFF THE PLANE BEFORE HIM.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; JFK-SJU. WOMAN RPTED THAT A MALE PAX HAD VIOLATED HER; WHILE SHE WAS ASLEEP. AUTHS CALLED TO MEET FLT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 0.5; Flight Attendant Total 14; Flight Attendant Type 15
column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A PAX WAS WALKING AROUND THE CABIN; WHILE WE WERE TAXIING BACK TO GATE TO HAVE THE COM EQUIP CHKED. ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT ENCOUNTERED HIM IN THE FORWARD CABIN AND TOLD HIM TO RETURN TO HIS SEAT. HE REFUSED. SHE INFORMED HIM TO SIT; AND THAT IF HE DIDN'T; SHE WOULD HAVE THE AUTHS MEET THE FLT. I GOT INVOLVED LATER; BECAUSE I WAS WALKING THROUGH THE CABIN AND HE COMPLAINED TO ME ABOUT IT AND WANTED TO FILE A COMPLAINT WITH THE COMPANY. IT TURNS OUT THAT THE FLT ATTENDANT HE HAD THE ENCOUNTER WITH WAS THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT AND HE WAS DETAINED BY THE AUTHS. THE FLT THEN DEPARTED AFTER THE COM PART WAS REPLACED. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE MAN WAS WALKING AROUND THE CABIN BAREFOOTED DURING BOARDING; BECAUSE HE 'JUST LIKED TO WALK.' AFTER THE MAN REFUSED MANY REQUESTS FROM THE FLT ATTENDANTS TO SIT DOWN; THE PURSER TOLD THE CAPT; WHO DECIDED TO HAVE THE POLICE MEET THE FLT WHEN THEY GOT TO THE GATE. THE POLICE DETAINED THE MAN; WHO GOT BELLIGERENT WITH THEM; AS WELL AS HIS FAMILY. THE FLT LEFT WITHOUT THEM.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; MIA-LAX. PAX REFUSED TO SIT DOWN DURING TAXI. CAPT CALLED FOR POLICE TO MEET FLT. PAX AND FAMILY REMOVED.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12; Flight Attendant Total 12; Flight Attendant Type 10
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A PAX WAS ASKED TO STEP ASIDE BY 2 DIFFERENT FLT ATTENDANTS AT 2 DIFFERENT TIMES; SO THAT THEY COULD DO THEIR JOBS. APPARENTLY IRRITATED; HE FIRED BACK AT THE GALLEY FLT ATTENDANT; USING PROFANITY; SAYING HE WAS IN EVERYBODY'S WAY. THE FLT ATTENDANT TRIED TO EXPLAIN WHAT SHE WAS DOING AND WHY SHE ASKED HIM TO STEP ASIDE; AND HE CAME BACK WITH 'DON'T EVEN START WITH ME...DON'T START WITH ME BECAUSE I'LL FINISH IT.' THIS APPEARED TO BE A DIRECT THREAT; THEREFORE; WE ASKED FOR AUTHS TO HANDLE THIS SIT UPON ARR IN DFW.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; TPA-DFW. PAX MADE A VEILED PHYSICAL THREAT TO A CABIN ATTENDANT. CALL FOR AUTHS TO MEET FLT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 4.3; Flight Attendant Total 4.3; Flight Attendant Type 30
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WAS THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT ON THIS FLT (IN BACK PREPARING MY CART FOR THE SVC. THE #1 CALLED ME ON THE PHONE AND SAID A MAN WAS 'INTOXICATED; SO I SAID 'I'LL COME UP AND SEE.' SO WHEN I GOT UP THERE; I ASKED HER WHAT HAPPENED. SHE SAID HE WALKED ON THE PLANE AND SAID 'HI BABY' OR 'HEY BABY.' HE WAS CARRYING A LIQUOR (I BELIEVE IT WAS A 5TH) BOTTLE IN HIS JACKET POCKET. HE WAS ALSO STAGGERING. SHE FOLLOWED HIM TO HIS SEAT AND ASKED HIM WHAT HE WAS DRINKING. HE GAVE HER THE 'RUM' BOTTLE (EMPTY -- ONLY A COVER LEFT). AT THAT POINT; THE AGENT WAS CALLED AND SHE TALKED TO HIM AND HE (THE PAX) WAS FINALLY REMOVED FROM THE FLT. THIS INCIDENT HAPPENED DURING BOARDING.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; F100; JAX-DFW. OBVIOUSLY; INTOXICATED PAX BOARDED WITH BOTTLE OF RUM IN BACK POCKET. PURSER CONSULTED WITH GATE AGENT. PAX REMOVED IN JAX.

column121: PAX BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO OTHER PAX; CREW; HIS BROTHER. HE WAS SLAPPING HIS BROTHER; YELLING AND SCREAMING; AND REFUSED TO COOPERATE AT HIS SEAT. I WENT BACK TO MAIN CABIN TO HELP FLT ATTENDANTS FINISH THE MEAL SVC AND OBSERVED FLT ATTENDANT #2 TRYING TO CALM 2 PAX SEATED IN ROW XG. I WAS STANDING NEAR THE BUSINESS CLASS GALLEY AND COULD HEAR THESE MEN SHOUTING. FLT ATTENDANT #2 SPOKE TO THEM TWICE BEFORE I COULD GET THERE. WHEN I ADDRESSED THEM THE MAN ASKED ME TO GET HIM AN ALCOHOLIC DRINK. I TOLD HIM HE HAD HAD ENOUGH AND OFFERED HIM AN ENTREE CHOICE AND SOFT DRINK. HE BECAME BELLIGERENT AND HANDED THE TRAY BACK TO ME. HE DID NOT WANT TO EAT IF HE COULDN'T HAVE ALCOHOL. HE STARTED SHOUTING AT HIS BROTHER; AND HITTING THE SEAT IN FRONT OF HIM DISRUPTING THE PAX SEATED IN FRONT OF HIM. I TRIED TO REASON WITH HIM THAT HE MUST GET CTL OF HIMSELF OR WE WOULD HAVE AUTHS MEET THE FLT. AT THIS POINT I ASKED FLT ATTENDANT #3 IF HE COULD SPEAK WITH HIM. THIS SEEMED TO WORK TEMPORARILY; AND HE ONCE AGAIN BEGAN SHOUTING; CHANTING; CLAPPING HIS HANDS. THE CAPT WAS INFORMED THAT HE NEEDED TO COME BACK. THE CAPT CAME BACK TO REASON WITH HIM; TO NO AVAIL. THE CAPT INFORMED US THAT WE WOULD BE LNDG AT GANDER; NEWFOUNDLAND; TO REMOVE HIM (THE PAX). THE CAPT AND FLT ATTENDANT #3 RESTRAINED THE PAX TO HIS SEAT AND MOVED HIS BROTHER ACROSS THE AISLE. DURING THE APCH; FLT ATTENDANT #2 PHONED ME THAT THE PAX HAD WRIGGLED FREE OF THE RESTRAINTS AND CUT HIS WRISTS DOING IT. I REMOVED THE RUBBER GLOVES FROM THE SVC KIT AND GAVE THEM TO THE OFFICERS WHEN THEY BOARDED. THE PAX WAS REMOVED WITHOUT FURTHER INCIDENT; WE REFUELED AND LEFT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE UNRULY PAX NEVER STRUCK A CREW MEMBER; JUST HIS BROTHER. THE CREW LATER FOUND THAT THEY WERE DRINKING OUT OF THEIR OWN BOTTLE OF DUTY FREE LIQUOR. ON TOUCHDOWN; THE MAN GOT OUT OF HIS RESTRAINTS AND STARTED TO RUN DOWN THE AISLE; CHANTING 'I WANT TO GO TO JAIL. I WANT TO GO TO JAIL.' EVERYONE SEATED IN 10 ROWS IN FRONT OF HIM AND IN BACK OF HIM WAS VERY FRIGHTENED BY THE WHOLE AFFAIR; ESPECIALLY THE WOMAN SITTING IN FRONT OF THE BROTHERS; BECAUSE HE WAS KICKING HER SEAT AND TOUCHING HER HEAD. THEY HAD AT LEAST 1 HR DELAY ON THE GND IN GANDER; WHILE MECHS CHKED OUT THE AIRPLANE FOR DAMAGE DUE TO LNDG HVY. WHILE ON THE GND IN GANDER; THE CREW DECIDED THAT THE BROTHER COULD CONTINUE ON WITH THEM. HOWEVER; WHEN THEY WENT TO TELL HIM OF THEIR DECISION; THEY FOUND HIM IN A LAVATORY; SMOKING. THE RPTR DOES NOT KNOW WHAT CHARGES; IF ANY; WERE FILED AGAINST HIM.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-200. JFK-LHR; INTOXICATED; VERBALLY AND PHYSICALLY ABUSIVE PAX. DIVERT TO GANDER; NF. POLICE REMOVED PAX. PAX RELATIVE SMOKED IN LAVATORY ON GND.

column121: A PAX APPEARED TO BE INTOXICATED AND BECAME BELLIGERENT. HE REFUSED TO SIT DURING DSCNT AND LNDG. HE WALKED TO THE REAR OF THE ACFT DURING TAXI-IN; HE BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE TOWARDS 2 FLT ATTENDANTS. I SPOKE TO HIM IN HIS NATIVE TONGUE AND TOLD HIM TO BE SEATED AND TO BE QUIET. HE REFUSED. HE STORMED OFF; HOLDING HIS BRIEFCASE OVER HIS HEAD; IN A MENACING MANNER; SHOVING PEOPLE OUT OF HIS WAY. AUTHS MET THE FLT AT SDQ AND HE WAS CARTED OFF.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; A300; JFK-SDQ; INTOXICATED AND VERBALLY ABUSIVE PAX; REFUSED TO SIT DURING DSCNT; LNDG AND TAXI-IN. AUTHS MET FLT AND REMOVED HIM.

column121: CLBING THROUGH 13000 FT FROM RSW TO MDW; FLT ATTENDANT CALLED AND INFORMED ME THAT L2 DOOR (L AFT GALLEY DOOR) HAD A LOUD AIR NOISE. NOTICED CABIN CLBING 2000 FPM. REQUESTED CTR TO STOP CLB AT 15000 FT. MAINTAINED CABIN AT 8000 FT. REQUESTED CTR FOR VECTORS TO DUMP 15000 LBS OF FUEL TO REDUCE TO LNDG WT OF 160000 LBS. LANDED AT PIE AFTER FUEL DUMP AND REPAIRED PROB BY MAINT AT PIE. MAINT FOUND BOTTOM OF L2 DOOR NOT SEATED PROPERLY. DOOR WAS SECURED AND LATCHED WITH NO DOOR LIGHT ILLUMINATED IN COCKPIT PRIOR TO DEP FROM RSW. MAINT AT PIE CLEANED DOOR SEAL. CHKED PRESSURIZATION ON GND AND CLRED WRITE-UP IN LOG. REBOARDED PAX AND DEPARTED FOR MDW WITH NO FURTHER PROBS. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 464237: WE NEVER DECLARED AN EMER. NO WARNING LIGHTS WERE EVER ILLUMINATED. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 464138: DURING THIS WHOLE ORDEAL THERE WAS AN UNRULY PAX IN BACK THAT WAS INTERFERING WITH THE FLT ATTENDANT'S DUTIES. UPON LNDG; WE DEPLANED PAX AND HAD SECURITY MEET THE PAX. MAINT FOUND DOOR HAD NOT BEEN SEATED PROPERLY IN RSW BY GND SVC PERSONNEL. THE UNRULY PAX CALLED THE PRESS IN CHICAGO AND THE WHOLE SAFE; PRECAUTIONARY SIT WAS TURNED INTO A FIASCO. THE MEDIA TURNED ALL FACTS INTO LIES. I THINK THE GND SVC PERSONNEL SHOULD BE 'CHKED OUT' ON THE CLOSING OF THESE DOORS TO PREVENT FUTURE PROBS. UNFORTUNATELY; THE FLT ATTENDANTS COULD NOT WARN US ANY SOONER (ON GND) BECAUSE MOST DOORS HAVE SOME AIR LEAKAGE ON GND UNTIL THE ACFT SEALS BEGIN TO CLOSE DOOR GAP WHEN ACFT IS PRESSURIZING DURING FLT; SO THEY FELT THERE WAS NO PROB. THE CABIN AND COCKPIT CREWS DID EVERYTHING IN A PROFESSIONAL MANNER AND THE WHOLE SIT WAS BLOWN OUT OF PROPORTION.
column125: A B727-200 IS FORCED TO LAND AT PIE ENRTE TO MDW WHEN THE CABIN ATTENDANT RPTS A LOUD RUSHING SOUND FROM THE L2 DOOR IN CABIN. ZMA; FL.

column121: 2 PAX WERE HAVING A FIGHT IN THE CABIN. A FLT ATTENDANT CALLED COCKPIT -- PANICKED. THE CAPT LEFT THE FLT DECK TO DEAL WITH THE SIT. THE PAX COMPLIED IMMEDIATELY WITH CAPT'S DEMANDS TO RETURN TO SEAT. POLICE MET ACFT. FBI CALLED. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE 2 PAX WERE SITTING IN FIRST CLASS ON A B757. ONE HAD JUST COME IN FROM AUSTRALIA AND WAS EXTREMELY TIRED; SO HE RECLINED HIS SEAT BACK TO SLEEP. THE MAN SITTING BEHIND HIM BECAME VERY AGITATED AND STARTED PUSHING THE SEAT FORWARD. THIS EVENTUALLY LED TO A VERBAL FIGHT AND ALMOST ERUPTED INTO A PHYSICAL FIGHT; RIGHT OUTSIDE THE COCKPIT DOOR; WHERE THE LAVATORIES ARE LOCATED. THE CAPT CAME OUT OF THE COCKPIT AND GOT IN THE MIDDLE OF THE FIGHT TO TRY TO GET THEIR ATTN THAT HE WAS THE CAPT. THEY WERE SO BLINDED BY THEIR ANGER THAT THEY COULDN'T EVEN SEE HIM. HE SAID HE DIDN'T BELIEVE ALCOHOL WAS A CONTRIBUTING FACTOR. THE POLICE DETAINED THE 2 PAX FOR SEVERAL HRS BEFORE RELEASING THEM. THE FAA CALLED THE CAPT AT HIS LAYOVER HOTEL THAT NIGHT TO SEE IF HE WANTED TO FILE CHARGES; WHICH HE DIDN'T.
column125: PLT RPT; B757. FIRST CLASS PAX GOT IN LOUD; VERBAL FIGHT OUTSIDE COCKPIT. CAPT HAD TO BREAK IT UP. POLICE MET FLT AND DETAINED PAX. NO CHARGES FILED.

column121: AN 18 YR OLD FEMALE PAX; ON BEHAVIOR MEDICATIONS; WALKED AROUND DURING TAXI OUT. WHEN CONFRONTED BY A FEMALE FLT ATTENDANT THE PAX STATED THAT SHE WAS GOING TO 'SLAP THE BITCH.' THE FEMALE PAX ALSO GRABBED A MALE FLT ATTENDANT'S BUTTOCKS. THE PAX WAS VERY AGGRESSIVE AND DISRUPTIVE. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE GIRL WAS TRAVELING WITH HER FAMILY OF FIVE. THE FATHER WAS AN MD; WHO SAID HIS DAUGHTER HAD BEHAVIOR PROBS AND HE HAD HER ON BEHAVIOR MEDICATION. THE OLDER BROTHER WAS QUITE EMBARRASSED BY HER BEHAVIOR AND THE YOUNGER KIDS WERE SCARED. THE FATHER AND MOTHER SEEMED TO BE UNCONCERNED THAT THEIR DAUGHTER WAS DISRUPTING THE WHOLE FLT AND THAT SHE NEVER SAT DOWN FOR 6 HRS. TO THE PAX AND CREW; SHE APPEARED TO BE OUT OF CTL AND FRIGHTENING. HER EYES WERE DAZED AND HALF CLOSED. THE FAMILY WAS SEATED IN THE BACK OF COACH; AND SHE CAME ALL THE WAY UP TO FIRST CLASS TO USE THE LAVATORIES ON TAXI. THAT'S WHEN SHE HAD THE CONFRONTATION WITH THE FEMALE FLT ATTENDANT. THE RPTR SAID THAT; IN RETROSPECT; THEY SHOULD HAVE GONE BACK TO THE GATE AND HAD HER REMOVED. THE CAPT WAS READY TO CALL FOR AUTHS; BUT THE FATHER HAD INTIMIDATED THE PURSER OF A COUNTER-SUIT; SO THE RPTR DIDN'T HAVE THE CAPT CALL FOR AUTHS TO MEET THE FLT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-200; SAN-JFK. DISRUPTIVE PAX ON BEHAVIOR MEDICATION; WOULDN'T SIT DOWN FOR TAXI AND REST OF FLT. FATHER (MD) INTIMIDATED CREW. NO CHARGES.

column121: FOLLOWING THE SAFETY VIDEO; I WAS CHECKING THE CABIN. MYSELF AND THE #4 FLT ATTENDANT AND PAX IN THE AFT SECTION OF ACFT SMELLED A CHEMICAL SMELL IN THE CABIN. WE ASKED PAX TO CHECK BAGS FOR ANY ITEMS THAT MIGHT HAVE BEEN LEAKING. THE #4 FLT ATTENDANT CALLED THE COCKPIT AND INFORMED THEM OF THE SIT. WE COULD NOT FIND THE SOURCE OF THE SMELL. THE #4 FLT ATTENDANT OPENED THE COCKPIT DOOR AND TOLD THEM WE SHOULD GO BACK TO THE GATE AND HAVE THE CABIN CHECKED OUT. THE CAPT MADE A PA THAT WE WERE GOING BACK TO THE GATE. THE PAX IN ROW X HAD 2 BABY BOTTLES FILLED WITH ETHER/PCP. WHEN THE AGENTS AND MYSELF ASKED WHAT HE HAD IN THE SEAT NEXT TO HIM; HE DENIED ANYTHING WAS THERE. THEN WE PERSISTED; BECAUSE HE HAD BLANKETS IN THE SEAT NEXT TO HIM; AND HE WAS TRYING TO COVER SOMETHING UP. WE DISCOVERED ONE BABY BOTTLE WHICH TURNED OUT TO BE THE SOURCE OF THE CHEMICAL SMELL. THE #4 FLT ATTENDANT TOOK THE PAX TO THE FORWARD PART OF THE ACFT. HE PUT HIS HANDS IN HIS PANTS; AS IF HE HAD A WEAPON. A FEW MINUTES WENT BY AND THERE WAS NO ONE TO TAKE THIS PAX OFF THE ACFT; SO HE WENT BACK TO HIS SEAT. THE PAX IN ROW Y SAW HIM POUR ANOTHER BABY BOTTLE FILLED WITH THE ETHER/PCP ALL OVER BLANKETS; PILLOWS AND SEAT. HE NUDGED MY ELBOW TO GET MY ATTENTION AND THE SMELL WAS GETTING STRONGER AT THIS POINT. AFTER THE MAN IN ROW Y GOT MY ATTENTION I ASKED ROW X WHAT HE HAD (A DEADHEADING CAPT WAS THERE WITH ME AT THIS POINT). HIS RESPONSE WAS 'NOTHING.' WE FINALLY GOT HIM TO HAND OVER THE SECOND BOTTLE THAT HE JUST POURED ALL OVER THE AREA. THE DEADHEADING CAPT TOOK HIM TO FORWARD PART OF THE ACFT; AND I STAYED IN THE BACK OF THE ACFT AND COLLECTED EVERYTHING THAT HAD THE LIQUID POURED ON IT (2 BLANKETS; 1 PILLOW; 1 PURPLE VELVET CROWN ROYAL BAG). I GAVE THESE ITEMS TO AGENTS AT FORWARD OF ACFT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE PAX WAS NOT TRAVELING WITH A BABY. SHE BELIEVES THAT IS WHY HE KEPT TRYING TO COVER THE BABY BOTTLES WITH A BABY BLANKET. WHEN CONFRONTED BY THE RPTR ABOUT THE CONTENTS OF THE BOTTLE; HE PRETENDED HE DIDN'T SPEAK ENGLISH AND REFUSED TO SHOW HER THE BOTTLES. THEY WENT BACK TO THE GATE TO WAIT FOR THE POLICE. THE POLICE TOOK A LONG TIME GETTING TO THE PLANE; SO THE MAN WENT BACK TO HIS SEAT. MEANWHILE; BECAUSE OF THE EXTENSIVE WAIT FOR THE POLICE; PAX AND THE FLT ATTENDANTS BECAME QUITE SICK. ONE FLT ATTENDANT AND A 12 YR OLD BOY HAD TO BE RUSHED TO THE EMER ROOM. FINALLY; THE POLICE AND THE FIRE DEPARTMENT CAME AND TOOK HIM OFF. THEY TOLD THE CREW THAT THE BABY BOTTLE CONTAINED THE ETHER/PCP MIXTURE. THE POLICE DIDN'T THINK THAT THE GUY WAS A TERRORIST; BUT THAT HE WAS TAKING THE DRUGS TO DALLAS TO SELL THEM. THE FLT; EVENTUALLY; WAS CANCELLED; BECAUSE THE WHOLE CREW AND SOME PAX HAD TO GO TO THE MEDICAL DEPARTMENT. ONE FLT ATTENDANT; WHO WAS NOT DIRECTLY INVOLVED IN THE INCIDENT; TESTED POSITIVE FOR PCP; AND THE RPTR; WHO HANDLED THE CONTAMINATED SEATS AND BLANKETS; DID NOT. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 465492: THERE NEEDS TO BE A BETTER SYS OF HIRING AND SCREENING AT SECURITY CHECK POINTS.
column125: MULTIPLE CAB REPORT; B757; LAX-DFW. CHEMICAL FUMES FILLED CABIN ON TAXI OUT. PAX SNUCK ON BABY BOTTLES FILLED WITH ETHER/PCP. RETURN TO GATE. PAX REMOVED.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: ON JAN/XA/00 WE WERE BOARDING FLT MIA-DFW. THE FLT WAS VERY FULL AND WE EVENTUALLY NEEDED TO START CHKING BAGS. THE AGENTS CAME DOWN AND BEGAN CHKING THE BAGS AS WE CONTINUED TO BOARD BOTH FIRST CLASS AND COACH. MANY PAX WERE VERY ANGRY ABOUT CHKING THEIR BAGS BECAUSE THE CLOSET AND OVERHEAD BIN SPACE HAD FILLED UP VERY FAST. WE MADE OUR REQUIRED ANNOUNCEMENTS ABOUT THE BAGGAGE PRIOR TO BOARDING AS WELL AS ON THE ACFT; YET WE UNFORTUNATELY DID NOT HAVE ENOUGH SPACE FOR EVERYONE'S CARRY-ON LUGGAGE. ABOUT 5 MINS BEFORE DEP; I COULD HEAR SOMEONE YELLING LOUDLY FROM THE BOARDING DOOR. IT WAS AT THIS TIME THAT I HAD THE PLEASURE OF ENCOUNTERING MR X WHO WAS VERY UNRULY; DEMANDING; AND THREATENING! HE WAS SHAKING; SWEATING; SWEARING AND REFUSING TO CHK HIS BAG! HE WAS CURSING ABOUT HOW TERRIBLE OUR AIRLINE WAS AND INSISTING ON WANTING EVERYONE'S NAME AND EMPLOYEE NUMBERS; INCLUDING THE GATE AGENTS AND ENTIRE CREW. HE PUT HIS FINGER IN MY FACE AND SWORE THAT IF I CHKED HIS BAG; IT WOULD BE ALL OF OUR JOBS! HE WAS EXTREMELY VOLATILE WITH THE #6 FLT ATTENDANT. I DID AT THIS TIME CONFIDE IN THE CAPT THAT THINGS WERE VERY HECTIC AND WE WERE STRUGGLING WITH A DIFFICULT PAX; BUT FELT THE SIT WAS UNDER CTL! PAX X FINALLY SAT DOWN AND CONTINUED TO COMPLAIN AND YELL UNTIL AFTER TKOF! HE REMAINED RELATIVELY QUIET DURING THE FLT; BUT INTERFERED WITH ME DISARMING MY DOORS IN THE FIRST CLASS GALLEY UPON DEPLANING. BECAUSE OF HIS LARGE SIZE AND AGGRESSIVE NATURE; I FELT VERY INTIMIDATED WITH HIM STANDING IN FRONT OF ME. HE TOLD ME THAT HE HAD MY BOSS ON THE PHONE AND THAT HE WANTED MY NAME AND EMPLOYEE NUMBER. I WROTE BOTH MY NAME AND EMPLOYEE NUMBER ON A PIECE OF PAPER; HANDED IT TO HIM AND REQUESTED THE SAME FROM HIM! HE REFUSED. I TOLD HIM THAT IF HE DID INDEED HAVE A REPRESENTATIVE ON THE PHONE; THAT I WOULD BE HAPPY TO TALK WITH THEM; OR THEY WERE WELCOME TO CALL ON ME ON MY LAYOVER. HE THREW UP HIS HANDS AND STORMED PASSED ME; ALMOST KNOCKING ME OVER AND YELLING ABOUT HIS BAG! THE REASON I FEEL CONCERN FOR THIS PAX IS BECAUSE OF HIS VIOLENT AND EXPLOSIVE DISPLAY OF EMOTION TOWARDS THE AGENTS; MYSELF; MY FELLOW CREW MEMBERS; THE OTHER 175+ PAYING PAX ON THE AIRPLANE. MY REAL REASON FOR TAKING THE TIME TO WRITE THIS IS BECAUSE I BELIEVE HE IS TRYING TO GET SOMETHING FOR NOTHING; AND HE WILL TAKE ANYONE DOWN WITH HIM IN ORDER TO GET IT! I DID INFORM THE CAPT OF THE SIT WHILE DEPLANING AND HE APOLOGIZED FOR NOT REMOVING HIM BEFORE DEP. I PERSONALLY FELT WE COULD HANDLE HIM; AND THAT IS WHY I DID NOT ESCALATE THE SIT WITH THE CAPT. HE TOLD ME HE WOULD BE AVAILABLE; IF I NEEDED BACKING. I ONLY REGRET 1 DECISION I MADE CONCERNING THIS SIT. I BELIEVE WE SHOULD HAVE REMOVED PAX X FROM THE ACFT BEFORE DEP.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; MIA-DFW. VERBALLY ABUSIVE PAX BOARDED; MAD AT AIRLINE OVER CARRY-ON AND UPGRADE TO FIRST CLASS. THREATENED CREW AND BLOCKED EXIT ON ARR IN DFW.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX IN SEAT ROW XB RANG HER CALL BUTTON. FLT ATTENDANT #3 WALKED TO HER. SHE COMPLAINED THAT PAX SEATED IN ROW XA PUT HIS HAND BTWN HER LEGS AND STARTED RUBBING HER. SHE ASKED HIM WHAT HE WAS DOING. FLT ATTENDANT #3 PUT PAX FROM ROW XB IN A FIRST CLASS SEAT. SHE WAS EMOTIONALLY AND VISIBLY SHAKEN. THE CAPT GAVE HER THE CHOICE IF SHE WANTED TO PRESS CHARGES. THE MALE PAX IN ROW XA CAME BACK AND TALKED TO FLT ATTENDANT #2 (ME) AND #4 FLT ATTENDANT. HE ASKED WHAT WAS WRONG. BEFORE I SPOKE; HE SAID 'I'M A MARRIED MAN WITH 2 KIDS.' I DIDN'T SAY A WORD ABOUT WHAT THE PAX IN ROW XB SAID HE DID. SHE (PAX IN ROW XB) WANTED THE CHICAGO POLICE TO MEET THE FLT. AFTER WE LANDED; THE ORD POLICE MET OUR FLT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE MAN SUPPOSEDLY WAS ASLEEP AND WASN'T AWARE THAT HE HAD DONE ANYTHING WRONG; EVEN IN HIS SLEEP. THE ORD POLICE TOOK BOTH OF THEM OFF THE PLANE TO GET THEIR STATEMENTS.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; S80; LGB-ORD. YOUNG WOMAN ACCUSED THE MAN SITTING NEXT TO HER OF SEXUALLY MOLESTING HER. POLICE MET FLT AND TOOK BOTH OFF FOR STATEMENTS.

column105: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown
column121: PAX BROUGHT ONBOARD A SMALL DOG NOT IN A HOLDER. FLT ATTENDANT INFORMED HER; MUST BE KEPT IN HOLDER BEFORE DEP AND PAX COMPLIED. ENRTE THE DOG WAS REMOVED FROM THE HOLDER BY THE PAX AND WHEN QUERIED; BY THE FLT ATTENDANT; PAX SAID DOG WAS HAVING BREATHING PROBS IN HOLDER. THE FLT ATTENDANT SAID THE DOG'S BREATHING PROBS WERE OBVIOUS AND APPARENT TO HER. SHE ASKED ME IF IT WAS ALL RIGHT; AND I CONCURRED; AS LONG AS DOG WAS KEPT ON LEASH AND NEARBY PAX DID NOT MIND DUE TO DOG'S CONDITION. SECOND FLT ATTENDANT WAS UNAWARE OF THIS ARRANGEMENT AND ASKED THE PAX TO PUT THE DOG BACK; RESULTING IN A PERSONALITY CONFLICT. THE FIRST FLT ATTENDANT SMOOTHED THINGS OVER AND KEPT ME ADVISED OF SIT. DURING DEPLANING AT GATE IN YUL; PAX WITH DOG GOT INTO VERBAL DISPUTE WITH OTHER PAX; RESULTING IN OBSCENE AND ABUSIVE LANGUAGE. I TALKED TO THE OFFENDING PAX TO DEFUSE SIT AND DETERMINED SECURITY WAS NOT REQUIRED. BOTH FLT ATTENDANTS DID GREAT JOB WITH A DIFFICULT SIT AND A PAX WITH POOR PEOPLE SKILLS. THE PAX SAID THEY WERE NEVER INFORMED BY THE AGENT ABOUT RULES FOR CARRYING PETS ONBOARD AND WERE ALLOWED BY THE CREW ON A PREVIOUS CONNECTING FLT TO KEEP DOG OUT OF HOLDER. EITHER SHE WAS LYING; OR WE ARE BEING INCONSISTENT WITH OUR POLICY. FLT MANUAL SAYS THAT THE AGENTS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR TELLING PAX CARRY-ON PET RULES. MY DECISION TO ALLOW THE DOG OUT WAS BASED ON THE FLT ATTENDANT'S JUDGEMENT THAT THE ANIMAL WAS WELL BEHAVED; RESTRAINED BY THE OWNER; NOT A NUISANCE OR HAZARD TO OTHER PAX AND IN PHYSICAL DISTRESS IN THE HOLDER. GREAT JOB DONE BY CREW; UNFORTUNATE THAT THE PAX DID NOT RECOGNIZE THIS AND BECAME A PROB FOR THEM.
column125: PAX WITH DOG IN KENNEL TOOK DOG OUT FOR FLT DUE TO DOG'S BREATHING PROB WITH CAPT PERMISSION. UPON DEPLANING; PAX FOUGHT WITH OTHER PAX.

column121: WHILE CLBING THROUGH FL290 TO FL310; WE RECEIVED AN ECAM MESSAGE 'HYD B LOW PRESSURE;' 'BLOWER FAULT;' AND LOSS OF ACARS DATA; AND OTHER MINOR MESSAGES. ACCOMPLISHED ABNORMAL PROCS AND CHKLISTS. COMPANY DISPATCH AND I AGREED TO DIVERT TO DTW (APPROX 60 NM SE OF DJB). WE REQUESTED EMER EQUIP TO STANDBY AS PRECAUTION. WHILE ENRTE TO DTW; THE LEAD FLT ATTENDANT RPTED 'BURNING SMELL' FROM CABIN. I REQUEST THE FLT ATTENDANT ATTEMPT TO GET MORE INFO -- SUCH AS ANY VISIBLE SMOKE; WHERE THE SMELL WAS STRONGEST; ETC; AND DECLARED EMER WITH ATC REQUESTING A LOWER ALT AND STARTED CONSIDERING A CLOSER ARPT. SHORTLY THEREAFTER; THE FLT ATTENDANT RETURNED TO THE COCKPIT AND RPTED THE 'SMELL' WAS GONE; AND NO SMOKE OR HAZE WAS VISIBLE. WE CONTINUED TO DTW WITH PRIORITY. UPON DEPLANING PAX; IT WAS REVEALED THAT A PAX HAD A LIGHTED 'ROPE' CAUSING THE BURNING SMELL.
column125: ACR FLT WITH SEVERAL ERROR MESSAGES AND ELECTRICAL GREMLINS DIVERTS FOR AN ALTERNATE LNDG. PAX APPARENTLY SMOKING MARIJUANA ADDS SMOKE SMELL CONFUSION AND UNNECESSARY CONCERN TO THE MIX; THUS CAUSING FLC TO DECLARE AN EMER.

column121: ON FEB/XA/00; OUR FLT WAS EXTREMELY OVERBOOKED; DUE TO THE BAD WX IN NEW YORK OVER THE WEEKEND. PAX WERE EXTREMELY ANXIOUS. THE AGENT AND MYSELF WERE ONBOARD THE ACFT ASKING FOR VOLUNTEERS; THIS CAUSED A DELAY APPROX 10 MINS. WHEN A PAX CAME FORWARD AND STARTED SCREAMING AT FLT ATTENDANT #2; USING PROFANITY AND SWINGING HIS ARMS AROUND. WHEN SHE HOLLERED FOR THE CAPT; (BECAUSE SHE WAS AFRAID OF WHAT HE MAY DO) HE JUMPED AROUND HER; GRABBED MY ARM AND YANKED ME TOWARDS HIM; ASKING HOW WE WERE GOING TO ACCOMMODATE HIM FOR BEING LATE; AND HIS MISCONNECTION. THE POLICE; AND FLT SVC MGR ON DUTY WERE CALLED. WE LATER FOUND OUT THE POLICE NEVER ARRIVED AT THE SCENE. AND THE PAX PULLED 'A FAST ONE' BY GOING TO ANOTHER AGENT; STATING HE WAS A VOLUNTEER; AND WAS RE-ROUTED AND GIVEN A $1500 TRAVEL VOUCHER (LATER REVOKED). WE HAVE BEEN ADVISED HIS RETURN TRIP WILL BE MET AND HE WILL BE SPOKEN TO AND ALSO MADE AWARE THE VOUCHER IS REVOKED AND PAX'S MISCONDUCT IS ON FILE.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; S80; LGA-DFW. BOARDING IN LGA; OVERBOOKED DELAY FOR VOLUNTEERS TO GET OFF. IRATE PAX PHYSICALLY; ATTACKED CABIN ATTENDANT. POLICE CALLED AND NEVER CAME.
