column121: WITHIN THE FIRST HR OF THE FLT; I WAS INFORMED BY THE PURSER THAT A COUPLE IN THE BUSINESS CLASS CABIN WERE REFUSING TO HOLD OR STRAP IN THEIR INFANT CHILD (AGE 18 MONTHS) WHILE THE SEATBELT SIGN WAS ON. AT THIS TIME; THE CHILD WAS LAYING ON THE FLOOR OF THE CABIN. THE CHILD'S MOTHER MADE A STATEMENT TO THE EFFECT 'DO YOU EXPECT ME TO WAKE THIS CHILD UP AND HOLD HER EVERY TIME THE SEATBELT SIGN IS TURNED ON?' MY PURSER ALSO TOLD ME THAT HE HAD FOUND OUT FROM ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT THAT AT SOME POINT DURING TAXI OUT FROM THE TERMINAL; THIS SAME CHILD HAD BEEN LEFT TO CRAWL AROUND ON THE FLOOR. I ASKED THE PURSER TO CONVEY TO THE PARENTS MY DIRECT REQUEST FOR THEM TO RESTRAIN THEIR CHILD WHILE I HAD THE SEATBELT SIGN ON; BUT THEY AGAIN REFUSED. AT A LATER TIME IN THE FLT; WHEN I AGAIN HAD TO ILLUMINATE THE SEATBELT SIGN; I WAS TOLD THAT THE FATHER HAD PLACED THE CHILD ON HIS LAP AND THEN PROCEEDED TO FASTEN HIS SEATBELT AROUND THE BOTH OF THEM. CLRLY THIS COUPLE HAD NO CLUE AS TO THE PHYSICS AND FORCES OF A TURB ENCOUNTER OR SUDDEN STOP WHILE TAXIING! PRIOR TO LNDG; I ISSUED A DIRECT ORDER THAT THIS CHILD BE PROPERLY RESTRAINED. TO MY KNOWLEDGE THAT WAS THE ONLY INSTRUCTION IN THIS MATTER THAT WAS FOLLOWED.
column125: PLT RPT. FAMILY REFUSED TO OBEY THE SEATBELT SIGN RULES FOR 18 MONTH OLD CHILD. CHILD ON FLOOR DURING TURB. DIRECT ORDER FROM CAPT. COMPLIANCE LNDG.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 25; Flight Attendant Total 25; Flight Attendant Type 99
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: BUSINESS CLASS PAX BECAME VERY IRATE BECAUSE HER CHILDREN'S SPECIAL MEALS WERE NOT ON BOARD. (SHE DID NOT BOTHER TO TELL THE FLT ATTENDANT INVOLVED THAT SHE WAS REBOOKED FROM AN EARLIER FLT; WHICH WOULD'VE EXPLAINED WHY THE CHILDREN'S MEALS WERE NOT ON OUR FLT.) SHE WAS VERBALLY AND PHYSICALLY THREATENING TO AT LEAST 3 FLT ATTENDANTS AFTER BEGINNING THE TAXI OUT PERIOD. THIS WAS RPTED TO THE CAPT; WHO RETURNED THE ACFT TO THE GATE. AFTER ARRIVING IN LAX; OUR CREW LEARNED THAT THIS ABUSIVE PAX WAS PUT ON DEP JFK-LAS; AND THE CREW WAS NOT INFORMED OF HER HISTORY. I PERSONALLY FIND THIS LACK OF COM DANGEROUS AND APPALLING. THIS ONLY CONVEYS A MESSAGE OF ACCEPTANCE TO THIS DISRUPTIVE BEHAVIOR!
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767; JFK-LAX. ON BOARDING AND TAXI; WOMAN BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE AND THREATENED CABIN ATTENDANTS BECAUSE HER CHILDREN'S MEALS WEREN'T BOARDED. TAXI BACK. PAX REMOVED.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12; Flight Attendant Total 12; Flight Attendant Type 99

column118: Flight Crew Diverted; Flight Crew Landed As Precaution; General Declared Emergency; General Physical Injury / Incapacitation
column121: A MALE PAX CAME TO ME TO INFORM ME THAT A FEMALE PAX BEHIND HIM WAS STEALING LIQUOR FROM OUR PARKED BEVERAGE CART AND THAT SHE WAS INTOXICATED AND BECOMING EXTREMELY DISRUPTIVE. TRUE TO FORM; THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT AND I LOOKED UP THE AISLE TO SEE THIS FEMALE PAX LEAVING THE AFT VESTIBULE AREA WITH HER ARMS FULL OF LIQUOR MINIS. AS THERE WERE QUITE A FEW PEOPLE STANDING AROUND THE BATHROOM AREA AND WE WERE PREPARING TRAYS OF WATER TO DELIVER DURING THE MOVIE; WE HAD NOT SEEN THIS. WE FOLLOWED HER TO HER SEAT WHERE WE ASKED FOR THE LIQUOR BACK. WE IMMEDIATELY COULD TELL THAT SHE WAS INDEED INTOXICATED FROM HER SLURRED SPEECH; STAGGERING WALK; AND IMPAIRED ABILITY TO FUNCTION. WE OPENED HER BAG TO FIND DOZENS OF LIQUOR BOTTLES THAT SHE HAD STOLEN FROM THE CART IN NUMEROUS RUNS TO THE BACK. THE PAX SEATED NEXT TO HER INFORMED US THAT THIS LADY HAD ALSO GIVEN HERSELF 2 SHOTS OF SOMETHING; ONCE IN THE STOMACH; ONCE IN THE THIGH. WE INFORMED THE INTOXICATED PAX THAT SHE COULD NO LONGER DRINK ANY ALCOHOL. SHE BECAME FURIOUS. WE ASKED HER TO MOVE TO THE LAST ROW OF COACH; WHICH WAS EMPTY BECAUSE OTHER PAX WERE BECOMING ALARMED AT HER BEHAVIOR (WE HAD MANY CHILDREN ON THE FLT). SHE DID MOVE; BUT ONLY LONG ENOUGH TO ROB A FLT ATTENDANT OF HER WALLET; JEWELRY; AND GLASSES; WHICH WE LATER DISCOVERED IN THE PAX'S PURSE. THE PAX'S BEHAVIOR WORSENED. WHEN SHE WOULD NOT TAKE HER SEAT AFTER DEMANDING MORE ALCOHOL; I CALLED THE PURSER. HE ATTEMPTED TO GET HER TO CALM DOWN AND TAKE HER SEAT; BUT THE PAX REFUSED; FINALLY GIVING HIM A PUSH. THE CAPT WAS CALLED AND AFTER HE TRIED TO GET HER TO FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS; THE PAX ALSO PUSHED HIM. THE CAPT LEFT TO RETRIEVE THE WIRE TIE. IT TOOK 3 MEN; 2 WOMEN AND 1/2 HR TO GET THIS WOMAN RESTRAINED; AS SHE WAS FIGHTING; SCREAMING; AND EVEN BIT A FLT ATTENDANT. I BELIEVE IF MY AIRLINE HAD PROVIDED THE CAPT WITH HANDCUFFS; INSTEAD OF A FLIMSY WIRE TIE; THIS SCENE WOULD NOT HAVE BEEN PROLONGED AS IT WAS. THE PAX WAS FINALLY SUBDUED AND THE DECISION WAS MADE TO LAND IN GANDER; NEWFOUNDLAND; TO HAVE HER REMOVED. SHE CONTINUED TO WAIL UNTIL LNDG. SHE WAS FROTHING AT THE MOUTH AND WAS UNCONTROLLABLE. THE CANADIAN POLICE DRAGGED HER OFF THE PLANE; AGAIN WITH MUCH RESISTANCE. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT EVERYONE WAS FRIGHTENED AND TERRORIZED BY THE WOMAN. CHILDREN WERE VERY SCARED AND WERE SCREAMING AND CRYING. THE WOMAN WAS MAD AT THE WOMAN SITTING NEXT TO HER; BECAUSE SHE TOLD THE CREW ABOUT HER INJECTING HERSELF IN VARIOUS AREAS OF HER BODY. THE MAD WOMAN PINNED THE WITNESS (WOMAN) AGAINST THE WALL AND WAS THREATENING HER. THE WITNESS WAS SCREAMING FOR HELP AND THAT'S WHEN THE CAPT SHOWED UP. HE SPENT A VERY LONG TIME OUT OF THE COCKPIT TRYING TO RESTRAIN THE WOMAN; WHO BY THEN; WAS FOAMING AT THE MOUTH AND COMPLETELY INCOHERENT. SHE SUDDENLY HAD UNNATURAL AND TREMENDOUS STRENGTH. THE COPLT HAD TO DEAL WITH HEADQUARTERS TO TELL THEM WHAT WAS GOING ON AND TO GET PERMISSION TO LAND IN GANDER AND HAVE THE WOMAN REMOVED. WHEN FLT ATTENDANTS LOOKED THROUGH THE WOMAN'S BAG; THEY NOT ONLY FOUND STOLEN ITEMS FROM A FLT ATTENDANT; THEY FOUND THE INJECTION NEEDLE. THE CANADIAN POLICE CAME IN THROUGH THE BACK DOOR AND DRAGGED THE WOMAN OFF. WHILE 1 POLICEMAN WAS INTERVIEWING THE RPTR AND OTHERS; THE RPTR LOOKED OUTSIDE AND SAW THE WOMAN BANGING HER HEAD AGAINST WINDOW OF THE POLICE CAR. THE RPTR SAID THAT THE WOMAN WAS A MENTAL CASE. THE WOMAN WAS TAKEN TO A HOSPITAL; INSTEAD OF JAIL.
column125: MULTIPLE CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-300-ER; CDG-BOS. WOMAN INTOXICATED WITH DRUGS AND ALCOHOL STOLE LIQUOR FROM CART; ITEMS FROM CABIN ATTENDANT'S PURSE; AND ASSAULTED CABIN ATTENDANT AND CAPT. PAX WAS RESTRAINED AND FLT DIVERTED TO GANDER. POLICE REMOVED HER.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 14; Flight Attendant Total 14; Flight Attendant Type 10
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Electronic Device; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A PAX; MR XX; REFUSED TO TURN OFF AND DISCONTINUE USING HIS 2-WAY PAGER. AS I WAS DOING MY FINAL SAFETY CHK PRIOR TO LNDG; I HEARD THE PAGER GO OFF. I SAW MR XX GET HIS PAGER OUT. WHEN I REALIZED HE WAS NOT TURNING IT OFF; I ASKED HIM TO TURN IF OFF. (THE PA HAD ALREADY BEEN MADE.) I STRAPPED INTO MY JUMP SEAT AND OBSERVED HIM STILL REPLYING TO THE PAGE. I GOT UP AND TOLD HIM TO STOP USING HIS PAGER. HE TOLD ME IT WAS OK; BECAUSE IT WORKS. I TOLD HIM THE FAA AND FCC PROHIBIT USE OF CELL PHONES AND 2-WAY PAGERS ON BOARD. HE CLOSED THE PAGER; BUT DID NOT TURN IT OFF. HE CONTINUED TO WRITE HIS MESSAGE; AS WE PULLED UP TO THE GATE. HE TOLD ME THAT HE WORKED FOR MOTOROLA AND IT IS OK TO USE MOTOROLA PRODUCTS; BECAUSE THEY DON'T INTERFERE WITH ACFT SYS. I TOLD HIM THE RULE DOES NOT APPLY TO SPECIFIC BRANDS -- ALL 2-WAY PAGERS AND CELL PHONES ARE PROHIBITED ON BOARD. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE MAN SAID HE WAS IN TOP MGMNT FOR MOTOROLA AND THEREFORE HE KNEW WITHOUT A DOUBT THAT MOTOROLA PRODUCTS DON'T INTERFERE WITH THE AIRPLANE'S INSTS. AFTER LNDG; THE RPTR STUCK HER HEAD INTO THE COCKPIT AND ASKED THE CAPT IF HE HAD HEARD ABOUT THE MOTOROLA CLAIM. THE CAPT SAID HE HADN'T; SAYING THAT ALL CELL PHONES AND LAPTOPS MUST BE TURNED OFF. JUST THEN; THE MAN WAS DEPLANING AND OVERHEARD WHAT THE CAPT HAD SAID; AND BRIEFLY ARGUED WITH THE CAPT. AS THE MAN HEADED DOWN THE JETBRIDGE; THE CAPT ASKED THE RPTR IF SHE WANTED HIM TO FOLLOW THE MAN. INSTEAD; SHE WENT OUT TO SEE IF HE HAD A CONNECTING FLT; SO AS TO WARN THE NEXT CREW; BUT HE DIDN'T. THE RPTR BELIEVES THAT SINCE HE HAD BEEN THE TYPE OF PAX THAT WAS DISSATISFIED WITH EVERYTHING OFFERED TO HIM ON THE FLT; THAT THE MOTOROLA CLAIM WAS JUST A LOT OF HOT AIR.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; F100; DFW-ORD. PAX WOULDN'T TURN OFF 'MOTOROLA' PAGER ON DSCNT AND LNDG; CLAIMED MOTOROLA PRODUCTS DON'T AFFECT ACFT SYS.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 2; Flight Attendant Total 2; Flight Attendant Type 75
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A FLT ATTENDANT CAME TO US IN GALLEY (FIRST CLASS) AND EXPLAINED THAT A PAX WOULD NOT COMPLY WITH THE SAFETY PROCS -- FOR TAXI OUT. AFTER PA FOR SEATBELTS AND TRAY TABLES IN ROW X; THE PAX MADE VERBAL SLANDERS AND RACIAL SLANDERS TO HER; AS SHE EXPLAINED THE SAFETY PROCS. FLT ATTENDANT #1 ALSO WENT BACK TO PAX. SHE SAID HE REPEATED THE RACIAL SLURS AND VERBAL ABUSE ALONG WITH REPEATED LOUD PROFANITY. A PAX COMPLAINED TO ME THAT THEY DID NOT WANT THIS MAN ON BOARD; DUE TO HIS LOUD; PROFANITY BEHAVIOR. A WELL KNOWN DOCTOR WAS ON BOARD; AND REITERATED THAT GETTING HIM OFF THE ACFT WAS THE RIGHT THING TO DO. HE MADE EVERYONE VERY UNCOMFORTABLE WITH HIS RACIAL ACCUSATIONS. HE SEEMED TO BE PREJUDICE TO OUR RACE. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT SHE DIDN'T KNOW IF ALCOHOL WAS INVOLVED. THE MAN WAS TRAVELING WITH A WOMAN; WHO SEEMED TO SUPPORT HIS HARASSMENT OF THE FLT ATTENDANT. THEY STARTED TO TAXI OUT; AS THE MAN WAS CONTINUING TO YELL AT THE CABIN ATTENDANT; 'YOU *&^(% $#@^% *&%$@* HONKY.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; LGA-DFW. PAX WOULD NOT OBEY SAFETY INSTRUCTION ON BOARDING; MADE RACIAL SLURS AND PROFANITY AGAINST CREW ON TAXI. RETURN TO GATE; PAX REMOVED.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12; Flight Attendant Total 12; Flight Attendant Type 75
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WAS PUSHED AND SHOVED OUT OF MY BOARDING LOCATION TO OPERATE THE ELECTRONIC BOARDING MACHINE. PAX WERE APPROX 8 ABREAST AND VERY DEEP. I COULD NOT GET THEM TO FORM 2 LINES. IT WAS A MOB SCENE AND BECAME EVEN MORE UNRULY. THEN A MALE PAX BECAME VERY VERBALLY AGGRESSIVE; ABUSIVE AND THEN BECAME LOUDER AND INSISTED ON MY NAME AND FILE NUMBER; BECAUSE HE COULDN'T BOARD ON HIS DEMAND. I COULD GET NO REAL HELP FROM THE WORKING AGENTS. I TOLD THE AGENTS THAT I WOULD RETURN TO THE ACFT; IF THEY DIDN'T DO SOMETHING. THE PAX WHO BERATED ME; DID UPSET ME. DURING BOARDING; THE PURSER WAS VERY CONCERNED ABOUT ME; SO HE CAME OUT TO SEE IF ALL WAS OK. WHEN BOARDING WAS FINISHED; I INFORMED THE CAPT OF THE SIT. BECAUSE PAX WERE 8 ABREAST; MANY PAX JUST ENTERED THE JETBRIDGE WITHOUT ME TAKING THEIR TICKET.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; A300-600; SJU-MIA. ON BOARDING; CABIN ATTENDANT IN TERMINAL TAKING TICKETS WAS SHOVED AND PUSHED OUT OF POS BY MOB OF AGGRESSIVE; VERBALLY ABUSIVE PAX. SOME TICKETS UNABLE TO BE COLLECTED.

column121: I WAS A CREW MEMBER ON A FLT FROM JFK TO LAX. AFTER TKOF; THE LEAD FLT ATTENDANT CAME UP TO THE COCKPIT AND NOTIFIED US THAT THERE WAS A COUPLE IN BUSINESS CLASS TRAVELING WITH AN APPROX 3 YR OLD DAUGHTER. THE COUPLE WAS ALLOWING THE GIRL TO LAY ON THE FLOOR OF THE CABIN DURING TAXI AND TKOF; WITH THE FASTEN SEATBELT SIGN ILLUMINATED. WHEN THE FLT ATTENDANT TOLD THEM TO PLEASE HAVE THE CHILD IN THE SEAT WITH BELT ON WHEN THE SEATBELT SIGN WAS ILLUMINATED; THEY REFUSED AND WERE VERBALLY ABUSIVE. THE CAPT HAD THE FLT ATTENDANT TELL THEM THE CAPT REQUESTED THEM TO COMPLY; AGAIN THEY REFUSED. THIS CONTINUED ACROSS THE COUNTRY AND WE HAD A CUSTOMER SVC SUPVR MEET THE AIRPLANE IN LAX. THE CUSTOMER SVC AGENT SAID THERE WAS NOTHING THEY COULD DO; UNLESS THERE WAS SOME PHYSICAL ABUSE INVOLVED AND THE FLT ATTENDANT PRESSED CHARGES. THESE PEOPLE WALKED AWAY FROM THE GATE AFTER ENDANGERING THEIR CHILD; INTERFERING WITH A CREW MEMBER DOING THEIR DUTIES; BREAKING FARS AND POSSIBLY ENDANGERING OTHER PAX. WE NEED CONSEQUENCES FOR PEOPLE LIKE THIS; JUST AS THERE WOULD HAVE BEEN CONSEQUENCES FOR MY AIRLINE HAD THEIR CHILD BEEN INJURED IN TURB WITH THE SEATBELT SIGN OFF. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE COUPLE HAD PURCHASED A SEAT FOR THE CHILD; BUT THEY WANTED THE CHILD ON THE FLOOR. THEY HAD 3 SEATS ABREAST IN BUSINESS CLASS; SO THEY HAD ROOM FOR THE CHILD TO LAY IN THEM. AS THE RPTR EXITED THE PLANE IN LAX; HE OVERHEARD THE COUPLE SAY TO THE CUSTOMER SVC SUPVR THAT 'I BOUGHT A TICKET ON YOUR AIRLINE; I CAN DO ANYTHING I PLEASE;' AND THEN PROCEEDED OUT TO LIMO WAITING FOR THEM. THE RPTR IS VERY CONCERNED THAT THE CHILD ON THE FLOOR CAN BECOME A PROJECTILE IN TURB OR A CRASH AND HURT OTHER PEOPLE.
column125: PLT RPT; B767-200; JFK-LAX. COUPLE REFUSED DIRECT ORDER FROM CAPT TO PUT 3 YR OLD CHILD IN SEAT; WITH SEATBELT ON. CHILD ON FLOOR WHOLE FLT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 8; Flight Attendant Total 18; Flight Attendant Type 40
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: AFTER WE WERE INFLT FOR SOME TIME; THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT CALLED TO ASK FOR INFO FOR THIS SAME PAX I HAD SPOKE WITH WHILE BOARDING. HOWEVER; I WAS NOT AWARE IT WAS THE SAME MAN. THE FO WAS ASKED TO COME OUT OF THE COCKPIT TO SPEAK TO THE PAX. HE STAYED OUT APPROX 30 MINS. I FINISHED PICKING UP THE CABIN AND WHEN I SAW THE ROW IN QUESTION; I REALIZED THE MAN/PAX WAS THE SAME. HE HAD A CAT BELOW HIS SEAT AND HE HAD NO PAPERWORK TO SHOW AN ANIMAL WAS ON BOARD. THEY HAD DECLINED THEIR FOOD AND WE WERE LNDG SHORTLY. PAX AROUND HIM WERE ASKED TO BE WITNESSES; SO AS EVERYONE WAS DEPLANING; A FEW HUNG BACK TO RETURN INFO AS TO WHAT THEY SAW AND TO SPEAK TO THE CAPT. ONE WOMAN IN PARTICULAR WAS WAITING IN FIRST CLASS. I ASKED HER IF SHE NEEDED HELP. SHE SAID SHE WAS SITTING IN THE SAME ROW AND WANTED TO TELL THE CAPT SHE WAS HELD HOSTAGE IN THE ROW (AT THE WINDOW). THE CAPT HEARD HER RECALL THE MAN TELLING HER HE HAD A CAT UNDER THE SEAT; SO SHE WOULDN'T BE ABLE TO GET OUT OF HER SEAT. SO SHE REMAINED IN HER ASSIGNED SEAT THE ENTIRE FLT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; JAC-ORD. PAX SNUCK CAT ON BOARD; PUT UNDER SEAT IN FRONT. LADY IN WINDOW SEAT COULDN'T GET OUT. FO LEFT COCKPIT TO TALK TO PAX; WITNESSES.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: JUST PRIOR TO TKOF; THE 'A' FLT ATTENDANT NOTICED A PERSON IN THE 4TH FLT ATTENDANT JUMP SEAT (EMPLOYEES AT MY AIRLINE ARE PERMITTED). THE 'A' FLT ATTENDANT ASKED THIS PERSON IF HE WAS AN EMPLOYEE OF MY AIRLINE. HE RESPONDED IN THE AFFIRMATIVE. BEFORE THE 'A' FLT ATTENDANT COULD ASK FOR HIS IDENT; I SIGNALED WITH THE CHIME THAT WE WERE ABOUT TO TAKE OFF; SO THE 'A' FLT ATTENDANT TOOK HIS FORWARD FLT ATTENDANT JUMP SEAT. AFTER TKOF; THE 'A' FLT ATTENDANT WENT BACK TO THE AFT JUMP SEAT AREA AND ASKED THE PERSON FOR HIS IDENT. THE PERSON THEN SAID THAT HE WAS NOT AN EMPLOYEE. THE 'A' FLT ATTENDANT THEN MOVED THE MAN TO A PAX SEAT. THE FLT ATTENDANTS SHOULD HAVE MADE SURE THE FLT ATTENDANT JUMP SEAT PERSON HAD PROPER IDENT AND PAPERWORK; DESPITE A HECTIC/HURRIED BOARDING EVENT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE BOARDING WAS HECTIC AND THE AGENT TOLD THIS GUY; WHO GOT ON LATE; TO JUST TAKE ANY SEAT. THE GUY TOOK HIM LITERALLY AND SAT ON THE BACK JUMP SEAT. THE FLT ATTENDANT WHO SITS THERE JUST ASSUMED THAT HE HAD HAD HIS IDENT CHKED. SHE JUST CHATTED WITH HIM FOR TKOF; NEVER REALIZING HE WASN'T AN EMPLOYEE. WHEN THE PURSER DISCOVERED HIM; HE ADMITTED HE HAD LIED ABOUT BEING AN EMPLOYEE AND THEN TOOK A REGULAR PAX SEAT. THE CAPT DIDN'T KNOW ANYTHING ABOUT THE SIT UNTIL THEY HAD LANDED IN BALTIMORE. THE PURSER THEN TOLD HIM; HOWEVER; HE ALSO MENTIONED IT TO THE AGENT OPENING THE DOOR. THE AGENT ASSUMED THE PAX WAS A STOWAWAY; AND CALLED THE POLICE. THE SIT EVENTUALLY STRAIGHTENED ITSELF OUT.
column125: PLT RPT; B737. ON BOARDING; TAXI AND TKOF; PAX SAT ON AFT JUMP SEAT. NO EMPLOYEE BADE; NO IDENT CHK BY CABIN ATTENDANT. FARS VIOLATED.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 30; Flight Attendant Total 30; Flight Attendant Type 5
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: WHILE WORKING THE MEAL CART WITH FLT ATTENDANT #2; A PAX APCHED FLT ATTENDANT #2 FROM BEHIND AND BASICALLY PINNED FLT ATTENDANT #2 AGAINST THE CART; BECAUSE THE PAX WAS THAT CLOSE TO FLT ATTENDANT #2; AND THE PAX STARTED TO YELL ABOUT A GLASS OF ICE. I HEARD THE PAX SAY TO FLT ATTENDANT #2 'WE'LL SETTLE THIS ISSUE OVER A FIGHT IN THE TERMINAL.' FLT ATTENDANT #2 WENT TO THE COCKPIT TO TALK TO THE CAPT AND THE ACFT WAS MET BY THE SJU POLICE. FLT ATTENDANT #2 AND THE PAX WERE TAKEN TO THE POLICE STATION.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT; B757; EWR-SJU. PAX PINNED CABIN ATTENDANT AGAINST CART; THREATENED HIM WITH A FIGHT IN THE TERMINAL. ARR; SJU POLICE TOOK CABIN ATTENDANT AND PAX TO POLICE STATION.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 8.7; Flight Attendant Total 10.5; Flight Attendant Type 40
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: UPON THE FINAL BREAKFAST SVC; I WAS RUNNING TRAYS AND SERVING BREAKFAST TO MY BUSINESS CLASS PAX. I HAD MY SERVING CART OUT; AND WAS TRYING TO SERVE WHILE PEOPLE WAITED FOR THE BATHROOM. THERE WERE SEVERAL PEOPLE; FROM BUSINESS CLASS; WAITING IN LINE; AS WELL AS AN ILL PERSON; IN THE BATHROOM. A LADY CAME UP FROM THE MAIN CABIN; AND I REFEREED HER TO THE BACK LAVATORIES; SINCE THE BUSINESS CLASS ONES WERE OCCUPIED. HER HUSBAND SOON CAME UP TO MY SERVING AREA AND STARTED YELLING AT ME (THREATENING ME) THAT IT WAS AGAINST FAA REGS TO HAVE MY CART OUT. WE WERE NOT IN DSCNT/TAXI/OR LNDG; AND MY KNOWLEDGE OF PROCS ALLOWS ME TO HAVE MY CART IN THE AISLE (FOR SVC). I WAS NOT BLOCKING ANY EXIT OR REG. I LATER TRIED TO TALK TO THE PAX CALMLY; BUT HE REFUSED TO LISTEN AND HAD A TEMPER TANTRUM IN FRONT OF MOST OF COACH CABIN. I LATER TALKED TO THE WIFE; AND SHE LATER UNDERSTOOD THE SIT. THE MAN CONTINUED TO THREATEN AND UPSET ME OVER THE FAA REGS. I DID NOT VIOLATE PROCS; AND DID NOT APPRECIATE HIS ABUSE. I LATER CALLED MY AIRLINE HOTLINE AND A SUPVR AND RPTED THE INCIDENT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767; GIG-MIA. COACH PAX TRIED TO USE BUSINESS CLASS LAVATORY; TOLD NO. HUSBAND CAME UP; YELLED AND THREATENED CABIN ATTENDANT ABOUT VIOLATION OF FAR'S.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 4.5; Flight Attendant Total 4.5; Flight Attendant Type 90
column97: Boarding; Deplaning; Safety Related Duties; Service
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A GROUP OF APPROX 4 MEN; WHO FROM THE BEGINNING OF THEIR PRESENCE ON BOARD; SET OUT TO ANTAGONIZE; BERATE AND BADGER EVERY CREW MEMBER THEY CAME IN CONTACT WITH; INCLUDING THE COCKPIT CREW. I WAS THE SOLE FEMALE CREW MEMBER IN THIS CABIN. THIS GROUP WAS NOT APPARENTLY DRUNK; BUT I WOULDN'T DISCOUNT SOME OTHER FORM OF SUBSTANCE ABUSE BECAUSE THEIR BEHAVIOR WAS EXTREME AND ABNORMAL. THEY DID NOT RECOGNIZE THE RELEVANCE OF THE PLT OR THE PORT AUTH POLICE WHEN THEY CAME ON BOARD. I CAN VOUCH FOR THE PROFESSIONAL MANNER OF MY MALE CO-WORKERS; WHO MADE EVERY ATTEMPT TO NEUTRALIZE THIS SIT BY DOING EVERYTHING THAT IS EXPECTED OF THEM AND MORE. WE HAD TO RECRUIT HELP FROM THE BUSINESS CLASS CABIN TO EVEN FINISH OUR SVC. I HAD TO FINALLY REFRAIN FROM SPEAKING TO THIS GROUP; BECAUSE IT BECAME A NO-WIN SIT IN WHICH THEY WOULD CONTINUE TO BADGER ME IF I STAYED TO LISTEN TO THEM. THEY WERE WALKING AROUND (2 OF THEM) THE CABIN; AFTER THE CAPT SPECIFICALLY ANNOUNCED UPCOMING DANGEROUS TURB AND REQUESTED ALL PAX TO STRAP IN. I AGAIN REMINDED ONE OF THEM; AS HE PASSED MY JUMP SEAT; THAT IT WAS AT HIS OWN RISK; THAT HE WAS WALKING AROUND (BAREFOOT) AT SUCH A PREANNOUNCED MOMENT. THE CAPT HAD COME OUT TWICE TO TALK TO THIS GROUP AND THREATENED TO LAND IN CARACAS AND LET THEM OUT; WHICH I BELIEVE WOULD HAVE BEEN THE BEST SOLUTION; AS HAVING CHARGES PRESSED AGAINST THEM IN NYC DIDN'T SEEM TO PHASE THEM IN THE LEAST BIT. MY MAJOR CONCERN HERE IS THE DANGER PAX LIKE THESE PRESENT TO THE ENTIRE COMPLEMENT OF CREW AND PAX. WITH A FULL CABIN; THEY COULD EASILY CREATE A DANGEROUS SIT. IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT THIS IS A LONG RANGE (9 1/2 HR AVERAGE) TRIP. THERE WERE MANY FAMILIES WITH CHILDREN ON BOARD; ALL CONCERNED BY THE DISTURBANCES AND APPEARANCE OF SO MANY MEMBERS OF THE CREW; TRYING TO DEAL WITH THE ONGOING PROB. SEVERAL PAX WERE RELIEVED TO SEE THE PORT AUTH POLICE AT JFK; TO CONFIRM THAT THERE COULD BE SOME CTL OVER PEOPLE; WHO HAVE A BLATANT DISREGARD FOR THE SERIOUSNESS OF PAX RESPECT AND SAFETY; AS WELL AS RESPECT FOR THE AUTH OF FLT ATTENDANTS AND COCKPIT MEMBERS. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE 5 MEN SPOKE AND UNDERSTOOD ENGLISH VERY WELL; AND THAT THEY UNDERSTOOD EVERYTHING THAT WAS SAID TO THEM BY THE CAPT AND CABIN CREW AT ALL TIMES. THEY JUST DIDN'T SEEM NORMAL TO HER; VERY ANTI-AUTH. IN FACT; THEY THOUGHT GETTING ARRESTED BY THE NEW YORK PORT AUTH POLICE WAS A BIG JOKE. THE RPTR; AGAIN; EMPHASIZED THAT THE CAPT SHOULD HAVE LANDED IN CARACAS; BUT HE WAS MORE CONCERNED ABOUT GETTING HOME ON TIME; PROBABLY BECAUSE HE WAS A COMMUTER.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-200; GIG-JFK. GROUP OF 4 MEN WERE UNCTLABLE; VERBALLY ABUSIVE; IGNORED SEATBELT SIGN. CAPT LEFT COCKPIT; INTERVENED; THREATENED LNDG IN CARACAS TO REMOVE THEM. JFK POLICE MET FLT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 21; Flight Attendant Total 21; Flight Attendant Type 50
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: WHILE WORKING THE FLT; A PAX DRANK BEER; WE (ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT AND MYSELF) STOPPED SERVING ALCOHOL TO 2 MALE PAX. THEY HAD 5-6 BEERS EACH. AFTER LAST SVC; A FLT ATTENDANT DISCOVERED HER TOTE BAG MISSING AND ALL FLT ATTENDANTS STARTED SEARCHING FOR IT. IT WAS FOUND LATER BACK IN EARLIER POS. WHEN FLT ATTENDANT CHKED BAG; SHE FOUND $100 MISSING AND BROWN SUBSTANCE THROUGHOUT THE BAG -- THIS WAS FECES. IT WAS THROUGHOUT HER BAG. AUTHS MET FLT. A SAFE AND SECURE PLACE FOR FLT ATTENDANT LUGGAGE IS NEEDED ON ALL ACFT. IT ALSO HAS TO BE ACCESSIBLE DURING THE FLT (OVERHEAD BINS DESIGNATED FOR FLT ATTENDANTS ONLY -- CREW BAG STORAGE). CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID THAT WHEN SHE AND ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT HAD CUT THE 2 MEN OFF FROM MORE BEER; THERE SEEMED TO BE NO BIG CONFLICT. THE FLT ATTENDANTS TOLD THEM THAT THEY WOULD SERVE THEM MORE BEER DURING THE NEXT SVC BEFORE LNDG. IT WAS AFTER THIS SVC WAS COMPLETED AND THEY WERE ABOUT 45 MINS FROM LNDG IN JFK; THAT ANOTHER PAX SAW 1 OF THE 2 MEN (WHO EARLIER HAD BEEN CUT OFF FROM MORE BEER) COME OUT OF A LAVATORY WITH THE FLT ATTENDANT'S TOTE BAG IN HAND. WHEN THE FLT ATTENDANTS REDISCOVERED THE TOTE BAG; THEY DIDN'T REALIZE THAT IT WAS FULL OF FECES THROUGHOUT; UNTIL ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT WENT TO WASH OFF THE TOOTH BRUSH CONTAINER. ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT THEN WENT TO GET THEM PLASTIC GLOVES FOR EVERYONE TO WEAR. THEY ENDED UP DISPOSING OF ALL OF THE CONTENTS FROM HER TOTE BAG; AND THEN THE BAG ITSELF. THE NEW YORK POLICE MET THE FLT AND TOOK THE MEN INTO CUSTODY BEFORE ANYONE GOT OFF THE FLT. THE PORT AUTH'S SECURITY PERSON; THE AIRLINE'S SECURITY PERSON AND AN INFLT MGR ALSO MET THE FLT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-300; FRA-JFK. CABIN ATTENDANT CUT OFF BEER FROM PAX; WHO WERE SUSPECTED OF STEALING CABIN ATTENDANT'S TOTE BAG AND $100; THEN PUTTING FECES IN TOTE BAG. NEW YORK POLICE REMOVED PAX.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Other / Unknown; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A PAX XX DISRUPTED AND INTERFERED WITH MY SVC WHEN SHE AND HER FATHER KEPT COMING UP TO FIRST CLASS FROM COACH TO VISIT MOTHER/WIFE. I EXPLAINED TO PAX XX THAT SHE COULD NOT CONTINUE COMING UP TO FIRST CLASS FROM COACH; AND SHE YELLED AT ME 'YOU *?#$; YOU ARE SO RUDE. YOU ARE JUST A STEWARDESS; GET A LIFE!' I RPTED THE INCIDENT TO THE CAPT AND HE ISSUED TO PAX XX A PAX DISTURBANCE RPT. WHEN SHE READ IT; SHE LAUGHED AT ME AND TOLD ME THAT IF I WAS ON A POWER TRIP TO 'GO FOR IT.' I ASKED IF THIS WAS THE ANSWER TO CAPT; AND SHE REPLIED 'GO FOR IT!'
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; SJU-ORD. FAMILY SEPARATED; MOTHER IN FIRST CLASS; FATHER AND DAUGHTER (Y CLASS) KEPT COMING TO FIRST CLASS; DISRUPTING SVC; VERBAL ABUSE AGAINST CABIN ATTENDANT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 8; Flight Attendant Total 8; Flight Attendant Type 50
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: THE PAX THAT WAS REMOVED THREATENED THE WELL-BEING OF ANOTHER PAX. THE REMARK MADE WAS 'IF YOU TOUCH MY WIFE; I'LL CUT YOUR &*^%$#@ THROAT.' HE WAS THREATENING THE MAN SITTING NEXT TO HIS WIFE. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE HUSBAND; WIFE AND 2 TEENAGE CHILDREN HAD GOT INTO A SHOUTING MATCH BTWN THEMSELVES IN THE BOARDING AREA; USING MANY PROFANE WORDS. THEY WERE STILL SCREAMING AT EACH OTHER WHEN THEY GOT ONBOARD. THEY SAT IN THE WINDOW EXIT ROW AND HAD TOO MANY OVERSIZED BAGS; WHICH WERE BLOCKING THE EXIT ROW FLOOR SPACE. ONE OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS TOLD THEM THAT THEY ALL HAD TO BE STOWED; WITH NOTHING STICKING OUT FROM UNDER THE SEATS. THE HUSBAND GOT VERY ANGRY ABOUT THIS; BUT THE FLT ATTENDANT DID FIND SPACE IN THE OVERHEAD BIN ABOVE HIS WIFE'S SEAT ACROSS THE AISLE. THE MAN SITTING NEXT TO THE WIFE SAID; 'DO AS THE FLT ATTENDANT SAYS; SO WE WON'T HAVE A DELAY.' THIS REALLY MADE THE MAN ANGRIER THAN EVER. IT WAS DURING THE TAXI OUT THAT THE HUSBAND THREATENED THE MAN SITTING NEXT TO HIS WIFE. THE FLT ATTENDANTS TOLD THE CAPT; SO THEY TURNED AROUND AND TAXIED BACK; WHERE THEY WERE MET BY CUSTOMER SVC SUPVRS AND SECURITY. ALL THE FAMILY GOT OFF; AND THEN THEY FOUGHT WITH SECURITY. THE DAUGHTER THREW HER WALLET IN THE FACE OF THE SECURITY GUARD; WHEN ASKED TO SHOW SOME IDENT. THE AIRLINE DENIED THEM FURTHER PASSAGE ON THE AIRLINE.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; MIA-LAX. ON BOARDING; PAX THREATENED TO CUT ANOTHER PAX'S THROAT IF HE TOUCHED HIS WIFE. PAX REMOVED.

column94: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 16; Flight Attendant Total 16; Flight Attendant Type 100
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WAS PASSED OUT IN SEAT WITH PANTS UNDONE AND SHIRT OFF. I TRIED TO WAKE THE PAX AND WITH DIFFICULTY WOKE HIM AND SAID PUT YOUR SHIRT ON. PAX HAD 10+ WINE AND LIQUOR BOTTLES UNDER HIS FEET AND SAID HE DIDN'T KNOW WHERE HIS SHIRT WAS. PAX IN AISLE SEAT HAD SEEN HIM GO INTO FORWARD LAVATORY; HEARD A LOT OF NOISE AND AFTER A LONG PERIOD OF TIME; SAW MAN COME OUT OF LAVATORY WITHOUT HIS SHIRT ON. I WENT INTO THE LAVATORY. WATER WAS COVERING THE FLOOR. TOILET PAPER EVERYWHERE. THE COMMODE WAS FULL OF PAPER AND WATER AND THE SINK WAS SAME. THE CABINET CONTAINING PAPER TOWELS HAD BEEN TORN OFF THE WALL. THE PLASTIC DOOR PULLED OFF AND TWISTED IN HALF; THE TISSUE HOLDER ALSO WAS TORN OFF AND BENT IN HALF. I CALLED THE CAPT. THE CAPT SAID 'HAVE ONE OF THE MALE FLT ATTENDANTS GIVE HIM ONE OF THEIR SHIRTS OR CASHMERE SWEATER AND TELL HIM TO GO BACK TO SLEEP. WHEN I CALLED AGAIN AND SAID THE BATHROOM WAS TOTALED; CAPT X SENT THE FO BACK TO LOOK. THE FO OPENED THE LAVATORY DOOR AND SAID 'THIS GUY'S GOING TO JAIL.' I ASKED THE MAN IF HE HAD TAKEN MEDICATION; HE SAID 'YES; AMBIEN AND WINE.' I TOLD THE CAPT. THE CAPT HAD MEDICAL EXAMINERS MEET FLT; AN AGENT AND LCL POLICE. THE MEDICAL EXAMINER CHKED THE PAX AND THEN THE MAN AND HIS SEAT PARTNER WALKED OFF THE ACFT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT BOTH THE MAN AND HIS SEAT MATE WERE TAKING THE DRUG 'AMBIEN' AND DRINKING WINE AND OTHER LIQUORS. THEY WERE BOTH INCOHERENT. A WOMAN SITTING IN THE AISLE SEAT ACROSS FROM THE LAVATORY NOTICED ALL THE COMMOTION IN THE LAVATORY AND NOTICED WATER SEEPING OUT THE DOOR. THE MAN HAD STUFFED HIS 'MISSING' SHIRT DOWN THE TOILET. WHEN HE SOBERED UP A BIT LATER; HE DIDN'T REMEMBER ANYTHING ABOUT HIS DESTROYING THE LAVATORY. THE RPTR WAS INCENSED BY THE CAPT'S FIRST REMARK ABOUT THE SHIRT AND THOUGHT IT WAS TASTELESS AND SHOWED NO RESPECT FOR WHAT THEY HAD BEEN THROUGH. BY THE TIME THEY LANDED IN BUENOS AIRES; THE MAN HAD SOMEWHAT SOBERED UP. THE MEDICAL EXAMINER AND POLICE TOOK THE MAN UP TO FIRST CLASS TO INTERROGATE HIM WHILE THE REST OF THE PAX DEPLANED. THE RPTR WAS UPSET THAT THE ONLY MEDICAL TEST THEY GAVE HIM WAS TO LISTEN TO HIS HEART; AND DO THE 'NOSE TOUCHING' DUI TEST; ALL TO DETERMINE THAT HE COULD WALK OFF THE PLANE. THE CABIN CREW WAS VERY UPSET THAT THEIR COMPANY'S SUPVRS ESCORTED THE MAN OFF THE PLANE AND THANKED HIM FOR FLYING THEIR AIRLINE.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; MD11; MIA-EZE. PAX INTOXICATED WITH DRUGS AND WINE. DESTROYED LAVATORY; STUFFED SHIRT DOWN TOILET; TORE OFF FIXTURES. POLICE; MEDICAL EXAMINER MET FLT.

column94: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 2; Flight Attendant Total 2; Flight Attendant Type 85
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Smoke / Fire / Fumes / Odor
column121: THE RPTING FLT ATTENDANT NOTICED A STRONG ODOR OF CIGARETTE SMOKE AS A PAX EXITED FIRST CLASS LAVATORY. A FLT ATTENDANT MADE AN ANNOUNCEMENT REMINDING PAX THAT THE FLT WAS DESIGNATED AS NON-SMOKING. ANOTHER PAX THEN ASKED IF SOMEONE HAD BEEN SMOKING; BECAUSE SHE 'SMELLED SOMETHING FUNKY IN THE LAVATORY.' LATER; THE PAX USED A DIFFERENT LAVATORY AND WITNESSES SAW AND SMELLED CIGARETTE SMOKE FROM THAT LAVATORY. A FLT ATTENDANT PULLED THE PAX ASIDE TOWARDS END OF THE FLT (SHE HAD BEEN SLEEPING AFTER SECOND SMOKING INCIDENT) TO DISCUSS THE MATTER. THE PAX MAY HAVE FELT EMBARRASSED AT BEING CAUGHT SMOKING OR FELT THAT IT WOULD BE OVERLOOKED DUE TO HER 'CELEBRITY STATUS.' WHEN THE PAX REALIZED THAT SHE WOULD NOT RECEIVE SPECIAL TREATMENT; SHE BECAME MORE ADAMANT IN DENYING THAT SHE EVEN SMOKED ANYMORE (THOUGH SHE WAS LATER SEEN BY 3 OF THE CREW MEMBERS SMOKING OUTSIDE THE TERMINAL). THIS PAX ADMITTED TO BEING FINED ON A PREVIOUS FLT FOR SMOKING; YET LIED ABOUT NOT SMOKING ANYMORE. FINES AND PENALTIES (NOT NECESSARILY MONETARY) MUST BE STRICTER. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID THAT HE FIRST NOTICED THE SMOKE IN THE FIRST CLASS LAVATORY; AND KNEW THAT THE WOMAN WAS A FIRST CLASS PAX WHEN HE FIRST CONFRONTED HER. SHE KNEW HE SUSPECTED HER OF SMOKING; SO SHE WENT BACK TO THE MAIN CABIN AND USED THAT LAVATORY; WHERE THE SMOKE WAS BILLOWING OUT AND COULDN'T BE HELPED BUT BE NOTICED BY OTHER PAX. WHEN CONFRONTED BY THE PURSER; SHE GOT AGGRESSIVE AND CALLED THE PURSER A 'ROBOT.' SHE TRIED TO GET OUT OF BEING FINED BY TELLING HIM THAT SHE HAD GIVEN UP SMOKING; AFTER BEING FINED BEFORE ON AN INTL FLT. THE RPTR SAID THAT IN EITHER LAVATORY; THE SMOKE ALARM HAD NOT SOUNDED; EVEN THOUGH SMOKE WAS BILLOWING OUT OF THE MAIN CABIN LAVATORY.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; LAX-EWR. 'CELEBRITY' PAX SMOKED IN 2 DIFFERENT LAVATORIES; WITNESSED BY ANOTHER PAX. PAX DENIED IT; BUT HAD BEEN FINED BEFORE. NO FINE.

column105: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown
column121: AFTER THE DOORS WERE CLOSED AND THE JETBRIDGE PULLED; FLT ATTENDANT #1 SAID ALL SEATS WERE FULL; BUT 1 MAN WAS STILL STANDING. THE FLT ATTENDANTS DISCOVERED HE HAD NO PAPERWORK; TICKET STUB; ETC. AFTER THE JETBRIDGE WAS HOOKED AND THE DOOR OPENED; THIS MAN BOLTED UP THE JETBRIDGE; BUT WAS STOPPED AND DETAINED BY ONE OF OUR EMPLOYEES OR A SKYCAP. I HEARD IT WAS A GOOD TACKLE. WE COMPLETED AN ENTIRE SECURITY CHK OF THE ACFT AND DUMPED THE LAVATORIES SINCE IT WAS RPTED HE HAD BEEN IN THERE FOR A WHILE. HE HAD CHKED ON BAGS. MCO DID A GREAT JOB; ESPECIALLY THE SUPVR/MGR. HOWEVER; THIS MAN COULD HAVE GOTTEN AWAY WITH THIS IF THE ACFT HAD ONE OPEN SEAT AND THE CREW DOES NOT CHK THE CLOSEOUT PAX COUNT WITH A FLT ATTENDANT HEAD COUNT. I BELIEVE MORE VIGILANCE IS REQUIRED BY THE PLUCKER AGENTS AND FLC'S. WE ARE ALL IN THIS SECURITY THING TOGETHER AND NEED TO WORK TOGETHER; RATHER THAN BLAME ONE INDIVIDUAL.
column125: PLT RPT; B737; MCO-MIA. STOWAWAY ON PLANE; CAUGHT BY CABIN CREW BECAUSE THERE WAS NO EMPTY SEAT. PAX BOLTED; TACKLED ON JETBRIDGE; REMOVED. PLANE SEARCHED.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 32; Flight Attendant Total 32; Flight Attendant Type 50
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A PAX IN SEAT XX (MR X) WAS EXTREMELY ABUSIVE TO THE FLT ATTENDANTS ON THE CREW. WE THOUGHT AT ONE POINT HE WAS GOING TO BE PHYSICALLY ABUSIVE TO ONE FLT ATTENDANT; SO WE TRIED TO STAY CLR OF HIM; BECAUSE WE THOUGHT HE MIGHT BE MENTALLY ILL. THEN; HE STARTED VERBALLY ASSAULTING US; CALLING ONE FLT ATTENDANT A MORON; AND THAT HE WAS ENTITLED TO DO SO; BECAUSE HE PAID FOR A TICKET. OTHER PAX WERE COMPLAINING. THEY TRIED TO MOVE TO ANOTHER SEAT. IT GOT SO BAD; WE HAD SECURITY MEET HIM IN SXM. WHEN SECURITY MET HIM; HE STARTED YELLING AT THEM AND WAS ALSO VERBALLY ABUSIVE. HE SAID THAT HE WAS GOING TO CALL THE NAACP; AND HE BASICALLY LOST IT. THEY SAID THEY WOULD TAKE OVER FROM THERE. THIS MAN MADE A LOT OF PAX VERY UNCOMFORTABLE ON THE TRIP. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID THAT THE MAN HAD BEEN DRINKING; BUT THAT DIDN'T SEEM TO BE THE REAL PROB; WHICH WAS THAT HE WAS MORE PARANOID AND DELUSIONAL. THE REAL TROUBLE STARTED WHEN HE ASKED FOR ANOTHER MUFFIN. ONE OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS GAVE HIM ONE IN A NAPKIN AND HE COMPLAINED THAT HER HANDS HAD TOUCHED IT. HIS LOUD TIRADE BEGAN AT THIS TIME.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767; JFK-SXM. PAX VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO CABIN ATTENDANT AND TO SECURITY; WHEN THEY MET FLT. OTHER PAX MOVED AWAY FROM ABUSIVE MAN. SECURITY HAULED HIM OFF.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 1.2; Flight Attendant Total 2.5; Flight Attendant Type 40
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: IT ALL STARTED WHEN I WOKE UP MRS X FOR HER SPECIAL MEAL. MR X WAS SITTING IN THE ROW BEHIND HER AND GOT UPSET WHEN I WOKE MRS X FROM HER SLEEP. I APOLOGIZED AND TOLD HIM I WAS JUST GIVING HER THE SPECIAL MEAL THAT SHE HAD PUT IN A REQUEST FOR. LATER ON AFTER THE MEAL SVC; MR X BROUGHT HIS SON TO USE THE LAVATORY. WHEN HE CAME OUT; HE SAT ON THE RWY 4R JUMP SEAT. I WAS SITTING ON THE 4RC JUMP SEAT; SO I TURNED TO PAX X AND TOLD HIM HE WAS NOT ALLOWED TO SIT IN A FLT ATTENDANT JUMP SEAT. HE IGNORED ME AND SO I TOLD HIM ONCE AGAIN. HE GOT UPSET WITH ME ONCE AGAIN AND ASKED ME WHY DID I WAKE HIS WIFE UP WHEN SHE WAS SLEEPING. I REALIZED HE WAS STILL UPSET FROM THE INCIDENT THAT OCCURRED EARLIER. I EXPLAINED WHY AND HE GOT UP AND YELLED AT ME TO 'GET UP.' I TURNED TO HIM AND EXPLAINED TO HIM THAT HE SHOULD SPEAK TO ME IN A MORE RESPECTFUL WAY AND I WAS NOT A CHILD. IF HE WANTED TO GET BY; HE SHOULD ASK IN THE 'PROPER WAY.' HE TOLD ME I 'NEEDED TO SHOW HIM RESPECT.' HE SAID EXCUSE ME; AND SO I GOT UP TO LET HIM GET BY ME. HE THEN GOT IN MY FACE; SHOUTING AT ME THAT I AM RUDE AND DISRESPECTFUL AND HE WANTED MY NAME. I TOLD HIM I COULD NOT GIVE HIM MY NAME; SO HE TOLD ME HE WOULD GET IT FROM THE CAPT. PAX X WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE AND DID NOT KNOW HOW TO CTL HIS TEMPER. HE WAS RUDE THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE FLT AND ALSO OFFENDED SOME OF THE OTHER CREW MEMBERS. I RPTED THE INCIDENT TO THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT. I FIGURED PAX X COULD HAVE PUT IN A REQUEST TO HAVE HIS WIFE UNDISTURBED WHILE SHE SLEPT AND WE WOULD HAVE BEEN HAPPY TO COMPLY WITH HIS WISHES.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-300; LAX-JFK. CABIN ATTENDANT WOKE WOMAN UP TO SERVE SPECIAL MEAL. HUSBAND IRATE; SAT IN CABIN ATTENDANT'S JUMP SEAT. FAR VIOLATION. THREATENED CABIN ATTENDANT.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 16; Flight Attendant Total 16; Flight Attendant Type 95
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: THE PAX IN QUESTION WAS SEATED AT EITHER XB OR YB. THERE WAS A LADY SITTING BESIDE HIM AT XA OR YB. I SERVED THE MAN IN XB OR YB 2 BLOODY MARYS DURING DINNER. ON PICK-UP OF TRAYS; HE ASKED FOR 1 MORE. THE LADY SITTING NEXT TO HIM WAS VERY NICE. IN FACT; I DIDN'T KNOW UNTIL THE END OF THE FLT; WHEN SHE COMPLAINED; THAT THEY WEREN'T TOGETHER. I SERVED THIS MAN 3 BLOODY MARYS DURING THE COURSE OF THE FLT. FLT ATTENDANT #4 SAID SHE HAD SERVED HIM 2 ON THE FIRST BEVERAGE SVC. THAT IS A TOTAL OF 5 DRINKS. HIS BEHAVIOR WAS FINE. ON DEPLANING; A MALE PAX FROM COACH CAME UP FRONT BY MY DEPLANING POS IN FIRST CLASS AND TOLD THE FO AND ME THAT 'A' LADY WAS UPSET THAT SOME MAN HAD JUST 'GRABBED HER CROTCH' AS HE WAS GETTING OFF. SHE THEN CAME UP AND WAS SCREAMING AT ME THAT IT WAS ALL MY FAULT. SHE SAID I SERVED HIM 4 ROUNDS OF DOUBLES ALL BY MYSELF DURING THE FLT -- 8 DRINKS! I DID NOT SERVE HIM AT ALL ON THE FIRST ROUND. I WAS WORKING THE BACK OF THE ACFT. I THINK THIS WOMAN HAD BEEN VERY FRIENDLY WITH THIS MAN DURING THE FLT AND FOR SOME REASON HE DECIDED TO MAKE A PASS AT HER. TO CORRECT OR PREVENT THESE PROBS ON AIRPLANES; ALCOHOL SHOULD BE BANNED. IT NEVER CAUSES ANYTHING BUT TROUBLE. THE FLT ATTENDANTS ARE IN TROUBLE IF WE CUT IT OFF AND WE'RE IN TROUBLE IF WE DON'T. I'M NOT A POLICEMAN OR COUNSELOR. IT REALLY SHOULD BE REMOVED FROM EVERY AIRLINE!
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; MD80; SMF-DFW. WOMAN ACCUSED MALE SEAT MATE OF BEING SERVED TOO MANY DRINKS BY CABIN ATTENDANT. HE BECAME SEXUALLY AGGRESSIVE; GRABBING HER.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 8; Flight Attendant Total 8; Flight Attendant Type 20
column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A FIRST CLASS PAX HAD BEEN TOLD BY PURSER THAT DVD EQUIP WOULD BE COLLECTED 30-45 MINS PRIOR TO LNDG; AS PER OUR PROC; TO ALLOW TIME FOR INVENTORY OF EQUIP AND OTHER PRELNDG DUTIES. THE PAX HAD BEEN AGITATED WITH THE PURSER AND OTHER FIRST CLASS FLT ATTENDANTS INFLT; SO THE PURSER REQUESTED THAT I COLLECT THE DVD EQUIP. UPON REQUESTING THE EQUIP; THE PAX SAID HE ONLY NEEDED A FEW MORE MINS (A COMMON COMMENT) TO COMPLETE HIS MOVIE; THAT HE WAS TAKING NOTES ON IT. I APOLOGIZED AND SAID THAT OUR PROC REQUIRED US TO COLLECT IT NOW. HE BECAME AGITATED; COMPLAINING IT WAS 30 MINS PRIOR TO LNDG -- WE HAD TIME. I EXPLAINED THAT WE HAD OTHER DUTIES TO COMPLETE AS WELL. HE RIPPED OFF HIS HEADSET; JERKED THE PLUG FROM THE OUTLET AND THREW THE EQUIP IN THE EMPTY SEAT BESIDE HIM. HE WAS GESTICULATING AND MUMBLING. I HEARD ONE OBSCENITY AND ASKED; 'EXCUSE ME; WHAT DID YOU SAY?' HE IGNORED ME AND CONTINUED MUMBLING; BREATHING ERRATICALLY; AND FIDGETING; AGITATED IN HIS SEAT. I SAID; 'PLEASE DON'T CURSE AT ME.' I REMOVED THE EQUIP AND APOLOGIZED FOR THE INCONVENIENCE. BASED SOLELY ON MY LIMITED INVOLVEMENT WITH THIS PAX; IT IS MY BELIEF THAT HE POSES A POTENTIAL THREAT TO CREW SAFETY BASED ON HIS BELLIGERENT; AGITATED; VERBALLY AGGRESSIVE BEHAVIOR. THIS PAX SEEMS VOLATILE; AND BASED ON THE EXPERIENCES OF MY FELLOW CREW MEMBERS; I BELIEVE HE SHOULD BE DENIED ACCESS TO AIR TRAVEL. I TRULY FELT THREATENED AND INTIMIDATED; AS THOUGH HE MIGHT HIT ME. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THIS PROC OF GIVING FIRST CLASS PAX INDIVIDUAL DVD PLAYERS JUST STARTED RECENTLY; BECAUSE THE UNITS THAT HAD BEEN BUILT INTO THEIR SEAT UNITS WERE UNRELIABLE; BREAKING ALL THE TIME. THESE INDIVIDUAL DVD PLAYERS ARE EXPENSIVE; SO THEY HAVE TO BE INVENTORIED BEFORE LNDG; AND LOCKED IN A CART AND STOWED IN THE GALLEY. WITH THE OTHER SYS; THE PAX COULD KEEP PLAYING THE MOVIE ALL THE WAY TO THE GATE; IF NECESSARY. THIS PAX HAD BEEN VERY VOLATILE THE WHOLE FLT; WHICH STARTED WITH THE FACT THAT THE AIRPLANE HADN'T BEEN A B777. WHEN THE RPTR STEPPED IN TO HELP AS A MORE NEUTRAL PARTY; SHE DIDN'T EXPECT HIS EXPLOSION AND WAS SCARED AND AFRAID HE WAS GOING TO HIT HER.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767; IAD-LAX. FIRST CLASS PAX REFUSED TO GIVE UP DVD PLAYER TO CABIN ATTENDANT BEFORE LNDG. VERBAL ABUSE; THREATS.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column107: Flight Attendant Airline Total 11; Flight Attendant Total 11; Flight Attendant Type 20
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: AFTER PUSHBACK IN LGA; WE HAD A 30+ MIN DELAY SEQUENCE FOR TAXI. 2 MALE COACH PAX BECAME ANNOYED WITH THE DELAY AND BECAME LOUD AND OBNOXIOUS. A MALE FLT ATTENDANT TRIED TO POLITELY QUIET THEM -- TO NO AVAIL. ONE OF THE PAX ORDERED THE FLT ATTENDANT TO GO TO THE BACK OF THE ACFT; USING PROFANITY. THE FLT ATTENDANT INFORMED ME OF SIT AND SAID THAT HE BELIEVED THE 2 PAX WERE INTOXICATED. I CALLED FOR SECURITY TO MEET ACFT AND RETURNED TO THE GATE. THE PAX WERE REMOVED AND WERE IN CUSTODY OF THE PORT POLICE. I DEBRIEFED THE POLICE AND LCL AIRLINE OFFICIALS. ONE OF THE OFFENDERS YELLED TO THE REMAINING PAX THAT THE R ENG WAS DEFECTIVE AND THE ACFT WAS UNSAFE TO FLY. WE HAD THE ACFT REFUELED AND DEPARTED FOR FLL; MINUS THE 2 INTOXICATED PAX. BEFORE WE LEFT; THE POLICE DISCOVERED THE TWO HAD THEIR OWN BOTTLE OF SCOTCH. ON INITIAL BOARDING; I BOARDED ACFT RIGHT BEHIND THESE 2 PAX AND DID NOT NOTICE A PROB. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 472554: OTHER PAX CAME TO THE BACK BECAUSE THEY WERE FEARFUL OF THIS PERSON.
column125: PLT; CABIN ATTENDANT RPTS; S80; LGA-FLL. 30 MIN DELAY ON TAXI; 2 INTOXICATED PAX WERE LOUD; VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO PAX; CABIN ATTENDANT. OTHER PAX SCARED. RETURN GATE. POLICE REMOVED PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 11.5; Flight Attendant Total 14; Flight Attendant Type 65
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown
column121: I WAS IN THE AISLE SERVING BEVERAGES AND TURNED TO SEE THE PAX IN ROW X WITH HIS HAND IN MY LIQUOR DRAWER. I TOLD HIM THIS WAS NOT 'SELF SVC.' AS WE PROCEEDED TO RETURN TO THE GALLEY; HE AND HIS WIFE STOPPED ME AND ASKED FOR A SUPVR. THE CAPT WAS INFORMED OF THE ATTEMPTED THEFT; AND DECIDED TO SPEAK TO THEM. WHEN THE CAPT RETURNED; HE STATED THE PAX WERE RUDE AND BELLIGERENT TO HIM. HE DECIDED TO CALL IN THE LCL POLICE AND A REPRESENTATIVE FROM FLT SVC TO SPEAK WITH THE PAX. RPTS WERE TAKEN FROM THE PAX AND MYSELF. I THINK IT NEEDS TO BE CLR TO PEOPLE THAT THEY CANNOT JUST HELP THEMSELVES TO CATERING ITEMS; ESPECIALLY LIQUOR. THEY ARE NOT AWARE THAT IT IS THEFT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE MAN OFFERED NO EXCUSE FOR RIFLING THROUGH HER WINE DRAWER; THAT ALSO CONTAINED SNACKS. SHE DIDN'T KNOW IF HE WAS AFTER THE SNACKS OR THE WINE; SO SHE OFFERED HIM ANOTHER SNACK; WHICH HE DECLINED. WHEN SHE TOLD THE CAPT; HE SAID 'I'LL GO RIGHT BACK AND TALK TO THEM.' THE RPTR SAID IT WASN'T NECESSARY; THAT IT WAS NO BIG DEAL. HE INSISTED; HOWEVER. WHEN THE CAPT WENT BACK; THE WIFE WAS THE MORE VERBALLY ABUSIVE ONE. 3 POLICE OFFICERS MET THE FLT. ONE TALKED TO THE MAN AND THE CAPT; ANOTHER TALKED TO THE WIFE AND A THIRD TALKED TO THE RPTR.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B737; SFO-LAX. PAX CAUGHT TRYING TO STEAL OUT OF LIQUOR CART IN THE AISLE THAT RPTR WAS WORKING. CAPT TALKED TO PAX; POLICE MET FLT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 4.5; Flight Attendant Total 7.5; Flight Attendant Type 30
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A PAX WAS ASKED TO REMOVE THEIR BAGS FROM A BROKEN OVERHEAD BIN THAT WAS LABELED 'DO NOT USE.' I ASSISTED THE PAX TO FIND SPACE FOR HER BAGS; BUT THE PAX REFUSED TO PUT HER BAGS UNDER THE SEAT; OR 2 ROWS BACK IN MAIN CABIN; OR FOR THE BAGS TO BE CHKED. THE PAX BECAME ANGRY; RUDE AND LOUD. THE PAX WAS VIOLENTLY SLAMMING OVERHEAD BINS AND CARELESSLY MOVING HER BAGS AROUND. THE PAX WAS USING PROFANITY -- OTHER PAX COMPLAINED ABOUT HER DISRUPTIVE BEHAVIOR (WORDS AND ACTIONS) AND ELDERLY PAX WERE FRIGHTENED. A MGR WAS CALLED TO SPEAK WITH THE ANGRY PAX. THE PAX CONTINUED HER INAPPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR. THE MGR AND CAPT DECIDED TO REMOVE HER FROM THE FLT. THE PAX REFUSED TO GET OFF. THE AUTHS WERE CALLED. THE PAX WAS PHYSICALLY AND VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO THE POLICE. THE PAX WAS PUT IN HANDCUFFS AND WAS TAKEN AWAY. THE PAX WAS HOSTILE IN ACTIONS AND DIRECTED PROFANITY AT ME. THE PAX WAS GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO CALM DOWN BY THE FLT ATTENDANT; CAPT AND MGR. THE PAX ONLY GOT MORE IRRITATED. SUGGESTION: MAKE PAX MORE AWARE OF THE SERIOUSNESS AND SAFETY OF AIR TRAVEL. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT SHE WAS WORKING FIRST CLASS; AND WHEN SHE GOT ON; THE UNUSABLE OVERHEAD BIN HAD 'BROKEN' AND 'DO NOT USE' STICKERS ALL OVER IT. THE WOMAN WAS THE SECOND PERSON TO BOARD IN FIRST CLASS AND ON THE ENTIRE PLANE; AND ALL THE OVERHEAD BINS WERE OPEN IN FIRST CLASS. FOR SOME REASON; SHE PUT HER BAGS IN THE OVERHEAD BIN THAT HAD BEEN STICKERED OVER WITH 'DO NOT USE' STICKERS. WHEN THE RPTR ASKED HER IF SHE WANTED A BEVERAGE; SHE NOTICED THAT THE WOMAN'S BAGS WERE IN IT AND ALL THE 'DO NOT USE' STICKERS HAD BEEN TORN OFF. THE RPTR OFFERED TO PUT HER BAGS IN SOME EMPTY BINS IN THE MAIN CABIN; BUT THE WOMAN SAID; 'I BOUGHT A FIRST CLASS TICKET AND MY BAGS HAVE TO FLY FIRST CLASS;' AND BY NOW; ALL THE FIRST CLASS BINS WERE FULL. THE WOMAN TOOK A SWING AT THE POLICE; WHILE THE WOMAN WAS HURTLING INSULTS AND THREATS AT THE RPTR. SHE ENDED UP IN JAIL OVERNIGHT. THE RPTR WAS SO UPSET OVER THE INCIDENT THAT SHE WAS SHAKING FOR 3 DAYS AFTERWARD. THE WOMAN IS NOW SUING THE AIRLINE AND THE RPTR IS TERRIFIED SHE WILL BE ASKED TO TESTIFY AND HAVE TO SEE THE WOMAN AGAIN.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; F100; ORD-MSP. WOMAN REFUSED TO PUT BAGS UNDER SEAT OR CHK THEM. VERBALLY; PHYSICALLY ABUSIVE TO: PAX; CABIN ATTENDANT; SUPVR; CAPT; POLICE -- REMOVED IN HANDCUFFS.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: ON MAY/XA/00; FLT X LAX-SFO; AFTER PUSHBACK AND DURING LAST SAFETY CHKS; PAX ROW X HAD A BACKPACK ON A SEAT. IT TOOK ME SEVERAL TIMES TO GET HIM TO CORRECTLY STOW IT. FROM THIS POINT ON; HE WAS VERY AGGRESSIVE AND SEEMED TO BE CONFUSED. WE HAD PROBS THROUGHOUT THE FLT WITH THIS PAX. AFTER THE BEVERAGE SVC; I WAS PASSING HIS ROW. HE SAID HE DROPPED SOMETHING AND WANTED TO GET RID OF IT. THE NEXT THING HE WAS SHOVING SEVERAL THINGS ONTO A TRAY I WAS HOLDING. THE PURSER HAD SERVED HIM 1 DRINK. I THEN WENT UP TO FIRST CLASS AND TALKED WITH OUR PURSER AND TOLD HER HE SHOULDN'T BE SERVED ANY MORE DRINKS. HE HAD OBVIOUSLY HAD A LOT MORE TO DRINK PRIOR TO OUR FLT. (I SMELLED IT DURING THE LAST CONVERSATION WITH MR X.) PAX Y (WOMAN) HAD ALREADY SPOKEN ABOUT HER CONCERNS WITH THE PURSER. WHEN I WAS WALKING BACK THROUGH; MR X STOPPED ME AGAIN AND SAID HE NEEDED TO MOVE BECAUSE HE WAS CLAUSTROPHOBIC. I SAID I WOULD SEE WHAT I COULD DO. I WENT BACK TO FIRST CLASS AND PAX Y (WOMAN) FOLLOWED. SHE WANTED TO MOVE BECAUSE SHE WAS AFRAID BECAUSE MR X HAD A GOLF CLUB WITH HIM AND HE HAD BEEN VERY STRANGE WITH HER AND SHE WANTED HIM TO STOP TALKING TO HER. AT THIS TIME; SHE MOVED AND MR X GOT UP AND WENT TO THE AFT LAVATORY. HE WAS IN THERE FOR 5-7 MINS. WHEN HE CAME OUT; FLT ATTENDANT #3 AND I WERE BACK THERE. I TOLD HIM THAT THE ROW BEHIND HIM; SEAT ABC WAS NOW EMPTY AND THAT HE COULD SIT THERE IF HE WOULD LIKE. HE SOUNDED GRATEFUL FOR A SECOND AND I THOUGHT HE WAS GOING TO GIVE ME A PAT OR HUG. INSTEAD HIS ARM WENT AROUND MY NECK AND HE HELD ME AGGRESSIVELY FOR SEVERAL SECONDS. I HAD TO TURN MY HEAD AND PULLED DOWN AND OUT TO GET FREE. I TOLD HIM HE COULDN'T DO THAT; AND NOT TO TOUCH ME AND TO GO TAKE HIS SEAT. HE THEN WANTED HELP TAKING HIS BACKPACK BACK TO HIS SEAT. AGAIN HE WAS NASTY AND AGGRESSIVE. HE WENT TO HIS SEAT. I FOLLOWED A MIN LATER AND LEFT HIS BAG. PRIOR TO LNDG; HE HAD A COUPLE HEATED CONVERSATIONS WITH OTHER PAX. DURING OUR FINAL SAFETY CHKS; HE GOT UP TO GET HIS GOLF CLUB DOWN. WE TOLD HIM IT NEEDED TO STAY IN THE OVERHEAD BINS. THE CAPT HAD BEEN ADVISED OF OUR CONCERN THAT HE WAS GETTING ON ANOTHER FLT. RIGHT AFTER LNDG; MR X WAS AGAIN IN A CONVERSATION WITH A PAX IN A SEAT ACROSS THE AISLE. IT LOOKED HEATED. THE CAPT SAID OUR GATE WAS OCCUPIED AND IT WOULD BE A FEW MINS. I CALLED HIM AND SAID WE NEEDED A GATE ASAP. WE GOT ONE; TAXIED IN AND WERE MET BY AIRLINE CUSTOMER SVC SUPVR AND POLICE. WHEN MR X WAS WHEELING HIMSELF UP THE JETWAY (PARTIALLY DISABLED); HE PUT THE CLUB BTWN HIS LEGS AND WAS IGNORING THE SUPVR AND YELLING '*&%$ YOU;' ETC. THE POLICE TOOK THE CLUB AND ARRESTED HIM FOR PUBLIC INTOXICATION AND I CHARGED ASSAULT CHARGES. MR X WAS VERY AGGRESSIVE AND ABUSIVE. I CAN'T BELIEVE NO ONE ON THE GND PRIOR TO THE FLT HADN'T OBSERVED HIS MANNER. HE SHOULD NEVER HAVE BEEN BOARDED. (I HAVE HAD TO TAKE TIME OFF FOR A SORE BACK AND SOME PHYSICAL THERAPY DUE TO MR X GRABBING ME.) CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT MAN WAS BOARDED IN HIS OWN WHEELCHAIR; WHICH WAS THEN STOWED IN THE BELLY OF THE PLANE. THE RPTR DOESN'T KNOW IF THE MAN'S CLAUSTROPHOBIA CAUSED HIS PARANOID BEHAVIOR; BUT ANY TIME ANOTHER PAX TALKED TO HIM; HE PERCEIVED IT AS A VERBAL ASSAULT. HE TOLD THE RPTR A NUMBER OF TIMES THAT IF HE DIDN'T LOOK LIKE THIS; SHE WOULD BE HELPING HIM. THE RPTR ASSUMED HE MEANT 'LOOKING LIKE THIS' TO HIS BEING IN A WHEELCHAIR. AFTER ARRIVING AT THE GATE; RAMP PERSONNEL BROUGHT UP HIS WHEELCHAIR TO THE FRONT DOOR; WHERE CUSTOMER SVC SUPVRS WERE WAITING FOR HIM TO DEPLANE. HE IGNORED THEM; AND RAPIDLY MOVED UP THE JETWAY; FASTER THAN THE SUPVRS COULD WALK. HE ROLLED RIGHT INTO THE POLICE; WHO WERE STANDING AT THE TOP OF THE JETWAY. THE RPTR SAID THAT THE MAN SHOULD HAVE BEEN OBSERVED AS BEING INTOXICATED BY AT LEAST 3 DIFFERENT COMPANY PEOPLE: AT CHK-IN; WHEN THEY BOARDED HIS CHAIR DOWN IN THE BELLY AND BY THE PERSON PUSHING HIM TO THE PLANE IN HIS WHEELCHAIR. HIS COURT ARRAIGNMENT WASIN JUNE; BUT HE WAS A NO-SHOW. A WARRANT HAS BEEN ISSUED FOR HIS ARREST. THE RPTR IS NOW IN THE PROCESS OF WRITING HER CONGRESSMEN AND SENATORS TO FOLLOW THROUGH WITH THIS.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B737; LAX-SFO. INTOXICATED; PARANOID PAX IN WHEELCHAIR. ASSAULT ON CABIN ATTENDANT. OTHER PAX TRAUMATIZED. POLICE ARRESTED MAN; CHARGES FILED BY CABIN ATTENDANT.

column121: MY FO WAS FLYING THE AIRPLANE WHEN WE FAILED TO MAKE THE XING RESTR AT CEDES INTXN. I WAS NOT MONITORING THE SIT CLOSELY ENOUGH DUE TO MULTIPLE DISTRS; WHICH I WILL DESCRIBE. THIS FLT WAS FROM STL-SFO. IN STL WE HAD A BELLIGERENT PAX WHO I PERSONALLY CONFRONTED. THE MAN REFUSED TO SAY THAT HE WAS WILLING TO COOPERATE WITH THE FLT ATTENDANTS; AND FORCED HIS WAY ONTO THE AIRPLANE. I HAD THE POLICE COME AND REMOVE THIS MAN. DURING THE FLT; I SPENT A LOT OF TIME DISCUSSING THIS SIT WITH THE FLT ATTENDANTS. THEN A FLT ATTENDANT TOLD ME THAT A PAX HAD BEEN SMOKING IN THE BATHROOM. THIS HAPPENED JUST BEFORE TOP OF DSCNT. THE FLT ATTENDANTS HANDLED THIS SIT BY THEMSELVES; BUT I WAS THINKING ABOUT IT AND SUGGESTED FURTHER ACTIONS IN THE DSCNT. NOT FAR BEFORE CEDES (AT ABOUT GROAN); I CALLED OPS IN TO TELL THEM OUR ETA. WHILE I WAS DOING THIS; THE CTLR GAVE US A 350 DEG HDG FOR SPACING. THEN THE CTLR GAVE US A 210 DEG HDG TO REJOIN THE ARR. AT THE TIME THE FO'S VOR WAS ON MODESTO; I WAS ON MANTECA VOR. IT APPEARED THAT THIS HDG WAS NOT GOING TO GET US BACK ON THE ARR AS WE WERE XING THE ECA 215 DEG RADIAL. I CALLED THE CTLR AND INQUIRED ABOUT THE VECTOR. I WAS NOT THINKING ABOUT THE XING ALT. THE CTLR RESPONDED THAT HE WAS NOT CONCERNED ABOUT THAT; HE WANTED THE ALT. I TOLD HIM THAT WE WOULD BE UNABLE TO MAKE THE ALT. ATC SAID THAT IS WHY THEY HAD GIVEN US THE VECTOR; IMPLYING THAT HE HAD BEEN AWARE OF THE ALT. CTR CALLED BAY APCH AND TOLD US THAT THE ALT WAS OK. WE CROSSED CEDES AT ABOUT 12000 FT. MY FO LATER SAID THAT HE THOUGHT THAT WE MIGHT NOT MAKE THE XING RESTR. SUGGESTIONS: I SHOULD HAVE MONITORED THE FLYING MORE CLOSELY. MY FO SHOULD HAVE SPOKEN UP AND SAID 'WE MIGHT NOT MAKE THIS RESTR.' THE CTLR COULD HAVE QUERIED US AS TO WHETHER WE WOULD BE ABLE TO MAKE THE RESTR.
column125: A DISTR MD83 FLC FAILS TO MAKE THE ASSIGNED ALT XING RESTR AT CEDES INTXN ON FREQ WITH ZOA; CA.

column121: A FLT ATTENDANT ADVISED US THAT A CHILD HIT HIS HEAD WHILE IN THE MOTHER'S CARE. NO LACERATION OR ABNORMAL REACTIONS WERE SHOWN BY THE CHILD. THE MOTHER CLAIMED THAT THE CHILD JUMPED OUT OF HER ARMS. I NOTIFIED MY AIRLINE THAT WE NEEDED PARAMEDICS TO MEET THE ACFT AND ATC FOR PRIORITY HANDLING (FOR LNDG). CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE CHILD WAS A LITTLE GIRL AROUND 2 YRS OLD. HE BELIEVES THAT THE SEAT BELT SIGN WAS TURNED ON; WHEN THE CHILD TOOK A 'NOSE DIVE' OUT OF THE MOTHER'S LAP. SHE HAD A BIG KNOT ON HER HEAD. WHEN THE CAPT WENT BACK TO SEE THEM; HE CAME AWAY WITH A VERY DISTURBING FEELING THAT THE MOTHER WASN'T WATCHING THE CHILD; IE; LACK OF SUPERVISION. PARAMEDICS TOOK THE CHILD OFF.
column125: PIREP; DC9-30; MOTHER WAS HOLDING CHILD WHEN CHILD JUMPED OUT OF HER ARMS AND HIT HEAD. PRIORITY LNDG. CALLED FOR PARAMEDICS.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 2; Flight Attendant Total 6
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: THE SIZE OF THE DOG DID NOT FIT PROPERLY UNDER A SEAT. WE REALLY HAD TO STRUGGLE TO GET IT IN; PER REGS. THE SAME GOES FOR DOG CARRIERS AS LUGGAGE -- THEY SHOULD BE CHKED BEFORE BOARDING. THIS PERSON WAS VERY IRATE. SHE SAID THAT SHE HAD CALLED AND THE SIZE WAS OK -- I DON'T THINK SO! I WOULD LIKE TO ADD; I HAVE FLOWN WITH FLT ATTENDANTS THAT DON'T SEEM TO CARE ABOUT BULKHEAD ITEMS. I ASKED A CUSTOMER TO PLACE ITEMS IN A PROPER STOWAGE PLACE. OTHER FLT ATTENDANT'S REMARK WAS 'OH; IT'S ONLY A SMALL ITEM!' HOW CAN YOU HELP ON THIS MATTER? THE STOWAGE RULE SHOULD BE GOOD FOR ALL. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT SHE DIDN'T KNOW IF THERE HAD BEEN AN AIRPLANE CHANGE; BUT WAS ADAMANT ABOUT THE SIZE OF PET CARRIERS BEING CARRIED ON. SHE WOULD LIKE TO SEE AN FAA DIRECTIVE ABOUT PURSES ON THE FLOOR AT BULKHEAD ROWS. SHE ALSO SAYS THAT ONE OF THE REASONS FOR PREMEASURED BAGS NOT FITTING UNDER SEATS IS THAT THE AIRLINES ARE PUTTING ELECTRICAL OUTLETS UNDERNEATH SEATS FOR INDIVIDUAL USE OF COMPUTERS; ETC. THE OUTLET BOX HAS A DIAMETER OF ABOUT 4 INCHES; WHICH IS ENOUGH TO MAKE A REAL DIFFERENCE IN NOT BEING ABLE TO STOW NORMAL SIZE BAGS UNDER THE SEATS.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B727; BWI-DFW. PAX WITH DOG CARRIER THAT WOULDN'T FIT UNDER SEAT WITHOUT A REAL STRUGGLE. PAX IRATE DUE TO AIRLINE'S SIZE MEASUREMENT.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Smoke / Fire / Fumes / Odor; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other STEALING LIQUOR
column121: AROUND XA00 PACIFIC TIME; SMOKE COULD BE SMELLED FROM THE AFT; R-HAND LAVATORY. PAX CALL LIGHTS WERE GOING OFF AROUND MID-CABIN. THEY ALSO WERE RPTING THE SMELL OF SMOKE. MYSELF AND ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT OPENED THE LAVATORY DOOR. THE 'LADY' FROM ROW X HAD QUICKLY EXTINGUISHED HER CIGARETTE; DISPOSING OF IT IN A RECEPTACLE FULL OF PAPER HAND TOWELS. THERE WERE ALSO ASHES BY THE TOILET SEAT. SHE REEKED OF CIGARETTES; CLAIMED SHE HAD ONLY LIT ONE TO 'CLR' THE AIR. SHE HAD BEEN DRINKING QUITE A BIT AND WE HAVE WRITTEN RPTS FROM 2 OTHER PAX; WHO WITNESSED 'ROW X' LADY STEALING LIQUOR FROM THE BEVERAGE CARTS. SAN JOSE POLICE THEN MET OUR FLT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT NO ONE SAW THE WOMAN EXTINGUISH THE CIGARETTE IN THE TRASH CONTAINER. THE SMOKE WAS ALL THE WAY UP TO THE FRONT OF THE CABIN; SCARING A LOT OF THE PAX. THE SMOKE ALARM NEVER WENT OFF. DISCUSSING IT LATER WITH HER FLYING PARTNERS; SOMEONE SAID THAT THE SMOKE ALARM DOESN'T GO OFF FOR SMOKE THAT IS SMOLDERING; BUT ONLY FLAMES CAUSE THE HEAT TO GO WAY UP. THE WOMAN WAS TRAVELING WITH A GROUP OF NINE; INCLUDING CHILDREN. WHEN THE WOMAN STOLE THE LIQUOR FROM THE CARTS IN THE GALLEY; SHE POSTED ONE OF HER FRIENDS TO WATCH FOR AN APCHING FLT ATTENDANT; WHILE SHE FILLED A BAG UP WITH A LOT OF MINIATURES. THE POLICE MET THE FLT AND WAITED TO ARREST HER. THE REST OF THE FAMILY RAN OFF; NOT WANTING TO HAVE ANYTHING TO DO WITH HER. THE CAPT DECIDED NOT TO PRESS CHARGES; BECAUSE HE DIDN'T WANT TO DO ALL THE PAPERWORK INVOLVED. HE JUST WANTED AN APOLOGY; WHICH SHE DIDN'T WANT TO DO; DENYING ALL ALONG THAT SHE DID ANYTHING WRONG. THE FEMALE GATE AGENT GOT HER TO ADMIT WHAT SHE DID AND APOLOGIZE TO THE CAPT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; S80; DFW-SJC. WOMAN SMOKING IN LAVATORY; SMOKE ALARM DIDN'T GO OFF; STOLE LIQUOR FROM GALLEY; INTOXICATED. POLICE MET FLT. CAPT DIDN'T PRESS CHARGES.

column121: I NOTICED 2 PAX BEING TAKEN OFF THE ACFT AT DEP TIME. THE FORWARD PAX DOOR WAS CLOSED; THE JETBRIDGE REMOVED. NO ONE HAD INFORMED ME OF THE SIT. SECURITY WAS NOT CLRED. I CALLED THE JETBRIDGE BACK ALONG WITH SECURITY TO EXPLAIN THE SIT. SECURITY EXPLAINED THAT THE PAX HAD ILLEGAL TICKETS AND THAT THEIR BAGGAGE HAD BEEN REMOVED. SECURITY SHOULD HAVE INFORMED ME. I INFORMED THE STATION MGR THAT I WAS WRITING THE INCIDENT RPT ON MY RETURN TO MIA.
column125: PRIOR TO DEP; ARPT SECURITY ENTERED THE ACFT AND REMOVED 2 PAX; THEN CLOSED THE DOOR AND PULLED JETWAY WITH NO EXPLANATION TO FLC.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING BOARDING; A FOREIGN AIRLINE REPRESENTATIVE BROUGHT ON A NON ENGLISH SPEAKING WOMAN TO LEAVE ON OUR FLT. SHE (THE AGENT) INFORMED US THAT SHE (THE WOMAN) DID NOT SPEAK ENGLISH AND ASKED IF WE WOULD TAKE HER TO HER SEAT AND MAKE HER COMFORTABLE. DURING OUR TAXI OUT; SHE STOOD UP FROM HER SEAT AND TRIED TO CLB OVER THE PAX WHO WAS SITTING NEXT TO HER. I TRIED TO EXPLAIN THAT SHE SHOULD SIT DOWN; WHILE THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT CALLED THE COCKPIT SO THEY KNEW OF THE SIT AND WOULDN'T TAKE OFF. THE WOMAN WALKED TO THE FRONT OF THE ACFT. WE CONTINUED TO TRY TO UNDERSTAND WHAT SHE WAS TRYING TO TELL US. AFTER A FEW MINS SHE WENT BACK TO HER SEAT. SHE WAS QUIET AND CALM DURING TKOF; HOWEVER; ABOUT 10 MINS AFTER TKOF SHE GOT OUT OF HER SEAT WITH HER BAGS. THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE FLT; SHE WALKED THE AISLE; YELLED; UNPACKED AND REPACKED HER BAGS SEVERAL TIMES. FINALLY; BEFORE LNDG; WE GOT HER BACK IN HER SEAT. 2 MEN ON BOARD SAT ON EACH SIDE OF HER; SO SHE DIDN'T GET UP DURING LNDG. ONCE WE LANDED; SHE IMMEDIATELY GOT UP AND WENT TO THE FRONT DOOR. WE WERE MET BY THE AGENT AND 2 ARPT POLICE. HER FAMILY WAS WAITING TO MEET HER. I DON'T BELIEVE SHE SHOULD HAVE BEEN BY HERSELF. THE FAMILY CLAIMED THAT SHE WAS OLDER AND DIDN'T KNOW WHAT WAS GOING ON. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE WOMAN SAT IN A WINDOW SEAT AND DURING THE STERILE COCKPIT PERIOD DURING CLBOUT; SHE NOT ONLY CLBED OVER THE PERSON SITTING NEXT TO HER; BUT SHE LANDED ON THE LAP OF A THIRD PERSON; A MAN SITTING IN THE AISLE SEAT. THE RPTR STOWED HER 3 CARRY-ON BAGS (2 IN THE OVERHEAD BIN; AND A QUILT AND ANOTHER BAG) UNDER THE SEAT IN FRONT OF HER. SHE TOOK ALL 3 BAGS OUT; AND KEPT UNWRAPPING AND WRAPPING UP SMALL PACKAGES; SOME OF WHICH WAS FOOD. ON TAXI IN; SHE RAN UP TO THE FRONT DOOR AND PUSHED THE PURSER ASIDE AS SHE WAS DISARMING THE DOOR. THE WOMAN DEPLANED; LEAVING ALL HER BAGS STOWED AT HER SEAT. THE POLICE INTERVIEWED HER FAMILY THAT MET HER; BUT THE CREW NEVER LEARNED THE OUTCOME OF THAT. ONE OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS TOOK THE WOMAN'S BAGS OFF; BUT THE WOMAN AND HER FAMILY HAD ALREADY DISAPPEARED; SO THEY PAGED FOR THE FAMILY.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; MD80; DFW-BWI. FOREIGN CARRIER REPRESENTATIVE BROUGHT NON ENGLISH SPEAKING WOMAN TO PLANE. WOMAN DISRUPTED FLT; STANDING UP FOR TAXI-IN; TAXI-OUT. POLICE MET FLT.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: THE PAX IN ROW XX WENT INTO THE LAVATORY AFTER TKOF; CARRYING A PLASTIC BAG. HE WAS STILL IN THE LAVATORY WHEN WE TOOK THE CART INTO AISLE. THE PAX ROW XY INFORMED OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS THAT HER PURSE WAS GONE. HE WENT TO HELP LOOK AND THE PURSE WAS NOWHERE. PAX XX CAME BACK FROM LAVATORY AND SAID PURSE WAS IN HIS SEAT. PAX XY CAME TO THE BACK OF THE PLANE AND CHKED HER PURSE AND FOUND CREDIT CARDS GONE. SHE SAID SHE WANTED POLICE TO MEET THE FLT. I TOOK A DESCRIPTION OF PAX XX TO FLT ATTENDANT #1. POLICE MET THE FLT -- HER CREDIT CARDS WERE IN HIS POSSESSION. HE WAS HANDCUFFED AND TAKEN WITH THE ORLANDO POLICE. PAX XY AND 3 TRAVELING COMPANIONS WERE WITH THE POLICE TO FILE CHARGES.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B727-200; MIA-MCO. MALE PAX STOLE PURSE OF WOMAN SEAT MATE; TOOK CREDIT CARDS; PUT PURSE BACK. POLICE MET FLT; HANDCUFFED AND ARRESTED.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 22; Flight Attendant Total 22; Flight Attendant Type 100
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A BUSINESS CLASS PAX WAS SERVED A BEER ON THE GND DURING AN EXTENSIVE GND DELAY. AFTER IT WAS SERVED THE FLT ATTENDANT FELT THAT HE MUST HAVE OBVIOUSLY HAD MORE BEFORE HE BOARDED; SO SHE WAS CAUTIOUS TO SERVE MORE. AFTER TKOF; THIS PAX GOT OUT OF HIS SEAT AND WENT TO THE BUSINESS CLASS GALLEY BEFORE FLT ATTENDANTS WERE READY TO SERVE AND ATTEMPTED TO HELP HIMSELF TO A BEER. FLT ATTENDANT #2 CUT HIM OFF FROM ALCOHOL AND INFORMED ME. THIS PAX THEN KEPT TURNING ON HIS CALL LIGHT TO ASK FOR MORE BEER; AND WAS ONCE AGAIN INFORMED THAT THERE WOULD BE NO MORE. HE WAS SERVED WATER BY THE BOTTLE; EACH TIME TURNING ON HIS CALL LIGHT. AFTER 3 EVIAN BOTTLES AND 2 GLASSES OF WATER; IT WAS CLRLY EVIDENT THAT HE WAS HARASSING FLT ATTENDANTS BY CONSTANTLY TURNING ON THE CALL LIGHTS; OR PERHAPS IN HOPES THAT ANY FLT ATTENDANT WOULD SERVE HIM A BEER. I THEN ANSWERED A CALL LIGHT AND TOO WAS ASKED FOR A BEER AND TOLD HIM THAT HE WOULD HAVE TO REFRAIN FROM HIS CONSTANT PRESSING OF THE CALL LIGHT; BECAUSE THE CHIMES WERE ENOUGH TO WARRANT ANOTHER MESSAGE TO CREW. HE BECAME ANGRY AND DEMANDED MORE WATER OR BEER; I TOLD HIM THAT HE HAD CONSUMED MORE WATER IN THE LAST 5 MINS THAN ANYONE ON THE ACFT AND THAT IT WAS CLR THAT HIS ATTEMPT WAS REALLY TO HARASS THE CREW. HE WAS INTERFERING WITH OUR DUTIES AND THAT HE NEEDED TO REFRAIN FROM THIS BEHAVIOR. THE CALL LIGHTS CONTINUED AND THE COCKPIT WAS INFORMED. I SPOKE TO THIS MAN AGAIN AND WARNED THAT HIS BEHAVIOR WOULD HAVE TO CHANGE; AS IT WAS SO INTERFERING WITH OUR ATTN TO OTHER PAX AND COMPLETION OF CABIN SVC. ONCE I ASKED FOR HIS DRIVER'S LICENSE AND OR PAX TICKET; HE LET UP A BIT. THE CAPT AND I FELT THAT HIS BEHAVIOR NEEDED TO BE RPTED TO KEEP FROM HIS REENACTING THIS AGAIN. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT IT WAS THE CAPT'S DECISION NOT TO HAVE THE AUTHS MEET THE FLT TO ARREST THE MAN FOR INTERFERING WITH THE CREW'S DUTIES. AFTER CONFERRING WITH THE RPTR (PURSER); THEY DECIDED TO WRITE A RPT TO THEIR COMPANY IN HOPES OF DENYING HIM FROM TRAVELING ON THEIR AIRLINE AGAIN.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767; BOS-LAX. EXTENSIVE GND DELAY; LIQUOR SERVED. INTOXICATED PAX DENIED LIQUOR; ANGRY; RANG CALL BUTTON WHOLE FLT. THREATENED WITH ARREST.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: RIGHT AFTER TKOF; A PAX GOT OUT OF HER SEAT AND STARTED OPENING THE OVERHEAD BINS. FLT ATTENDANT #4 MADE A PA ANNOUNCEMENT THAT THE SEATBELT SIGN WAS STILL ILLUMINATED; AND IT WAS NOT SAFE TO MOVE AROUND THE CABIN. SHE REQUESTED FOR PAX TO REMAIN SEATED WITH SEATBELTS FASTENED. I TURNED AROUND AND SAW A PAX STANDING UP. I WAITED FOR ABOUT 20 SECONDS AFTER ANNOUNCEMENT AND PAX DID NOT SIT DOWN. I GOT UP FROM MY JUMP SEAT AND APCHED THE LADY. I ASKED HER TO PLEASE RETURN TO HER SEAT AND FASTEN HER SEATBELT. SHE ANSWERED 'NO; I'M NOT GOING TO SIT DOWN.' I EXPLAINED TO HER IT WAS NOT SAFE FOR HER OR THE PAX AROUND HER. SHE SAID TO ME 'I WILL NOT SIT DOWN. THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS TOLD ME THAT I COULD CHANGE SEATS RIGHTS AFTER TKOF.' I EXPLAINED TO HER THAT AFTER THE SEATBELT SIGNS WERE TURNED OFF SHE COULD DO IT SAFELY. SHE REFUSED TO SIT DOWN AND FASTEN HER SEATBELT. I EXPLAINED AGAIN TO HER THAT IT WAS FOR HER SAFETY AND THE SAFETY OF THE PAX SEATED NEXT TO HER. SHE SAID; 'I'LL SIT DOWN; ONLY AFTER I FINISHED DOING WHAT I'M DOING;' MOVING AROUND HER CARRY-ON BAGS FROM ONE OVERHEAD BIN TO ANOTHER. I WENT BACK TO MY JUMP SEAT AND PUT MY SEATBELT ON. WHEN IT WAS SAFE TO GET UP; I INFORMED THE CAPT OF THE SIT. HE SAID 'I'LL GO AND INFORM THE LADY THAT SHE IS TO FOLLOW THE SAFETY RULES.' THE CAPT WENT TO TALK TO PAX. SHE STARTED POINTING FINGERS AT THE CAPT'S FACE AND BEING NASTY TO THE CAPT. AT THIS POINT; THE CAPT GAVE UP; AND INFORMED HER HE WAS GOING TO CALL POLICE UPON ARR. WHEN WE ARRIVED; WE WERE MET BY LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS. WE FILED A CASE IN CHICAGO OF MISCONDUCT BY THE PAX. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID THAT THE POLICE IN CHICAGO MET THE FLT AND TOOK THE WOMAN OFF TO A WAITING SQUAD CAR. THE RPTR WENT TO THE POLICE STATION AND FILED HIS RPT; WHICH TOOK SEVERAL HRS; MAKING HIM MISS THE REST OF HIS TRIP. THE COMPANY STOOD BEHIND HIM AND DEADHEADED HIM HOME. THE CAPT FILED A RPT ONLY WITH THE COMPANY.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; MD80; BDL-ORD. ON TKOF AND CLB; SEATBELT SIGN ON. PAX STOOD UP AND REARRANGED LUGGAGE IN OVERHEAD; REFUSED ORDER TO SIT. POLICE ARREST.

column121: A PAX SMOKED IN THE AFT LAVATORY. I WAS PUTTING CARTS AWAY IN THE GALLEY; WHEN I SMELLED A BURNING SMELL/SMOKE. I SNIFFED AROUND AND AT THAT TIME; THE PAX EMERGED FROM THE AFT LAVATORY WITH SMOKE EVERYWHERE. SHE PASSED BY ME AND AFTER CAREFULLY EXAMINING THE LAVATORY TO MAKE SURE THERE WAS NO FIRE; I FOLLOWED THE PAX UP THE AISLE. I APCHED HER AND SAID; 'NO SMOKING IN THE LAV' IN HER LANGUAGE. THIS WAS THE ONLY INTERACTION I HAD WITH THE PAX. ONLY A CSR MET THE PLANE; NO AUTHS. IF WE CONTINUE TO ALLOW SMOKING IN THE LAVATORY; IT WILL CONTINUE TO HAPPEN. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 476867: PAX BOARDED THE PLAN VERY FRUSTRATED FROM THE BEGINNING AND SPEAKING QUICKLY IN A FOREIGN LANGUAGE. I ASKED ANOTHER PAX TO HELP TRANSLATE; BECAUSE SHE WAS OBVIOUSLY VERY UPSET AND WANTED TO ASK SOME QUESTIONS. THE OTHER PAX TRANSLATED THAT MS X HAD A BAD EXPERIENCE ON HER PREVIOUS FLT AND MANY PROBS WITH HER BAGGAGE. SHE THEN SAID MS X WANTED TO SMOKE A CIGARETTE BECAUSE SHE WAS SO UPSET AND SHE HAD NO TIME BETWEEN FLTS.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; S80; MIA-DEN. NON ENGLISH SPEAKING PAX BOARDED UPSET WITH AIRLINE. SMOKED IN LAVATORY. CUSTOMER SVC SUPVR CALLED TO MEET FLT.

column121: A PAX REFUSED TO COMPLY WITH A FLT ATTENDANT'S REQUEST TO TURN OFF HIS CELL PHONE. HE WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO ME. THE FLT ATTENDANT TOLD HIM IF HE DIDN'T TURN OFF THE CELL PHONE; HE WOULD BE REMOVED. THE PAX REFUSED TO COMPLY. SECURITY WAS CALLED. THE PAX WAS REMOVED. HE WAS UPSET ABOUT HIS COAT BEING HUNG IN THE CLOSET WITH BAGS; TOO.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; ORD-MIA. DURING PREFLT BEVERAGE SVC; PAX REFUSED TO TURN OFF CELL PHONE. PAX REMOVED BY SECURITY.

column121: FLT XX WAS INBOUND TO CHICAGO-ORD WHEN THE CAPT ANNOUNCED THAT DUE TO TSTMS IN THE AREA; WE WOULD BE HOLDING FOR ABOUT 30 MINS. A PAX CAME TO THE BACK GALLEY AREA AND REMARKED 'DO YOU MEAN THAT THESE 'CAT 1' PLTS CAN'T LAND AN AIRPLANE IN A TSTM?' HE REMAINED IN THE BACK FOR A FEW MINS; TRYING TO LISTEN TO OUR CONVERSATION; THEN RETURNED TO HIS SEAT. A FEW MINS LATER THE CAPT ANNOUNCED THAT WE WOULD BE DIVERTING TO MINNEAPOLIS FOR FUEL. THE PAX CAME TO THE BACK AGAIN TO SEE HOW LONG WE WOULD BE DELAYED. WHEN WE TOLD HIM THAT WE DIDN'T HAVE THAT INFO YET; HE BECAME AGITATED; BUT SAID NOTHING AND RETURNED TO HIS SEAT. AFTER WE LANDED; THE CAPT MADE THE ANNOUNCEMENT THAT THERE WERE OTHER AIRPLANES AHEAD OF US WAITING TO BE FUELED; AND THAT WE COULD BE THERE FOR 2 HRS. THE PAX CAME TO THE BACK TO WHERE FLT ATTENDANT #2 WAS SITTING AT HER JUMP SEAT AND SAID; 'I HAVE TO GET OFF THIS PLANE NOW; I'M GOING TO HAVE A FIT; I DON'T CARE IF YOU HAVE ME ARRESTED; I'LL JUST GO TO SEE THE JUDGE ON MONDAY.' FLT ATTENDANT #2 CALLED THE PURSER AND TOLD HIM THAT THE PAX WAS COMING FORWARD TO TALK TO HER. THE POLICE BOARDED A FEW MINS LATER; INTERVIEWED THE PAX SEVERAL TIMES; AND THEN DETAINED HIM AT MSP.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767-300; CDG-ORD. TSTMS AT ORD; DIVERT MSP. A PAX BECAME UPSET; TRIED TO DEPLANE IN MSP. POLICE BOARDED AND DETAINED MAN.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12; Flight Attendant Total 25; Flight Attendant Type 75
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WAS WORKING UP FRONT IN FIRST CLASS. THE INCIDENT TOOK PLACE IN THE REAR OF THE ACFT IN THE AFT GALLEY AREA. THE SEAT BELT SIGN WAS TURNED ON BECAUSE OF SOME CHOPPY TURB. THE AFT #2 FLT ATTENDANT TOLD A GENTLEMAN THAT HE NEEDED TO TAKE HIS SEAT AND FASTEN HIS SEAT BELT. HE REFUSED AND SAID HE WAS NOT GOING TO SIT DOWN AND PROCEEDED TO LOCK HIMSELF IN REAR LAVATORY. THE FLT ATTENDANT INVOLVED CAME UP FRONT AND EXPLAINED SIT TO COCKPIT. A DEADHEADING CAPT RIDING JUMP SEAT WENT BACK TO CONFRONT THE PAX AND OPENED THE LAVATORY DOOR FROM OUTSIDE TO SPEAK WITH HIM. SUPVRS MET FLT AND I OVERHEARD HIM TELLING SUPVR THAT THE FLT ATTENDANTS NEVER TOLD HIM HE NEEDED TO SIT DOWN WHEN THE INCIDENT FIRST OCCURRED. HE WAS VERY ARGUMENTATIVE. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR SAID THAT WHEN THE DEADHEADING CAPT OPENED THE LAVATORY DOOR; THE MAN WAS SITTING ON TOP OF THE TOILET SEAT READING. THE CAPT ORDERED HIM TO HIS SEAT AND HE KEPT STANDING THERE UNTIL THE MAN SAT DOWN. THE FLT ATTENDANT INVOLVED WITH THE INCIDENT SPENT 1 HR AFTERWARDS DISCUSSING THE INCIDENT WITH THE SVC SUPVRS.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B757; ORD-SNA. DURING TURB; PAX REFUSED TO SIT AND FASTEN HIS SEAT BELT; LOCKED HIMSELF IN AFT LAVATORY. DEADHEADING CAPT GOT HIM OUT. SUPVR MET FLT.

column121: A MALE PAX; TRAVELING WITH A FEMALE COMPANION; REPEATEDLY ASKED 2 FLT ATTENDANTS FOR COMPLIMENTARY UPGRADE SEATS XY. THE CABIN FLT ATTENDANTS REQUESTED MY ASSISTANCE (PURSER) TO SPEAK WITH THE PAX. ON TAXI OUT; I GREETED THE PAX; AND THE PAX CALLED AGAIN FOR COMPLIMENTARY UPGRADE. I DECLINED THE REQUEST. THE PAX BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE AND REQUESTED AN UPGRADE FROM ALL 7 FLT ATTENDANTS DURING 3 HR 40 MINS FLT FROM EWR-SJU. HE NEVER QUIT ASKING. I FOUND OUT IN SJU; AFTER PULLING THE PAX'S RECORD; THAT THIS PAX WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO THE EWR GATE AGENTS AFTER HE REQUESTED A COMPLIMENTARY UPGRADE. IF I HAD KNOWN THIS AT EWR AND DURING THE FLT; I WOULD HAVE REQUESTED SJU AUTHS MEET THE FLT BECAUSE THE PAX INTERFERED WITH FLT ATTENDANT DUTIES THE ENTIRE FLT SEGMENT. THE CAPT WAS BRIEFED THE ENTIRE TIME. THE PAX WAS A TOP TIER FLYER WITH ANOTHER AIRLINE; NOT WITH OUR AIRLINE; BUT HE WANTED SPECIAL ACCOMMODATION WITHOUT ANY PAYMENT. THE PAX CONTINUED HIS REQUESTS THE ENTIRE FLT SEGMENT. THE AUTHS WERE NOT CALLED ENRTE. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT THE MAN HAD GOT ONBOARD AND WANTED AN UPGRADE TO FIRST CLASS; SO A FLT ATTENDANT SENT HIM BACK TO THE PODIUM; SAYING SHE COULDN'T DO IT; BUT THEY PERHAPS COULD. HE CREATED A HUGE RUCKUS AT THE PODIUM; BUT DIDN'T GET HIS WAY; BECAUSE HIS FREQUENT FLYER MI WITH ANOTHER AIRLINE DIDN'T XFER OVER. THE RPTR SAID THAT HAD HE NOTIFIED SAN JUAN AUTHS; IE; POLICE; THAT THEY WOULD HAVE TAKEN THE MAN OFF; BECAUSE THEY ARE VERY NO NONSENSE WITH ABUSIVE PAX AND THEY ARE VERY RESPECTFUL OF FLT ATTENDANTS.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; A300-600; EWR-SJU. FREQUENT FLYER WITH ANOTHER AIRLINE BADGERED GATE AGENTS; CABIN ATTENDANT; FOR FREE UPGRADE TO FIRST CLASS. DENIED. DISRUPTED WHOLE FLT.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WAS ADVISED BY FLT ATTENDANT #2; THAT PAX MR X; IN SEAT XH WAS VIOLENTLY KICKING THE SEAT OF PAX MS Y IN SEAT XH; WHILE CURSING. I SPOKE WITH THE PAX AND WE NEEDED TO MOVE HIM TO ANOTHER SEAT; AS HE CONTINUED TO KICK THE SEAT AS SOON AS I WOULD LEAVE. HE KICKED AND POUNDED ON THE BATHROOM DOOR; SOILED THE INTERIOR AND REPEATEDLY REQUESTED MORE ALCOHOL. HE WOULD ROAM AROUND THE AIRPLANE; HARASSING THE FLT ATTENDANTS FOR MORE COCKTAILS; AS SOON AS I WOULD LEAVE HIS SIDE. I KEPT THE CAPT INFORMED AND HOPED TO CONTAIN THE SIT. WHEN I LEARNED THAT HE VERBALLY THREATENED PAX MR YY IN SEAT YY; IT WAS DECIDED TO HAVE THE AUTHS MEET THE FLT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR STATED THAT SHE DIDN'T KNOW IF THE MAN WAS DRUNK WHEN HE BOARDED IN BUSINESS CLASS; BECAUSE SHE WAS WORKING FIRST CLASS. THE WHOLE INCIDENT STARTED WHEN THE MAN TAPPED ON THE WOMAN'S SHOULDER SITTING IN FRONT OF HIM AND TOLD HER THAT HE HAD A PROB WITH THE MAN SITTING NEXT TO HER. HE HAD NEVER MET EITHER OF THEM BEFORE; BUT JUST STARTED TO GO SUDDENLY CRAZY. HE SAID HE WAS GOING TO 'SIT ON HIS *&%$#$ HEAD; AND KILL HIM.' THE INNOCENT MAN SAID THAT HE WAS AFRAID TO GET OFF THE AIRPLANE WITH THIS GUY FOLLOWING HIM. THE POLICE CAME ONBOARD IN JFK; HANDCUFFED HIM AND LED HIM OFF BEFORE THE OTHER PAX GOT OFF.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; B767; SFO-JFK. INTOXICATED PAX VERBALLY; PHYSICALLY ASSAULTED WOMAN AND MALE PAX; SOILED LAVATORY; ROAMED PLANE SHOUTING OBSCENITIES. CALL FOR AUTHS.

column121: DURING BOARDING; CLOSE TO DEP TIME; A PAX ASKED TO DEPLANE THE ACFT FOR A MOMENT. I TOLD HIM HE COULD DEPLANE; BUT HE MUST TAKE HIS CARRY-ON LUGGAGE AND THE AGENTS WOULD HAVE TO BE NOTIFIED THAT HE WAS GETTING OFF. THE PAX WAS IRRITATED THAT HE WOULD HAVE TO GO BACK TO THE AFT OF THE ACFT TO GET HIS LUGGAGE. THE PAX WENT BACK TO HIS SEAT AND TOLD THE FLT ATTENDANT IN THE AFT SECTION THAT HE WOULD HAVE TO TAKE 'HIS BOMB OFF WITH HIM.' THE PAX WAS REMOVED FROM THE ACFT AND NOT ALLOWED TO REBOARD. THE PROB IS THAT THE PUBLIC DOES NOT TAKE AIRLINE SAFETY AND SECURITY SERIOUSLY. MANY PAX DO NOT UNDERSTAND THAT ANY SECURITY THREATS (BOMBS) ARE TAKEN VERY SERIOUSLY; EVEN IF THEY WERE ONLY 'JOKING.' ALSO; THE LACK OF RESPECT THE PUBLIC HAS FOR THE FLT ATTENDANT'S POS AND AUTH CAN CREATE PROBS WITH PAX COMPLIANCE WITH SAFETY ISSUES. THE FAA NEEDS TO PROMOTE AWARENESS OF SAFETY AND SECURITY ISSUES AND BE TOUGHER ON PAX MISCONDUCT.
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT RPT; S80; LGA-MCO. ON BOARDING; PAX WANTED TO GET OFF FOR A MIN. WAS TOLD HE'D HAVE TO TAKE CARRY-ON WITH HIM; BECAME ANGRY AND MADE BOMB JOKE. PAX REMOVED.

column121: WE ENCOUNTERED 2 INCIDENTS ON FLT XX; MXP-ORD; MAR/XA/00. A PAX SEATED IN SEAT YY WOULD NOT FOLLOW RULES AND REGS; SIT IN SEAT; FASTEN SEAT BELT; AND STOW CARRYON DURING TAXI OUT; FOR TKOF. WE RETURNED TO THE GATE. THE PAX WAS REMOVED.
column125: SPLIT; CABIN ATTENDANT SECONDARY RPT; B767-300. MILAN-CHICAGO. ON TAXI; PAX WOULDN'T COMPLY WITH SEAT BELT AND BAG STOWAGE REG. RETURN TO GATE. PAX REMOVED.

column121: JUST AS WE WERE CLRED FOR TKOF; ON RWY 1R IN SFO; WE HEARD 6+ CHIMES IN SUCCESSION. WE PULLED THE PWR BACK AND STOPPED THE JET; ABEAM TXWY M. WE MAY HAVE ROLLED 200 FT AT A SPD OF 15 KTS. WE CANCELED OUR TKOF CLRNC AND RECEIVED PERMISSION TO HOLD THERE FOR A MIN. A FLT ATTENDANT CALLED AND SAID SHE MAY HAVE AN EMER. SHE CALLED BACK AND SAID EVERYTHING WAS FINE. A LITTLE OLD LADY IN SEAT XY HAD PUSHED HER CALL BUTTON 6+ TIMES FOR NO REASON. WE RECEIVED TKOF CLRNC AND DEPARTED.
column125: PIREP; SFO RWY FOR TKOF. HEARD 6+ PAX CHIMES; THOUGHT IT WAS AN EMER; STOPPED TKOF. PURSER RPTED ELDERLY WOMAN RANG CHIME BY MISTAKE. RECEIVED TKOF CLRNC AGAIN; DEPARTED.

column96: Flight Crew Last 90 Days 160; Flight Crew Total 8000; Flight Crew Type 320
