column121: AFTER CLRING THE RWY AND WAITING FOR TAXI CLRNC; A PAX LEFT THEIR SEAT. AFTER TAXI CLRNC WAS RECEIVED; TAXI TO GATE BEGAN. CAPT WAS NOT INFORMED THAT A PAX WAS NOT SEATED. WE TAXIED TO THE GATE AND WERE TOWED INTO FINAL POS. PAX DEPLANED WITHOUT INCIDENT. THE FLT ATTENDANT DID NOT INFORM ME UNTIL THE FOLLOWING MORNING OF THE UNSEATED PAX. WHEN ASKED WHY SHE ALLOWED THE PAX OUT OF THEIR SEAT; SHE REPLIED 'I DIDN'T KNOW IF I HAD THE AUTH TO TELL THEM TO SIT DOWN.' WHEN ASKED WHY SHE DIDN'T CALL THE CAPT; SHE SAID 'I DIDN'T KNOW I WAS SUPPOSED TO.' I INSTRUCTED HER IT WAS HER OBLIGATION TO PREVENT THIS VERY TYPE OF THING. THIS FLT ATTENDANT IS NOT NEW. OTHER PLTS HAVE TOLD ME THIS FLT ATTENDANT IS 'WEIRD.' PERHAPS 2 1/2 WKS TRAINING FROM NEW HIRE TO ONLINE IS A BIT SHORT?
column125: CABIN ATTENDANT ON CL65 DID NOT ADVISE A PAX TO REMAIN SEATED DURING TAXI TO PARKING.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 31; Flight Attendant Total 31; Flight Attendant Type 75
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WAS NOTICED BY A PAX TO HAVE BEEN DRINKING FROM HIS OWN BOTTLE OF ALCOHOL. SHE TOLD FLT ATTENDANT #2 WHO; IN TURN; LOOKED FOR THE BOTTLE; BUT DID NOT SEE ONE. THE PAX DID NOT SEEM TO BE DISTURBING ANYONE SO SHE DID NOT WANT TO ACCUSE HIM. DURING TURB HE CAME TO THE AFT LAVATORY TO GO TO THE BATHROOM. HE HAD A CAN OF COKE AND A BLANKET IN HIS HAND. I INFORMED HIM THE SEAT BELT SIGN WAS ON AND HE SHOULD BE IN HIS SEAT BUCKLED UP. HE TOLD ME HE REALLY HAD TO GO. I TOLD HIM TO LEAVE THE CAN AND BLANKET OUTSIDE; BUT HE QUICKLY WENT INTO THE LAVATORY. AS HE WAS CLOSING THE DOOR I COULD SEE A BOTTLE IN THE BLANKET. I WAITED FOR HIM TO COME OUT AT WHICH TIME I TOLD HIM I DID NOT WANT TO UPSET HIM BUT I WOULD HAVE TO TAKE HIS BOTTLE AND I WOULD GIVE IT TO HIM UPON DEPLANING. HE SAID OKAY AND RETURNED TO HIS SEAT. HE DID NOT DO ANYTHING ELSE AS WE KEPT AN EYE ON HIM. THEN A PAX CAME BACK TO THE GALLEY AND SAID THAT HE LURCHED AT HER DAUGHTER. WE ASKED IF HE HURT HER AND SHE SAID NO; BUT SHE THOUGHT WE SHOULD DO SOMETHING. I WENT TO HIS SEAT AND HE HAD HIS EYES CLOSED AND THE COUPLE NEXT TO HIM DID NOT SEEM TO BE BOTHERED BY HIM. I HAVE SEEN; IN THE PAST; IF YOU UPSET SOMEONE INTOXICATED IT CAN CAUSE MORE PROBS SO WE DECIDED NOT TO SAY ANYTHING AND JUST WATCH HIM. THERE WERE NO FURTHER PROBS UNTIL WE WERE TOLD TO PREPARE FOR LNDG. I THINK BECAUSE OF THE STATE HE WAS IN; HE THOUGHT WE HAD ALREADY LANDED. HE GOT UP OUT OF HIS SEAT AND TOOK HIS BAG DOWN OUT OF THE OVERHEAD BIN AND SAID HE WAS GETTING OFF. IT TOOK A FEW MOMENTS TO CONVINCE HIM TO SIT DOWN AT WHICH TIME HE DID. UPON LNDG; EVERYTHING WAS FINE. HE STAYED IN HIS SEAT FOR TAXI. AS PAX WERE DEPLANING (ABOUT 1/3 OF THE CABIN HAD LEFT); PAX STARTED TO SAY WE NEEDED SECURITY BECAUSE HE WAS CAUSING PROBS. THE CAPT CALLED SECURITY AND WE FOUND; AFTER MOST PAX HAD DEPLANED; THAT 3 MALE PAX HAD SURROUNDED HIM IN HIS SEAT. HE WAS CURSING AND CARRYING ON; MAD THAT THE PAX WOULDN'T LET HIM OFF. ONE OF OUR CREW CHIEFS (CABIN CLEANING PERSONNEL) TOOK OVER AND THE PAX DEPLANED. THE CAPT ASKED THE MEN TO LEAVE THEIR NAMES BUT THEY ALL SAID THEY DIDN'T WANT TO AND THEY LEFT. WHEN SECURITY CAME THEY ASKED IF THIS MAN INTERFERED WITH THE CREW AND WE SAID NO. THEY TOLD US THEY WOULD HANDLE IT FROM THERE.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A PAX WAS DRINKING OUT OF A CONCEALED BOTTLE OF ALCOHOL.

column94: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 15; Flight Attendant Total 15; Flight Attendant Type 70
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: BEFORE BOARDING; ONE OF MY FLT ATTENDANTS MENTIONED THAT HE OBSERVED AN INTOXICATED PAX IN THE BOARDING LOUNGE. I EXPRESSED MY CONCERN TO A COMPANY AGENT BEFORE BOARDING. SHE SAID SHE WOULD CALL A SUPVR TO HANDLE IT. DURING BOARDING; THE FLT ATTENDANT AT THE ACFT DOOR NOTICED THE PAX WAS ALLOWED TO BOARD. I GOT OFF THE ACFT TO DISCUSS MY CONCERN. AN AGENT SUPVR BOARDED THE ACFT AND SUBSEQUENTLY HE WAS REMOVED FROM THE ACFT. WHAT IS PROBLEMATIC IS THE FACT THAT HE WAS ALLOWED TO BOARD IN THE FIRST PLACE; AFTER BRINGING OUR CONCERN TO THE AGENT'S ATTN. I BELIEVE THIS IS A DIRECT VIOLATION OF FARS. SHOULD MY CREW NOT HAVE NOTICED THIS INTOXICATION; AND HE WAS ALLOWED TO TRAVEL WITH US; THE POTENTIAL FOR A PROB INFLT CONCERNS ME.
column125: A B767-300 FLT ATTENDANT IN CHARGE RPTED THAT AN INTOXICATED PAX HAD BEEN BOARDED EVEN AFTER HE HAD TOLD THE GATE AGENT TO DENY BOARDING TO THE PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 15; Flight Attendant Total 22; Flight Attendant Type 100
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: 5 MINS BEFORE DEP; FLT ATTENDANT #9 INFORMED ME THAT A MALE PAX; DURING BOARDING; WAS TOUCHING AND POKING FLT ATTENDANT #10 AND MADE THE COMMENT THAT HE HAD JUST BEEN RELEASED FROM AN INSTITUTION. FLT ATTENDANT #6 WHO WAS DIRECTING AT THE ACFT DOOR AND HEARD MY CONVERSATION WITH FLT ATTENDANT #9 SAID THAT THE SAME PAX ALSO CAME UP TO HER AND BEGAN SNIFFING HER IN AN INAPPROPRIATE MANNER. I WENT DIRECTLY TO CAPT AND INFORMED HIM OF THE SIT AND ASKED HIM TO PLEASE NOT LET THE AGENT CLOSE THE ACFT DOOR UNTIL I WENT BACK TO WHERE THIS PAX WAS SEATED AND ASSESSED HIS CONDITION. BECAUSE WE WERE AN EXTREMELY FULL FLT; I DID NOT WANT TO DRAW TOO MUCH ATTN TO THIS SIT. I VERY CALMLY AND POLITELY ASKED THE PAX IF EVERYTHING WAS OK. HE ASKED ME WHAT I WAS TALKING ABOUT. I TOLD HIM THAT I WAS INFORMED THAT HE MADE SOME COMMENTS TO 2 OF OUR FLT ATTENDANTS; AND I NEEDED TO MAKE SURE THAT EVERYTHING WAS ALRIGHT. HE TOLD ME TO MIND MY OWN BUSINESS AND TO GET OUT OF HERE AND GO DO MY JOB. I TOLD HIM THAT I WAS THE PURSER ON BOARD THIS FLT TODAY AND IT WAS MY JOB TO ASSESS ANY SIT THAT I FELT IN ANY WAY COULD BE A PROB. HE ANGRILY TOLD ME TO SHUT UP; GET OUT OF HERE AND GO HOME. BASED ON THE PREVIOUS INFO THAT FLT ATTENDANT #9 AND FLT ATTENDANT #6 GAVE ME; AND HIS ANGRY AND HOSTILE REACTION TO ME; I ASKED FLT ATTENDANT #9 WHO WAS NEARBY AT THE TIME; TO CALL THE CAPT. I TOLD THE PAX TO GET HIS PERSONAL BELONGINGS TOGETHER BECAUSE HE WOULD NOT BE GOING ON THIS FLT. I WENT UP TO THE ACFT DOOR. CAPT WAS OUT OF HIS SEAT AND READY TO ASSIST ME IN ANY WAY. BASED ON THE INFO I HAD FROM THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS AND THE FACT THAT THE PAX WAS VERY ANGRY AND HOSTILE AND NOT ABLE TO HAVE A RATIONAL CONVERSATION WITH ME; I DID NOT FEEL IT WOULD BE SAFE FOR HIM TO BE ON BOARD. THE AGENT WENT BACK TO REMOVE THE PAX. WHEN THE PAX CAME UP TO THE ACFT DOOR HIS FRIEND WHO WAS SEATED NEXT TO HIM FOLLOWED HIM. THE PAX AND HIS MALE FRIEND PROCEEDED TO ARGUE WITH THE AGENTS. THEY BECAME ANGRY WHEN THEY WERE TOLD THAT THE PAX WOULD NOT BE ABLE TO BE ON THIS FLT. THEY TOLD THE AGENTS THAT I WAS LYING; THAT NONE OF THE PROCEEDING TOOK PLACE; ETC. WHEN THE CAPT SAID THIS WAS HIS FINAL DECISION; THE PAX TOLD THE CAPT TO F___ OFF AND THAT HE WAS GOING TO SUE US; ETC; AND USED MORE PROFANITIES. HIS FRIEND WAS GIVEN THE OPTION TO STAY ON BOARD OR DEPLANE ALSO. HE CHOSE TO STAY ON BOARD. THE AGENT CLOSED THE ACFT DOOR AND WE PROCEEDED TO LAX WITHOUT FURTHER INCIDENT. IN CONCLUSION. I FEEL THAT I; ALONG WITH CAPT; MADE THE RIGHT DECISION TO HAVE THIS PAX REMOVED FROM OUR FLT.
column125: A B767 FLT ATTENDANT IN CHARGE RPTED THAT DURING BOARDING OF A MALE PAX; WHO ADMITTED HAVING JUST BEEN RELEASED FROM AN INSTITUTION; AND WHO WAS INAPPROPRIATELY TOUCHING THE FLT ATTENDANTS. WAS REMOVED FROM THE FLT.

column121: THE DEPORTEE WAS ESCORTED BY 2 INS OFFICERS TO THE 2L DOOR. THEY SAID THE AUTHORITIES WILL MEET HIM UPON ARR IN JAPAN. HE DIDN'T SIT DOWN IN HIS SEAT DURING BOARDING. HE WENT TO LAV; LOOKING FOR MAGAZINE; JUST WALKING AROUND. HE LOOKED VERY NERVOUS. I TOLD THE PURSER AND SHE ASKED INS OFFICERS WHY THE DEPORTEE WAS TRAVELING BY HIMSELF WITHOUT AN ESCORT? AFTER DOOR WAS CLOSED; DURING PUSH BACK I FOUND HE WAS NOT IN HIS SEAT. JUST RIGHT AFTER THAT; HE CAME OUT FROM 3R LAV. WE SAW HE CUT HIS WRIST AND HE WAS BLEEDING. THE KNIFE WAS FOUND IN THE TRASH BIN IN 3R LAV. FA TRIED TO TAKE HIM TO 2L LAV AND TREAT HIS WOUND. BUT HE STARTED TO RAGE AND RUN AROUND FIRST CLASS CABIN; SCREAMING 'HELP; HELP; OUT; OUT!' HE WAS SUBDUED BY 2 PLTS; AND WE WENT BACK TO THE GATE. SPANISH SPEAKING AGENT TALKED TO HIM. HE SAID HE IS A MEMBER OF SPANISH TERRORIST ORGANIZATION AND HE SAID HE WILL BE KILLED BY TERRORIST MEMBERS WHEN HE GETS TO JAPAN. THAT'S WHY HE DIDN'T WANT TO GO TO JAPAN. WHY WOULD INS PUT HIM ON OUR FLT WITHOUT ESCORT? HE CARRIED A SMALL KNIFE. HOW HE COULD BRING TO THE AIRPLANE? HE CUT HIMSELF BUT HE COULD HAVE HURT OUR PASSENGERS AND US. HE COULD BE A HIJACKER TO FORCE TO GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. IN THIS CASE; IT HAPPENED ON THE GND; BUT IF IT HAPPENS IN THE AIR; IT'S TOO LATE.
column125: B-777 CREW ON INT'L FLT HAD INS OFFICERS INVOLUNTARILY BOARD A PAX THAT WAS BEING DEPORTED. THE PAX WAS UNWILLING TO GO ON FLT AND TRIED COMMIT SUICIDE WITH A KNIFE HE CARRIED ABOARD.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 11; Flight Attendant Total 11; Flight Attendant Type 1
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other Bomb Threat In Overhead
column121: GREETINGS! DURING BOARDING OF FLT ON JUN/XA/01; THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT CALLED ME TO ADVISE ME OF A SIT IN MAIN CABIN. HE SAID HE WAS TRYING TO MAKE ROOM IN AN OVERHEAD BIN AND ASKED PAX AROUND THE OVERHEAD BIN 'WHOSE BAG IS THIS?' A LADY REPLIED 'MINE' AT THE SAME TIME A MALE PAX IN THE AREA SAID 'I WOULDN'T MOVE THAT BAG IF I WAS YOU; THERE IS A BOMB IN IT.' HE THEN EXPLAINED TO THE PAX NOT TO MAKE JOKES ABOUT THE SAFETY OF THE ACFT. HE FURTHER EXPLAINED THE SERIOUSNESS OF THE SIT AND INFORMED THE PAX THAT HE COULD CALL THE POLICE. THE PAX REPLIED 'CALL THE POLICE!' AFTER HEARING THIS STORY; I ADVISED THE CAPT OF THE SIT AND HE SAID HE WANTED THAT PAX OFF; HE ASKED ME TO GET THE AGENT. I ADVISED THE AGENT AND HE CAME AND SPOKE WITH THE CAPT; THEN REMOVED THE PAX FROM THE ACFT. CONVERSATION TOOK PLACE ON THE JETBRIDGE BTWN THE SUPVR (FEMALE); #2 FLT ATTENDANT; AND THE PAX. ANOTHER SUPVR (MALE) ARRIVED AND BEGAN INQUIRING ABOUT THE SIT. THE PAX'S CHKED LUGGAGE WAS REMOVED AND THE FEMALE SUPVR ASKED FOR A STATEMENT FROM THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT. I ASSISTED THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT IN WRITING THE STATEMENT AND WE GAVE IT TO THE FEMALE SUPVR AS THE ACFT DOOR WAS BEING CLOSED.
column125: PAX ON A B727 WAS DEPLANED AFTER STATING TO THE FLT ATTENDANT THAT A BOMB WAS IN A BAG IN THE OVERHEAD COMPARTMENT AND DID NOT CARE IF POLICE WERE CALLED.

column121: AFTER LNDG AND CLRING THE TXWY; WE WERE TOLD TO HOLD SHORT OF A TXWY INTXN WHILE WE CHKED ON OUR GATE STATUS. WHILE PARKED; 2 PAX LEFT THEIR SEATS TO USE THE FACILITIES. THE CAPT WAS UNAWARE THAT PAX WERE NOT SEATED AND WAS NOT INFORMED BY THE FLT ATTENDANT. THE FLT TAXIED TO THE GATE AND SHUT DOWN WITHOUT INCIDENT. THIS IS THE SECOND TIME IN A MONTH THAT THIS HAS HAPPENED. BOTH FLT ATTENDANTS WERE NEW TO THE COMPANY; AND BOTH TOLD ME THEY DIDN'T KNOW THEY WEREN'T SUPPOSED TO LET PEOPLE UP. FLT ATTENDANT TRAINING AT THIS AIRLINE IS DISGRACEFUL! BOTH FLT ATTENDANTS WERE MADE ACUTELY AWARE OF THEIR RESPONSIBILITIES; BUT AFTER THE FACT IS TOO LATE.

UPON ARR AT THE ACFT; THE FO DISCOVERED THE COCKPIT DOOR OPEN. IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE B737 OPERATING MANUAL; A THOROUGH PREFLT INSPECTION WAS ACCOMPLISHED.

column119: Environment - Non Weather Related; Human Factors
column121: WE HAD A NORMAL LNDG ON RWY 24 AT MKG AND WE WERE ROLLING OUT; WHEN THE PAX WANTED TO OPEN THE DOOR TO GET AIR INTO CABIN. THE NOSE GEAR COLLAPSED AND PROP STRUCK THE RWY AND WE SKIDDED ABOUT 15 FT ON RWY TO A STOP. WE EXITED THE AIRPLANE AND REALIZED THE MAINS WERE UP ALSO AND THE GEAR SWITCH WAS IN THE 'UP' POS. I HAVE A BAD HABIT OF RAISING MY FLAPS IN ROLLOUT AND THE FLAPS WERE STILL DOWN. I DO NOT REMEMBER TOUCHING THE FLAP SWITCH OR THE GEAR SWITCH. MY ONLY EXPLANATION IS THAT I RETRACT FLAPS SUBCONSCIOUSLY AND THE INABILITY FOR THE PAX TO OPEN THE DOOR WAS ENOUGH OF A DISTR TO CAUSE ME TO HIT THE GEAR SWITCH INSTEAD OF THE FLAP SWITCH. I USE A CHKLIST RELIGIOUSLY BEFORE TKOF; AND GUMPS PRIOR TO LNDG. I HAVE NEVER USED AN AFTER LNDG CHKLIST; BUT WILL START NOW. YOU SHOULD NEVER DO ANYTHING SUBCONSCIOUSLY IF IT CAN BE AVOIDED AND THAT IS WHAT CHKLISTS ARE FOR. ALSO; I FIRMLY BELIEVE THAT IF THE DOOR OPENING HADN'T DISTR ME; THIS NEVER WOULD HAVE HAPPENED. THEREFORE; NOTHING SHOULD BE DONE (IE; OPEN DOORS; WINDOWS; RETRACT FLAPS) UNTIL YOU ARE OFF THE RWY.
column125: A PVT SMA PLT INADVERTENTLY RAISES THE GEAR INSTEAD OF THE FLAPS WHEN DISTR BY HIS PAX ON THE LNDG ROLL AT MKG; MI.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12.75; Flight Attendant Total 12.75
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other INVOLUNTARILY BOARDED PAX OPENED WINDOW EXIT AND JUMPED OFF ACFT
column118: General Maintenance Action; General None Reported / Taken
column121: DEPORTEE OPENED WINDOW EXIT ON TAXI OUT AND JUMPED OUT. SLIGHT PANIC FOLLOWED AS SEVERAL PAX THOUGHT THERE WAS AN EVACUATION. RETURNED TO GATE TO CLOSE WINDOW EXIT; THEN DEPARTED FOR MIAMI. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: AN INS AGENT ESCORTED THE PAX ONTO THE ACFT. HE THEN HANDED PAPERWORK TO THE FAA AT THE DOOR AND LEFT. THE PAX WAS TO BE MET IN MIA BY ANOTHER INS AGENT; TO BE DEPORTED TO RETURN TO JAIL. THE PAX WAS ASSIGNED A SEAT. AFTER BOARDING; THE PAX WENT TO THE REAR RESTROOM. WHILE THERE HE COMPLETELY CHANGED HIS CLOTHES. HE REMAINED IN THE REAR RESTROOM UNTIL THE ACFT BEGAN PUSH BACK FROM THE GATE. HE THEN RAN AND OPENED THE OVER WING EXIT; LEFT THE ACFT AND JUMPED OFF THE LEADING EDGE OF THE WING. AT THIS POINT THE OTHER PAX THOUGHT THE ACFT WAS BEING EVACUATED AND BEGAN TO DO LIKEWISE. IT WAS ALL THE FA'S COULD DO TO KEEP THE REST OF THE CABIN FROM AN EVACUATION. THE FA KNOWS OF OTHER PROBS THAT HAVE OCCURRED WITH PAX BEING DEPORTED.
column125: B737-800 CREW HAD AN INVOLUNTARY BOARDED PAX OPEN THE OVER WING ESCAPE EXIT AND JUMP OFF THE WING OF THE ACFT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 8.5; Flight Attendant Total 8.5
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX AND WIFE WITH 2 KIDS; AT ANNOUNCEMENT OF BOARDING; BECAME VERY VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO ME. THEY WERE VERY UPSET AND THREATENED ME. I SPOKE WITH AGENT; CAPT; FLT ATTENDANT #2; AND FO. OPERATIONAL MANAGER SPOKE WITH ENRAGED PAXS; WHO TOLD THEM THEY COULD BE REMOVED FROM THE FLT. PAX REMAINED CALM BUT SEVERELY AGITATED AT ME DURING FLT. I FEEL THAT; BECAUSE I WAS THREATENED; YELLED AT; AND WAS VERBALLY ABUSED PRIOR TO PAX EVEN ENTERING THE JET BRIDGE; THAT THESE PAX SHOULD HAVE BEEN PULLED OFF THE FLT. THEY WERE DISRUPTIVE WITH THE BOARDING PROCESS AND; ONCE ON THE AIRPLANE; THEIR HOSTILITY PREVENTED ME FROM DOING MY DUTIES ON THE ACFT FOR A 3 1/2 HR FLT. THE CAPT REFUSED THEM ALCOHOL. I COULDN'T HAVE CONTACT WITH THEM; BUT MY JUMPSEAT WAS RIGHT BEHIND THEM. THEREFORE IN AN EMER THERE WAS ABSOLUTELY NO GUARANTEE THAT I COULD BE ASSURED A SMOOTH EVACUATION AND COOPERATION.
column125: A B767 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT AN ABUSIVE FAMILY WAS NOT REMOVED BEFORE THE FLT FROM ORD DEPARTED; CAUSING CONCERN THAT THEY WOULD NOT HAVE LISTENED TO HER IN AN EMER.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 11; Flight Attendant Total 10; Flight Attendant Type 80
column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty); FA #1
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other Crew Security FO Operations
column121: DURING FLT TO SKBQ; I WAS INFORMED THAT A PAX ASSAULTED TWICE THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT. I WAS TOLD SECURITY WOULD MEET THE FLT. AFTER DEPLANING I WAS THE SECOND FLT ATTENDANT ON THE VAN. FLT ATTENDANT #5 WAS ALREADY ON. WHEN I LOOKED TO MY R; I SAW A GROUP OF PEOPLE APCH THE VAN. WE IMMEDIATELY GOT OFF THE VAN AND I BEGAN TO ORDER THE REMAINING CREW MEMBERS TO GET ON THE VAN. MEANWHILE SOME MEN WERE SURROUNDING THE PLTS. THE SISTER OF PAX WAS THREATENING CREW TELLING US THAT THEY KNEW OUR NAMES AND WHERE WE STAYED; THAT THEIR BODYGUARDS WOULD TAKE CARE OF US. I INFORMED SECURITY THAT WE WOULD NOT LEAVE WITHOUT BEING ESCORTED TO HOTEL. WHILE WAITING IN VAN; A MAN PARKED HIS TRUCK IN FRONT OF OUR VAN TO BLOCK OUR EXIT. SECURITY SENT HIM AWAY. SECURITY AGREED THAT WE WOULD HAVE AN ARMED ESCORT IN THE VAN TO TRY TO MAKE OUR TRIP SAFE. WHEN WE LEFT; THE DRIVER HAD TO TAKE AN ALTERNATE ROAD TO AVOID ANYONE TO FOLLOW US. WE ALSO HAD TO BE ESCORTED IN THE MORNING BACK TO THE ARPT. IT WAS A VERY SCARY AND TENSE SIT. NO ONE FROM ACR MET THE FLT THE NEXT DAY. I REFUSE TO RETURN TO THE SAME ARPT DUE TO THE SIT.
column125: PAX MISCONDUCT INFLT CONTINUES AFTER LNDG TO INCLUDE THREATS TO THE CREW AND THE USE OF ARMED GUARDS FOR SECURITY OF TRANSPORTATION. FOREIGN OP.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 2.5; Flight Attendant Total 2.5
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other PAX THREW MEAL ON FLOOR ISLE
column121: AS I WAS DOING THE FOOD SVC ON THE L-HAND SIDE OF THE AIRBUS 300; FLT ATTENDANT #2; WHO WAS ALSO ON THE MEAL CART; BUT ON THE R-HAND SIDE AISLE ASKED ME IF I HAD AN EXTRA CHICKEN MEAL FOR PAX SITTING IN ROW XYZ. I REPLIED BY SAYING I ONLY HAD 1 CHICKEN LEFT AND I ALREADY OFFERED TO ABC. PAX SITTING IN ROW ABC WERE A FAMILY OF 4 (THE FATHER; THE MOTHER; AND 2 LITTLE GIRLS). I INFORMED THE PAX (FATHER) THAT WE ONLY HAD 1 CHICKEN FOR 1 OF HIS DAUGHTERS AND 3 BEEF FOR THE REST OF THE FAMILY. AT THIS POINT FLT ATTENDANT #2 APOLOGIZED TO THE MOTHER; WHO GOT VERY UPSET ABOUT THE SIT AND STARTED YELLING AT FLT ATTENDANT #2. FLT ATTENDANT #2 HANDED THE BEEF TO THE MOTHER WHO; AFTER LOOKING AT IT THREW THE MEAL ON THE FLOOR WHERE FLT ATTENDANT #2 WAS STANDING. FLT ATTENDANT #2 TOLD THE PAX THAT SHE DID NOT APPRECIATE WHAT SHE JUST HAD DONE. SHE PICKED UP THE BEEF AND WALKED UP TO FIRST CLASS GALLEY TO SPEAK TO THE PURSER. AFTER A FEW MINS; SHE CAME BACK AND FINISHED THE SVC. PURSER HANDLED THE SIT AND FLT ATTENDANT #2 DID NOT HAVE ANY MORE CONTACT WITH THE PAX.
column125: AIRBUS A300 CABIN CREW EXPERIENCED AN IRATE PAX WHEN SERVED A MEAL TYPE SHE DID NOT LIKE.  STARTED YELLING AND THEN THREW THE MEAL ON THE AISLE FLOOR. THE CABIN ATTENDANT VOICED HER DISPLEASURE AND SCRAPED IT OFF THE FLOOR. THE MATTER WAS TURNED OVER TO THE #1 CABIN ATTENDANT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 1.5; Flight Attendant Total 1.5; Flight Attendant Type 10
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FROM THE TIME PAX GOT ONBOARD HE WAS LOUD AND OBNOXIOUS AND VERY DEMANDING. I REFUSED TO GIVE HIM ANOTHER ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE; HE BECAME VERY DEFIANT. I HAD TO TELL HIM SEVERAL TIMES TO STAY SEATED WITH SEAT BELT FASTENED. HE DID NOT COMPLY WITH ANY OF MY DEMANDS. HE ALSO PICKED A FIGHT WITH PAX. DURING DSCNT; LNDG; HE STOOD UP AND WENT TO THE RESTROOM AFTER I ALREADY MADE SEVERAL PA REQUESTS TO STAY SEATED. PAX SHOULD HAVE NEVER BEEN ALLOWED TO BOARD THE PLANE SINCE HE WAS ABUSIVE TO AGENT AT THE GATE. ALCOHOL AND POSSIBLY DRUGS WERE CONTRIBUTING FACTORS.
column125: B727 CABIN ATTENDANT COMPLAINS ABOUT UNRULY PAX WHO WAS DEFIANT WHEN ATTENDANT REFUSED TO SVC HIM AN ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE AND UNWILLING TO FOLLOW SAFETY INSTRUCTIONS. HE WAS DISRUPTIVE TO OTHER PAX THE ENTIRE FLT. HE WAS SUSPECTED OF BEING INTOXICATED; AND OR DRUGGED.

column125: B727-200 CABIN ATTENDANT COMPLAINT THAT FOREIGN AUTHS WOULD NOT ARREST PAX AFTER LNDG BECAUSE THERE WERE NO VISUAL SIGNS OF INJURY.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX; MRS X; HAD REMOVED ANOTHER PAX'S BAG FROM THE OVERHEAD BIN. I HAD COME OVER TO PAX; MRS X; AND INSTRUCTED THAT SHE MUST MOVE HER BAG TO ANOTHER OVERHEAD BIN OR HAVE IT GATE CHKED. I EXPLAINED TO MRS X THAT OVERHEAD BINS ARE SHARED SPACE. THE PAX'S RESPONSE WAS 'WHAT AM I SUPPOSED TO DO MAKE THE BAG DISAPPEAR?' I REPEATED MY INSTRUCTION AND PAX'S RESPONSE WAS ABUSIVE. PAX REFUSED TO MOVE HER BAG OR CHK IT. I WENT TO THE FLT ATTENDANT #1 FOR ASSISTANCE; WHO REITERATED MY INSTRUCTIONS (THE GATE AGENT CHK HER BAG). 20 MINS INTO THE FLT PAX; MRS X; LEFT HER SEAT AND APCHED ME IN THE GALLEY. SHE SAID 'WHAT IS YOUR NAME?' THEN SAID ANGRILY; 'PRAY TO GOD MY BAG IS THERE WHEN I GET THERE OR YOU WILL SEE.' I RESPONDED DON'T THREATEN ME. SHE REPEATED IT AGAIN THEN GRABBED MY R ARM AND SAID THAT BAG BETTER BE THERE. I INSTRUCTED HER NOT TO TOUCH ME; THAT I WOULD NOT TOLERATE HER THREATS OR VERBAL ABUSE ANYMORE. SHE CALLED ME A LIAR SEVERAL TIMES. I WENT TO THE CAPT TO EXPLAIN THE SIT. THE FO WENT TO THE PAX; READ TO HER IT WAS A FEDERAL OFFENSE TO TOUCH A FLT ATTENDANT. SHE WAS STILL CARRYING ON AND HE TOLD HER NOT TO HARASS HIS FLT ATTENDANT OR TOUCH THEM OR HE WILL LAND THE ACFT. WHEN WE ARRIVED AT FLL THE POLICE MET THE ACFT. I DID NOT PRESS CHARGES ON HER. THE POLICE RESPONSE WAS SHE WAS TRAVELING WITH A SICK HUSBAND AND SHE WAS AN ELDERLY WOMAN. TO ME THAT IS NO EXCUSE FOR HER BEHAVIOR. MY JOB IS SAFETY NOT TO BE ABUSED BY PAX.
column125: SUPER MD80 CABIN ATTENDANT THREATENED WITH VERBAL ABUSE AND PHYSICALLY TOUCHED BY IRATE PAX OVER LOCATION OF CARRY ON BAG.

column121: PAX BOARDED ACFT WITH DOG IN A CARRIER. FLT ATTENDANT #2 WAS DOING SAFETY COMPLIANCE CHK AND NOTICED THAT CARRIER WAS TOO LARGE AND WOULD NOT FIT UNDER SEAT. CAPT DECIDED TO LOCK CARRIER IN AFT LAVATORY WHICH WAS INOP. AFTER TKOF PAX WENT TO LAVATORY AND TOOK DOG OUT OF KENNEL; AND BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE. PAX BARELY SPOKE ENGLISH. DIDN'T WANT TO COMPLY WITH FLT ATTENDANT'S INSTRUCTIONS. MGR ON DUTY AND PAX SVC STAFF MET THE FLT. POLICE WAS CALLED AS WELL. PROB SHOULD HAVE BEEN TAKEN CARE OF IN PHL.
column125: B727. PAX WAS ALLOWED TO CARRY A DOG KENNEL ONTO THE ACFT THAT WOULD NOT FIT UNDER THE SEAT.

column118: Air Traffic Control Issued New Clearance; Air Traffic Control Provided Assistance; General Declared Emergency
column121: PRIOR TO TOP OF DSCNT THE HEAD FLT ATTENDANT RPTED A STRESSED; DISRUPTIVE; ABUSIVE PAX WHO HAD COMPLAINED ABOUT A CRYING CHILD SEATED BEHIND HIM. HE WANTED A SEAT CHANGE BUT THE FLT WAS FULL SO THIS WAS NOT POSSIBLE. THE PAX COMPLAINED ABOUT BEING MISTREATED AND IGNORED; DEMANDED TO BE FIRST OFF THE PLANE AND UPGRADED ON THE NEXT FLT. AS IT PROGRESSED HE STARTED COMPLAINING OF A HIGH HEART RATE AND HEADACHE. HIS PROBS SEEMED SELF INDUCED BUT WE COULD NOT IGNORE THAT HE MIGHT REALLY HAVE MEDICAL PROBS. WE ADVISED ATC OF A MEDICAL SIT. THE HEAD FLT ATTENDANT WENT BACK AGAIN AND THIS TIME HE 'DID NOT LOOK GOOD' SO SHE ADMINISTERED OXYGEN. WE DECLARED MEDICAL EMER AND ASKED FOR PARAMEDICS TO MEET THE FLT. OUR HANDLING INTO CVG WAS EXPEDITIOUS. PARAMEDICS MET THE FLT AND HE WALKED OFF TO THEIR AMBULANCE. HE CONTINUED ON WITH HIS NEXT FLT. PAX NOW CLAIMS NEGLIGENCE/INJURY DUE TO OUR HANDLING. IT WAS ONLY ABOUT 1/2 HR FOR ENTIRE EVENT. ONLY THING WE WOULD DO DIFFERENTLY WOULD BE TO SEE IF A DOCTOR WAS ONBOARD. UNFORTUNATELY OUR MINDSET WAS MORE HOW TO HANDLE A DISRUPTIVE PAX RATHER THAN A MEDICAL PROB. THE TRANSITION WAS DIFFICULT TO MAKE.
column125: B757-200 CREW HAD A DISRUPTIVE AND ILL PAX ON THE FLT TO CVG.

column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Illness / Injury; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column118: Flight Crew Landed As Precaution; General Declared Emergency
column121: JUST PRIOR TO TOP-OF-DSCNT THE ONBOARD LEADER; HEAD FLT ATTENDANT; RPTED A STRESSED; DISRUPTIVE; ABUSIVE PAX WHO HAD COMPLAINED BITTERLY AND REPEATEDLY ABOUT CONDITIONS DURING THE FLT. BECAUSE OF A CRYING CHILD; HE HAD REQUESTED A SEAT CHANGE. THE FLT WAS FULL; SO A SEAT CHANGE WAS NOT POSSIBLE. HIS COMPLAINTS WERE NOT LIMITED TO THE CRYING CHILD. HE ALSO CLAIMED TO HAVE BEEN MISTREATED AND IGNORED BY THE FLT ATTENDANTS. INITIALLY THE ONBOARD LEADER REQUESTED A PAX SVC AGENT MEET THE FLT. AS THE SIT PROGRESSED THE PAX BEGAN COMPLAINING OF SHORTNESS OF BREATH AND AN INCREASED HEART RATE. THE ONBOARD LEADER GAVE HIM OXYGEN AND RPTED THE SIT TO ME. SHE FELT HIS SYMPTOMS WERE SELF-INDUCED; BUT SHE COULD NOT DISCOUNT THE POSSIBILITY THAT HE HAD REAL DEVELOPING MEDICAL PROBS. I DECLARED A 'MEDICAL EMER' AND REQUESTED AN EXPEDITED ARR TO CVG. I ALSO REQUESTED PARAMEDICS TO MEET THE FLT. WE LANDED SHORTLY AFTERWARDS. PARAMEDICS REMOVED THIS PAX TO AN AMBULANCE. I DON'T KNOW THE RESULTS OF THEIR EXAMINATION OF THE PAX. THIS PAX IS NOW THREATENING A LAWSUIT AND A RPT TO THE FAA CONCERNING HIS TREATMENT. AMONG HIS COMPLAINTS; HE SAYS NO ONE SOUGHT THE HELP OF MEDICAL PERSONNEL WHO MAY HAVE BEEN ONBOARD. THIS IS TRUE. SINCE HE WAS INITIALLY PRESENTED TO ME AS DISRUPTIVE I DIDN'T THINK TO ASK THE ONBOARD LEADER TO PAGE FOR A DOCTOR. NEXT TIME I'LL PAGE FOR A DOCTOR AND HAVE POLICE AND PARAMEDICS MEET THE FLT.
column125: B757 FLC DECLARED A MEDICAL EMER FOR PRIORITY HANDLING DURING TOP OF DSCNT FOR LNDG DUE TO A DISRUPTIVE; UNHAPPY; COMPLAINING AND SUBSEQUENTLY ILL ACTING PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 3; Flight Attendant Total 7; Flight Attendant Type 40
column113: Aircraft Equipment Problem Less Severe; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A FEMALE PAX REFUSED TO COMPLY WITH REGS REGARDING PETS IN THE CABIN. SHE REFUSED TO KEEP DOG IN CARRIER UNDER THE SEAT. EVEN AFTER SHE WAS TOLD OVER; AND OVER AGAIN DURING THE ENTIRE FLT; CLRLY INTERFERING WITH CREW MEMBER'S DUTIES. SHE WAS HANDED A 'DISTURBANCE RPT' AND STILL REFUSED. POLICE MET THE AIRPLANE ON ARR IN MIA.
column125: A B737-800 INFLT HAS A FEMALE PAX WHO REFUSES TO COMPLY WITH REGS BY ALLOWING A PET DOG OUT OF A PET CARRIER.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 2; Flight Attendant Total 2; Flight Attendant Type 30
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other Smoking in Lavatory.
column116: Automation Aircraft Other Automation; Person Other Person
column121: PAX WAS SUSPECT IN SMOKING IN FORWARD LAVATORY; LATER CAUGHT SMOKING IN AFT ACFT LAVATORY. PAX HAD CONSUMED 3 ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES DURING FLT. PAX WAS ISSUED 'INFLT DISTURBANCE RPT' PER COMPANY REG. THIS WAS A WARNING TO CEASE OR FURTHER ACTION WILL FOLLOW. NO FURTHER DISTURBANCE FROM PAX. APPROPRIATE COMPANY PERSONNEL AND RPTS WERE NOTIFIED AND COMPLETED. MY FEELINGS ON THIS ISSUE IS THAT; 1) THE SMOKE DETECTORS SHOULD DETECT CIGARETTE SMOKE. 2) I BELIEVE WHERE A PAX IS IGNITING AN OPEN FLAME ONBOARD AND BURNING TOBACCO ONBOARD; SUCH ACTION IS THE MOST DANGEROUS TO ACFT SAFETY. OUR SAFETY DEMONSTRATION PREFLT DESCRIBE THE ACTIONS AGAINST SMOKING...'MAY RESULT IN A FINE...'THIS IS NOT SERIOUS ENOUGH. ARREST AND PROSECUTION SHOULD BE FOR FIRST OFFENSE. A SLAP ON THE WRIST IS NO THREAT THESE DAYS.
column125: B727-200 PAX CAUGHT SMOKING IN TWO OF THE LAVATORIES AND WAS ISSUED WARNING NOTICE.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 2; Flight Attendant Total 2
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: WE WERE ON THE RWY; WHEN THE CAPT ANNOUNCED THAT WE WERE #14 ON THE LINE-UP AND WILL TAKE APPROX 30 MINS. AT THIS TIME; FLT ATTENDANT #4 GOT UP FROM HER JUMP SEAT AND WENT TO THE CABIN. I HEARD; OVERHEARD BINS BEING OPENED AND CLOSED. SECONDS AFTER; I HEARD A PAX SCREAMING 'I WANT TO GET OFF THIS PLANE.' HE SHOUTED THIS SEVERAL TIMES. AT THE SAME TIME; FLT ATTENDANT #4 CAME STRAIGHT TO HER JUMP SEAT AND SHE COMMENTED 'WE CAN ARRANGE FOR THAT.' THE PAX STARTED TO GET LOUDER AND THEN SCREAM 'YOU'RE HERE TO SERVE ME.' I HAD JUST GOTTEN UP FROM MY JUMP SEAT TO SEE WHAT WAS THE MATTER WITH THE PAX. I WENT TO HIM AND ASKED HIM TO PLEASE CALM DOWN AND TELL ME WHAT WAS THE MATTER. HE BEGAN SCREAMING THAT HE DIDN'T LIKE FLT ATTENDANT'S #4 ATTITUDE. HE HAD ASKED FOR BLANKETS AND PILLOWS FOR HIS WIFE AND SON WHO WAS SICK AND THE FLT ATTENDANT GAVE HIM THE PILLOW AND BLANKETS; BUT WITH AN ATTITUDE. I TOLD HIM TO PLEASE CALM DOWN; SIT BACK AND PUT ON HIS SEAT BELT. BUT THIS MADE IT WORSE; BECAUSE HE THEN BEGAN SHOUTING AT ME AND TELLING ME TO 'SHUT UP AND GO BACK AND READ YOUR BOOK.' HE CONTINUED TO SHOUT YOU'RE HERE TO SERVE ME. IN THE MEANTIME; HIS WIFE WAS TRYING TO CALM HIM DOWN. I PROCEEDED TO CALL THE PURSER AND THE CAPT. THE PURSER CAME TO THE BACK. WE EXPLAINED THE SIT AND WITH A VERY CALM TONE; SHE ASKED THE PAX TO EXPLAIN WHAT HAPPENED. HE GOT VERY EXCITED AND BEGAN TO SCREAM. SHE ASKED HIM TO PLEASE CALM DOWN AND LISTEN TO HER; BUT THIS DIDN'T WORK. THE CAPT CALLED BACK AND ASKED TO INFORM THE PAX THAT WE WERE RETURNING TO THE GATE; WHERE HE WAS GOING TO BE ARRESTED. THIS DIDN'T CALM HIM DOWN. HE PROCEEDED TO STATE 'I DON'T HAVE A KNIFE. WHY ARE YOU GOING TO ARREST ME?' PAX WAS ESCORTED OUT OF THE PLANE.
column125: B737 PAX BECAME LOUD AND DISRUPTIVE DURING HOLDING FOR TKOF RESULTING IN THE ACFT RETURNING TO THE GATE AND THE PAX ARRESTED AND TAKEN OFF ACFT.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other Security Concern
column121: DURING THE BOARDING OF FLT; EWER-LAX; JUL/SAT/01; FLT ATTENDANT #4 ENTERED THE COCKPIT TO TELL ME THAT AN OLDER GENTLEMAN HAD JUST BOARDED THE ACFT AND APPEARED TO HAVE BEEN DRINKING AND THAT SHE SMELLED ALCOHOL. I ASKED HER IF THE PAX WAS CAUSING ANY PROBS. HER ANSWER WAS 'NO.' I THEN ASKED WHAT THE PAX WAS DOING. HER ANSWER WAS 'SITTING IN HIS SEAT.' JUDGING FROM FLT ATTENDANT'S ANSWER AND THE FACT THAT THE GATE AGENTS ALLOWED THE PAX TO BOARD; I DECIDED TO ALLOW THE PAX TO STAY ON BOARD. APPROX 3 HRS INTO THE FLT; FLT ATTENDANT #4 ENTERED THE COCKPIT TO TELL FO AND ME THAT THE MALE PAX WAS DISTURBING SOME OF THE PAX SEATED NEXT TO HIM. I TOLD FLT ATTENDANT #4 TO KEEP ME UPDATED ON THE SIT. APPROX 30 MINS LATER FLT ATTENDANT #4 ENTERED THE COCKPIT TO TELL ME THAT THE PAX WAS NOW SWEARING AND CONTINUING TO DISTURB SOME OF THE PAX SEATED AROUND HIM. FLT ATTENDANT #4 ASKED IF ONE OF US WOULD COME BACK TO THE CABIN TO TALK TO THE PAX. WHEN FO RETURNED TO THE COCKPIT HE STATED TO ME THAT 'THE PAX WAS ANNOYING SOME OF THE PAX; BUT WE DO NOT HAVE A PROB.' ABOUT 40 MINS LATER FLT ATTENDANT #4 ENTERED THE COCKPIT AND WAS ANGRY AND EMOTIONAL. SHE ASKED IF FO COULD RETURN TO THE CABIN TO TALK TO THE PAX. FO RETURNED TO THE CABIN AND TALKED TO THE PAX. UPON RETURNING TO THE COCKPIT; FO EXPLAINED TO ME THAT HE HAD TALKED TO THE PAX AGAIN AND SAID IN HIS VIEW THE PAX WAS TIRED OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS CONSTANTLY TELLING HIM WHAT HE COULD DO AND WHAT HE COULD NOT DO. FO THEN STATED AGAIN 'THE PAX WAS ANNOYING SOME OF THE PAX; BUT WE DO NOT HAVE A PROB.' SUBSEQUENTLY; FLT ATTENDANT #4 REENTERED THE COCKPIT SEVERAL TIMES TO CHARACTERIZE TO FO AND ME WHAT SHE WAS SAYING AND HOW SHE WAS INTERACTING WITH THE PAX. FLT ATTENDANT WAS NOW EXTREMELY ANGRY AND HIGHLY EMOTIONAL. REPEATEDLY; I DIRECTED FLT ATTENDANT #4 TO CTL HER EMOTIONS AND ANGER BECAUSE SHE WAS EXACERBATING THE SIT. FLT ATTENDANT CHOSE TO IGNORE MY DIRECTION AND CONTINUED HER ANGER AND VINDICTIVE APCH WITH THE PAX. FO AND I THEN DISCUSSED FLT ATTENDANT'S ACTIONS AND CONCLUDED THAT ABSENT FLT ATTENDANT; ANGRY APCH; THE SIT IN THE CABIN WOULD BE MITIGATED. FLT ATTENDANT'S DECISION TO REPEATEDLY IGNORE MY DIRECTION HAD THE POTENTIAL OF ESCALATING THE SIT AND PUTTING THE PAX AND CREW IN DANGER. AFTER MY DISCUSSION WITH FO; I LEFT THE COCKPIT TO GO TO THE LAVATORY. WHEN I EXITED THE FORWARD LAVATORY; FLT ATTENDANT #1 AND SEVERAL OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS WERE STANDING IN THE FIRST CLASS GALLEY. FLT ATTENDANT #4 WALKED UP TO ME; HELD UP HER ARM; POINTED AT MY FACE AND YELLED 'YOU DON'T KNOW WHAT YOU'RE DOING; I'M SORRY TO SAY.' THIS ANGRY OUTBURST IN FRONT OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS AND WITHIN EARSHOT OF THE FIRST CLASS PAX HAD THE NET EFFECT OF ABROGATING MY ABILITY TO MAINTAIN THE RESPECT OF THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS; WHICH WAS MOST NOTICEABLE FOR THE REST OF THE FLT. I DECIDED NOT TO RESPOND TO THE STATEMENT. I ENTERED THE COCKPIT AND BEGAN MAKING PREPARATIONS FOR OUR DSCNT AND LNDG. FLT ATTENDANT #1 ENTERED THE COCKPIT AND REQUESTED A MALE CUSTOMER SVC REPRESENTATIVE TO MEET THE FLT. FO CALLED ACR OPS 3 TIMES TO REQUEST A MALE CUSTOMER SVC REPRESENTATIVE. THE 3RD TIME FO CALLED OPS WAS AT THE GATE WHEN WE NOTICED THERE WAS NO REPRESENTATIVE AT THE GATE TO MEET THE FLT. AFTER ALMOST ALL OF THE PAX WERE DEPLANED; FO AND I TOOK OUR BAGS AND LEFT THE ACFT AND NOTICED THE CUSTOMER SVC REPRESENTATIVE ON THE JET BRIDGE APCHING THE ACFT. FLT X LANDED IN LAX AHEAD OF SCHEDULE AND THE PAX DEPARTED THE ACFT UNEVENTFULLY BEFORE THE CUSTOMER SVC REPRESENTATIVE ARRIVED. 3 DAYS LATER ON JUL/TUE/01; AS I WAS SIGNING IN FOR THE SAME SEQUENCE; LAX CHIEF PLT MET ME IN OPS AND ASKED IF HE COULD SPEAK TO ME. I DISCUSSED THE EVENTS THAT OCCURRED WHICH ARE EXPLAINED ABOVE. DURING OUR DISCUSSION CAPT INDICATED TO ME THAT FLT ATTENDANT HAD COME INTO HIS OFFICE TO TALK ABOUT FLT X. CAPT INDICATED TO ME THAT FLT ATTENDANT STATED THAT OUR PROB PAX HAD MADE A HIJACK THREAT. I TOLD CAPT THAT THIS WAS THE FIRST I HAD HEARD OF AHIJACK THREAT. AFTER MY MEETING WITH CAPT I PROCEEDED TO THE AIRPLANE AND BEGAN PREPARING THE COCKPIT FOR DEP. FLT ATTENDANT #1 WAS ONCE AGAIN THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT. FLT ATTENDANT CAME INTO THE COCKPIT AND BEGAN YELLING AT ME IN FRONT OF MY NEW FO AND WITHIN EARSHOT OF SEVERAL FLT ATTENDANTS STANDING NEAR THE COCKPIT; ABOUT THE FACT THAT ON OUR PREVIOUS FLT FO AND I DID NOT CALL A MALE 'MOD' AS REQUESTED. AFTER FLT ATTENDANT LEFT THE COCKPIT FO STATED TO ME 'I WAS UNCOMFORTABLE WITH THAT. THAT WAS UNCALLED FOR AND UNPROFESSIONAL.' DURING CRUISE; FLT ATTENDANT FELT COMPELLED TO PRIVATELY APOLOGIZE ON 2 SEPARATE OCCASIONS TO FO FOR HER ACTIONS. THIS LACK OF PROFESSIONALISM AND OVERT INSUBORDINATION COMPROMISED MY AUTH AS CAPT AND ABILITY TO EFFECTIVELY COMMUNICATE WITH THE REST OF THE CREW. I AM EXTREMELY APPALLED THAT THE FLT ATTENDANTS COLLECTIVELY DECIDED THAT IT WAS INCONSEQUENTIAL TO TELL FO AND I THAT WE HAD A HIJACK THREAT. THE DECISION NOT TO TELL THE PLTS THAT A HIJACK THREAT WAS MADE RENDERED US UNABLE TO ASSESS THE SEVERITY OF THE SIT. IT IS ACR X'S POLICY TO CONSIDER ALL THREATS TO BE SERIOUS. THIS CLRLY PUT THE PAX AND CREW IN DANGER AND ALSO FALLS INTO THE CATEGORY OF CRIMINAL NEGLIGENCE. ALSO; FLT ATTENDANT #1'S DEMAND FOR A 'MALE CUSTOMER SVC REPRESENTATIVE' TO MEET THE ACFT; FLT ATTENDANT #1 CONTENDS SHE REQUESTED AN 'MOD;' WAS APPARENTLY HER INJUDICIOUS SOLUTION TO A HIJACK THREAT THAT WAS PRIVILEGED INFO OF ONLY THE FLT ATTENDANTS. I AM REQUESTING A FORMAL WRITTEN RESPONSE REGARDING THIS MATTER.
column125: A PAX WHO APPEARED TO HAVE BEEN DRINKING WAS BOARDED. ENRTE HE CAUSED DIFFICULTY WITH OTHER PAX AND CABIN CREW. INTERACTION BTWN CABIN AND COCKPIT CREW DID NOT GO SMOOTHLY. AN APPARENT HIJACK THREAT WAS NOT COMMUNICATED TO THE CAPT.

column107: Flight Attendant Airline Total 13; Flight Attendant Total 13; Flight Attendant Type 100
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other ALCOHOL INDUCED
column121: ABOUT 1 HR AFTER TKOF; PAX SEATED IN COACH WENT FORWARD TO USE THE BUSINESS CLASS LAVATORY; HASSLED A FLT ATTENDANT IN BUSINESS CLASS. WHEN SHE TOLD HIM MEAL CARTS WERE IN THE WAY; HE DEMANDED TO SEE THE CAPT -- GOT VERY RUDE AND ARGUMENTATIVE. THE PURSER WENT BACK TO SPEAK WITH HIM -- NOTICED THE SMELL OF ALCOHOL ON HIS BREATH. DECIDED TO TRY TO CUT OFF OR LESSEN HIS ALCOHOL INTAKE. HE DEMANDED MORE ALCOHOL. WENT FROM COACH GALLEY TO BUSINESS GALLEY AND BACK AND FORTH YELLING AT THE FLT ATTENDANTS; DEMANDING ALCOHOL DURING SOME TURB. WHEN THE SEATBELT SIGN CAME ON; HE REFUSED TO SIT DOWN. NEVER DID SIT DOWN -- PROCEEDED TO GET MORE AND MORE BELLIGERENT AS FLT WENT ON. HE MADE ODD STATEMENTS. FOR EXAMPLE: THAT HE WAS THE HEAD OF FBI; THEN THAT HE WAS IN THE WITNESS PROTECTION PROGRAM -- USED LOTS OF PROFANITY TOWARD THE FLT ATTENDANTS. EVENTUALLY THREATENED TO 'KICK ANOTHER PAX'S ASS' AND TOLD A FLT ATTENDANT THAT HE WOULD 'BREAK HER NECK.' AT THIS POINT; WE DECIDED TO LAND AND HAVE HIM REMOVED. WE DIVERTED TO IAD TO DO THIS. THE PURSER WANTED TO TRY TO MAKE IT TO JFK BECAUSE HE (THE MAN) WAS TRAVELING WITH HIS 10 YR OLD SON AND THOUGHT IT WOULD BE BETTER TO GET THE SON TO NEW YORK; BUT THIS MAN WAS JUST SO UNBEARABLE. THEY WERE ESCORTED OFF THE ACFT BY POLICE IN IAD. WE THEN WENT ON TO JFK. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 522694: PAX GOT ON PLANE; ORDERED 2 DRINKS. HE WAS ON AN ANTIDEPRESSANT AND WOULDN'T STAY SEATED WHEN SEATBELT SIGN ON. APPEARED DRUNK. WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO FLT ATTENDANTS WITH LANGUAGE AND THREATENING PAX AND FLC.
column125: A B767-300 CREW ON A FLT FROM LAX TO JFK DIVERTED TO IAD DUE TO AN UNRULY PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 40; Flight Attendant Total 40; Flight Attendant Type 10
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: AFTER THE DINNER SVC IN B1C HAD CONCLUDED AND THE LIGHTS WERE OFF; I HEARD A DISTURBANCE AND LEFT THE FIRST CLASS CABIN TO SEE WHAT WAS HAPPENING. A MAN; WHO HAD BEEN SEATED IN THE 1ST ROW OF BC BY THE WINDOW; WAS STANDING UP WALKING AROUND AND SHOUTING AT ALL CREW MEMBERS HE COULD SEE. HE HAD COME FROM A CONNECTING FLT. HE DID NOT APPEAR TO HAVE HAD TOO MUCH ALCOHOL. HIS LOUD VOICE WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO ANY FLT ATTENDANT HE ENCOUNTERED. WE DECIDED THAT NO MORE THAN 2 FLT ATTENDANTS SHOULD TRY AND DEAL WITH HIM AT ONE TIME TO AVOID HIS FEELING OF BEING OVERWHELMED. HE COMPLAINED OF BEING COLD OF BEING MISTRUSTED. HE WAS OFFERED HIS CHOICE OF SEATS; AS THERE WERE ONLY 10 PAX. HE WAS OFFERED ADDITIONAL BLANKETS. NOTHING WOULD HELP BUT TO GO TO FIRST CLASS. THE IRO CAME BACK TO SPEAK TO HIM AND HE WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO HIM AS WELL. FROM TIME TO TIME; I WOULD LEAVE AND LET ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT TAKE OVER. DURING THAT TIME; THE SEAT BELT SIGN CAME ON AND HE WAS ASKED TO TAKE A SEAT. HE REFUSED SAYING EVERYONE WAS TREATING HIM BADLY. I CAME BACK TO BUSINESS CLASS AND SAT NEXT TO HIM THOUGH HE REFUSED TO USE HIS SEAT BELT. LATER; HE MADE A FIST AND WITH A TWISTING MOTION AIMED IT AT MY STOMACH AS THOUGH HE WISHED TO STAB ME. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE FLT ATTENDANT STATED THAT THE INDIVIDUAL WAS LATER IDENTIFIED AS A 'VIP DOCTOR' THAT APPEARED TO HAVE A LOW REGARD FOR WOMEN. HE HAD BEEN SERVED TWO GLASSES OF WINE AND WAS INSISTING UPON BEING SEATED IN FIRST CLASS; WHICH WAS EMPTY. THE FLT WS NEARLY EMPTY WITH ONLY 10 PAX IN BUSINESS CLASS AND THIRTY IN COACH. WHEN ASKED TO SIT DOWN BY THE FLT ATTENDANT WHEN THE SEAT BELT SIGN WAS ON HE SAID THAT; ' HE DIDN'T' HAVE TO LISTEN TO ANY STUPID WOMEN THAT DIDN'T KNOW WHAT THEY WERE TALKING ABOUT.' AFTER THE IRO CAME BACK TO SPEAK WITH HIM. THE IRO HAD TOLD HIM THAT THE FLT WOULD DIVERT AND DROP HIM OFF SHORT OF HIS DEST ARPT IF HE DIDN'T' STOP THIS BEHAVIOR. SINCE HE WAS BEING MET AT THE ARPT BY FRIENDS; HE APPEARED TO SETTLE DOWN SOMEWHAT. CREW ASKED FOR POLICE TO MEET THE FLT. WHEN AT THE DEST ARPT; PARKED AT THE HARD STAND; THE MAN REFUSED TO GET OFF WITH THE OTHER PAX. LATER; HE WAS BUSSED TO THE TERMINAL WITH THE CREW AFTER HAVING A RUN IN WITH THE CAPT. HE HAD ASKED FOR ALL OF THE CREW MEMBERS NAMES; INCLUDING THE CAPT'S. WHEN HE WAS TOLD THE CAPT'S NAME (WHICH WAS EXACTLY THE SAME AS A FAMOUS PERSON) HE FLEW INTO A RAGE AND FELT HE WAS BEING TOYED WITH. POLICE MET THE PAX AT THE TERMINAL. CAPT DID NOT PREFER TO PRESS CHARGES BUT ASKED OPS IN THE U.S. TO NOT ALLOW THIS PAX TO FLY ON COMPANY ACFT; IN FACT; 'NOT ON ANY ACFT.' COMPANY DISAPPROVED THAT REQUEST BUT WOULD 'MONITOR HIM.'
column125: A FLT ATTENDANT REPORT ON AN ABUSIVE PAX THAT FELT HE WAS BEING MISTREATED BY THE AIRLINE PERSONNEL ON A B767-300 ENROUTE TO SAN PAULO; SBGR; FO.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 6; Flight Attendant Total 6; Flight Attendant Type 5
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Illness / Injury; Inflight Event / Encounter Weather / Turbulence; Other Food Svc Prob; Other Theft
column119: Company Policy; Weather; Human Factors; Environment - Non Weather Related
column121: THIS FLT WAS DIVERTED FROM MEX TO ACA. APPROX; ONE AND A HALF HRS AFTER ARRIVAL A PAX REQUIRED MEDICAL ATTENTION DUE TO DIZZINESS. FLT ATTENDANT #2 AND #7 PAGED FOR PHYSICIAN AND OBTAINED OXYGEN. 3 DOCTORS RESPONDED AND REQUESTED A FLASHLIGHT TO CHECK HER PUPILS. I WAS OBTAINING MY PERSONAL FLASHLIGHT WHEN ANOTHER PAX RIPPED THE FLASHLIGHT FROM THE WALL AT DOOR. AN AMBULANCE CAME AND PAX WAS REMOVED. AN HOUR AFTER THAT; WE WERE FINALLY ABLE TO DEPLANE OUR PAX. GND SVCS ASSISTED OUR PAX. DURING THE DEPLANING PROCESS WHICH TOOK SOME TIME DUE TO THE NECESSITY OF USING BUSSES AND PAX NEED TO CLEAR CUSTOMS; FLT ATTENDANT #2 NOTICED THAT ANOTHER FLASHLIGHT HAD ALSO BEEN RIPPED FROM THE WALL. UNLIKE THE OTHER FLASHLIGHT WHICH WAS RETURNED IMMEDIATELY THE #2 HAD TO PAGE TO ASK FOR ITS RETURN. IT WAS SURRENDERED AT THAT TIME. BEFORE THE CREW DEPLANED; FLT ATTENDANT #2 ALSO NOTICED THAT THE PIN FROM THE HALON LOCATED BEHIND THE LAST ROW OF SEATS IN MAIN CABIN ON ACFT RIGHT WAS MISSING. THIS WAS NEVER FOUND OR RETURNED. THE FOLLOWING DAY ARPT SECURITY DISCOVERED OXYGEN CARTRIDGES (PAX LIFEVEST) WITH PAX CARRY ON BAGGAGE. LIFEVEST WERE REQUESTED FROM PAX (BY CREW) INVOLVED AND ALL THREE WERE RETURNED. THE LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS IN MEX MET THE FLT AND REMOVED THE PAX WHO HAD TAKEN THE EQUIP. THIS WAS A TEN HOUR ORDEAL FOR OUR PAX. FOUR OF THESE HOURS WERE SPENT FLYING; THE REMAINING HOURS WERE CHAOTIC FOR EVERYONE. THE ACFT WAS HOT; OUR SUPPLIES WERE LOW; LITTLE ICE AND NO FOOD OTHER THAN SNACK BARS; AND OUR PAX WERE CLOSE TO RIOTING. ADDITIONAL CABIN CREW WOULD HAVE HELPED WITH CROWD CTL AND A FASTER DEPLANING PROCESS WOULD HAVE HELPED EVERYONE. CABIN CREW WAS ON DUTY FOR 17.30 HRS.
column125: A FLT ATTENDANT REPORT ON LOSS OF CTL OF THE PAX ON BOARD A DIVERTED AIRLINER SITTING ON THE RAMP AT MMAA; FO.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 29; Flight Attendant Total 29; Flight Attendant Type 100
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other PAX IGNORED SEAT BELT SIGN
column121: I WAS PURSER ON THE FLT INVOLVED. I HAD NO PROB WITH THE PAX (FIRST CLASS) IN QUESTION; BUT SHE DID GET UP TWICE DURING MEAL SVC AND MADE HER WAY TO THE MAIN CABIN; UPSETTING THE SVC IN BUSINESS CLASS AND MAIN CABIN. SHE DISREGARDED THE SEAT BELT SIGN. PERSONALLY; WITH A BIT MORE TACT AND AN AWARENESS OF CULTURAL DIFFERENCES; THIS RPT COULD HAVE BEEN AVOIDED. I WOULD ANTICIPATE NO FURTHER PROBS WITH PAX.
column125: B767-300 PURSER HAD A PAX THAT IGNORED THE SEAT BELT SIGN.

column121: PAX X WAS ERRATIC AND VIOLENT. HE APPEARED INTOXICATED; SO I CUT OFF ALL ALCOHOL AT ABOUT 1 HR 45 MINS OUT OF LAX. MR X SEEMED TO BE GETTING WORSE NOT BETTER. WE LEARNED FROM HIS 10 YR OLD SON THAT HE HAD TAKEN PAXAL(?) ANTIDEPRESSANT. ALSO FROM OTHER PAX HE TOLD THEM HE WAS ON SLEEPING PILLS AND WAS A DRUG DEALER. TRIED TO REASON WITH HIM; BUT HE WAS TOO UNSTABLE. WE LET THE SIT GO ON FOR FEAR OF UPSETTING HIS SON. MR X HOWEVER PUSHED A FEMALE PAX SITTING BEHIND HIM. HE ALSO THREATENED TO BREAK THE '*!#! NECK' OF THE #10 FLT ATTENDANT. THE CAPT AND I DECIDED AT THIS TIME TO MAKE A LNDG IN IAD TO HAVE MR X REMOVED.
column125: B767-300 PAX THREATENED A FLT ATTENDANT AND ASSAULTED ANOTHER PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12; Flight Attendant Total 12; Flight Attendant Type 70
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Inflight Event / Encounter Weather / Turbulence; Other Aisle Blockage
column121: DURING BOARDING; THE WOMAN SITTING IN XXX STARTED TAKING PILLOWS AND BLANKETS OFF OF OTHER PEOPLE'S SEAT. AS I STARTED TO COLLECT THEM; SHE GRABBED THEM FROM MY HAND AND YELLED AT ME THEY WERE HERS. I EXPLAINED THERE WAS 1 PILLOW AND 1 BLANKET FOR EACH SEAT. SHE DID NOT LIKE THAT AND THREW THEM AT ME. HER HUSBAND THEN WALKED BACK TO APOLOGIZE FOR HER BEHAVIOR. THIS WAS BEFORE TKOF. THEN AFTER TKOF; SHE DRANK MANY ICE TEAS WITH EQUAL AND VODKA. SHE THEN BLEW UP AN AIR MATTRESS AND PROCEEDED TO LAY ACROSS THE XXX-CEG FLOOR WITH HER HEAD HANGING OUT ONE SIDE AND HER FEET OUT THE OTHER. THE SEATBELT SIGN WAS ON AND SHE REFUSED TO SIT IN HER SEAT WITH THE SEATBELT. SHE ALSO MADE US STEP OVER HER ON BOTH SIDES OF THE AISLE AND PAX HAD TO DO THE SAME. WE ALSO HAD SEVERAL WITNESSES OF HER UNUSUAL BEHAVIOR.
column125: A B767-300 FLT ATTENDANT RPT ON A PAX THAT WAS HOSTILE BEFORE AND AFTER CONSUMING LARGE AMOUNTS OF VODKA IN ICED TEA ON A FLT TO SJC; CA.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 8; Flight Attendant Total 8; Flight Attendant Type 80
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other Inappropiate Pax Behavior
column121: FEMALE PAX APCHED ME IN THE GALLEY WITH A HAND WRITTEN NOTE STATING THAT THE MAN NEXT TO HER WAS MASTURBATING DURING TKOF. SHE MOVED SEATS. SHE WAS VERY SHAKEN UP AND UPSET ABOUT THIS BECAUSE THERE WERE CHILDREN ACROSS FROM WHERE THEY WERE SITTING. I ASKED HER IF HE HAD EXPOSED HIMSELF AND SHE SAID 'NO;' THAT IT WAS UNDERNEATH A BLANKET THAT SHE SAW THE MOTIONS. I NOTIFIED THE CAPT OF THE SIT. THE WOMAN SAID THAT SHE WANTED THE MAN ARRESTED. AFTER TALKING TO THE CAPT; I NOTIFIED THE WOMAN THAT WE COULD NOT HAVE HIM ARRESTED; THAT SHE WOULD HAVE TO PURSUE IT ON HER OWN. SHE REQUESTED THE POLICE TO MEET THE FLT AND THEY DID.
column125: F100 PAX OBSERVED ANOTHER PAX MISCONDUCT.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 2; Flight Attendant Total 2; Flight Attendant Type 55
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other Dog Carrier Boarded; Too Large To Fit Under Seat. Pax Let Dog Out Of Carrier.
column121: A VERY LARGE (HARD) DOG CARRIER WAS BOARDED AND WAS NOT NOTICED UNTIL AFTER PUSHBACK; WHEN I SPOTTED IT DURING MY SAFETY DEMO. I IMMEDIATELY ADVISED THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT; WHO IN TURN ADVISED THE CAPT. WE WERE TOLD TO PUT THE DOG AND DOG CARRIER IN AFT LAVATORY; WHICH WE DID. AFTER IN THE AIR; THE PAX IMMEDIATELY WENT BACK TO THE LAVATORY WHERE THEY TOOK THE DOG OUT OF THE CARRIER AND HELD ON LAP. THEY WOULD NOT PUT DOG BACK IN CARRIER OR RETURN TO THEIR SEATS TO FASTEN THEIR SEATBELTS. THE MAN SCREAMED AT US IN RUSSIAN USING ALL KINDS OF HAND GESTURES. AFTER THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT AND COPLT TRIED TIME AND AGAIN TO GET THEM TO ABIDE (COMPLY); THE CAPT LET THEM TAKE AN EMPTY PAX SEAT IN BACK WITH THE CARRIER NEXT TO THEM; STRAPPED IN THE SEAT. THEY WERE GOOD ABOUT LEAVING THE DOG IN THE CARRIER AT THIS TIME; BUT AS SOON AS WE TOUCHED DOWN; OUT THE DOG CAME ONCE AGAIN. IT IS MY OPINION THE DOG CARRIER SHOULD NEVER HAVE BEEN BOARDED IN THE FIRST PLACE. HOW WE MISSED IT COMING ON I DON'T KNOW. I FEEL WE SHOULD HAVE RETURNED TO THE GATE AND DISEMBARKED PAX AND DOG. THESE PEOPLE COULD HAVE CARED LESS ABOUT ANY OF OUR RULES. HOWEVER; ONCE IN THE AIR; I DIDN'T FEEL AN EMER LNDG WAS NECESSARY; EVEN THOUGH THE CARRIER WAS NOT FAA PROPERLY STOWED.
column125: MD80 FLT ATTENDANT SAW A DOG KENNEL THAT WAS TOO BIG TO FIT UNDER THE PAX SEAT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 1.5; Flight Attendant Total 1.5; Flight Attendant Type 40
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX IN QUESTION HAD BEEN VERY CONCERNED FOR THE ENTIRE FLT ABOUT MAKING HER CONNECTION IN DALLAS. THE CAPT OFFERED TO GO SPEAK WITH HER. SHE SEEMED AT EASE AFTER SPEAKING WITH THE CAPT. (WE HAD TAKEN A DELAY IN DCA DUE TO A MECHANICAL AND SHE WAS VERY UPSET BY THIS.) AT THE END OF THE FLT THE CAPT MADE HIS 'PREPARE FOR LNDG' PUBLIC ADDRESS. THE PAX CALLED ME OVER AND SAID THE CAPT HAD PROMISED HER AN UPDATE AS WE GOT CLOSER. I EXPLAINED TO HER THAT I HAD JUST SPOKEN WITH THE CAPT AND HE DIDN'T OFFER ANY ADDITIONAL INFO AS TO HER CONNECTION. SHE WANTED ME TO GO AND 'GET ANSWERS' FOR HER. I EXPLAINED TO HER THAT WE WERE IN A CRITICAL STAGE IN OUR FLT AND WE WERE NOT ALLOWED IN THE COCKPIT EXCEPT FOR EXTREME EMERS. I ALSO TOLD HER THAT ONCE WE HAD LANDED SAFELY ON THE GND I WOULD DOUBLE CHK WITH THE CAPT TO BE SURE HE DIDN'T HAVE ANY ADDITIONAL INFO FOR HER. SHE DIDN'T RESPOND TO ME SO I ASSUMED SHE WAS OKAY WITH THIS AND I WENT TO MY JUMP SEAT. A FEW MINS LATER SHE CAME UP TO THE FORWARD PART OF THE CABIN AND DEMANDED INFO AND REFUSED TO TAKE HER SEAT UNTIL SHE GOT SOME. AT THIS POINT; I CALLED THE CAPT AND TOLD HIM OF MY SIT. HE TOLD ME TO TELL HER TO SIT DOWN. I DID AND SHE REFUSED -- CROSSING HER ARMS LIKE A CHILD PITCHING A TEMPER TANTRUM. AFTER SEVERAL ATTEMPTS; I TOLD HER THE CAPT WILL NOT LAND THIS PLANE WITH YOU STANDING SO IF YOU DON'T SIT DOWN HE'S GOING BACK UP. SEVERAL PAX IN FIRST CLASS HEARD THIS AND WERE CONCERNED WITH MAKING THEIR OWN CONNECTIONS AND STARTED YELLING AT HER TO SIT DOWN. SHE REACHED FOR THE PHONE WANTING TO SPEAK TO THE CAPT. AT THIS POINT; THE CAPT HAD ALREADY HUNG UP ON ME AND THE PLANE BEGAN ITS ASCENT BACK UP. I VERY STERNLY TOLD THE PAX 'YOU HAVE NOW CAUSED US TO HAVE TO GO BACK UP AND GET BACK IN LINE. THE CAPT IS NOT GOING TO SPEAK WITH YOU. I WOULD SUGGEST YOU TAKE YOUR SEAT.' WHICH SHE DID FINALLY. THE CAPT CALLED AFTER WE WERE BACK UP TO MAKE SURE EVERYTHING WAS OKAY AND SHE WAS SEATED. UPON LNDG AND ONCE WE PARKED AT THE GATE; THE CAPT CAME OUT OF THE COCKPIT AND PULLED THE PAX ASIDE. WHEN THE DOOR OPENED THERE WERE 4 UNIFORMED OFFICERS WAITING FOR HER FOR QUESTIONING.
column125: PAX MISCONDUCT RESULTS IN ARPT AUTHORITIES QUESTIONING PAX ACTION UPON ARRIVAL.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column95: Flight Crew Multiengine; Flight Crew Instrument; Flight Crew Commercial
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: LOCATION; ON THE RAMP AT IND; TAXI PRE-TKOF. DURING BOARDING A GENTLEMAN STOPPED BY THE COCKPIT TO INTRODUCE HIMSELF. HE STATED THAT HE WAS AN INSPECTOR WITH THE DEPT OF TRANSPORTATION BUT WAS TRAVELING ON A PURCHASED TICKET. AFTER RECEIVING THE CABIN READY RPT FROM THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT WE PUSHED OFF THE GATE AND COMPLETED WHAT WE THOUGHT WAS AN UNEVENTFUL FLT TO DFW. UPON REACHING THE GATE; THE INSPECTOR PULLED OUR #1 FLT ATTENDANT ASIDE AND THEN ENTERED THE COCKPIT TO INFORM US THAT HE HAD OBSERVED SEVERAL VIOLATIONS TO THE FAR'S. HE STATED THAT HE WAS NOT A LICENSED INSPECTOR; BUT ONE WHO WAS IN TRAINING AND THEREFORE COULDN'T PURSUE THE VIOLATIONS. UPON INVESTIGATION WE DETERMINED THAT AFTER WE HAD STARTED OUR PUSH THE FLT ATTENDANTS DISCOVERED A MAN WITH A HVY BAG THAT HADN'T BEEN PROPERLY STOWED. DURING OUR PUSH HE APPARENTLY GOT UP AND WALKED UP THE AISLE TO STOW HIS BAG. WE WERE NEVER INFORMED OF THIS UNTIL AFTER THE FLT.
column125: AN FAA INSPECTOR IN TRAINING ADVISES AN ACR CREW AFTER THE FLT THAT HE OBSERVED SEVERAL VIOLATIONS THAT WOULD NOT BE PURSUED. ONE INCLUDED A PAX OUT OF HIS SEAT DURING TAXI.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Inflight Event / Encounter Weather / Turbulence
column118: Flight Crew Returned To Clearance; General Physical Injury / Incapacitation
column121: I WAS JUST COMING OFF CREW REST BREAK FOLLOWING A SEAT BELT ANNOUNCEMENT WHILE THE CREW WAS CIRCUMNAVING WX IN THE TOPS. WE HIT ONE UNEXPECTED JOLT WHICH THREW ME BACK OVER A FOOT AND LANDED HARD ON MY HEELS; LEGS LOCKED. SEVERAL PAX AND FLT ATTENDANTS WERE KNOCKED TO THE FLOOR. THE FLT ATTENDANTS WERE CHKING PAX FOR SEAT BELTS; AND APPARENTLY SEVERAL PAX WERE WAITING FOR THE LAVATORIES; EVEN THOUGH THEY HAD BEEN ADVISED TO RETURN TO THEIR SEATS. I AND SEVERAL OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS SUSTAINED MINOR INJURIES AND MET WITH A DOCTOR FOR A BRIEF CHK-UP AFTER ARR IN LONDON AT THE LAYOVER HOTEL. EVERYONE WAS ABLE TO WORK THEIR RETURN TRIPS. I HAVE HAD SOME MINOR NECK AND LOWER BACK DISCOMFORT AS A RESULT. I WAS STANDING IN THE L FIRST CLASS LAVATORY AT THE TIME. A PAX SVC MGR WAS REQUESTED TO MEET THE FLT ON ARR; BUT APPARENTLY THERE WERE NO RPTED PAX INJURIES DURING OR AFTER THE FLT TO MY KNOWLEDGE.
column125: A RELIEF PLT WHO WAS IN THE PAX CABIN ON AN ATLANTIC XING FLT RECOUNTS A TURB ENCOUNTER DURING CRUISE. MINOR INJURIES WERE SUSTAINED.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 35; Flight Attendant Total 35; Flight Attendant Type 60
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: ON PUSH BACK FROM GATE (ZZZ); FA #6 CALLED FROM JUMPSEAT AND SAID DEPORTEE WAS SCREAMING; RUNNING UP THE AISLE WITH HIS ARM BLEEDING.  I INFORMED COCKPIT AND WENT TO THE BACK CABIN.  I MADE PA TO DISARM ALL EXITS AND TOLD COCKPIT WE NEED HELP IN CABIN NOW.  PLTS KNOCKED PAX TO FLOOR AT SEAT XYZ; HANDCUFFED PAX; AND AUTHORITIES TOOK OVER. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE FA WAS THE CHIEF PURSER ON THE FLT. SHE STATED THAT TWO INS AGENTS ESCORTED THE DEPORTEE ONTO THE FLT. THEY INSISTED THAT SHE TAKE THE DEPORTEE PAPERWORK AND PASSPORT TO GIVE TO THE OFFICIALS AT THE FOREIGN ARPT. SHE ASKED THE AGENTS IF THE DEPORTEE HAD BEEN PAT DOWN SEARCHED; IF HE HAD BEEN THROUGH A METAL DETECTOR; AND IF HE WAS DANGEROUS. THE INS AGENTS SAID THAT HE HAD BEEN PAT DOWN SEARCHED; HAD BEEN THROUGH A METAL DETECTOR; AND WAS NOT DANGEROUS. THE AGENTS STAYED AT THE ACFT BOARDING DOOR UNTIL THE ACFT DOOR WAS CLOSED AND THE ACFT PUSHED BACK FROM THE GATE. AT THAT POINT; THEY DISAPPEARED. WHEN THE DEPORTEE WAS ON THE ACFT; HE BEGAN TO WALK THROUGH THE CABIN AND STARTED TO GO THROUGH THE OVERHEAD BINS. THE PURSER THOUGHT HE WAS TRYING TO FIND PURSES WITH MONEY THAT COULD BE STOLEN. THE PURSER THEN TOLD THE DEPORTEE THAT HE MUST TAKE HIS SEAT. AFTER PUSHBACK THE DEPORTEE WAS SEEN RUNNING FROM THE LAVATORY BLEEDING PROFUSELY. THREE FA'S ATTEMPTED TO STOP HIM AND WERE UNSUCCESSFUL. ONLY WHEN ASSISTED BY THE TWO RELIEF PLTS WERE THEY ABLE TO SUBDUE THE DEPORTEE. THE CAPT RETURNED TO THE GATE WITH LAW ENFORCEMENT MEETING THE FLT. AT THIS TIME; THE PURSER WAS INFORMED THAT THE DEPORTEE HAD ARRIVED THE DAY BEFORE FROM A FOREIGN LOCATION AND WAS BEING RETURNED THERE BECAUSE HE HAD A FORGED PASSPORT. WHEN THE ACFT WAS SEARCHED; A 'BOX CUTTER' WAS FOUND IN THE LAVATORY TRASH BIN WITH BLOOD ALL OVER IT.
column125: B777-200 CREW HAD AN INVOLUNTARILY BOARDED PAX WHO WAS BEING DEPORTED. PAX CUT HIS WRIST WITH A 'BOX CUTTER' THAT HE APPARENTLY CARRIED ABOARD THE ACFT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 2; Flight Attendant Total 2.25; Flight Attendant Type 10
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Smoke / Fire / Fumes / Odor; Other PAX AGGRESSION
column116: Automation Aircraft Other Automation; Person Flight Crew
column121: I WAS WORKING IN THE FIRST CLASS GALLEY WITH THE OTHER FIRST CLASS FLIGHT ATTENDANT WHEN ONE OF THE MAIN CABIN FLT ATTENDANTS CAME FORWARD AND INFORMED US THAT A PAX WAS SMOKING IN THE LAV AND THAT HE HAD ALSO ASSAULTED HIS GIRLFRIEND. SHE THEN WENT INTO THE COCKPIT TO NOTIFY THE CAPT. WHEN SHE CAME OUT; WE ASKED IF THERE WAS ANYTHING WE COULD DO. SHE SAID AT THE TIME THE SITUATION WAS UNDER CTL. APPROXIMATELY 45 MINUTES LATER AS I WAS CONDUCTING ANOTHER SAFETY CHECK; THE PAX IN QUESTION ASKED IF HE COULD SPEAK TO SOMEONE IN CHARGE. WHEN I EXPLAINED THAT WE ALL WORKED TOGETHER HE THEN ASKED TO SPEAK TO 'ONE OF THE BLONDE LADIES' (FLT ATTENDANTS IN MAIN CABIN). ONE OF THEM CAME FORWARD TO SPEAK TO HIM. A FEW MINUTES HAD PASSED AND THEY HAD MOVED TO THE FRONT OF THE MAIN CABIN. I HAD RETURNED TO FIRST CLASS; BUT WHEN I NOTICED THEY HAD MOVED TO THE MAIN CABIN DIVIDER; I WENT TO SEE IF I COULD ASSIST. THEY SPOKE FOR SEVERAL MINUTES AND THE FLT ATTENDANT ADVISED THE PAX HE NEEDED TO RETURN TO HIS SEAT; SEVERAL TIMES. WHEN HE DID NOT COMPLY; I ADVISED HIM IT WAS HIS OPTION TO RETURN TO HIS SEAT OR BE IN VIOLATION OF ANOTHER FEDERAL AVIATION REGULATION AND THAT I WOULD BE OBLIGATED TO NOTIFY THE CAPT. HE VERY QUICKLY RETURNED TO HIS SEAT. THROUGH THE REMAINDER OF THE FLIGHT HE WAS SERVED SEVERAL GLASSES OF WATER AND REMAINED IN HIS SEAT. AS I WAS NOT WITNESS TO THE SMOKING OR THE ASSAULT OR THE EVENTS LEADING UP TO SUCH; IT IS DIFFICULT FOR ME TO IDENTIFY CONTRIBUTING FACTORS. I DO; HOWEVER; FEEL STRONGLY THAT ALCOHOL CONSUMPTION SHOULD NOT BE PERMITTED IN FLIGHT; AND THAT AIRLINES SHOULD NOT SELL ALCOHOL ON BOARD. IT IS MY SINCERE HOPE THAT THIS INDIVIDUAL IS PENALIZED FOR JEOPARDIZING PAX AND CREW.
column125: A FLT ATTENDANT REPORT ON A SMOKING PAX THAT HAD ASSAULTED HIS GIRLFRIEND AND REFUSED TO TAKE HIS SEAT WHEN ON A FLT TO BOS; MA.

column121: I WAS PLUCKING TICKETS AND AS I GAVE THE PAX BACK HIS BOARDING PASS HE SAID SOMETHING TO ME AND I SMELLED ALCOHOL ON HIM. I WATCHED AS HE STAGGERED DOWN THE JET BRIDGE. I WENT AFTER HIM AND MET THE CAPTAIN COMING UP THE JET BRIDGE. HE WITNESSED WHAT WAS GOING ON AND CALLED THE SUPERVISOR. SUPVR CAME DOWN TO TALK TO PAX. PAX WOULDN'T LEAVE. THE LOCAL POLICE WERE CALLED. PAX STILL WOULDN'T LEAVE. FBI CAME AND PAX WENT WILLINGLY. I DON'T KNOW HOW THIS PAX MADE IT SO FAR TO THE GATE WITHOUT ANYONE SEEING HIS CONDITION. HE WAS ISSUED A BOARDING PASS AND WENT THRU SECURITY. PEOPLE NEED TO BE MORE ALERT.
column125: A FLT ATTENDANT REPORT ON REMOVING AN INTOXICATED PAX FROM THE ACFT THAT HAD MADE IT AS FAR AS THE JETWAY AT MCO; FL.

column121: FIRST CLASS PAX MR X ASSIGNED TO SEAT XY SLEPT ON THE FLOOR OF SEATS ZY. HE WAS TOLD COURTEOUSLY TO RETURN TO HIS SEAT; WHICH HE DID; BUT NOT WITHOUT USING VULGAR LANGUAGE IN THE PRESENCE OF CREW AND PASSENGERS. CAPT WAS INFORMED OF HIS BEHAVIOR. MINUTES LATER; MR X ENTERED THE FIRST CLASS LAVATORY; SMELLED THE CIGARETTE SMOKE; AND INFORMED THE FIRST FA. THE FIRST FA INFORMED THE CAPT; WHO AUTHORIZED THE ISSUANCE OF THE MISCONDUCT FORM. THE FAA NEEDS TO SPECIFY THAT VULGAR LANGUAGE TOWARDS CABIN CREW IS A FAR VIOLATION. MR X IS NOW SUING THE COMPANY. HE SHOULD NOT BE ALLOWED TO FLY ON ANY ACFT.
column125: A B737 FA RPT ON A MISBEHAVING PAX THAT MAY HAVE TAMPERED WITH THE SMOKE DETECTOR IN THE FIRST CLASS LAVATORY ON A FLT TO BOS; MA.

column121: WE WERE IN THE CLOUDS AND ON A VECTOR FROM CHICAGO APCH CTLR TO JOIN THE LOCALIZER FOR RWY 22L AT ORD. BOTH NAV RADIOS HAD BEEN TUNED TO 110.1 AND THE IDENTIFIER (ILQQ) HAD BEEN RECEIVED. AS WE WERE FLYING TOWARD THE COURSE; BOTH THE CAPT'S AND FO'S CDI'S BEGAN TO WAVER BETWEEN FULL SCALE AND 'FLY RIGHT' AND FULL SCALE 'FLY LEFT' INDICATIONS. OUR DISPLAYS ALSO SHOWED INTERMITTENT LOC AND GS RED FLAGS. WE WANTED TO QUERY ATC ABOUT THE INTEGRITY OF THE 22L LOC; BUT THE CTLR WAS TALKING NON-STOP AND WE COULD NOT GET HIS ATTENTION. I WAS CONSIDERING EXECUTING A MISSED APCH WHEN THE CTLR CALLED AND ASKED US IF WE WERE RECEIVING THE LOCALIZER. WE ANSWERED THAT OUR CDI'S WERE WAVERING. THE CTLR BROKE US OFF THE APCH AND GAVE US VECTORS AROUND FOR A SECOND APCH. THE SECOND APCH TO RWY 22L WAS UNEVENTFUL AND ALL INDICATIONS WERE NORMAL. AFTER DEPLANING THE PAX AT THE GATE; WE DISCUSSED WHAT HAD HAPPENED WITH THE FLT ATTENDANT. THE FLT ATTENDANT STATED THAT; DURING HER FINAL WALK THROUGH THE CABIN BEFORE LANDING; SHE HAD TO ASK A PAX TO TURN OFF A CELL PHONE THAT HE WAS USING. BY MY ESTIMATION; THE TIME THAT THE FLT ATTENDANT SAID SHE SAW THE PAX USING HIS CELL PHONE CORRELATES APPROX TO THE TIME WE WERE RECEIVING THE FAULTY LOCALIZER COURSE INDICATIONS DURING THE FIRST APCH.
column125: CL65 CREW HAD ERRATIC LOC AND GS POSSIBLY CAUSED BY PAX CELL PHONE USE.

column121: PAX X WAS PRE BOARDED TO FIRST CLASS ON FLT AT GATE IN PHX BY WHEEL CHAIR AND STRAIGHT BACK DUE TO THE NATURE OF HIS HANDICAP. AT ONE POINT BEFORE ANY OTHER PAX WERE BOARDED; HE WAS WITNESSED SAYING 'I WOULD KIKE TO SHOOT YOU' BY FO AND FLT ATTENDANT. AS FLT ATTENDANT WAS SERVING; PAX X; HE AGAIN SAID 'I WOULD LIKE TO SHOOT YOU.' I WAS TOLD WHAT WAS HAPPENING AND IMMEDIATELY CALLED FOR A RESOLUTION REP. AFTER CONFERRING WITH THE REP AND FLT CREW; I WANTED PAX X REMOVED FROM THE FLT. MY DECISION WAS BASED ON THE UNCERTAINTY OF PAX X! EMOTIONAL AND PSYCHOLOGICAL STATE; THE INTEGRITY OF MY FLT CREW; THE SAFETY OF THIS FLT AND PAX UNDER THE PRESENT ENVIRONMENT; AND THE ADDED STRESS OF HAVING THIS INDIVIDUAL ON OUR FLT. PAX X WAS REMOVED RESPECTFULLY BY OUR AGENTS; WITHOUT ANY RESISTANCE OR COMPLAINTS BY PAX X.

NO FURTHER PROBLEMS WITH PAX AND REMAINDER OF FLT WAS UNEVENTFUL.

column121: I WAS HANGING COATS AND WENT TO ASSIST #1 FLT ATTENDANT WITH PRE DEP BEVERAGES. AT THE ENTRY DOOR WAS AN OLDER FEMALE PAX WHO CLAIMED SHE WASN'T FEELING WELL. ON THE JET BRIDGE WERE A FAMILY OF 4 (ADULT MALE AND FEMALE AND 2 CHILDREN) THE MALE WAS SHOUTING AT THE AGENT AND FEMALE 'CHIMED IN' AT VARIOUS TIMES. TWO OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS WERE PRESENT. WHEN THE OLDER FEMALE SAID SHE DIDN'T FEEL WELL; I GRABBED THE BOARDING PASSES FROM THE MALE AND TOOK ONLY HER BACK TO HER SEAT. AFTER DISCUSSION WITH THE CAPT; FEMALE AND TWO CHILDREN WERE ALLOWED TO BOARD; THE MALE WAS DENIED.
column125: MD80. ANGRY MALE PAX WAS NOT ALLOWED TO BOARD THE ACFT AFTER SHOUTING AT THE ACR GATE AGENT IN THE JETWAY.

column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other OVERAGE CHILD ON PAX LAP
column121: PAX PURCHASED 4 FIRST CLASS SEATS AND ONE COACH SEAT. HE AND HIS WIFE AND TWO SMALL DAUGHTERS SAT UP FRONT AND TEENAGE SON SAT IN COACH. BEFORE CLOSING ACFT DOOR FOR DEP THE FATHER MOVED SON TO A FIRST CLASS SEAT AND PUT HIS 3 YEAR OLD DAUGHTER ON HIS LAP; THE AISLE FLT ATTENDANT INFORMED ME WHAT HAPPENED AND I WENT AND TOLD THE FATHER THAT THE SON MUST GO BACK TO COACH AND HE MUST PUT HIS DAUGHTER IN THE FIRST CLASS SEAT (HE PURCHASED) FOR TKOF AND LNDG. HE REFUSED AND SAID HIS DAUGHTER WOULD STAY ON HIS LAP. HE SAID HE WOULD GET OFF THE ACFT IF WE DIDN'T LET HIS DAUGHTER STAY ON HIS LAP AND HIS SON IN HER SEAT. CHILDREN OVER 2 YRS MUST BE IN THEIR OWN SEAT FOR TKOF AND LAND. HE WOULDN'T COOPERATE; SO WE RE OPENED THE ACFT DOOR AND HD HIM AND HIS FAMILY REMOVED. SUGGESTION: ALL CHILDREN SHOULD BE IN THEIR OWN SEATS WITH CHILD RESTRAINT SEATS.
column125: B757-200 CREW HAD A PAX THAT INSISTED ON HOLDING AN OVERAGE CHILD ON HIS LAP.

column121: PAX XX REFUSED TO HANG UP CELL PHONE WHEN FLT ATTENDANT #4 ASKED HIM TO. FLT ATTENDANT #4 THEN ASKED HIM AGAIN. HE BEGAN TO YELL AND THROW ITEMS AROUND HIM. #4 FLT ATTENDANT WENT TO INFORM CAPT. PAX THEN BEGAN TO CALL #4 FLT ATTENDANT A *&%$# AND SAY 'SHE' NEEDED TO BE REMOVED FROM ACFT. CAPT CALLED SPECIAL SVCS TO REMOVE PAX FROM ACFT. BEFORE EXITING ACFT; PAX TOLD ME THAT WE WOULD HAVE TO DEAL WITH WHAT WE HAVE DONE. I DON'T KNOW WHAT HE MEANT BY THAT. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: RPTR STATED THAT SHE HAS NOT RECEIVED ANY FEEDBACK ABOUT THE RESULTS OF THIS INCIDENT. SHE STATED THAT THE PAX DID NOT SEEM UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL AS HE DISPLAYED A VERY AGGRESSIVE PERSONALITY AND ANNOYED BY THE DELAY IN THE EXTRA SECURITY UPON BOARDING THE FLT.
column125: B727 PAX REFUSES TO STOP USING CELL PHONE PRIOR TO PUSHBACK. BEGAN THROWING ITEMS AT CABIN ATTENDANT AND SUBSEQUENTLY THREATENING THE CABIN CREW WHEN BEING REMOVED FROM THE ACFT BY ARPT SECURITY.

column121: DURING BOARDING ONE OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS INFORMED ME THAT FOUR MIDDLE EASTERN MEN HAD BOARDED AND WERE SITTING NEAR EACH OTHER. SOME OF THE PAX AND FLT ATTENDANTS WERE NERVOUS ABOUT THOSE MEN BEING ON BOARD. THE PAX IN SEAT 1C USED VULGAR LANGUAGE TO A FLT ATTENDANT AND I TOLD THE AGENT TO REMOVE HIM. A LITTLE LATER ONE OF THE MIDDLE EASTERN MEN MADE EYE CONTACT WITH ONE OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS IN A MANNER THAT SHE PERCEIVED AS THREATENING AND INTIMIDATING. SHE WAS IN THE COCKPIT CRYING. ALL THE FLT ATTENDANTS WERE PRETTY UPSET. I TOLD THE AGENT TO CALL POLICE IN CASE WE NEEDED THEM. THEN I TOLD THE AGENT TO REMOVE THE FOUR MEN FROM THE FLT. HE ASKED THEM TO LEAVE AND THEY DID WITHOUT ANY TROUBLE. WE DEP 35 MINS LATER.

column121: PAX MOVED FROM Y CABIN TO J CABIN; THEN F CABIN AND REFUSED TO RETURN TO ORIGINAL SEAT. WHEN ASKED BY CREW TO RETURN TO ORIGINAL SEAT; PAX BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE TOWARD CREW. ON GND; AT GRU ARPT; PAX THREATENED MY LIFE. ANY THREAT OR INTERFERENCE WITH CREW SHOULD INVOLVE MANDATORY JAIL SENTENCES AS WELL AS BARRING FROM AIR TRAVEL.

column121: A FEMALE PAX BECAME AGITATED AND HOSTILE. I WAS ABLE TO CALM HER ENOUGH TO KEEP HER SEATED FOR LNDG; BUT SHE WAS NOT STABLE ENOUGH TO LEAVE. I ASKED FOR EMT'S. I GOT POLICE; WHO HANDCUFFED HER AND LED HER AWAY. I DON'T KNOW WHAT THEY DID WITH HER; BUT I FELT SHE NEEDED MEDICAL EVALUATION; NOT POLICE FORCE.

column121: WHEN PLUCKING TICKETS MALE PAX AND HIS WIFE BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO ME. I GAVE THEM A VERBAL WARNING AND THEY RETALIATED. I REFERRED THEM TO THE TICKET AGENT. AS THEY RETURNED AND BOARDED FLT THEY KEPT SAYING AND DISPLAYING HOSTILE BEHAVIOR. I THEN CONTINUED TO PURSUE THE EVENT WITH THE CAPT PRIOR TO DEP. AT THE GATE OPERATIONAL MGR MEETS FLT AND REPRIMANDS PAX WITH WARNING FROM FLT CREW; CAPT; AND CARRIER PERSONNEL. FLT LEFT AND NO DIVERSION WAS MADE. PAX REMAINED QUIET THROUGHOUT THE FLT.
column125: CAB ATTENDANT IS GIVEN HOSTILE BEHAVIOR FROM PAX COUPLE. TICKET AGENT AND FLC VERBALLY WARNED PAX THAT THEY WOULD BE DEPLANED IF THEY DID NOT STOP BEHAVIOR AND THEY OBEYED FOR THE FLT.

column121: PAX WAS CAUGHT SMOKING IN AT LAV BY FLT ATTENDANT #2 AND #3. HVY SMOKE COMING OUT AFT LAV WHERE PAX SMOKED A CIGARETTE. PAX; WHEN CONFRONTED BY FLT ATTENDANT #2 AND #3 THEN MYSELF; BECAME ABUSIVE BY HIS VERBAL ACTIONS AND GESTURES. UNACCEPTABLE BEHAVIOR. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: RPTR STATED THAT THE PAX WAS TAKEN AWAY BY LCL POLICE AFTER LNDG. HE FURTHER STATED THAT IF PAX ATTITUDE IS REMORSEFUL; THEY WILL BE TREATED ACCORDINGLY. HOWEVER; THIS PAX BECAME BELLIGERENT AND ABUSIVE TO THE CAB CREW.
column125: A300 PAX FOUND SMOKING IN THE AFT LAV AND TAKEN AWAY BY LCL LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS AFTER LNDG.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 13; Flight Attendant Total 13; Flight Attendant Type 60
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: UPON LNDG; PAX JUMPED UP AND OPENED OVERHEAD BIN TO RETRIEVE BAGS. FLT ATTENDANT #2 WENT IN AISLE TO INSTRUCT PAX TO TAKE SEATS; FASTEN SEATBELTS AND CLOSE OVERHEAD BIN. PAX BECAME ARGUMENTATIVE; ABUSIVE; WOULDN'T TAKE SEAT; KEPT REOPENING OVERHEAD BIN AND BEGAN CUSSING OUT FLT ATTENDANT #2 AND TRIED TO HIT HIM IN THE FACE. HE CAME TO THE GALLEY AND I WENT TO TRY AND GET HER TO TAKE HER SEAT AND FASTEN HER SEATBELT. SHE WAS SCREAMING; CUSSING KEPT REOPENING HER OVERHEAD BIN TRYING TO GET HER BAGS. SHE WANTED TO KNOW WHY SHE HAD TO TAKE A SEAT AND FASTEN HER SEATBELT SO I TOLD HER. I ASKED HER PLEASE; THEN SHE SAID I DON'T HAVE TO DO ANYTHING THAT YOU SAY. SHE VERBALLY ABUSED ME; CREATED A MAJOR SAFETY PROBLEM AND WAS IRRATIONAL. I TOLD HER I WASN'T GOING TO ARGUE WITH HER ANYMORE AND WAS SCARED SHE WOULD ATTACK ME OR ANOTHER PAX. I WENT TO THE PURSER (WHILE #2 CALLED COCKPIT TO HAVE POLICE MEET FLT) TO TELL HER WHAT WAS HAPPENING. THE LADY JUMPS UP GRABS HER STUFF AND IS HEADING FOR FIRST CLASS AS #1 IS GOING TO BACK. THE LADY IS YELLING AND CUSSING. WE GET TO GATE; POLICE AREN'T THERE. #1 IS TELLING HER TO BE QUIET. SHE ASKS IF SHE WILL BE ARRESTED? WE SAID YES; PROBABLY. SHE BEGINS LOOKING FOR SOMETHING AND AT THE DOOR SHE SAYS 'WELL I BETTER DO SOMETHING ELSE TO YOU AND MAKE (THE ARREST) REALLY COUNT. TWO FLT ATTENDANTS AND PAX ARE ON EDGE OF SEAT GIVING ME SIGNALS THEY WILL HELP IF SHE ATTACKS ME. SHE IS YELLING AND I ASSUME LOOKING FOR SOMETHING TO COME AT ME WITH. (I HAVE BEGUN SELF DEFENSE.) I CHANGED MY STANCE FULLY PREPARED FOR HER ATTACK. AFTER 10 MINS POLICE ARRIVE; WE OPEN DOOR; THEY TAKE HER AND SHE BEGINS CUSSING AND YELLING AT THEM. I FEARED FOR THE SAFETY OF THE PAX; COCKPIT; CREW AND MYSELF. SHE EXHIBITED BEHAVIOR COMPLETELY UNACCEPTABLE FOR AIRLINE TRAVEL AND ANY OTHER SITUATION AS WELL. SHE ENDANGERED THE SAFETY OF OTHER PAX. INTERFERED WITH DUTY OF CREWMEMBERS. THREATENED CREWMEMBERS AND VERBALLY ASSAULTED US. SHE IS DANGEROUS; UNSTABLE AND VIOLENT. I FEEL THAT OUR TRAINING HELPED. I ALSO FELT TAKING SELF DEFENSE BENEFITED THE MOST BECAUSE I FELT IN CTL AND KNEW I COULD HANDLE HER TO PROTECT PAX; COCKPIT AND CREW. GAVE ME A MENTAL AND PHYSICAL EDGE OVER HER. SHE WAS NOT ALLOWED TO CONTINUE ON. THEY DIDN'T ARREST HER. THE UNION SAID SHE IS TO BE FINED. HOW DO WE MAINTAIN CTL IF PEOPLE AREN'T ARRESTED FOR THIS TYPE OF BEHAVIOR?
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPT ON THE UNSTABLE ACTIONS OF A PAX WHO REFUSED TO KEEP HER SEAT DURING TAXI INTO MIA; FL.

column121: ON AN ACR FLT AT CRUISE ALT OF FL390; FLT ATTENDANT CAME TO COCKPIT WITH A NOTE FOUND BY A PAX IN A MAGAZINE. THE NOTE SAID 'FLT WILL EXPLODE.' AN EMER WAS DECLARED AND A RAPID DSCNT MADE TO LAND AT ZZZ. 250 KIAS EXCEEDED BELOW 10000 FT MSL IN RAPID DSCNT DUE TO NATURE OF SIT. APCH AND LNDG TO RWY WERE NORMAL. ACFT WAS STOPPED IN A SECURE AREA; AND PAX DEPLANED.

column121: A MR X REFUSED TO FOLLOW CREW MEMBER INSTRUCTIONS; IN THAT HE REFUSED TO PUT HIS DOG IN THE KENNEL THAT HE BROUGHT ON THE ACFT. HE LET THE DOG RUN FREE IN THE BACK AREA OF THE ACFT AND DECIDED TO MAKE HIS WAY TO THE FIRST CLASS AREA. WHEN I DISCOVERED HIM SITTING THERE; HE WAS FONDLING HIMSELF. I FIRMLY ASKED HIM TO GO BACK TO HIS SEAT. MR X ROSE FROM SEAT AND GOT UNCOMFORTABLY CLOSE TO ME. HE DEMANDED I SERVE HIM DINNER. THERE WAS NO MEAL SVC IN THE COACH CABIN; BUT THERE WAS IN FIRST CLASS. I TOLD HIM THAT THE MEAL SVC WAS FOR THOSE WHO PAID TO SIT IN THE FIRST CLASS CABIN. HE DID GO BACK TO HIS SEAT; BUT NEVER RESTRAINED HIS DOG. APPARENTLY; HE WAS DIFFICULT WITH THE FLT ATTENDANTS IN THE BACK. ALL FLT ATTENDANTS FELT THAT MR X WAS MENTALLY DERANGED. HIS RETURN TRAVEL BACK TO THE UNITED STATES WAS CHANGED TO ANOTHER AIRLINE.
column125: B757-200 PAX REFUSED TO KEEP HIS DOG IN HIS KENNEL; HE THEN TRIED TO SNEAK INTO THE FIRST CLASS CABIN AND WAS FOUND FONDLING HIMSELF.

column96: Flight Crew Type 637
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other SCHEDULED PRESS
column121: PRIOR TO DEP; ORD CUSTOMER SVC REPRESENTATIVE ADVISED THAT THERE HAD BEEN A PROB WITH A PAX AT CHK-IN DUE TO A LANGUAGE PROB AND I WAS ASSURED THAT IT WAS RESOLVED AND THAT THE PAX HAD CALMED DOWN WITH NO FURTHER PROB. I ELECTED TO ACCEPT THE PAX BASED ON THAT ASSURANCE; AND PURSER AGREEMENT. AFTER DEP; THE PAX ACTED IRRATIONALLY AND BEGAN SCREAMING IN THE COACH CABIN. I COORDINATED WITH THE PURSER AND ARRANGED FOR A FORMER POLICE OFFICER TO HAVE RESTRAINTS IF NECESSARY. PIC ADVISED DISPATCH AND SINCE THE PAX REMAINED IN HER SEAT; CONTINUED FOR THE SHORT FLT TO MCI. UPON ARR; CUSTOMER SVC REPRESENTATIVE ATTEMPTED TO COMMUNICATE UNSUCCESSFULLY AND I REQUESTED THE POLICE TO ASSIST SINCE THE PAX APPEARED TO BE IN NEED OF HELP. AFTER LNDG; IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT THE POLICE HAD BEEN AT THE GATE IN ORD AND THAT THE PAX HAD BEEN ACTING STRANGELY IN THE TERMINAL AREA AND THAT HER BOOKING WAS MILANO; ORD; MCI; AND BACK THE FOLLOWING AFTERNOON. AS THE CAPT; I CALLED DISPATCH AND ADVISED DISPATCH WITH THE RECOMMENDATION THAT THE PAX NOT BE ACCEPTED FOR TRAVEL ON OUR ACR. DUE TO THE EFFECT OF FRIGHTENING THE OTHER PAX AND THIS WAS DONE. ALSO; THE CUSTOMER SVC REPRESENTATIVE IN ORD WAS CLRLY WRONG IN PUSHING THIS PAX OFF ON THE CREW AND I WILL CONSIDER THE CUSTOMER SVC REPRESENTATIVE OPINION ON PAX CONDITION TO BE OF LITTLE VALUE IN THE FUTURE.
column125: A B737-300 PIC RPT ON A HYSTERICAL PAX THAT WAS CARRIED FROM ORD TO MCI ON THE ASSURANCES TO THE CAPT BY A CUSTOMER SVC REPRESENTATIVE THAT ALL WAS WELL PRIOR TO DEP FROM ORD; IL.
