column118: Air Traffic Control Issued New Clearance; Air Traffic Control Provided Assistance; Flight Crew Landed As Precaution; Flight Crew Diverted; General Declared Emergency
column121: ABOUT 2 1/2 HRS INTO FLT; THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT RANG THE COCKPIT. HE SAID THERE WAS A PAX THAT WANTED TO TALK TO THE CAPT. THE FLT ATTENDANT TOLD HIM HE WOULD PASS IT ON. HE RELAYED THIS INFO: 'PAX HAD A MENTAL MEDICAL CONDITION OF EXTREME PARANOIA AND MEDICAL PAPERWORK TO PROVE IT. HE WAS HEARING VOICES IN HIS HEAD TELLING HIM TO KILL HIMSELF. THE ACFT WOULD NOT MAKE IT TO DEST AND THE VOICES WERE GETTING PROGRESSIVELY WORSE THE FURTHER WE WENT.' WE PULLED OUT THE CHKLIST AND INITIATED LOCK-DOWN PROCS. THE CAPT TOLD THE FLT ATTENDANT TO GO BACK TO THE PAX AND KEEP CAPT UPDATED ON HIS CONDITION. CAPT ALSO TOLD HIM TO FIND 2 MEN IN THE BACK; EXPLAIN THAT THEY MIGHT BE NEEDED AND GET THE WRIST BANDS READY IN CASE THERE WAS TROUBLE. THE CAPT AND I WENT THROUGH THE CHKLIST AND DECIDED AT THIS POINT THERE WAS NOT A THREAT TO THE ACFT; BUT THERE WAS TO THE PAX AND FLT ATTENDANTS. THE CAPT TRIED TO CONTACT DISPATCH ON 2 DIFFERENT REMOTE SITES; HOWEVER; NO CONTACT ON EITHER OF THESE SITES. THE CAPT CALLED BACK TO THE FLT ATTENDANT. THE FLT ATTENDANT SAID THE PAX WAS GETTING WORSE AND WE NEEDED TO LAND. THE CAPT TOLD HIM WE WERE DIVERTING TO ZZZ AND WOULD BE ON THE GND IN 10 MINS. ZZZ WAS ABOUT 60 MI. NEAREST COMPANY CITY WAS 500 MI AWAY. WE DECLARED AN EMER AND ASKED CTR TO CONTACT OUR DISPATCH AND LET THEM KNOW. WE WERE VERY BUSY ON DSCNT. THE CAPT CALLED THE FLT ATTENDANT ONE LAST TIME AND HE SAID THE PAX WAS NO WORSE; SINCE WE HAD TOLD THE PAX (PA ANNOUNCEMENT) WE WERE LNDG. WE LANDED AND WERE MET ON TXWY BY SECURITY AND FIRE PERSONNEL AND AIRSTAIRS. SECURITY WOULD NOT BOARD ACFT UNTIL CITY POLICE DEPT SHOWED UP ABOUT 5 MINS LATER. COCKPIT STAYED IN LOCK-DOWN UNTIL THE PAX WAS REMOVED. A GOV AGENCY WAS ALERTED AND DECIDED TO HOLD OUR FLT UNTIL THEY COULD INTERVIEW ALL OF THE PAX. WE TAXIED TO THE TERMINAL AND UNLOADED ALL PAX AND CARRY-ONS. FLT ATTENDANTS AND PAX WERE INTERVIEWED. THE CREW SWEPT THE CABIN FOR ANYTHING UNUSUAL. IT WAS ASCERTAINED THAT THE REMOVED PAX HAD NO CHKED BAGS. AFTER PREFLT; WE RELOADED THE ACFT AND CONTINUED TO DEST. ATC WAS VERY HELPFUL. OVERALL COORD BTWN CREW AND CABIN WAS VERY GOOD. NEED A BETTER CHKLIST FOR DIVERT (IE; THE DIVERT PACKAGE). THE CHKLIST ON BACK OF STAMPED ENVELOPE CALLED FOR 56 DIFFERENT DOCUMENTS; WHEN IN FACT THERE WERE ONLY 2 TO BE MAILED: 1) LOADING SCHEDULE; AND 2) SIGNED DISPATCH RELEASE. I HAD TO CALL DISPATCH AND ASK WHAT TO DO ABOUT THE NAME LIST. THEY WERE CONFUSED WHY IT WAS IN THE PACKAGE BECAUSE WE NOW HAD A LIST OF ALL PAX. THEY SAID IT WAS NOT APPLICABLE. THE CHKLIST ALSO CALLED FOR 1) SIGNED DISPATCH RELEASE; 2) FLT RELEASE; 3) AIRWORTHINESS ACKNOWLEDGEMENT. THOSE ARE ALL ON THE SAME DOCUMENT. THERE IS ALREADY A LOT OF CONFUSION GOING ON IN THE COORD OF EVERYTHING ELSE TO HAVE TO WORRY ABOUT AN OUT-OF-DATE AND CONFUSING DIVERT PACKAGE.
column125: FLC DECLARES EMER; DIVERTS.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 3; Flight Attendant Total 3; Flight Attendant Type 50
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WAS WORKING POS #1; FIRST CLASS. I DIDN'T KNOW WHAT WAS GOING ON IN MAIN CABIN UNTIL THE #2 (RPTR) CAME UP TO NOTIFY ME THAT THIS PAX APPEARED TO BE INTOXICATED. SHE CUT HIM OFF; HE GOT UPSET AND ARGUED WITH FLT ATTENDANT. HE REFUSED TO SIT DOWN. HE 'HECKLED' ALL THE PAX AROUND HIM. WHEN I WENT BACK THERE; I COULDN'T UNDERSTAND WHAT HE WAS SAYING (ONLY SPOKE SPANISH). ALL PAX AROUND HIM WERE REQUESTING TO BE MOVED. HE WOULD SIT FOR A WHILE; HARASSING PAX; THEN GET UP AND COME TO MAIN CABIN GALLEY; ASKING FOR MORE DRINKS AND OFFERING MONEY. AFTER ABOUT 1/2 HR OF GETTING UP AND DOWN; PAX FELL ASLEEP FOR REMAINDER OF THE FLT. FLT ATTENDANT #4 WAS WORKING THE EGR MACHINE DURING BOARDING AND STATED THAT PAX DIDN'T APPEAR TO BE INTOXICATED OR SMELL OF ALCOHOL UPON BOARDING. HE ONLY HAD 1-2 DRINKS INFLT. IT WAS UNCLR IF HE WAS ACTUALLY INTOXICATED; ON MEDICATION OR SOMETHING ELSE. UPON DEPLANING; PAX STUMBLED UP THE AISLE AND FELL FACE FIRST AT ABOUT ROW 12. HE STRUGGLED TO GET UP AGAIN. MEXICAN POLICE ESCORTED HIM OUT OF THE TERMINAL IN A WHEELCHAIR. HE WAS SINGING LOUDLY THROUGHOUT THE TERMINAL.
column125: B737-800 PAX BECAME UNRULY WHEN CABIN ATTENDANTS REFUSED TO SELL HIM MORE ALCOHOLIC DRINKS.

column121: I TOLD THE FO BY INTERCOM THAT WE HAD A SIT IN THE CABIN AND HE INFORMED ME TO HOLD ON; I SHOULD TELL THE CAPT IN FULL DETAIL. I CALLED THE CAPT TO RPT THIS BEHAVIOR. THERE WERE 3 OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS GUARDING THE COCKPIT. THE CAPT CONTACTED TWR TO GET A GATE TO REMOVE PAX. PAX CURSING AND TELLING US TO SHUT UP; HE WANTED OFF NOW. HE KEPT HITTING THE CLOSET WALL HARDER AND HARDER. HE APPEARED INTOXICATED AND MENTALLY UNSTABLE. HE REFUSED TO SIT WHILE TAXIING BACK TO THE GATE. I INFORMED CAPT OF PAX'S BROTHER SITTING IN COACH. WE WANTED BOTH TO GO. PAX ALSO STATED 'I MUST GET OFF THIS ACFT NOW OR I'M GOING TO DIE' AS HE WALKED UP THE AISLE.
column125: RETURN TO GATE TO DEPLANE 2 PAX'S FROM A B757 AFTER ONE PAX WAS VIOLENT AND ABUSIVE WHEN TAXIING FOR TKOF AT LAX; CA.

column121: ON TAXI; AS A FLT ATTENDANT I DID MY BEST TO TRY TO DIFFUSE A BAD SIT. THE CAPT WAS INFORMED AND MY ADVICE WAS TO REMOVE A VOLATILE; UNSTABLE INDIVIDUAL FROM THE PLANE. WE RETURNED TO THE GATE TO DO SO. THAT IS WHEN EVERYTHING WAS DONE IMPROPERLY. THIS WAS A LEVEL 1 THREAT THAT WAS NOT HANDLED AS SUCH. ONCE THIS WAS RPTED AND WE RETURNED TO THE GATE THE CAPT SHOULD HAVE FOLLOWED THROUGH AND REMOVED THE PAX AND THEIR BAGS AS PER A LEVEL 1 THREAT.
column125: PAX MISCONDUCT. RESULTS IN COCKPIT/CABIN DISAGREEMENT.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: AT BOARDING; ACFT PAX MRS X WAS TRYING TO SQUEEZE A WHEELCHAIR INTO AISLE WITH HER SON IN A CAR SEAT. I SAID 'THE WHEELCHAIR WILL NOT FIT IN AISLE.' SO A MECH CARRIED THE CAR SEAT TO A WINDOW SEAT. THE PLT SAID SHE SEEMED VERY STRANGE AT BOARDING AND TRIED TO SHOW THEM HER BOARDING PASS AND IDENT. ON OUR FIRST BEVERAGE SVC; MRS X AND THE MAN IN WINDOW SEAT IN FRONT OF MR Y GOT INTO A VERY LOUD FIGHT AND BOTH PAX STARTED TO GET UP AND FIGHT EACH OTHER. I SAID TO BOTH PAX 'THAT'S NO WAY TO SOLVE THE PROB' AND MOVED MR Y TO FIRST CLASS. DURING THE FLT; MRS X WAS VERY LOUD AND RUDE TO PAX AROUND HER. SHE SAID SEVERAL TIMES HER SON WAS AUTISTIC. AFTER THE SVC; I WALKED AND HELD THE LITTLE BOY TO GIVE MRS X TIME TO CALM DOWN. THEN PAX Z IN AISLE SEAT IN FRONT OF MRS X SAID MRS X PULLED HER HAIR AND POKED HER WITH A PEN. ALSO SAID SHE WAS GOING TO SPILL HER COFFEE ON HER HEAD. SO I MOVED PAX Z TO AFT MAIN CABIN. MRS X SAID SOMETHING ABOUT A LAWYER SO I HAD CAPT CALL POLICE TO MEET FLT. THE POLICE SAID MRS X DOES NOT SEEM STABLE AND NEEDS HELP.' THE POLICE WALKED HER TO BAGGAGE CLAIM TO TELL PERSON MEETING HER TO NOT LET HER FLY ALONE. AS THE CREW LEFT ARPT; MR Y CAME TO US AND TOLD POLICE HE WANTED TO PRESS CHARGES. MRS X SHOULD NOT FLY ON AIRLINE.
column125: UNSTABLE PAX BOARDS WITH AUTISTIC SON AND IS A MAJOR TRIAL FOR THE CABIN CREW. A FULL FLT; AND MRS X BECOMES BELLIGERENT WITH 2 PAX SEATED IN FRONT OF HER AND HER SON. POLICE MEET THE FLT AT TPA; FL.

column121: UNCONFIRMED RPT FROM FLT ATTENDANT OF POSSIBLE PAX SMOKING IN FORWARD LAVATORY. A PAX RPTED SMELLING SMOKE IN LAVATORY TO FLT ATTENDANT. 2 FLT ATTENDANTS CHKED LAVATORY AND DID NOT SMELL SMOKE OR FIND EVIDENCE OF SMOKING (IE; CIGARETTE; ETC) WHEN INTEGRITY CHK OF LAVATORY ACCOMPLISHED. PAX'S RPTING TO FLT ATTENDANT WERE IN FORWARD COACH. PAX SUSPECTED; BUT NOT CONFIRMED; OF SMOKING WAS NEAR RPTING PAX. FLT ATTENDANT INDICATED THAT PAX DID NOT ADMIT TO SMOKING. NO SMOKING SIGN SWITCH IN COCKPIT WAS CONFIRMED IN 'ON/NO SMOKING' POS. MAINT CHKS ACCOMPLISHED. UNEVENTFUL FLT TO DEST COMPLETED.
column125: A CASE OF AN ALLEGED SMOKER IN THE FORWARD LAVATORY IS HANDLED BY THE FLT ATTENDANT IN COORD WITH THE PIC AND OTHER FLT ATTENDANT ON FLT ON DSCNT INTO LAS; NV.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 14; Flight Attendant Total 14; Flight Attendant Type 35
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX SEATED IN MAIN CABIN HAD SPECIAL DIETARY NEEDS; GLUTEN FREE. OFFERED CHOICE OF 3 ENTREES. PAX DID NOT BRING ANY FOOD FOR DIETARY NEEDS; DID NOT ORDER SPECIAL MEAL WHICH AIRLINE MAKES AVAILABLE TO ALL PAX. PAX GIVEN ENTREE AND TRAY SET-UP; CALLED TO FLT ATTENDANT WHO WAS AT ROW 40. PAX PROCEEDED TO THROW ENTIRE TRAY SET-UP AND HOT ENTREE; HITTING FLT ATTENDANT AND GETTING 15 PAX SCALDED AND BURNED FROM ENTREE. PAX HAD MANY DRUGS TO TAKE. PAX BECAME IRATE; SCREAMING SO ALL PAX BEHIND HER; APPROX 50; BECAME SCARED AND THOUGHT FLT ATTENDANT WAS BEING ASSAULTED AS PART OF A HIJACKING. PAX SEEMED TO BE HUNG OVER FROM STAYING UP OVER 24 HRS BEFORE FLT. PAX DRANK; AND TRIED TO ENTICE 3 MALE PAX IN SAME ROW TO HAVE SEX. PAX CONTINUED TO TALK SEXUALLY EXPLICIT WITH THOSE 3 GENTLEMEN IN SAME ROW. PAX GIVEN WRITTEN WARNING STATING SHE HAD VIOLATED FARS; AND MUST CEASE AND DESIST. FEDERAL AND METRO-DADE COUNTY MET PLANE ON ARR IN MIAMI.
column125: UNUSUAL REACTION BY A GLUTEN INTOLERANT PAX DURING AN EXTENDED OVERWATER OP. A CABIN ATTENDANT WAS ASSAULTED BY THE PAX WHO THREW A HOT FOOD SVC TRAY AT HIM AFTER DEP FROM LHR; FO.

column118: Air Traffic Control Issued Advisory / Alert; General None Reported / Taken
column121: WHILE ON DSCNT INTO MSP; WE HAD JUST RECEIVED A DSCNT FROM 7000 FT TO 6000 FT WHEN A TARGET APPEARED SUDDENLY ON TCASII AT 11:30 O'CLOCK POS AT -200 FT AND WELL INSIDE THE INNER RING. IMMEDIATELY TCASII COMMANDED A CLBING RA AT 2000 FPM. I DISCONNECTED THE AUTOPLT AND BEGAN AN AGGRESSIVE CLB AND SCANNED FORWARD FOR TFC. I DID NOT SEE ANY TFC AND NEITHER DID THE FO. THE TCASII RA WENT AWAY WITHOUT ANNOUNCING 'CLR OF CONFLICT.' THERE WAS AN A320 TFC VISIBLE 12:30 O'CLOCK POS AND 5 MI ON FINAL FOR RWY 12R BUT THIS COULDN'T HAVE BEEN THE TFC AT ISSUE. IN POINT OF FACT; I AM CONVINCED THERE WAS NO TFC AND THAT THIS WAS ANOTHER CASE OF PAX ELECTRONIC DEVICE INTERFERENCE CAUSING A FALSE TCASII RA. SUSPECTING THIS; I MADE A PA ANNOUNCEMENT DIRECTING THAT 'ALL ELECTRONIC DEVICES INCLUDING CELL PHONES AND PAGERS BE DEPWRED.' I ALSO HAD THE FO ASK THE LEAD FLT ATTENDANT TO DO A PAX ELECTRONIC DEVICE WALK. HE RPTED BACK IN A COUPLE OF MINS 'NO PAX ELECTRONIC DEVICES OBSERVED IN USE.' WE RESUMED OUR DSCNT TO 6000 FT AND THE TCASII FUNCTIONED NORMALLY THE REST OF THE FLT AND TESTED NORMALLY AT THE GATE. THE OTHERWISE NORMAL FUNCTION OF TCASII AND THE ABRUPT APPEARANCE OF THE TCASII TARGET AND EQUALLY ABRUPT DISAPPEARANCE AND THE ABJECT LACK OF A VISUAL TARGET IN THE DEPICTED LOCATION CONVINCES ME THAT THIS WAS A FALSE RA AND THAT PAPER OP IN THE CABIN IS THE MOST LIKELY EXPLANATION.
column125: DC9-40 CREW HAD A FALSE TCASII RA DSNDING INTO MSP.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 29; Flight Attendant Total 29; Flight Attendant Type 90
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other PAX DRUNK; AND STEALING LIQUOR
column121: A PAX WENT INTO AFT GALLEY WHILE FLT ATTENDANTS WERE IN CABIN DOING A BEVERAGE SVC. HE STOLE SEVERAL MINI'S OF LIQUOR AND WAS INTOXICATED; SWEARING LOUDLY AND REFUSING TO BE QUIET. IF WE WERE NOT STAFFED WITH ONLY 11 FLT ATTENDANTS; THERE COULD BE A FLT ATTENDANT IN THE GALLEY TO MONITOR CABIN AT ALL TIMES.
column125: B777-200 FLT ATTENDANT HAD A PAX THAT WAS DRUNK AND STEELING LIQUOR FROM THE AFT GALLEY.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 4; Flight Attendant Total 15; Flight Attendant Type 85
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX APCHED PURSER AND I. HE BEGAN YELLING AT US IN SPANISH. I DIDN'T UNDERSTAND. HIS BODY LANGUAGE AND VOICE INDICATED ANGER. PURSER TOLD HIM TO LOWER HIS VOICE; HIS ACCUSATIONS WERE FALSE AND TOLD HIM TO RETURN TO HIS SEAT. EVERY TIME A FLT ATTENDANT PASSED HIS ROW; HE WOULD YELL AND THREATEN US; SAYING 'I'M GOING TO HAVE YOUR ASSES.' 'I KNOW SOMEONE AT YOUR AIRLINE.' 'YOU STOLE AN HR OF MY LIFE' AND 'YOU HAVE NO RESPECT FOR ME.' THIS WENT ON FOR 2 1/2 HRS. CREW WAS GETTING UPSET AND DISTR FROM DUTIES BECAUSE WE HAD TO KEEP AN EYE ON HIM. WE CONFERRED WITH CAPT AND DECIDED TO ISSUE PAX DISTURBANCE FORM. AFTER PREPARING FOR LNDG; I WENT TO RETRIEVE FORM FROM AFT GALLEY. AS I PASSED HIM; HE WAS YELLING IN SPANISH. THEN HE GOT UP AND CHASED AFTER ME. I TURNED WHEN I REACHED AFT GALLEY. FLT ATTENDANT #2 CALLED PURSER AND CAPT TO INFORM THEM WE MAY HAVE A SIT. HE BEGAN YELLING AT ME AGAIN. I THOUGHT HE WAS GOING TO HIT ME. I TOLD HIM MANY TIMES TO RETURN TO SEAT. WE TOLD CAPT HE WAS NON COMPLIANT. HE FINALLY WENT TO HIS SEAT YELLING OBSCENITIES AT ME. WHEN WE LANDED; WE WERE MET BY AUTHS AND FILED RPTS.
column125: UNSTABLE PAX BOARDS FLT AND IS A MAJOR TRIAL FOR THE CABIN CREW. A FULL FLT AND MR X BECOMES BELLIGERENT WITH 2 FLT ATTENDANTS. POLICE MEET THE FLT AT MIA; FL.

column121: PAX (FEMALE) RPTED TO FLT ATTENDANTS THAT MALE PAX IN SEAT XYZ NEXT TO HER TOUCHED HER BODY INAPPROPRIATELY UNDER HER BLANKET SEVERAL TIMES (AND HER LEGS) AFTER SHE ASKED HIM TO STOP 3 TIMES. SHE WAS TEARFUL AND WENT TO FLT ATTENDANTS WHO CALLED ME AS PURSER. I REMOVED HER TO FIRST CLASS SEAT ABC AND SHE RELATED SAME INCIDENTS TO ME. I INFORMED CAPT AND HE CALLED MIA SECURITY. POLICE AND FBI MET PLANE ON ARR.
column125: B757-200 PAX RPTED SHE WAS MOLESTED BY A MALE PAX SEATED NEXT TO HER.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 17; Flight Attendant Total 18; Flight Attendant Type 75
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other PAX SPIT IN FA'S FACE
column121: I AM A FLT ATTENDANT. ON JUL/MON/02 I WAS WORKING ON FLT FROM NEW YORK. AT ABOUT XA30 I WAS IN THE GALLEY WORKING WITH ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT. I WAS FACING AROUND FROM FIRST CLASS AND TALKING WHEN I NOTICED THAT HE WAS DISTR AND LOOKING INTO FIRST CLASS. I FOLLOWED HIS GAZE. I SAW A FLT ATTENDANT THAT WAS SPEAKING WITH A PAX. I COULD HEAR RAISED VOICES; BUT I DO NOT KNOW WHAT THEY WERE SAYING. THEY WERE FACING EACH OTHER AND THEIR FACES WERE ABOUT 18 INCHES APART. FLT ATTENDANT HAD HER BACK TO ME AND PAX WAS FACING ME. I THEN SAW PAX STICK HIS TONGUE OUT AND BLOW THROUGH HIS MOUTH WHILE HIS TONGUE WAS STILL OUT. THE FLT ATTENDANT TURNED AROUND TOWARDS ME AND SHE SAID 'DID YOU SEE WHAT HE JUST DID? HE SPIT AT ME.' I DO NOT KNOW IF IT WAS TOWARDS ME OR JUST AT ANYONE IN THE CABIN. I DO NOT KNOW WHAT HAPPENED AFTER THAT. I CONTINUED ON WITH MY WORK. LATER IN THE FLT; THE FLT ATTENDANT CAME TO ME CRYING AND SAID 'I CAN'T BELIEVE ANYONE WOULD DO THAT TO ANOTHER PERSON -- TO SPIT IN THEIR FACE.' THE FO WAS THERE AND HE COMFORTED HER.
column125: A B777-200 FLT ATTENDANT WAS SPIT IN HER FACE BY A PAY DURING AN ATLANTIC OP.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model

column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: 5 MINS AFTER TKOF; A PAX WAS STANDING IN FRONT OF THE AFT LAVATORIES. I ASKED HER TO GO BACK TO HER SEAT AND SHE REFUSED TWICE. I UNDID THE SAFETY STRAP TO ALLOW HER TO USE THE LAVATORY. WHILE ENTERING THE LAVATORY; SHE KICKED THE DOOR TOWARDS MY KNEES BECAUSE I WAS STILL SITTING IN MY JUMP SEAT. I HELD THE DOOR BACK IN ORDER TO KEEP HER FROM CRUSHING MY LEGS. AFTER SHE CAME BACK FROM THE LAVATORY; SHE CAME TO ME AND FLT ATTENDANT #4 AND STARTED YELLING AT US. I NOTIFIED IMMEDIATELY FLT ATTENDANT #1 AND THE CAPT. THE PAX WAS MET BY POLICE AND CUSTOMER SVC AT ARR IN PHX. ALL 3 FLT ATTENDANTS FILLED OUT A PAX INFLT DISTURBANCE RPT.
column125: MD SUPER 80 CABIN ATTENDANT RPTS PAX REFUSED TO SIT WHEN REQUESTED DURING DEP AND ACTED WITH VERBAL OUTRAGE. PAX WAS ESCORTED OFF ACFT BY POLICE AFTER LNDG.

column96: Flight Crew Last 90 Days 15; Flight Crew Total 14600; Flight Crew Type 5200
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other FO Accused By Pax Of Drinking
column121: I RECEIVED A CALL FROM SCHEDULING REQUESTING ME TO FLY A FLT FROM PIT TO SDF TO COVER FOR A FO WHO DID NOT SHOW UP. I WAS 2 HRS FROM THE ARPT AND THE FLT WAS SCHEDULED TO LEAVE IN 45 MINS. I RUSHED TO THE ARPT; AND AS I STEPPED ON THE ACFT; A FEMALE PAX CONFRONTED ME AND DEMANDED TO KNOW IF I HAD BEEN DRINKING. I FIRMLY INFORMED HER I HAD NOT; AND BEGAN TO ENTER THE COCKPIT TO BEGIN WORK. SHE TRIED TO FOLLOW ME INTO THE COCKPIT; BUT THE FLT ATTENDANTS STOPPED HER AND TOLD HER TO SIT DOWN. IN THE FUTURE; IF CONFRONTED BY A PAX AGAIN ABOUT DRINKING; I SHALL REFUSE TO GET ON THE PLANE UNTIL OUR COMPANY GND SECURITY COORDINATOR CLRS ME.
column125: B737-300 FO WAS CHALLENGED BY A PAX OF DRINKING ALCOHOL PRIOR TO BOARDING ACFT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 6; Flight Attendant Total 6; Flight Attendant Type 30
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING THE CONVERGING BEVERAGE SVC FROM THE AFT BEVERAGE CART; I WAS APCHED FROM BEHIND BY PAX. AS I TURNED AROUND WITH A CUP OF COFFEE IN HAND; I ASKED PAX TO STEP BACK. HE TOLD ME HE HAD TO PASS THE CART. I TOLD HIM HE MUST FIRST STEP BACK SO I WOULDN'T SPILL THE COFFEE. HE REFUSED; INSISTING HE MUST PASS THE CART. SEVERAL PAX TRANSLATED THAT HE MUST STEP BACK. THEY IN TURN INFORMED ME HE HAD TO USE THE RESTROOM. I TOLD HIM HE MUST FIRST STEP BACK. HE BECAME VERY ANGRY AND RAISED HIS HANDS OVER HIS HEAD. AT THIS POINT; I TOLD HIM TO RETURN TO HIS SEAT. AGAIN PAX TRANSLATED FOR ME. THIS IS WHEN HE PUSHED ME ASIDE AND TRIED TO PASS. I THEN RAISED MY VOICE ALONG WITH PAX ASKING HIM TO SIT DOWN. PAX BEGAN TURNING AROUND. HE THEN RETURNED TO HIS SEAT. FLT ATTENDANT #2 ASKED ME IF I WERE OK AND SHE THEN INFORMED THE PURSER; WHO CALLED THE CAPT WHO MADE A PA TELLING PAX THAT HE WAS TO REMAIN SEATED; AND THAT TOUCHING A FLT ATTENDANT WAS NOT TO BE TOLERATED. THE POLICE MET THE FLT; SPOKE WITH PAX AND HIS WIFE AND THEN HE LEFT THE GATE AREA; NOT THINKING HE HAD DONE ANYTHING WRONG OR THAT HE SHOULD APOLOGIZE.
column125: B757 PAX BECAME ANGRY TOWARD CABIN ATTENDANT WHEN TRYING TO PASS CABIN ATTENDANT AND SVC CART FOR THE RESTROOM. OTHER PAX HELPED TRANSLATE CABIN INSTRUCTION FOR PAX TO RETURN TO SEAT UNTIL AISLE CLRED FOR HIS PASSAGE.

column28: Class A ZFW.A; Class E ZFW.E

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING TKOF; I OBSERVED 2 WOMEN IN SEATS X; Y; TURNING AROUND TO CONVERSE WITH 2 UNACCOMPANIED MINORS SITTING IN XX; YY. I THOUGHT IT A BIT ODD; AND I ALSO SAW PILLOWS GOING BACK AND FORTH BTWN THE 2 ROWS. NEXT THE OLDER UNACCOMPANIED MINOR RANG THE CALL BUTTON TO TELL ME THE WOMEN WERE BOTHERING THEM AND THEY WERE DRUNK. FURTHER THE OLDER UNACCOMPANIED MINOR TOLD ME THE YOUNGER ONE FELT THREATENED BY THEM; AND THEY HAD USED THE 'A' WORD TOWARD THEM. THE WOMEN WENT TO THE BATHROOM AND WHEN THEY CAME OUT I SPOKE WITH BOTH OF THEM TO FIND OUT THEIR SIDE OF THE STORY. THEY BLAMED IT ON THE BOYS; BUT THEY ALSO AFFIRMED THAT THEY HAD CALLED THEM THE 'A' WORD. THE WOMEN WERE VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO ME AND USED SEVERAL PROFANITIES; SEVERAL TIMES. I ADVISED BOTH PARTIES TO IGNORE THE OTHER AND AFTER THAT THERE WERE NO OTHER PROBS DURING THE FLT. THE WOMEN ONLY DRANK DIET COKES DURING THE FLT. THEY DID NOT APPEAR INTOXICATED DURING BOARDING. WHEN THEY SPOKE TO ME I DID SMELL ALCOHOL. THEY STATED THEY 'WERE 30 AND 40 YR OLD SISTERS JUST HAVING A GOOD TIME.'
column125: A FLT ATTENDANT RPTED ON THE STRANGE BEHAVIORAL ATTITUDE OF 2 WOMEN TOWARDS 2 UNACCOMPANIED MINORS ON AN MD80 ENRTE TO FLL; FL.

column121: ON MY WAY FROM FIRST CLASS TO COACH; THE MALE PAX IN BUSINESS CLASS; SEAT XY; ASKED ME; RUDELY; WITH NO 'PLEASE;' FOR A PILLOW AND BLANKET. I AVOID RUDE BEHAVIOR; SO I SIMPLY TOLD HIM THAT I WOULD SEE WHAT I COULD DO. IN COACH I FOUND A PILLOW AND A BLANKET AND ON MY WAY BACK TO FIRST CLASS; HANDED THEM TO PAX XY; WHO TOLD ME TO KEEP 'THAT BITCH THE BLANK AWAY FROM ME;' POINTING TO THE BUSINESS CLASS GALLEY AREA. I DECIDED TO IGNORE HIS COMMENT.
column125: A B767-300 FLT ATTENDANT RPT ON A RUDE PAX THAT USED FOUL LANGUAGE IN REFING ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT OR SVCS REQUIRED ON A FLT TO LEMD; FO.

column121: I HAVE ALREADY SENT IN MY ORIGINAL DETAILED RPT BUT TO RECAP; THE MALE PAX WAS SMOKING IN THE AFT R-HAND LAVATORY. I TOLD HIM IN SPANISH (HIS NATIVE LANGUAGE) THAT SMOKING IS PROHIBITED. AT FIRST HE DENIED SMOKING (AS THE SMOKE BELLOWED OUT OF LAVATORY) THEN HE SHOWED ME WHERE HE THREW THE CIGARETTE BUTT. IT WAS IN TRASH BIN UNDER SINK IN LAVATORY. I SHOWED IT TO THE CAPT AND HE FORWARDED MESSAGE.

column125: B767 LAX PAX JUST BEFORE DOOR CLOSURE WOULD NOT STOP USING CELL PHONE AFTER 3 PA ANNOUNCEMENTS AND 4 TIMES REQUESTED TO DO SO BY RPTING CABIN ATTENDANT. AFTER CAPT PERSONALLY SPOKE TO THE PAX HE FINALLY COMPLIED.

column121: PAX SUSPECTED OF SMOKING IN THE LAVATORY. I WAS INFORMED BY THE FLT ATTENDANT THAT A PAX HAD RPTED SOMEONE WAS SMOKING IN THE L AFT LAVATORY. FLT ATTENDANT #2 THEN KNOCKED REPEATEDLY ON THE LAVATORY DOOR AND GOT NO RESPONSE. SHE UNLOCKED AND OPENED THE DOOR FROM THE OUTSIDE AND THE PAX APPEARED TO BE WASHING ASHES DOWN THE WASH BASIN. HE AND THE LAVATORY SMELLED OF SMOKE. FLT ATTENDANT #2 WARNED PAX WHO THEN WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAR'S CONCERNING SMOKING. HE WAS COOPERATIVE AND STATED THAT HE WOULD COMPLY. PAX PROVIDED PERSONAL IDENT. CIGARETTE BUTT WAS LATER FOUND IN THE LAVATORY TRASH. THE NO SMOKING SIGN WAS ILLUMINATED DURING THE SMOKING INCIDENT.
column125: MD80 PAX DETECTED ANOTHER PAX SMOKING IN THE ACFT LAVATORY. HE RPTED THE SMOKING PAX TO THE FLT ATTENDANTS.

column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: TAXIING OUT; I MADE ANNOUNCEMENT FOR FLT ATTENDANTS TO BE SEATED FOR TKOF. SEAT BELT SIGN WAS ON. FLT ATTENDANTS ACKNOWLEDGED THEY WERE SEATED. AROUND 6TH IN LINE FOR TKOF. EVENTUALLY CLRED FOR TKOF. AS WE BEGAN TKOF ROLL; FLT ATTENDANT CALLED FLT DECK AND STATED THAT A FLT ATTENDANT AND SOME PAX WERE STANDING. I INFORMED THE CAPT. HE ELECTED TO CONTINUE THE TKOF. THE PEOPLE STANDING SAT IN LAPS OF SEATED PEOPLE OR HELD ON TO SOMETHING DURING TKOF. LATER IN CLBOUT; THE FORWARD FLT ATTENDANT ENTERED THE FLT DECK TO EXPLAIN WHAT HAPPENED. 2 PAX GOT OUT OF THEIR SEATS; ONE COULD NOT SPEAK ENGLISH; THE OTHER WAS IGNORANT OF WHAT THEY WERE DOING. FLT ATTENDANT TRIED UNSUCCESSFULLY TO SEAT THEM; THEN THE FLT DECK WAS CALLED. ENGLISH-UNDERSTANDING PAX WAS LATER TALKED TO ABOUT THEIR ACTIONS AND UNDERSTOOD THE LESSON LEARNED.
column125: B737 FLC HAS PAX STANDING DURING TKOF.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other UNDER AGED UM PAX
column119: Human Factors; Company Policy; Aircraft; Environment - Non Weather Related
column121: AFTER LNDG IN SCAMMON BAY; I OFFLOADED PAX AND BAGGAGE STARTING AT THE BACK OF THE AIRPLANE. I LOADED 1 PAX BEFORE OFFLOADING THE WINGS AND NOSE BAGGAGE FROM THE REST OF THE AIRPLANE. I BELIEVE THIS IS WHEN THE YOUNG BOY (3 YRS OLD) SNEAKED ON BOARD THE PLANE. WHEN DONE OFFLOADING; I PROCEEDED TO THE REAR OF THE PLANE. I STEPPED UP ON THE STEPS AND LOOKED UP AND DOWN THE AISLE. I DID NOT NOTICE THE CHILD IN THE SEAT; AS HE WAS BELOW MY LINE OF SIGHT. ALSO; MY VIGILANCE WAS DOWN BECAUSE I HAD ALREADY LOADED MY ONE NON-REVENUE PAX AND I SAW ONLY WHO WAS SUPPOSED TO BE ON THE PLANE. (THIS CHILD HAS IN THE PAST TRIED TO SNEAK ON BOARD AIRPLANES; ACCORDING TO THE PARENTS.) ONCE INSIDE THE AIRPLANE; I TURNED AROUND SO AS TO NOTE THE POS OF MY PAX. I THEN DID MY WT AND BAL. I ONLY SAW 3 PAX (NOT 4)! AFTER I LANDED IN BETHEL; AK; A LITTLE BOY JUMPED OUT OF THE PORT SIDE SEAT; SECOND ROW FROM THE REAR -- HE WAS BEHIND PAX Y. THEN 2 NON-REVENUE PAX ON BOARD AND I WERE AMAZED AS THIS WAS THE FIRST TIME WE SAW THIS PERSON. PAX Y SAID THAT BEFORE WE DEPARTED SHE HAD LOOKED BEHIND HER AND SAW NO ONE IN THE SEAT. THIS LEADS ME TO BELIEVE THAT THE CHILD WAS HIDING -- PURPOSELY TRYING TO AVOID DETECTION. BEFORE WE DEPARTED SCAMMON BAY; AK; I GAVE THE DEP BRIEF EXPLAINING THAT SEATBELTS MUST BE WORN AND HOW TO OPERATE THEM. IN THE FUTURE; I WILL JUST NEED TO BE MORE VIGILANT AND WALK UP AND DOWN THE AISLE BEFORE DEP. HOWEVER; THIS IS DIFFICULT IN A NAVAJO WHEN FULL WITH LARGE PAX -- THERE IS LITTLE ROOM IN THE AISLE.
column125: AN UNDER AGE UNMONITORED 3 YR OLD MALE STOWS AWAY ON A PA31-350 COMMUTER AT SCM; AK; NOT BEING DETECTED UNTIL FLT LANDS AT BET; AK.

column121: APCHING ATL FROM SW TOLD TO EXPECT RWY 27L. SUBSEQUENTLY CHANGED AND GIVEN ILS RWY 26R. NUMEROUS DEVS DUE TO TSTMS IN LCL AREA. APCH GAVE TURN TO 240 DEGS TO INTERCEPT LOC TO RWY 26R. CAPT PF NOTED IRREGULAR DEVS ON HIS CDI. FO LATE SWITCHING TO NEW LOC FREQ DUE TO USING WX RADAR. CAPT COMMANDED ON CDI DEVS AS FO SWITCHING TO LOC. CAPT'S CDI WENT TO FULL R DEFLECTION AND CAPT STARTED R TURN TO GO BACK. INTERCEPT VERIFIED BY FO'S CDI. AT THAT TIME; ATC DIRECTED FLT TURN TO 180 DEGS AND MAINTAIN 4500 FT DUE TO PASSING THROUGH LOC. SUBSEQUENT APCH WAS NORMAL. AFTER FLT; FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT ON APCH; A CELL PHONE WAS RINGING IN THE CABIN AND PAX ANSWERED CALL. SHE WAS UNABLE TO LOCATE WHICH PAX. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: WHILE ON THE INTERCEPT HDG; RPTR'S LOC NEEDLE SEEMED ERRATIC; LEADING HIM TO BELIEVE SOMETHING WAS WRONG WITH HIS RECEIVER. BY THE TIME THE FO'S ILS WAS TUNED IN; THEY HAD GONE THROUGH THE LOC. AT THAT POINT ATC; DUE TO THE WX AND THE HVY VOLUME OF TFC; ISSUED A GAR. NO FURTHER INFO REGARDING POSSIBLE CELL PHONE INTERFERENCE WAS FORTHCOMING.
column125: A B727-200 CREW; ON INTERCEPT HDG FOR AN ILS TO ATL; EXPERIENCED IRREGULAR LOC DEFLECTIONS ON THE CAPT'S CDI; RESULTING IN A CORRECTIVE VECTOR FROM ATC.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 16; Flight Attendant Total 16; Flight Attendant Type 95
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other PAX NON-COMPLIANCE DURING AN EMER. LNDG
column121: DURING AN EMER LNDG; A PAX REFUSED TO BRING HIS SEAT FORWARD; WAVED HIS HAND AT ME; SHUT HIS EYES; AND WENT BACK TO SLEEP. AS SOON AS THE WHEELS HIT THE GND; HE UNFASTENED HIS SEATBELT AND PUT HIS BAG IN THE AISLE. THE #7 FLT ATTENDANT ASKED HIM TO PUT HIS BAG AWAY AND FASTEN HIS SEATBELT. HE DIDN'T DO IT. THEN I ASKED HIM -- HE DID NOT COMPLY; YELLED AT ME IN PORTUGUESE AND PUT HIS BAG AWAY. I TOLD THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT; SHE TOLD THE CAPT; AND HE DECIDED WHAT TO DO FROM THERE.
column125: A B767-300 CABIN CREW; INVOLVED IN AN EMER; WERE CONFRONTED BY A PAX WHO REFUSED TO COMPLY WITH THE EMER PROCS.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Electronic Device; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: WHILE TAXING TO GATE AT JFK; RECEIVED CALL FROM BACK REGARDING IRATE FEMALE PAX. REQUESTED PORT AUTH POLICE MEET ACFT AT GATE. UPON GATE ARR; I WAS INFORMED THAT FLT ATTENDANT #3 WAS VERBALLY ASSAULTED BY A FEMALE PAX WHO WAS TOLD TO TURN OFF HER CELL PHONE. ACCORDING TO THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT; SHE COULD BE HEARD IN THE FRONT FROM APPROX ROW XO. I SPOKE TO POLICE WHEN DOOR WAS OPENED AND EXPLAINED SIT. THEY SPOKE TO THE WOMAN AND LET HER GO. NO PHYSICAL VIOLENCE WAS INVOLVED BUT THE FEMALE PAX MADE THREATS OF VIOLENCE. I THOUGHT IT BEST TO LET THE POLICE HANDLE IT.
column125: AN UNRULY PAX IS MET AT DEST BY LAW ENFORCEMENT.

column121: OUR ACFT WAS OPERATING WITH A DEFERRED AIR-CONDITIONING PACK. THEREFORE; THE WINDOW SHADES IN THE ACFT HAD BEEN PULLED DOWN TO SHADE THE CABIN. THE SIGNIFICANCE OF THIS IS THAT THE CABIN WAS DIM; YET 2 PAX SAT IN THE CABIN WITH DARK SUNGLASSES ON. THIS AROUSED THE SUSPICION OF THOSE IN THE CABIN. WHEN THE 2 PAX WENT INTO OUR SMALL ACFT LAVATORY TOGETHER INFLT; A 'PA ANNOUNCEMENT' WAS MADE FOR A SECOND TIME; SINCE THE SEATBELT SIGN HAD ALREADY BEEN ON; AND THE ANNOUNCEMENT TO REMAIN SEATED HAD ALREADY BEEN MADE. AFTER ABOUT 7 MINS; I INSTRUCTED THE FLT ATTENDANT TO OPEN THE BATHROOM DOOR TO FIND OUT WHAT WAS GOING ON IN THE LAVATORY; SINCE THE 2 PAX IN THE BATHROOM WOULD NOT RESPOND TO OUR CALLS TO RETURN TO THEIR SEATS. FINALLY; AS SHE WAS OPENING THE DOOR; THEY CAME OUT OF THE BATHROOM. STILL NEEDING TO KNOW WHY THE 2 OF THEM WERE IN THE BATHROOM AT AN INAPPROPRIATE TIME DURING THE FLT; I ASKED THE FLT ATTENDANT IF THE MAN IN THE BATHROOM APPEARED TO BE SEXUALLY AROUSED WHEN HE CAME OUT OF THE BATHROOM. SHE REPLIED THAT SHE HAD NOTICED THAT HE WAS. THIS COUPLE WAS CHARGED WITH DISORDERLY CONDUCT BY THE COMPANY. THE BOTTOM LINE IS: 1) A COUPLE HAD SEX IN OUR BATHROOM. 2) THEY WOULD NOT RESPOND TO OUR ANNOUNCEMENTS; AND 3) THEY INTERFERED WITH THE CREW DUTIES OF FLT ATTENDANTS WITH THEIR ACTIONS.
column125: FLC INSISTED THE CABIN WINDOW SHADES BE LOWERED BECAUSE OF A DEFERRED INOP PACK. THE CREW THEN SAW 2 PAX WITH THEIR SUNGLASSES ON. THE PAX THEN ENTERED THE ACFT LAVATORY TOGETHER.

column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other ACFT SECURITY CONCERN
column121: PAX #1 IN FIRST CLASS WITNESSED PAX #2 SAYING THINGS UNDER HIS BREATH EVERY TIME THE COCKPIT DOOR WAS OPENED. PAX SAID THINGS LIKE 'THOSE (VULGAR WORD) PLTS;' AND FINALLY SAID 'THERE'S GOING TO BE A BLOOD BATH ON THIS FLT.' PAX #1 MOVED TO THE AFT PART OF MAIN CABIN TO GET AWAY FROM HIM AND TOLD ME HE HAD BEEN SAYING THESE THINGS DURING THE WHOLE FLT. I CALLED THE CAPT. SECURITY MET THE FLT IN DFW. SECURITY QUESTIONED HIM AND HE CONTINUED ON TO HOUSTON.
column125: AN MD80 CABIN CREW; ENRTE EWR TO DFW; WERE CONFRONTED BY A PAX WHO WAS REPEATING; UNDER HIS BREATH; PHRASES NOT CONDUCIVE TO A SAFE FLT.

column96: Flight Crew Type 2230
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: THE PURSER CAME TO THE FLT DECK TO TALK ABOUT AN UNRULY PAX. HE SAID THE PAX HAD BEEN DRINKING FROM HER OWN CONTAINER AFTER SHE HAD BEEN CUT OFF BY THE FLT ATTENDANTS. SHE GRABBED A FLT ATTENDANT BY THE TIE AND PULLED HIM CLOSER TO HER. HE PUSHED HER HAND AWAY AND TOLD HER THAT SHE COULD NOT CONTINUE WITH THIS BEHAVIOR. SHE WAS ALSO TOLD THAT IF HER BEHAVIOR CONTINUED; THE ACFT WOULD BE MET BY THE AUTHS. I ASKED IF THE FLT ATTENDANT HAD BEEN INJURED. HE HAD NOT. IT WAS DECIDED TO HAVE CUSTOMER SVC REPRESENTATIVE SUPVR MEET THE FLT. DISPATCH WAS INFORMED. WHEN THE PURSER RETURNED TO THE CABIN; HE CALLED ME AND SAID THE PAX WAS OUT OF CTL. SHE WAS THROWING OBJECTS AT THE FLT ATTENDANTS AND HAD GRABBED A PAX BY THE TESTICLES. IT WAS DECIDED TO RESTRAIN THE UNRULY PAX. 4 UNITED STATES MARINES RESTRAINED THE PAX. 6 OTHERS HELPED. TOUCH-CUFFS WERE USED TO RESTRAIN THE PAX. I ENSURED THE CUFFS WERE APPLIED PROPERLY. 3 DOCTORS HELPED TO ENSURE THE PAX HEALTH. VALIUM WAS ADMINISTERED. THE FLT OPS MANUAL CHKLIST WAS USED. SATCOM WAS USED. CABIN USE OF SATCOM WAS DISABLED TO ENSURE UNINTERRUPTED FLT DECK USAGE. THE OTHER PAX WERE MOVED AWAY. DISPATCH AND THE FLT OPS MGR WERE PART OF THE PROCESS. BECAUSE THE EBBR GSC HAD CONCERNS ABOUT 5 MOROCCANS ON BOARD; THE MARINES GUARDED THE COCKPIT DURING THE DISRUPTION.
column125: B767 FLT ATTENDANT HAD AN UNRULY PAX THAT WAS DRINKING FROM HER OWN ALCOHOL SUPPLY AND HAD TO BE SEDATED BY ONBOARD MD PAX AND UNITED STATES MARINE PAX.

column95: Flight Crew Instrument; Flight Crew Multiengine; Flight Crew Commercial
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other PAX ATTEMPTED CREDIT CARD FRAUD
column121: PAX WANTED TO PURCHASE ALL PERFUMES AND LOTIONS FROM DUTY FREE CART (ABOUT $4500 WORTH). $500 ALLOWED ON EACH CREDIT CARD; COMPANY POLICY. HE SAID HE DID THIS QUITE FREQUENTLY. NO ONE ON THE CREW RECOGNIZED HIM. HE WAS A THROUGH PAX AT RJAA. WE CALLED DISPATCH TO VERIFY IDENT. DISPATCH SAID HE WAS OK -- A PLATINUM GOLD. WE THEN GAVE DISPATCH 4 OF HIS CREDIT CARD NUMBERS. FLT ATTENDANTS SOLD HIM THE GOODS ON 9 DIFFERENT CREDIT CARDS. DISPATCH CAME BACK 1 HR LATER AND SAID ALL THE CREDIT CARDS WERE BAD. WHAT TO DO. WE CALLED RJAA AND TOLD THEM OF THE SIT. THE POLICE WOULD NOT SHOW UP BECAUSE HE WAS A THROUGH PAX. WE DETAINED HIM ON THE PLANE AND HAD COMPANY SECURITY TALK TO HIM. HE RETURNED ALL THE ITEMS PURCHASED. THE FLT ATTENDANTS RESTOCKED THE CARTS. THE NEXT DAY; THE COMPANY SECURITY AGENT SAID HE HAD DONE THIS 9 TIMES AND 4 ON OUR ACR. THERE WAS A COMPANY RECORD; BUT IT WAS NOT AVAILABLE FOR SOME REASON. THE INFO ABOUT THIS GUY WAS RECORDED BUT NOT AVAILABLE TO US AS THE CREW. HE WAS A SECURITY RISK. HE SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN ALLOWED ON THE FLT. HIS HISTORY WAS NOT AVAILABLE TO THE DISPATCHER OR THE CREW. I QUESTION THE AVAILABILITY OF SECURITY INFO TO US; THE CREW. HOW MANY OTHER PAX DO WE CARRY THAT ARE A RISK AND WE AS THE CREW ARE NOT AWARE OF? THIS INFO NEEDS TO BE AVAILABLE TO THE PEOPLE RUNNING THE OP -- THE CREW.
column125: B777-200 CREW HAD A PAX THAT WAS ATTEMPTING TO PURCHASE HIGH VALUE DUTY FREE ITEMS WITH FRAUDULENT MULTIPLE CREDIT CARDS.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other BELIGERENT PAX
column121: JUST AFTER LEVELOFF; I WAS INFORMED BY THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT THAT SHE HAD A FIRST CLASS PAX WHO WAS ACTING INTOXICATED. HE WAS BELLIGERENT AND LOUD AND WANTED MORE DRINKS. SHE TOLD HIM HE COULD NOT HAVE ANY MORE ALCOHOL WHICH UPSET HIM. HE THEN STARTED MAKING VERBAL REMARKS TO HER EXPRESSING HIS ANGER. SHE THEN INFORMED ME OF THE SIT. I TOLD HER TO TELL PAX THAT I WOULD LAND AT THE NEAREST ARPT AND HAVE HIM REMOVED IF HE DID NOT COMPLY WITH HER REQUESTS. SHORTLY THEREAFTER; SHE INFORMED ME THAT SHE HAD THE SIT UNDER CTL AND SHE FELT COMFORTABLE CONTINUING TO DFW. WE HAD NO MORE TROUBLE WITH THE PAX FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FLT. FLT ATTENDANT WROTE UP A PAX MISCONDUCT RPT ON PAX AND SUBMITTED IT TO HER SUPVR. I HAVE HEARD NOTHING MORE ABOUT THE INCIDENT.
column125: A B757 CABIN CREW; ENRTE MROC TO DFW; WERE CONFRONTED BY A PAX WHO WAS ACTING INTOXICATED.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 27; Flight Attendant Total 27; Flight Attendant Type 100
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX LEFT HER SEAT BEFORE 30 MINS WERE UP AFTER LEAVING DCA. SHE SAT BACK DOWN WHEN ASKED TO BUT SOON AS THE 30 MINS TIME ELAPSED; SHE WENT IMMEDIATELY TO FIRST CLASS GALLEY AREA. I APCHED HER PUTTING MYSELF BTWN HER AND THE COCKPIT DOOR; AND ASKED HER TO GO TO THE BACK OF THE AIRPLANE TO STAND OR GO BACK TO HER SEAT. SHE COMPLAINED OF HER ASIATIC NERVE BOTHERING HER. SHE REFUSED TO GO; THEN ACCUSED ME OF ATTACKING HER. I CONTINUED TO INSIST SHE LEAVE THIS AREA. FINALLY; SHE TURNED TO LEAVE. I MOVED TO KEEP MYSELF BTWN HER AND THE COCKPIT DOOR. AS THE PAX STARTED BACK TOWARD COACH AND AS SHE GOT TO THE LAVATORY DOOR; SHE TURNED AND CAME AT ME; USING HER HEAD TO 'HEAD BUTT' ME; HITTING ME IN MY FOREHEAD AND NOSE -- HER SPITTLE SPEWING ALL AROUND MY MOUTH; HER BREATH IN MY MOUTH AS SHE SCREAMED 'BITCH.' I WAS MOMENTARILY STUNNED BUT DID NOT FALL.
column125: MD SUPER 80 PAX HEAD BUTTS CABIN ATTENDANT IN FOREHEAD WHEN ASKED TO LEAVE COCKPIT DOOR AREA.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 5; Flight Attendant Total 5; Flight Attendant Type 60
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other PAX AGGRESSION

column121: PAX WANTED TO USE FIRST CLASS LAVATORY. PAX WAS SITTING IN COACH. PAX APCHED FIRST CLASS GALLEY; REQUESTED USE OF LAVATORY. 1 PAX IN LAVATORY AND 1 WAITING IN FIRST CLASS GALLEY. I ADVISED PAX TO UTILIZE COACH LAVATORIES WHERE THERE WAS NO LINE. PAX INSISTENT ON UTILIZING FIRST CLASS LAVATORY. I REQUESTED PAX TO WAIT AT CABIN DIVIDER DUE TO PROCS OF NO CONGREGATING AT/AROUND COCKPIT. PAX EVENTUALLY UTILIZED FIRST CLASS LAVATORY. PAX RETURNED TO SEAT. ABOUT 3-4 MINS AFTER; WOMAN COMES CHARGING THROUGH COACH TO FIRST CLASS GALLEY; PUSHES ME AGAINST WALL AND BEGINS TO YELL AT ME REGARDING HER DAUGHTER HAVING TO WAIT TO UTILIZE LAVATORY. I ADVISED PAX TO TAKE HER HANDS OFF ME. I TOLD HER TO 'BACK OFF.' SHE TOOK HER HANDS OFF ME. SHE CONTINUED TO YELL AT ME; 'NEVER TO TREAT HER DAUGHTER LIKE THAT.' I TOLD HER TO BACK OFF AND TAKE HER SEAT. SHE TOOK HER SEAT. AUTHS MET ACFT UPON ARR.
column125: A FLT ATTENDANT RPT ON AN IRATE MOTHER WHOSE DAUGHTER HAD TO 'WAIT IN LINE FOR A LAVATORY' ON A FLT TO LGA; NY.

column121: FLT ATTENDANTS FROM BUSINESS CLASS SUSPECTED 1 OF 2 PAX OF SMOKING IN LAVATORY WHEN SMOKE WAS SMELT DURING FLT. LATER DURING THE FLT; SMOKE WAS SMELT AGAIN. FLT ATTENDANT #4 OPENED THE LAVATORY DOOR AND CAUGHT 1 OF THE SUSPECTED PAX WITH A LIT CIGARETTE IN HIS HAND. HE HAD BEEN ADVISED THAT HE WAS NOT PERMITTED TO SMOKE ON BOARD AND EVEN AFTER BEING CAUGHT RED-HANDED; HE CONTINUED TO DENY THAT HE WAS SMOKING. AUTHS MET THE FLT IN DFW AND HE WAS TAKEN INTO CUSTODY; STILL DENYING THAT HE HAD SMOKED. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 560752: COCKPIT CREW SMELLED SMOKE THROUGH VENTILATION SYS. THEY CALLED PURSER TO FIND SOURCE OF SMOKE. DALLAS POLICE ALONG WITH AIRLINE PAX SVC REPRESENTATIVES; MGR-ON-DUTY FROM FLT SVC; WERE PRESENT UPON ARR AT DFW.
column125: 2 FLT ATTENDANT RPTS RELATED TO A PAX CAUGHT SMOKING IN A REAR LAVATORY ON A B767-300 OVERWATER FLT TO DFW; TX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 4; Flight Attendant Total 8; Flight Attendant Type 80
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column119: Aircraft; Environment - Non Weather Related; Human Factors
column121: ON SEP/THU/02 DURING FLT; THE COCKPIT CALLED TO USE THE LAVATORY AND WAS TOLD BY #3 FLT ATTENDANT THAT IT WAS CLR FOR HIS USE. AS SOON AS THE COCKPIT DOOR WAS BEING OPENED; A PAX DIDN'T COMPLY WITH #3 FLT ATTENDANT'S REQUEST TO REMAIN SEATED UNTIL AFTER THE COCKPIT CREW USED THE FACILITIES. INSTEAD; THIS PAX PUSHED FLT ATTENDANT #3 OUT OF THE WAY AND WENT DIRECTLY TO THE LAVATORY. #3 FLT ATTENDANT HAD TO SHUT THE COCKPIT DOOR ON THE CAPT AND EXPLAIN WHAT HAPPENED. ZERO TOLERANCE FROM SUCH PAX SHOULD BE APPLIED FOR SAFETY AND SECURITY REASONS. THIS PAX WAS WRITTEN UP BY ME; BUT SHE NEEDS TO BE WARNED BY THE AIRLINES THAT SUCH BEHAVIOR WILL NOT BE TOLERATED AGAIN FOR SAFETY AND SECURITY REASONS. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: THE RPTR HAD BEEN SERVING IN THE REAR OF COACH JUST PRIOR TO THIS INCIDENT. SHE ADVISED #3 FLT ATTENDANT TO ADVISE THE CAPT OF THE SIT AND ASK FOR SECURITY AT DEST ARPT. SHE WAS NOT AWARE OF ANY OUTCOME OTHER THAN RPTED AS THE CREW HAD ALL 'MELTED AWAY' AFTER ARR AT LAX. RPTR HAD LECTURED THE PAX AND WAS TOLD THAT SHE DID NOT WANT TO DEAL WITH THIS ISSUE; AND THAT SHE WAS GOING TO RPT THE FLT ATTENDANT TO COMPANY.
column125: A FEMALE PAX PUSHES A MALE FLT ATTENDANT OUT OF HER WAY WHEN SHE TAKES PRECEDENCE OVER USING THE LAVATORY AS THE CAPT WAS EMERGING FROM THE COCKPIT FOR PERSONAL REASONS DURING CRUISE NE OF LAX; CA.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 5; Flight Attendant Total 6.5; Flight Attendant Type 95
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX SEATED IN XA HIT ME WITH HIS BAGS 2 TIMES DURING BOARDING. WHEN I SAID EXCUSE ME; HE LOOKED AT ME STRAIGHT IN THE EYES WITH A CHALLENGING STARE. WHEN THE CAPT SAID 'PREPARE FOR DEP;' HE STOOD UP AND WENT TO THE LAVATORY FOR APPROX 10 MINS. WHEN FLT ATTENDANT #4 KNOCKED ON THE DOOR; HE SCREAMED 'WAIT.' HE CAME OUT AND SAT DOWN. WHEN CAPT SAID 'PREPARE FOR TKOF;' THE PAX STOOD UP AGAIN (HE SAID HE NEEDED A BLANKET). HE HAD CROSSED WORDS WITH #4 FLT ATTENDANT AND I SAW HER TALKING TO HIM AND USING HER HANDS IN A VERY UPSETTING WAY. THAT'S WHEN I CALLED THE CAPT AND WE RETURNED TO THE GATE. WHEN HE CAME OFF; HE STARTED VERBALLY ABUSING THE AGENTS; THE SUPVRS; ALL IN FRONT OF THE CAPT. HE DIDN'T LOOK MENTALLY SANE. HE WAS A PROB SINCE BOARDING; AND I THINK THAT THE PROB WAS INCREDIBLY WELL HANDLED BY THE CAPT. HE DIDN'T HESITATE TO TURN THE PLANE AROUND; AND HE SUGGESTED THAT THIS PAX NOT FLY WITH THE AIRLINES ANYMORE. PAX THAT GIVE PROBS ON PLANES AND DISRUPT A FLT TO THE POINT OF TURNING AROUND AND TAKING THEM OFF THE ACFT; SHOULDN'T BE ALLOWED TO FLY WITH THAT CARRIER AGAIN. THAT'S WHAT SHOULD BE DONE FOR PAX TO REALIZE THAT BAD BEHAVIOR AND/OR ASSAULTING CREW MEMBERS OR PAX IS NOT GOING TO BE TOLERATED. THAT WAY; PEOPLE WILL BEHAVE.
column125: A PAX IS REMOVED AFTER HE HAD CREATED SOME LEVEL OF DISTURBANCE IN THE CABIN DURING A B757'S GATE AND TAXI PROCS AT MIA; FL.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 5; Flight Attendant Total 5
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX IDENTED HIMSELF AS A POLICE OFFICER; DEMANDING A FIRST CLASS SEAT. AS INSTRUCTED BY THE GATE AGENT; I ASKED HIM TO TAKE HIS ASSIGNED SEAT IN COACH. HE WAS A VERY INSISTENT PERSON AND ALWAYS MENTIONED THAT HE WAS AN OFFICER AND THAT HE COULD PROTECT THE COCKPIT. IN THE MIDDLE OF THE FLT; HE WAS CAUGHT SMOKING IN THE AFT LAVATORY BY 2 OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS. I ASKED HIM TO REFRAIN FROM ANY OTHER SMOKING AND GAVE HIM AN 'INFLT DISTURBANCE RPT.' HE WAS VERY UPSET AND KEPT SAYING HE WAS NOT SMOKING. BUT I PERSONALLY COULD SMELL HIS BREATH. UPON ARR; HE WAS DEMANDING SPECIAL SVC. HE SAID WE WERE LYING ABOUT THE WHOLE SIT. HE KEPT SAYING HE WAS A POLICE OFFICER; HE SHOWED A CARD FROM THE A POLICE DEPT; BUT HE DIDN'T PRESENT ANY BADGE. HE WAS YELLING AND SCREAMING AT THE ARR GATE. ALL FLT ATTENDANTS STEPPED OUT AND LEFT.
column125: A B757-200 CABIN ATTENDANT IN CHARGE RPTS A PAX IDENTING HIMSELF AS A POLICE OFFICER WHO DEMANDED A FIRST CLASS SEAT. ASSIGNED A COACH SEAT AND LATER FOUND SMOKING IN THE AFT LAVATORY.

column121: FEMALE PAX IN FIRST CLASS WAS AGITATED THROUGHOUT FLT. SHE GRABBED MY ELBOW AND DUG HER NAILS INTO MY ARM. SHE SAID I WAS ON A 'MISSION FROM HELL' AND HAD A BAD ATTITUDE. THE CAPT ATTEMPTED TO TALK TO HER AS SHE DEPLANED; AND SHE SCREAMED AT HIM ALL THE WAY UP THE JETBRIDGE. OVERALL; NOT A BIG DEAL.
column125: AN MD80 CABIN ATTENDANT RPTS A FIRST CLASS FEMALE PAX DISPLAYED AGGRESSIVE PHYSICAL AND VERBAL ABUSE.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 13; Flight Attendant Total 13; Flight Attendant Type 50
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX SEATED IN MAIN CABIN; XXA; VACATED SEAT TO USE AFT ACFT R-HAND SIDE LAVATORY TO SMOKE CIGARETTES. THE SCENT OF THE FUMES AND VISIBILITY OF LIGHT SMOKE TRIGGERED 2 FLT ATTENDANTS WHO WERE IN GALLEY NEXT TO LAVATORY; TO DETERMINE SOURCE. PAX WAS ISSUED REGULATORY WARNING AND VEHEMENTLY DENIED SIT AND THREATENED TO SUE; DESPITE BEING CAUGHT IN THE ACT.
column125: A B757-200 CABIN ATTENDANT RPTS DETECTING LIGHT SMOKE AND FUMES FROM THE R AFT LAVATORY AND DISCOVERED A PAX SMOKING.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 34; Flight Attendant Total 34; Flight Attendant Type 100
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: ENRTE TO NEW YORK; I WAS THE PURSER AND CALLED AND NOTIFIED BY INTERPHONE THAT A PAX HAD SMOKED IN THE AFT LAVATORY. I IMMEDIATELY WENT AFT AND FOUND HIM STANDING OUTSIDE LAVATORY AND ABOUT 4 FLT ATTENDANTS NEAR HIM. I INTRODUCED MYSELF AND ASKED HIM WHAT THE PROB WAS. HE SAID 'THEY (FLT ATTENDANTS) THINK I WAS SMOKING IN THE LAVATORY.' I ASKED HIM IF IT WAS TRUE AND HE DENIED IT AND SAID 'YOU CAN'T PROVE IT.' HE SMELLED OF SMOKE AND ALSO THE LAVATORY. I EXPLAINED THE RULES AND THE CONSEQUENCES FOR NOT COMPLYING. HE BECAME VERY ARGUMENTATIVE AND FINALLY ADMITTED AND SHOWED ME HIS CIGARETTES. I TOOK THEM AND TOLD HIM TO RETURN TO HIS SEAT; FASTEN HIS BELT AND REMAIN THERE. THE MALE FLT ATTENDANT REPEATED MY DIRECTIVE AND THE PAX SLOWLY RETURNED TO BUSINESS CLASS AND FELL ASLEEP. THIS PAX; I WAS INFORMED; HAD A NUMBER OF ALCOHOLIC DRINKS AND HIS SPEECH WAS SLOW AND A BIT SLURRED. IT WAS OBVIOUS THAT THE RULES DIDN'T APPLY TO HIM. AFTER THE INCIDENT; I ALSO LEARNED THAT THIS PAX WAS ANNOYED EARLIER BECAUSE HIS WIFE WAS IN COACH AND WE WOULDN'T JUST MOVE HER UP. HE ALSO ASKED IF HE COULD HAVE A PUFF AND WAS OBVIOUSLY TOLD NO. HE WAS NOT A CITIZEN AND DIDN'T MUCH CARE ABOUT OUR RULES. LATER; THE AIR MARSHALS INFORMED ME THAT IF HE WAS NOT A UNITED STATES CITIZEN THERE WAS NOTHING WE COULD DO TO FINE HIM OR PROSECUTE.
column125: B767-200 CABIN ATTENDANTS FOUND FOREIGN PAX HAD SMOKED IN LAVATORY AND WAS RESISTIVE TO BE SEATED. ALSO; SMELLED OF SMOKE AND ALCOHOL AND RESISTED BEING SEATED.

column121: ON FINAL APCH; RWY 14R ORD; FLT ATTENDANT NOTIFIED ME THAT A WOMAN WAS IN THE LAVATORY AND THAT SHE REFUSED TO RETURN TO HER SEAT. THE FLT ATTENDANT STATED THAT THE PAX WAS YELLING AT HER IN A COMBATIVE MANNER AND MAKING THREATENING REMARKS AND GESTURES. AT THIS TIME WE WERE ON SHORT FINAL. BECAUSE OF THE PAX'S APPARENT AGGRESSIVE BEHAVIOR AND MY DESIRE TO KEEP THE SIT FROM ESCALATING; I DECIDED TO LAND THE ACFT IMMEDIATELY; THUS ENSURING THE SAFETY OF MY PAX AND CREW. POLICE AND PARAMEDICS WERE CALLED.
column125: B737 CAPT LANDED ACFT WITH PAX IN LAVATORY. PAX WOULD NOT COOPERATE WITH CABIN ATTENDANT TO TAKE HER SEAT AND; INSTEAD; BECAME RUDE AND AGGRESSIVE IN A COMBATIVE YELLING MANNER.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other PAX GAVE THE APPERAANCE OF BEING INTOXICATED
column121: PRIOR TO BOARDING PAX; MY PURSER ADVISED ME THAT HE HAD BEEN ADVISED BY ONE OF THE LCL AGENTS THAT WE HAD A PAX WHO APPEARED TO BE INTOXICATED ATTEMPTING TO BOARD THE FLT. I ASKED THE PURSER AND THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT TO GO TALK TO THIS INDIVIDUAL AND SEE FOR THEMSELVES. THEY BOTH CAME BACK TO SAY THE PAX WAS INDEED INTOXICATED AND WAS OBVIOUSLY SO TO EVEN THE MOST CASUAL OBSERVER. HOWEVER; THEY STATED THE LEAD AGENT WISHED TO BOARD THIS PAX ANYWAY. I; THEREFORE; GOT UP; WENT OUT TO THE BOARDING LOUNGE AND ASKED TO SPEAK WITH THE LEAD AGENT. I EXPLAINED TO HER THAT FARS PROHIBITED THE BOARDING OF INTOXICATED INDIVIDUALS AND THAT THIS PAX IS NOT TO BOARD THIS FLT. I EXPLAINED THAT I TRUSTED IN THE ASSESSMENT FROM MY FLT ATTENDANTS AND THAT IT WAS NOT NECESSARY TO HAVE A BLOOD TEST TO DETERMINE DRUNKENNESS. HIS OBVIOUS APPEARANCE OF INTOXICATION WAS ENOUGH AND I REITERATED HE WAS NOT GOING TO FLY WITH US TODAY. LATER; DURING THE BOARDING PROCESS; MY FLT ATTENDANTS INFORMED ME THE INTOXICATED PAX WAS BOARDED ANYWAY; STUMBLING AND SLURRING HOW HE DID NOT THINK HE WOULD BE ABLE TO FIND HIS SEAT. I ASKED TO SPEAK WITH THE LEAD AGENT AGAIN. SHE EXPLAINED THIS TIME THAT SHE HAD SPOKEN WITH MGMNT AND THAT THEY HAD TOLD HER IT WAS ALRIGHT TO BOARD THIS INDIVIDUAL. I AGAIN EXPLAINED TO HER IT WAS NOT ALRIGHT WITH ME AND THAT WE WOULD NOT BE DEPARTING UNTIL HE WAS REMOVED. THE PAX WAS SUBSEQUENTLY REMOVED FROM THE AIRPLANE AND HIS CHKED BAG REMOVED FROM THE CARGO HOLD.
column125: A B737 CREW; WHILE AT THE GATE IN MROC; WERE INFORMED BY THE PURSER THAT A PAX; WHO APPEARED TO BE INTOXICATED; WAS ATTEMPTING TO BOARD THE FLT. THE CAPT HAD THE PAX AND HIS BAGS REMOVED FROM THE ACFT.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX STARTED PROBS ON GND MAKING DEMANDS FOR HIS PERSONAL COMFORT AND WAS FIGHTING WITH EMPLOYEES FROM THE BOARDING TO DEPLANING IN ORD. HE YELLED; LUNGED AT FLT ATTENDANTS; WHINED AND COMPLAINED THE ENTIRE FLT. HE SMOKED IN THE LAVATORY ON 2 OCCASIONS THAT I KNEW ABOUT. HE WALKED AROUND THE ENTIRE FLT; SCARED PAX NEAR HIM; FOUGHT WITH THE CAPT WITH HIS MOUTH INFLT AND AFTER LNDG IN ORD. 'IT WAS ALL ABOUT HIM.' HE OFFENDED EVERY EMPLOYEE; BROKE ALL THE RULES; SCARED PAX; DISRUPTED THE ENTIRE FLT; STOPPED US FROM DOING OUR DUTIES 25% OF THE FLT. WE DID A GOOD JOB. HE JUST WANTED TO BE TROUBLE SO WHAT ELSE COULD WE DO BUT RPT HIM? NO ONE WAS HURT; BUT HE DIDN'T CARE ABOUT ANYONE BUT HIMSELF. YOU TELL ME -- WHAT ARE WE TO DO WITH NUTS LIKE HIM?
column125: B777 CABIN ATTENDANT RESTR FROM HER DUTIES DUE TO UNRULY PAX AFTER BOARDING AND THROUGHOUT THE FLT. PAX SMOKED AT LEAST TWICE IN THE LAVATORY.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WAS CAUGHT SMOKING IN THE AFT LAVATORY. FLT ATTENDANTS CONFRONTED HIM WITH THE PROB. PAX BECAME UPSET; DENIED SMOKING. DEMANDED ANOTHER DRINK. FLT ATTENDANTS REFUSED. PAX WANTED EVERYONE'S NAME. THREATENED THE PURSER. FB WAS ABLE TO CALM PAX DOWN. FLT CONTINUED TO MAD. ACR SECURITY MET THE FLT ON ARR. PAX WAS DEBRIEFED BY STATION PERSONNEL. DID NOT SEEM TO DO ANY GOOD. SUGGEST THAT THIS PAX BE BARRED FROM ANY FURTHER FLTS ON ACR.
column125: B767 PAX SMOKED IN LAVATORY AND BECAME VERY UPSET OVER RESTR AND UNABLE TO HAVE AN ALCOHOL DRINK.

column121: PAX FOUND TO BE SMOKING IN LAVATORY. SHE AND HUSBAND DRINKING ALSO. SHE COMPLIED WHEN TOLD TO STOP. SINCE THEY WERE CONNECTING NOTIFIED AGENTS THEY WERE COMING TO THEIR FLT ALSO.
column125: MD-S80 PAX SMOKING IN LAVATORY.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other PAX CAUGHT SMOKING IN LAVATORY. WAS REQUIRED TO SHOW PHOTO ID TO CREW
column121: AFTER THE INITIAL BEVERAGE SVC IN COACH AND DURING THE CRUISE PHASE OF FLT; A MALE PAX EXITED THE AFT L LAVATORY AND FLT ATTENDANTS AND PAX IMMEDIATELY SMELLED SMOKE. FLT ATTENDANTS CHKED THE LAVATORIES; SMELLED CIGARETTE SMOKE IN THE AFT L LAVATORY AND CHKED FOR FIRE. FLT ATTENDANT #2 POURED CLUB SODA INTO THE TRASH RECEPTACLE IN CASE OF SMOLDERING PAPER. FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THE INCIDENT VIA INTERPHONE TO THE CAPT. I APCHED THE PAX IN QUESTION AND TOLD HIM THAT WE HAD A RPT OF SUSPECTED SMOKING IN THE LAVATORY. HIS CLOTHING AND BREATH SMELLED OF CIGARETTE SMOKE. HE NEITHER DENIED NOR ADMITTED SMOKING; BUT AGREED NOT TO SMOKE ON BOARD. AT THAT TIME I GAVE HIM A VERBAL WARNING. HE WAS COMPLIANT. THE CAPT NOTIFIED US THAT WE WERE REQUIRED TO FILL OUT AN INFLT DISTURBANCE RPT REGARDING THE INCIDENT. I AGAIN APCHED THE MALE PAX AS FLT ATTENDANT #2 STOOD NEARBY. I INFORMED HIM THAT FARS REQUIRE THE FILING OF A RPT REGARDING THE SUSPECTED SMOKING IN THE LAVATORY AND THAT I WAS REQUIRED TO OBTAIN HIS PHOTO IDENT FOR HIS NAME AND ADDRESS. HE DENIED SMOKING INFLT AND EXPLAINED THAT HE HAD BEEN USING A FLAME TO BURN OFF THREAD FROM HIS SHIRT SLEEVE WHILE IN THE LAVATORY. I EXPLAINED THAT BURNING THREADS WOULD NOT RESULT IN THE STRONG ODOR OF CIGARETTE SMOKE. HE AGREED BUT WAS RELUCTANT TO GIVE ME HIS IDENT. I EXPLAINED THAT IF HE DID NOT GIVE ME HIS IDENT AS REQUESTED; THE CAPT WOULD CALL AHEAD TO LGA AND THE PROPER AUTHS WOULD MEET THE FLT AND OBTAIN HIS IDENT AT THAT TIME. I INFORMED THE PAX THAT HE WAS SUBJECT TO PROSECUTION FOR FAILURE TO ADHERE TO FAA REGS. HE GAVE ME HIS IDENT AND I FILLED OUT THE DISTURBANCE RPT AND GAVE HIM THE LOWER HALF OF THE TOP (WHITE) COPY. A FEMALE PAX WITNESSED THE FORM. FLT ATTENDANT #2 SERVED AS A SECOND WITNESS. WE WERE WELL INTO DSCNT INTO LGA BY THIS TIME; SO I INFORMED THE CAPT OF OUR SUCCESS IN OBTAINING THE NECESSARY INFO. WE REVIEWED THE FORM AFTER ARR IN LGA. I KEPT THE YELLOW FLT ATTENDANT COPY AND THE CAPT TOOK THE REMAINING COPIES OF THE FORMS TO THE AGENT WORKING THE FLT. SUBSEQUENTLY; A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE COMPANY'S FLT SERVICE OBTAINED COPIES OF THE RPT FROM THE CAPT.
column125: MD80 PAX WAS CAUGHT SMOKING INFLT IN THE ACFT LAVATORY.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other COACH PAX AND SEAT MATE MOVED THEMSELVES TO FIRST CLASS. REFUSED TO RETURN TO COACH
column121: THE PURSER CHKED PAX SEATING MANIFEST; AND IT WAS REVEALED THAT PAX HAD MOVED TO FIRST CLASS. PLENTY OF SEATS; FEW PAX. PURSER NOTIFIED CAPT AND DID TALK WITH PAX AND HIS SEAT MATE WHOM THE PAX STATED 'THEY WERE TALKING BUSINESS.' CAPT WAS PERSISTENT IN RPTING THE INCIDENT. PAX'S SEAT MATE SAID THEY (PAX IN QUESTION) NEEDED TO TALK; NO HARM DONE; BAD JUDGEMENT BY PAX AND HIS SEAT MATE. THE PAX IN QUESTION DID NOT MOVE BACK TO COACH; SO CAPT RPTED BOTH 'THE' PAX AND HIS SEAT MATE UPON ARR IN DALLAS.
column125: MD80 FLT ATTENDANTS HAD 2 COACH PAX MOVE THEMSELVES INTO FIRST CLASS. THE PAX REFUSED TO RETURN TO COACH WHEN ASKED.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other SECURITY CONERN
column121: PAX X DISRUPTED CABIN PAST 1500 FT IN ASCENT TO FL330. PAX X HAD TAKEN AN INFLT PILLOW; RIPPED IT OPEN AND STARTED THROWING DEBRIS FROM THE PILLOW INTO CABIN. THIS SPARKED CONCERN TO THE CABIN CREW DUE TO THE FACT THAT DISRUPTION POSES A POTENTIAL FOR DISTR TACTIC IN LIEU OF A HIJACKING. IN AN EFFORT TO ISOLATE EVENTS AND EVALUATE ACTIVITY; I INTERVENED. AFTER CAREFUL ASSESSMENT OF INCIDENT; I CONCLUDED THAT ACTIVITY IN QUESTION DID NOT WARRANT DIVERSION. SIT HAD BEEN ISOLATED AND CTLED. LATER; PAX X REQUESTED A PAIR OF SCISSORS AND DID NOT GIVE REASON FOR REQUEST. PAX Y HAD TAKEN A PILLOW CASE AND PLACED IT OVER HIS HEAD LIKE A CLANSMAN. THE DISRUPTION WAS CONSISTENT AND CONSTITUTED LEVEL 1 THREAT. INFORMED CAPT AND REQUESTED LEO AND CUSTOMER SVC AGENT TO MEET FLT UPON ARR TO GATE. SIT WAS UNACCEPTABLE AND HAS THE POTENTIAL TO PRESENT CLR AND PRESENT DANGER TO PAX AND CREW. ATTORNEY GENERAL HAD STATED NOT TO TAKE ANY THREAT; NO MATTER HOW SMALL; LIGHTLY. HAD THERE BEEN A POTENTIAL HIJACKER OR TERRORIST ON BOARD; THESE EVENTS COULD HAVE BEEN EXPLOITED AND TAKEN ADVANTAGE OF.
column125: 2 PAX EXHIBITING STRANGE BEHAVIOR LEADS TO A DOMESTIC FLT BEING MET BY LAW ENFORCEMENT ON ARR.

column121: UPON CLRING RWY AND TAXI IN TO GATE AT OAK; I NOTIFIED BY THE FLT ATTENDANT THAT A MAN HAD BEEN SMOKING MARIJUANA IN THE FORWARD LAVATORY. AT THE TIME I HAD JUST ENTERED TXWY W OFF OF TXWY Y. I SLOWED MY TAXI SPD AND IMMEDIATELY NOTIFIED OAK OPS THAT A PAX HAD BEEN SMOKING MARIJUANA IN THE FORWARD LAVATORY. TOLD OPS TO HAVE SECURITY MEET US AT THE GATE; AND NOT TO HAVE THE JETWAY MEET THE ACFT UNTIL SECURITY ARRIVED. ONCE THE JETWAY WAS PULLED TO THE ACFT; I HAD THE INDIVIDUAL COME OFF THE ACFT AND HE WAS ARRESTED BY OAKLAND POLICE DEPT. SUBSEQUENT SEARCH OF THE PAX FOUND MARIJUANA ON THIS PERSON. I HAD THE OPS SUPVR SEARCH THE AREA HE WAS SITTING AND THE FORWARD LAVATORY FOR ANY CONTRABAND. NOTHING WAS FOUND. I TALKED WITH THE FLT ATTENDANTS AND THEY FELT OK TO CONTINUE THE NEXT FLT. THE CREW BRIEFED THE DUTY CHIEF PLT CONCERNING THE INCIDENT.
column125: A B737-500 FLC ADVISES THEIR GND OPS OFFICER THAT A PAX ON BOARD THEIR FLT HAD BEEN SMOKING MARIJUANA PRIOR TO LNDG AT OAK.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 11; Flight Attendant Total 19; Flight Attendant Type 90
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A PAX; DURING BOARDING; DECIDED TO REMOVE HIS PANTS AND SHIRT AND CHANGE INTO SWEATS OR PAJAMAS. I ASKED PAX TO USE THE LAVATORY TO CHANGE. HE SAID THAT THEY WERE BOTH OCCUPIED. I ASKED HIM IF THERE WAS A RUSH AND COULD HE NOT WAIT UNTIL ONE WAS VACANT. HE TOLD ME I SHOULD BE LOOKING! I TOLD HIM THAT WHEN A PAX DROPS HIS PANTS ON BOARD; A LOT OF PEOPLE ARE GOING TO BE LOOKING AND HE SHOULD USE THE LAVATORY. HE IGNORED ME AND STANDING IN HIS BVD'S PROCEEDED TO PUT HIS THINGS AWAY. HE SEEMED TO TAKE THE WHOLE THING AS TO BE NORMAL AND MY ADMONISHMENT OF HIS BEHAVIOR A BIG JOKE. THIS IS THE FIRST CLASS CABIN; A PUBLIC PLACE. I DID NOT FIND THE SIT AMUSING NOR TASTEFUL AND I REQUESTED THAT REMARKS BE PLACED IN THE PAX R-TEXT SO THAT SPECIAL SVCS WOULD BE AWARE OF PAX BEHAVIOR. PAX NEEDS TO KNOW THAT HIS DISPLAY WAS IMPROPER AND HIS LACK OF RESPECT FOR OTHERS WAS EVIDENT. HE ALSO NEEDS TO KNOW THAT NOT COMPLYING WITH A FLT ATTENDANT REQUEST IS SERIOUS.
column125: B777 CABIN CREW HAS DISORDERLY PAX DURING BOARDING AT JFK.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model

column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other Coach Pax Sat in 1st Class
column121: A PAX SAT IN FIRST CLASS WHEN BOARDING BEGAN. HE HAD A COCKTAIL BEFORE DEP AND A COCKTAIL IMMEDIATELY AFTER TKOF. SHORTLY AFTER THE BEVERAGE SVC; I REALIZED I HAD 1 TOO MANY PAX IN FIRST CLASS. I ASKED TO SEE HIS BOARDING PASS; WHICH HE GAVE ME AFTER A LITTLE PRODDING; AND IT SAID 27F. I ASKED HIM TO TAKE THE CORRECT SEAT; AT WHICH TIME HE TOLD ME THE AGENT SAID THAT HE COULD SIT IN FIRST CLASS. I ONCE AGAIN TOLD HIM THAT HIS SEAT NUMBER WOULD HAVE REFLECTED THAT. HE THEN TOLD ME HIS BROTHER WAS AN EMPLOYEE; AND I ASKED HIM 1 MORE TIME TO TAKE HIS CORRECT SEAT. HE LEFT FIRST CLASS; BUT BECAME MOUTHY WITH A FLT ATTENDANT IN THE MAIN CABIN. HE WAS UPSET THAT I HAD 'KICKED HIM OUT' OF FIRST CLASS AND WAS AFRAID HIS BROTHER WOULD LOSE HIS TRAVEL PRIVILEGES. HE WAS ON A NON-REFUNDABLE TICKET; AND WE LATER FOUND OUT HIS BROTHER WORKS FOR ANOTHER AIRLINE. I ASKED THE CAPT TO LET ME IN THE COCKPIT; AND I DESCRIBED THE EVENTS. HE WAS BELLIGERENT AT THAT TIME; BUT I WANTED TO GIVE HIM A 'HEADS UP.' I DON'T THINK THAT ALCOHOL SHOULD BE SERVED DURING THE CURRENT CONDITIONS OF THE AIRLINES OR OUR NATIONAL SECURITY. HE WAS MET BY THE AGENT; AND THE CAPT SPOKE TO HIM ON THE GND ABOUT HIS BEHAVIOR. THE AGENT SAID THEY PUT REMARKS IN HIS PNR. HE WAS FINE ON LNDG; AND WAS ACTUALLY EXCITED TO SPEAK TO THE CAPT; BECAUSE HE THOUGHT I WAS AT FAULT.
column125: MD-80 FLT ATTENDANTS HAD A COACH PAX THAT SAT DOWN IN THE FIRST CLASS CABIN. HE RESISTED WHEN ASKED TO RETURN TO COACH.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 14.5; Flight Attendant Total 14.5; Flight Attendant Type 98
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Inflight Event / Encounter Weather / Turbulence; Other Pax Noncompliance With Directive
column121: PAX REFUSED TO SIT IN HER SEAT WITH HER SEATBELT FASTENED DURING TURB AND ANY TIME THE SEATBELT SIGN WAS ON. PAX INSISTED ON SITTING ON THE FLOOR IN FRONT OF HER SEAT; FACING AFT WITH HER SEATBELT AROUND HER BACK. PAX CAUSED A MAJOR DISTURBANCE. COULD NOT UNDERSTAND WHY IT WASN'T SAFE TO SIT ON THE FLOOR AND SAID SHE'S FLOWN THIS WAY FOR 3 1/2 YRS. WHEN A PHONE CALL WAS MADE TO THE CAPT ABOUT THE SIT AND THE PAX WAS TOLD TO SIT IN HER SEAT OR SOMEONE WOULD MEET THE FLT; PAX SOBBED LOUDLY IN HER SEAT. PAX SVC AND OUR CAPT TALKED TO THE PAX AFTER WE ARRIVED BUT SHE STILL DIDN'T SEEM TO UNDERSTAND THE IMPORTANCE OF SITTING IN HER SEAT WITH HER SEATBELT FASTENED WHEN THE SIGN IS ON.
column125: A PAX DOES NOT UNDERSTAND THE IMPORTANCE OF COMPLYING WITH THE CREW'S DIRECTIVES TO USE THE SEATBELT WHEN REQUIRED.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 16; Flight Attendant Total 16
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other Pax Restrained with had cuffs.
column121: A FEMALE PAX IN MAIN CABIN CAME TO BUSINESS CLASS GALLEY AND TOLD ME AND FLT ATTENDANT #4 THAT THE MAN NEXT TO HER WAS RUBBING HER FACE AND BREAST WHILE SHE SLEPT. WHEN SHE WOKE UP; HIS HANDS WERE ON HER BODY AND SHE WAS FREAKED OUT. I KNEW WE HAD 1 BUSINESS CLASS SEAT OPEN; SO I MOVED HER THERE TO GET HER AWAY FROM HIM. AFTER WE MOVED HER; HE KEPT GETTING UP TO LOOK FOR HER. FLT ATTENDANT #2 AND PURSER CUFFED HIM. WE CONTINUED TO WATCH HIM IN SHIFTS UNTIL WE LANDED. THE MALE PAX THREATENED TO KILL THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT IF HE GOT FREE. HE WAS DRUNK AND SMOKING BEFORE HE WAS RESTRAINED. 2 DEADHEADING PLTS HELPED IN THE SIT AS WELL.
column125: B767-300. FEMALE PAX WAS SEXUALLY ASSAULTED BY A MALE PAX SEATED NEXT TO HER ON AN INTL FLT.
