column119: Environment - Non Weather Related; Human Factors; Weather
column121: VALLEY APCH HAD VECTORED US TO THE LOC FOR THE ILS RWY 13 APCH INTO MILLER INTL ARPT. THE ATIS WAS RPTING 400 FT OVCST; VISIBILITY 5 MI. THE APCH PROCEEDED NORMALLY. THE APCH CHKS AND BEFORE LNDG CHKS HAD BEEN ACCOMPLISHED AND UPON PASSING THE MARKER; A DSCNT WAS INITIATED. DURING THIS LEG; THE CAPT WAS FLYING THE ACFT. AS I RECALL; VALLEY APCH HANDED US OFF TO MCALLEN TWR WELL INSIDE OF THE MARKER. AS WE WERE RECEIVING THE HDOF; A PAX LEANED FORWARD IN TO THE CABIN AND BEGAN 'TAPPING' ME ON THE SHOULDER. I MOVED ONE SIDE OF MY HEADSET AWAY FROM MY EAR TO FIND OUT IF A PROB EXISTED AND REMINDED THE PAX TO REMAIN SEATED AS WE WERE ABOUT TO LAND. (PRIOR TO THE INTERRUPTION AND APCH PHASE; THE SEAT BELT SIGN WAS ON AND CABIN AND PAX VERIFIED CLR AND READY FOR LNDG.) DURING THE PAX INTERRUPTION; THE CAPT'S ATTN WAS ALSO MOMENTARILY DIVERTED AND HE MOTIONED FOR THE PAX TO REMAIN SEATED. THE PAX DISTR OCCURRED APPROX 500-600 FT ABOVE MINIMUMS. AFTER DEALING WITH THE PAX; OUR ATTN RE-FOCUSED ON THE APCH. IN A MATTER OF SECONDS; THE RWY BECAME VISIBLE; A FINAL CHK WAS COMPLETED; THE RWY WAS CONFIRMED CLR AND WE LANDED. AFTER CLRING THE RWY; WE WERE UNABLE TO RECEIVE MCALLEN TWR ON FREQ; SO WE SWITCHED TO GND. GND ADVISED US; WE HAD LANDED WITHOUT A CLRNC; SO THE CAPT CALLED THE TWR AFTER UNLOADING THE PAX. THE CAPT EXPLAINED A PAX INTERRUPTION HAD TAKEN PLACE DURING THE MOMENTS WE WERE SWITCHING FREQS. THE TWR EXPLAINED HE WAS TRYING TO CONTACT US WITHOUT ANY REPLY. THE CAPT APOLOGIZED FOR US AND SAID WE WOULD NOT LET HAPPEN AGAIN. BEYOND THE PAX INTERRUPTION; WE COULD NOT EXPLAIN HOW THE HDOF WAS MISSED. ANOTHER OF OUR COMPANY ACFT HAD LANDED AHEAD OF US AND EXPLAINED THEY HAD HEARD THE TWR TRYING TO CONTACT US WITHOUT A REPLY. THEY ALSO MENTIONED THEY HAD TURNED UP THE VOLUME TO BETTER HEAR THE CTL TWR. THE CAPT AND I RETURNED TO THE ACFT; DISCUSSED THE EVENT AND TRIED CONTACTING THE TWR AND GND ON OUR #1 COM. BOTH FREQS WORKED FINE AND WITHOUT PROBS THE REMAINDER OF THE DAY. AT NO POINT DURING THE APCH DID THE ACFT DEVIATE FROM THE LOC OR GS AS OUR PRIMARY ATTN WAS ON ACFT CTL. HOWEVER; FOR A MOMENT; BOTH MY THOUGHT PROCESS AND ROUTINE; AS WELL AS THE CAPT'S; WERE DISTR ENOUGH THAT NEITHER OF US REALIZED WE HAD NOT CONTACTED THE TWR. IN DISCUSSING THE EVENT WITH THE CAPT; WE REALIZE THAT AT SUCH A CRITICAL POINT IN THE APCH IT MAY BE NECESSARY TO IGNORE REQUESTS FROM PAX UNTIL THE CRITICAL PHASE OF FLT IS COMPLETED. WE FURTHER REVIEWED THESE EVENTS WITH OUR COMPANY'S CHIEF PLT.
column125: DURING AN ILS APCH TO RWY 13 WITH A 400 FT CEILING; AN LJ35 FLT CREW LANDS WITHOUT LNDG CLRNC AT MFE; TX.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Smoke / Fire / Fumes / Odor
column121: AS I DID SAFETY CHKS IN MAIN CABIN; I SMELT CIGARETTE SMOKE 3/4 WAY BACK. I LOOKED UP AND NOTICED A GENTLEMAN COMING OUT OF AFT R SIDE MAIN CABIN LAVATORY. WENT INTO LAVATORY AND SMELLED STRONG CIGARETTE SMOKE. I CALLED CAPT AND DISCUSSED WHAT ACTION I SHOULD TAKE. WE DECIDED IT WOULD BE BEST TO APCH THE GENTLEMEN I SAW COMING OUT OF THE LAVATORY; BECAUSE HE SMELLED WITH HVY CIGARETTE SMOKE. WHEN I SPOKE TO THIS PERSON ABOUT SMOKING IN THE LAVATORY; HE SAID THAT HE LIT THE CIGARETTE; THEN NOTICED THE 'NO SMOKING' SIGN AND PUT THE CIGARETTE OUT IN THE SINK. HE DID NOT APPEAR TO THINK WHAT HE DID WAS VERY SERIOUS AND THIS CONCERNED ME. SO I WROTE THE INCIDENT UP ON AN ACR PAX RPT. THE RPT ASKS FOR PAX INFO INCLUDING DRIVER'S LICENSE NUMBER AND WITNESSES. AFTER I EXPLAINED THE SERIOUSNESS OF THIS INCIDENT TO THE GUILTY PAX; AND INFORMED HIM OF THE RPT I WAS REQUIRED TO FILL OUT; HE TOOK IT SERIOUSLY AND APOLOGIZED. I WAS THE ONE IN THE CREW THAT WANTED TO PURSUE THE RPT BECAUSE I KNEW THIS PAX WOULD DO THIS AGAIN AND USE THE SAME EXCUSE. NEXT TIME IT COULD CAUSE PROBS AND WE MIGHT NOT BE SO LUCKY. I ALSO CHKED THE LAVATORY TRASH TO MAKE SURE HIS CIGARETTE BUTT WAS COMPLETELY OUT AND NOT SMOKING IN THE TRASH CAN
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A PAX SMOKED IN THE LAVATORY DURING A RELATIVELY SHORT FLT FROM LAX TO DFW.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 15.5; Flight Attendant Total 15.5
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WELCOMED A FEMALE AND MALE PAX ON BOARD WHO SEEMED VERY UPSET. I ASKED THE AGENT IF THERE WAS A PROB. HE SAID THAT THEY DID NOT HEAR THE GATE CHANGE ANNOUNCED 1 1/2 HRS EARLIER. THEREFORE; THEY HAD TO RUSH TO OUR GATE TO MAKE DEP. HE SAID THEY WERE VERY UPSET! THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT ASKED ME TO MAKE A FINAL PA TO STOW LUGGAGE FOR DEP. SO I DID. THE FEMALE PAX (WHO LAST BOARDED) TURNED AROUND AND MOUTHED TO ME 'F___ OFF.' I CHOSE TO IGNORE THIS RUDE COMMENT TO AVOID ANY FURTHER CONFRONTATION. LATER IN THE FLT; THE #4 FLT ATTENDANT TOLD ME HOW RUDE THIS COUPLE WAS. THEY WERE VERY UPSET THAT PAX WERE SITTING IN THEIR SEATS AND TOLD HER TO GET THEM NEW SEATS! FLT ATTENDANT #4 CLRED AN ENTIRE ROW FOR THEM. SHE ALSO 'COMP'ED' THEM 2 FREE HEADSETS AND 2 FREE DRINKS. (IN AN EFFORT TO CALM THEM DOWN.) I HAD NO FURTHER CONTACT WITH THESE 2 PAX. AT DEPLANING; THEY ASKED TO SPEAK TO THE CAPT AND MYSELF. THEY SAID I WAS RUDE AND RECEIVED NO CUSTOMER SVC. THE CAPT ASKED WHAT CUSTOMER SVC THEY DIDN'T RECEIVE. SHE SAID I TOLD HER TO SIT HER 'A__ DOWN;' THEN CORRECTED HERSELF. SHE ALSO DID NOT DENY TELLING ME TO 'F___ OFF.' THE CAPT SAID 'LET'S DEPLANE;' SO WE DID. IN THE TERMINAL; SHE GOT IN MY FACE AND STARTED TO VERBALLY ABUSE ME IN FRONT OF MY COCKPIT CREW. I ASKED HER TO STEP AWAY; THAT IT IS A FEDERAL OFFENSE TO ABUSE A CREW MEMBER. SHE PROCEEDED TO SAY; 'BRING IT ON!' I TOLD HER THAT IF SHE DID NOT STEP AWAY FROM MY FACE; I WOULD CALL THE AUTHS AND HAVE HER ARRESTED. HER HUSBAND GRABBED HER ARM AND PULLED HER AWAY FROM ME. THAT'S WHEN I WALKED AWAY FROM HER. SHE CONTINUED TO YELL THAT SHE WOULD HAVE MY JOB. OBVIOUSLY; THIS WOMAN WAS HAVING A BAD DAY AND CHOSE ME TO VENT ON!
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT WAS CONFRONTED BY AN IRATE COUPLE AFTER DEPLANING IN DEN.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 4; Flight Attendant Total 5; Flight Attendant Type 20
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX BECAME EXTREMELY AGITATED DURING SEATBELT COMPLIANCE CHK. DID NOT RESPOND WHEN ASKED IF SEATBELT WAS FASTENED. HAD BLANKET ON LAP. BELT HAD SEVERAL INCHES OF 'SLACK' TO SIDE OF BELT AND DID NOT APPEAR TO BE FASTENED. FLT ATTENDANT LIFTED CORNER OF BLANKET TO CHK SECURITY OF SEATBELT. PAX YELLED 'DON'T TOUCH ME; LEAVE ME ALONE.' 'YOU ARE DISCRIMINATING AGAINST ME -- I'M NOT MENTALLY RETARDED.' ATTEMPTED TO CALM PAX AND EXPLAIN I WAS JUST CHKING TO BE SURE BELT WAS FASTENED BECAUSE RIDE WAS BECOMING BUMPY. PAX LATER CAME TO BACK GALLEY; STILL VERY AGITATED STATING SHE WAS FILING A DISCRIMINATION RPT. OTHER PAX OFFERED THEIR NAMES AND PHONE NUMBERS TO FLT ATTENDANT. DISCUSSED WITH CAPT WHO REQUESTED INFLT DISTURBANCE RPT BE ISSUED.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT; AFTER DEPARTING MIA DURING A SEATBELT COMPLIANCE CHK; A PAX BECAME COMBATIVE AFTER THE RPTR ATTEMPTED TO VISUALLY CHK HER BELT.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 14; Flight Attendant Total 14; Flight Attendant Type 70
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX SUSPECTED OF SMOKING IN THE LAVATORY. (BECAUSE OF A SMOKY SMELL AFTER HE LEFT THE LAVATORY.) WHEN CONFRONTED BY #2 FLT ATTENDANT HE HAD BEEN SMOKING AND GAVE HIS IDENT TO FLT ATTENDANT TO FILL OUT INFLT DISTURBANCE RPT. PAX WAS COOPERATIVE AND NO FURTHER ACTION WAS NECESSARY. (COCKPIT CREW HAD BEEN ADVISED AND ALERTED GND PERSONNEL BEFORE OUR ARR.)
column125: AN MDS80 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A SMOKING PAX ACTUALLY TOOK RESPONSIBILITY FOR HIS ACTIONS DURING A FLT FROM LGA TO FLL.

column96: Flight Crew Last 90 Days 75; Flight Crew Total 12000; Flight Crew Type 2000
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Electronic Device; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Illness / Injury
column121: ADVISED DURING CRUISE ABOUT A PAX WITH A MEDICAL SIT; SHORT OF BREATH AND AGITATED. HE BECAME MORE AGITATED WHEN FLT ATTENDANT ASKED ABOUT DEVICE HE HELD IN LAP WITH A BREATHING MASK ATTACHED. HE WAS ILLOGICAL AND REFUSED DETAILS ABOUT DEVICE WHICH TURNED OUT TO BE A NEBULIZER FOR ASTHMATICS. PHONE PATCH TO DISPATCH AND MEDICAL PROFESSIONAL DECIDED SAFE TO CONTINUE MEDICALLY. HOWEVER; DISPATCH INTERFACE WITH MEDICAL INDICATED NEBULIZER; DEPENDENT ON TYPE MAY NOT BE LEGAL TO BE ON BOARD AND USED. PAX WAS SOMEWHAT BELLIGERENT; DIDN'T KNOW ASSIGNED SEAT AS IT WAS A LIGHT HOLIDAY LOAD. HE SAID HE GOT IT THROUGH SECURITY AND ESSENTIALLY IT WAS NOW OK. HE DIDN'T NEED TO DISCLOSE ANYTHING. CONCERN WENT FROM MEDICAL FOR PAX AS HE HAD NOW CALMED DOWN TO HIS POSSIBLY CONNECTING IN ORD WITH SAME DEVICE. ASSURED MY DISPATCHER THAT FLT WOULD BE MET TO ASCERTAIN HIS FURTHER FLT STATUS ON COMPANY. REMINDED ENRTE TO HAVE FLT MET. CALLED ON GND TO HAVE PLANE MET; AND NO ONE MET FLT! FOLLOW UP TO DISPATCH INDICATES THAT THE 'ZONE CTLR' WHO HE SPOKE TO DROPPED BALL AS HE WAS 'CARVING A TURKEY.' PAX WAS NOT CONTINUING ON. SUPVR EVENTUALLY SHOWED UP WITH NO KNOWLEDGE OF EVENTS AND TOOK OVER AFTER I HAD TO CONFRONT PAX. NO SUPPORT WHEN NEEDED. CUSTOMER SVC WAS UNABLE TO DETERMINE HIS IDENTITY AND PAX LEFT ARPT. CUSTOMER SVC MET US LATE. THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE. DISCREPANCY BTWN CUSTOMER SVC AND MEDICAL AS TO WHETHER NEBULIZER IS LEGAL. VERY DISAPPOINTED IN SUPPORT WE RECEIVED. ARE WE RUNNING AN AIRLINE OR A RESTAURANT? PLEASE CLARIFY. WAS RELUCTANT TO DECLARE A SECURITY THREAT; BUT DURING EVENT; IT CAME TO LIGHT THAT ASTHMA PROBS WERE LIKELY TO MAKE AN INDIVIDUAL VIOLENT AND IRRATIONAL. LACK OF SUPPORT FOR CREW IS ABHORRENT. NEXT TIME; I'LL BE INCLINED TO MAKE IT A SECURITY THREAT IF THAT'S WHAT IT TAKES TO ASCERTAIN AN INDIVIDUAL'S IDENT AND GET SOME SUPPORT FROM CUSTOMER SVC; HOLIDAY OR NOT.
column125: A B757 CAPT WAS CONCERNED ABOUT A MEDICAL DEVICE THAT WAS BEING CARRIED BY AN UNCOOPERATIVE PAX AND EXPRESSED DISMAY WHEN CUSTOMER SVC FAILED TO RPT TO HIS FLT AFTER LNDG.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 5; Flight Attendant Total 8; Flight Attendant Type 10
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING MY FINAL WALK-THRU; THE PAX AT THE BULKHEAD SEAT IN COACH; SEAT XX; HAD A BISTRO BAG AND A MANILA ENVELOPE ON THE FLO0OR IN FRONT OF HIM. I TOLD HIM HE HAD TO PICK ALL OF IT UP. HE REPLIED; 'I'VE BEEN WAITING FOR YOU; I'VE GOT A TIME BOMB.' HE STOPPED AND SAID; 'I SHOULDN'T HAVE SAID THAT; I DIDN'T MEAN IT.' I TOLD HIM; 'YOU SHOULDN'T HAVE SAID THAT.' I WENT BACK TO THE FIRST CLASS GALLEY AND TOLD THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT. I THEN WENT BACK AND LOOKED IN THE BAG. (IN HINDSIGHT I REALIZE I SHOULDN'T HAVE DONE THAT.) THE BAG ONLY HAD THE CONTENTS OF THE BISTRO BAG. I NOTIFIED THE CAPT AND HE TOOK THE FLT BACK TO THE GATE. HE NOTIFIED AUTHS. WHEN WE GOT TO THE GATE; THE POLICE MET THE PLANE AND REMOVED THE PAX AND HIS BAGGAGE IN THE OVERHEAD AND IN THE CARGO COMPARTMENT. ONCE THAT WAS TAKEN CARE OF; WE PROCEEDED ONTO ORD. CALLBACK CONVERSATION WITH RPTR REVEALED THE FOLLOWING INFO: RPTR ADVISED PAX WAS 'UNDER AGE' AND SECURITY ADVISED THAT PARENTS WOULD BE CALLED. NO OTHER INFO HAS BEEN RECEIVED SINCE THE INCIDENT.
column125: PAX RESPONDS TO FLT ATTENDANT WHEN TOLD TO CLEAN UP PAPER CONTAINER AND PLAN FOR TKOF; 'I'VE GOT A TIME BOMB.' ACFT RETURNED TO GATE AND PAX REMOVED.

column96: Flight Attendant Total 8
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column118: Flight Crew Diverted; General Physical Injury / Incapacitation
column121: APPROX 15 MINS INTO OUR FLT; WHILE PASSING OUT CUSTOM FORMS AFT FORWARD WITH THE SEATBELT SIGN ON; I STOPPED AT ROW X AND NOTICED A CHILD WAS NOT BUCKLED IN. AS THE MOTHER PUT HER SEATBELT ON THE CHILD SHE BEGAN TO CRY. I KNELT DOWN TO SPEAK TO THE CHILD. AT THIS POINT I WAS PUNCHED IN MY BACK. I STOOD UP AND TURNED AROUND AND ASKED THE PERSON LYING DOWN IF SHE HAD HIT ME. SHE DID NOT RESPOND; SO I LIFTED THE BLANKET FROM HER HEAD AND REPEATED 'EXCUSE ME MISS; BUT DID YOU HIT ME?' SHE ROSE UP AND PUNCHED ME AGAIN IN THE CHEST. I STEPPED BACK IN SHOCK. FLT ATTENDANT #2 CAME WALKING VERY FAST UP THE AISLE ASKING; 'WHY DID SHE HIT YOU?' I TOLD HIM I DID NOT KNOW. I TOLD THE PAX THAT SHE WAS OFF THE PLANE. I WALKED UP TO THE FIRST CLASS GALLEY TO INFORM THE PURSER OF THE INCIDENT. HE ASKED ME IF I WANTED HER OFF THE PLANE. I SAID YES. HE CALLED THE CAPT AND TOLD HIM A FLT ATTENDANT WAS HIT TWICE AND THAT WE WANTED TO GO BACK TO MIAMI. AFTER HE HUNG UP; THE PAX CAME UP TO THE FIRST CLASS GALLEY. SHE APOLOGIZED AND SAID THAT 'I AM VERY TIRED. I HAVE NOTHING AGAINST YOU SO PLEASE FORGIVE ME. I DID NOT KNOW WHAT I WAS DOING.' I TOLD HER THAT SHE COULD NOT JUST HIT SOMEONE BECAUSE SHE WAS TIRED. SHE THEN ASKED FOR SOMEONE WHO SPOKE SPANISH. THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT CAME UP TO SPEAK TO HER AND HE THEN ASKED IF WE WANTED HER TO BE SEATED. THE PURSER SAID YES AND THAT HE HAD ALREADY ASKED HER TO SIT DOWN; WHICH OF COURSE SHE IGNORED. THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT TOLD HER AGAIN TO BE SEATED. THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT SAID THAT HE HAD SEEN HER HIT ME TWICE AND THAT HE COULD NOT BELIEVE IT. HE THEN WENT TO THE BACK OF THE PLANE. I ASKED THE PURSER IF WE WERE GOING BACK TO MIAMI; WHY HADN'T THE CAPT MADE AN ANNOUNCEMENT? THE PURSER THEN MADE A PA AND THEN THE CAPT MADE HIS ANNOUNCEMENTS ADVISING THE PAX TO STAY SEATED AFTER WE LAND. THE PURSER MADE A SECOND ANNOUNCEMENT; SOMETHING TO THE EFFECT THAT IT WAS NOT A MECHANICAL PROB. AS I WALKED TO THE BACK GALLEY THE PAX SITTING IN ROW Y GAVE ME SUCH A HATEFUL LOOK. COMPANY SECURITY AND OUR CAPT COULD NOT HAVE BEEN MORE WONDERFUL. I THINK THEY HANDLED THE SIT VERY PROFESSIONALLY. I WAS QUESTIONED BY MIAMI DADE SEVERAL TIMES; COMPANY SECURITY; THE FBI AND; BY PHONE; I SPOKE WITH THE ASSISTANT DISTRICT ATTORNEY; WHO INFORMED ME CRIMINAL INTENT WAS VERY HARD TO PROVE. UNFORTUNATELY; OUR MARKET IS WELL KNOWN TO FLT ATTENDANTS AS ONE WHERE PAX TEND TO BE VERY NONCOMPLIANT AND DISRESPECTFUL TO CREW MEMBERS. I WAS TOLD BY THE FBI AND THE DA THAT THIS WOMAN WILL BE BLACK LISTED FROM EVER FLYING ON MY COMPANY AGAIN. I HOPE MY COMPANY WILL HOLD TO THAT PROMISE.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT; SHORTLY AFTER DEPARTING MIA; SHE WAS SLUGGED TWICE BY THE SAME PAX. THE CAPT RETURNED TO MIA TO OFFLOAD THIS PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 33; Flight Attendant Total 33; Flight Attendant Type 20
column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A FEMALE PAX ASKED TO SPEAK PRIVATELY WITH THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT AND ME IN THE BACK OF THE ACFT. SHE WAS SEATED IN XAB. SHE RPTED TO US THAT THE MAN NEXT TO HER HAD BEEN CURSING; MUTTERING; AND SAYING '**** THE AMERICANS' AT WHICH TIME ANOTHER PAX TOLD HIM 'HE SHOULDN'T TALK LIKE THAT.' SHE RPTED THAT PAX ALL AROUND HIM WERE CONCERNED AND UPSET BY HIS BEHAVIOR. THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT CALLED THE COCKPIT. THE PAX TOLD THE PLTS OF HER CONCERNS. THE ACFT RETURNED TO THE GATE. I HEARD; LATER; THAT THE MAN'S BROTHER WAS IN FIRST CLASS. HE DEPLANED WITH THE MAN WHEN HE WAS REMOVED. APPARENTLY; THE OFFENDING PAX HAD ALSO BEEN POPPING PILLS AND POUNDING HIS FIST INTO HIS PALM. PERHAPS THE INDIVIDUAL IS SUFFERING MENTAL ILLNESS.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THE AGGRESSIVE AND PROFANE LANGUAGE OF A PAX CAUSED THE CAPT TO RETURN TO THE GATE AT BOS AND OFFLOAD THE PAX AND HIS BROTHER WHO WAS SITTING IN FIRST CLASS.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12; Flight Attendant Total 12; Flight Attendant Type 25
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE DURING BOARDING. SHE WAS ANGRY BECAUSE HER SEAT WAS IN AFT OF ACFT. SHE ORDERED ME TO DO SOMETHING ABOUT HER SEAT. SHE WAS IRRATIONAL AND HOSTILE. I WAS BUSY WITH MY OWN PREFLT DUTIES AND TOLD HER SHE STILL HAD TIME TO TALK TO AGENT. THIS COMMENT FROM ME IRRITATED HER EVEN MORE. SHE BECAME EVEN MORE IRRATIONAL AND HOSTILE. I ASKED MY CO-WORKER TO TALK TO HER. PAX STILL IRRATIONAL AND ANGRY. SHE NEEDED SEATBELT EXTENSION. WHEN THIS WAS HANDED TO HER; SHE THREW IT BACK AT US. MY CO-WORKER AND I DECIDED THIS PAX MUST BE REMOVED. WE GOT THE AGENTS INVOLVED AND CAPT. ALL SPOKE TO HER. PAX REFUSED TO SHOW IDENT OR BOARDING PASS. THE NAME SHE GAVE US WAS NOT FOUND ON AGENT'S PAPERWORK. IN SPITE OF THIS; SHE WAS ALLOWED TO STAY ON BOARD BY AGENTS AND PLTS. PAX THREATENED TO SUE COMPANY BECAUSE SHE WAS OBESE AND WE WERE DISCRIMINATING BECAUSE OF HER WT. WE BELIEVE SHE WAS A NON-REVENUE PAX.
column125: AN F100 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A PAX WHO WAS HOSTILE DURING BOARDING; WHOSE NAME COULD NOT BE VERIFIED; WHO REFUSED TO SHOW HER IDENT; WHO REFUSED TO PRODUCE A BOARDING PASS; WAS ALLOWED TO STAY ON THE ACFT BY THE GATE AGENT AND CAPT.

column96: Flight Crew Last 90 Days 200; Flight Crew Total 16000; Flight Crew Type 400
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Illness / Injury; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FLYING FROM LHR TO IAD; OUR FLT WAS DELAYED 20 MINS TO ACCOMMODATE 2 LATE ARRIVING PAX; A YOUNG MAN (WHO WAS BOTH MENTALLY AND PHYSICALLY DISABLED); AND HIS FATHER. ABOUT 1 HR INTO THE FLT; THE PURSER CAME INTO THE COCKPIT AND TOLD THE CAPT ABOUT THIS YOUNG MAN; AND SAID THAT HE WAS 'VIOLENTLY FLAILING ABOUT IN HIS SEAT; STRIKING; SPITTING AND BLOWING HIS NOSE ON THE MAN WHO WAS SITTING NEXT TO HIM.' THE MAN WHO WAS BEING ASSAULTED; ASKED THE FLT ATTENDANTS IF HE COULD BE MOVED TO ANOTHER LOCATION. THE FLT WAS COMPLETELY FULL; SO THE PURSER ASKED THE CAPT IF THIS MAN COULD USE ONE OF THE FLT ATTENDANT JUMPSEATS. FOR THIS MAN'S SAFETY; AND BECAUSE OF THE BODILY FLUIDS INVOLVED; THE CAPT TOLD THE PURSER THAT THIS MAN COULD MOVE TO A FLT ATTENDANT JUMPSEAT; AS LONG AS HE RETURNED TO HIS ASSIGNED SEAT FOR THE LNDG. THE CAPT WAS UNAWARE OF ANY RESTRS REGARDING THE FLT ATTENDANT JUMPSEAT; SINCE THIS ISSUE IS NOT ADDRESSED IN OUR FLT MANUAL. IN ADDITION; SEVERAL OF THE PAX IN THE IMMEDIATE AREA OF THIS DISABLED MAN; WERE ANNOYED BY HIS BEHAVIOR; AND WERE VERBALLY ABUSIVE TO THE DISABLED MAN'S FATHER; AND TO THE FLT ATTENDANTS. THEY ALL EVENTUALLY WENT TO SLEEP; AND THE MAN (WHO SAT ON THE FLT ATTENDANT JUMPSEAT); RETURNED TO HIS ASSIGNED SEAT FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FLT. THE FLT LANDED SAFELY AT IAD. THIS INCIDENT COULD HAVE BEEN AVOIDED IF WE HAD A DESIGNATED SEAT LOCATION FOR SUCH DISABLED INDIVIDUALS. FOR EXAMPLE; IF THIS DISABLED PERSON HAD BEEN SEATED BEHIND A BULKHEAD; AND NEXT TO THE WINDOW; WITH HIS FATHER BTWN HIM AND THE OTHER PAX; HIS IMPACT ON THE OTHER PAX WOULD HAVE BEEN MINIMIZED.
column125: A B747-400 CAPT RPTED THAT A MENTALLY AND PHYSICALLY DISABLED PAX DISTURBED OTHER PAX DURING A FLT FROM LHR TO IAD. THE RPTR MADE A GOOD SUGGESTION ABOUT THE SEATING ARRANGEMENTS FOR SUCH PAX.

column96: Flight Crew Last 90 Days 210; Flight Crew Total 6150; Flight Crew Type 910
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: CAPT AND I WERE WORKING ON A FUELING PROB ON THE JETWAY. FLT ATTENDANT CAME ON THE JETWAY AND SAID THAT SHE NEEDED ME TO TAKE CARE OF A VERBALLY ABUSIVE PAX. PAX CONTINUED WITH HIS COMPLAINING AND THE USE OF PROFANITY DIRECTED AT MYSELF AND AT MY COMPANY. I CALMLY EXPLAINED THE SIT TO HIM; BUT THIS DID NOT CALM HIS DEMEANOR. AFTER TAKING CARE OF OUR FUELING ISSUE; WHICH REQUIRED US TO TOTALLY UNLOAD ALL OF THE FUEL ON THE ACFT; THE CAPT AND I; ALONG WITH THE STATION MGR; DISCUSSED THE COURSE OF ACTION TO TAKE REGARDING THIS PAX. AFTER TALKING TO THE FLT ATTENDANT AGAIN; WE COLLECTIVELY DETERMINED THAT THIS WAS; WITHOUT A DOUBT; A 'SAFETY OF FLT' ISSUE AND THAT WE MUST HAVE HIM REMOVED FROM THE TERMINAL PRIOR TO HIM BOARDING; BY LAW ENFORCEMENT. I FULLY SUPPORT THE FLT ATTENDANT'S ANALYSIS OF THE SIT SINCE PAX EXHIBITED THIS SAME BEHAVIOR TO ME. THIS INCIDENT HAD THE POTENTIAL TO ESCALATE INTO AN EVENT WHICH WOULD INTERFERE WITH A CREW MEMBER'S ABILITY TO PERFORM REQUIRED DUTIES.
column125: AN A320 FO RPTED THAT AN ABUSIVE PAX HAD TO BE REMOVED BY LAW ENFORCEMENT BEFORE PUSHBACK.

column94: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12; Flight Attendant Total 24
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING BOARDING AT LGB; FLT ATTENDANT #3 NOTICED THAT BOTH PAX IN FIRST CLASS ROW HAD PETS; AND THAT THEY WERE OUT OF THEIR CAGES. HE THEN ADVISED THEM OF THE RULES AND ASKED THEM TO PLEASE COMPLY; AND THEY SAID THAT THEY WOULD. PRIOR TO DEP; I HAD A FEW MINS; SO I TOOK MY MEAL PREFERENCES FORWARD TO AFT. WHEN I GOT TO THEIR SEATS; I NOTICED THAT THE DOGS WERE STILL OUT; SO I ADVISED THEM ONCE MORE. THEY SAID 'OK; I KNOW!' I WALKED AWAY ASSUMING THEY WOULD COMPLY AFTER THE SECOND REQUEST. DURING THE NEXT 1 1/2 HRS; BOTH OF US ASKED THEM SEVERAL MORE TIMES TO PLEASE PUT THEM AWAY. THEY NEVER DID! I EVEN TOLD THEM THAT I ALSO HAD DOGS AND LOVED THEM; BUT IT WAS JUST THE RULES. HE BECAME IRATE AND STARTED YELLING THAT HE BOUGHT FIRST CLASS TICKETS INSTEAD OF COACH JUST SO HE COULD KEEP THEM OUT! I EXPLAINED TO HIM VERY POLITELY THAT IT DID NOT MATTER WHICH CABIN HE WAS IN. I THEN FIRMLY TOLD HIM TO PUT THEM IN THE CAGES NOW! HE SAID; 'OH; SO YOU'RE JUST GOING TO STAND THERE AND WATCH ME?' I SAID; 'YOU HAVE 5 MINS;' AND WALKED AWAY. APPROX 30 MINS LATER; THE #3 FLT ATTENDANT NOTICED THAT BOTH PETS WERE STILL OUT OF THE CAGES. HE THEN ADVISED ME THAT HE WAS GOING TO FILL OUT THE PAX DISTURBANCE RPT; ISSUE THE WARNING; AND GET THE CAPT INVOLVED. AS FLT ATTENDANT #3 ISSUED THE WRITTEN WARNING TO MR X; I APCHED AND STOOD BESIDE THEM. MR X THEN BECAME VERY ANGRY AND DEFIANT. HE STARTED YELLING; 'LAND THE PLANE; I DON'T CARE WHAT YOU DO!' AFTER ASKING FOR COMPLIANCE IMMEDIATELY; MR X WADDED UP THE WARNING AND THREW IT. HE THEN YELLED TO ME; 'STEWARDESS; GET AWAY FROM ME NOW!' AFTER DISCUSSING THE PROB WITH THE CAPT; WE DETERMINED THAT THIS WAS NO LONGER A DOG ISSUE; BUT A NON COMPLIANCE AND INTERFERING WITH FLT CREW ISSUE. THIS PAX WAS NOT GOING TO COMPLY WITH ANY REQUEST WE HAD OF HIM; INCLUDING SAFETY RELATED REQUESTS THE REST OF THE FLT! I THEN APCHED MR X AGAIN AND TRIED TO EXPLAIN THE SEVERITY OF THE NON COMPLIANCE PROB OF WHICH THE CAPT AND I HAD JUST DISCUSSED. HE DID NOT WANT TO LISTEN; AND TOLD ME TO GET OUT OF HIS FACE! AFTER INFORMING THE CAPT OF MR X'S REACTION; HE TOLD ME HE WOULD HAVE THE POLICE MEET THE FLT IN NEW YORK. EVEN THOUGH MR X WAS NON COMPLIANT AND TOOK OUR FOCUS OFF OF ALL OTHER PAX AND POTENTIAL PROBS; BOTH THE #3 FLT ATTENDANT AND MYSELF MANAGED TO STAY PROFESSIONAL AND COURTEOUS TO ALL; THE ENTIRE FLT! UPON ARR AT JFK; THE CAPT MET AND ESCORTED BOTH PAX OFF THE ACFT AND INTO THE JETBRIDGE WHERE THE PORT AUTH AND NYC POLICE WERE WAITING. I STAYED AT THE ACFT DOOR WHILE THE REST OF THE CREW WENT TO THE GATE AREA. I THEN GAVE THE POLICE AND STATION MGR A COPY OF THE DISTURBANCE RPT AND ANSWERED SOME QUESTIONS. AFTER ABOUT 30 MINS; THE CAPT TOLD ME HE WAS HANDLING IT NOW AND NOT TO WORRY. HE THEN TOLD ME IT WAS OK TO LEAVE FOR MY LAYOVER.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT 2 PAX REFUSED TO KEEP THEIR DOGS IN THEIR KENNELS UNDER THEIR SEATS IN FIRST CLASS.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 15; Flight Attendant Total 15; Flight Attendant Type 4
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I DID NOT WITNESS ACTUAL INCIDENT; BUT HEARD #4 ASK PAX TO TURN OFF CELL PHONE AS WE WERE PUSHING BACK. PAX 'FLIPPED OFF' #4 FLT ATTENDANT AND DID NOT COMPLY. WE RETURNED TO GATE. PAX VERY MOUTHY; LOUD AND DISRUPTIVE WHEN AGENTS CAME TO REMOVE HER; PHYSICALLY AGGRESSIVE. WITNESSES INFORMED #4 FLT ATTENDANT SHE HAD BEEN DRINKING IN BOARDING LOUNGE.
column125: AN MDS80 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A PAX REFUSED TO TURN OFF HER CELL PHONE; WHICH RESULTED IN THE CAPT'S RETURNING TO THE GATE AND DEPLANING THE NON COMPLIANT PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 32; Flight Attendant Total 32; Flight Attendant Type 100

column121: PAX MADE TRIP TO LAVATORY DURING SECURITY LOCKDOWN AFTER TKOF FROM WASHINGTON NATIONAL ARPT. PAX FELT THE 30 MIN PERIOD WAS OVER AND HE WAS ALLOWED TO USE THE RESTROOM. WHEN HE WAS INFORMED THAT THE CAPT HAD NOT INFORMED THE PAX IT WAS SAFE AND 'OK' TO BE UP IN THE CABIN; HE ARGUED WITH THE FLT ATTENDANT. HE PERSISTED TO ARGUE WITH HER; TAKING HER AWAY FROM HER INFLT DUTIES. THIS WAS WITNESSED BY PAX. LATER IN THE FLT; THIS GENTLEMAN WROTE A NOTE TO APOLOGIZE FOR HIS BEHAVIOR -- STILL INSISTING THAT HE HAD A RIGHT TO BE UP IN THE CABIN. THE CAPT WAS INFORMED OF THE SIT AND MADE THE DECISION TO HAVE THE FLT MET BY THE AUTHS.
column125: AN MDS80 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED TO THE CAPT THAT A PAX GOT UP TO USE THE LAVATORY BEFORE THE 30 MINS HAD EXPIRED AFTER DEPARTING DCA.

column121: PAX IN FIRST CLASS WOULD NOT COMPLY WITH FLT ATTENDANT'S INSTRUCTIONS. PAX HAD SEATBACK IN RECLINED POS; REFUSED TO BRING IT TO STRAIGHT OR UPRIGHT POS FOR LNDG. WHEN I ASKED PAX; HE IGNORED ME. I REQUESTED FROM HIM TO BRING SEATBACK STRAIGHT UP. PAX SAID TO ME; 'YOU DON'T HAVE TO TELL ME WHAT TO SAY OR DO.' I INDICATED TO HIM NOT TO SCREAM AT ME AND HE DOES NEED TO FOLLOW CREW MEMBER INSTRUCTIONS. I INDICATED TO HIM THAT IT'S AN FAR.
column125: AN MD-80 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A FIRST CLASS PAX REFUSED TO MOVE HIS SEAT TO THE UPRIGHT POS FOR LNDG AT LGA.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING THE LAST 30 MINS OF FLT; FLT ATTENDANT XXXXX CALLED ME AND ADVISED ME THAT PAX COMPLAINED OF CIGARETTE SMOKE SMELL IN THE CABIN. AS FLT ATTENDANT XXX TRIED TO VERIFY THIS; THE MOTHER OF THE ALLEGED SMOKER TOLD FLT ATTENDANT THAT SHE THINKS HER 15 YR OLD SON WAS SMOKING IN THE LAVATORY. FLT ATTENDANT XXX CHALLENGED THIS PAX AND HE DENIED ANY WRONG DOING. CIGARETTE ASH WAS FOUND IN LAVATORY FLOOR MATS AS WELL AS INSIDE TOILET BOWL. THE OBVIOUS SCENT OF CIGARETTE AS WELL; TOO. DISPATCH WAS ADVISED. OUR IN-RANGE CALL TO XXX OPS INCLUDED THE REQUEST FOR POLICE TO MEET US AT THE GATE. XXX WAS CALLED TO CHK IF SMOKE DETECTOR WAS TAMPERED WITH. NORMAL INSPECTION OF LAVATORY WASTE BIN WAS ALSO ASKED FOR. POLICE DETAINED THE PERSON AT GATE AND ASKED ME IF I WAS PRESSING CHARGES. I SAID YES. THIS COULD HAVE RESULTED IN ACFT AND/OR LIFE LOSS SHOULD A FIRE HAD DEVELOPED. SO; HE WENT ON TO CALL FAA AUTH. LATER HE TOLD ME THAT FAA REPRESENTATIVE WAS NOT COMING TO DEAL WITH THIS; SO PAX WAS LET GO. THE PAX INVOLVED WAS A 15 YR OLD MINOR. I ASSUMED THAT HIS MOTHER AND YOUNGER BROTHER WERE NEXT TO HIM. I BELIEVE THAT THEY WERE DENIED BOARDING ON THEIR NEXT LEG TO AUSTIN; TX.
column125: AN EMJ CAPT RPTED THAT A MINOR PAX WAS SMOKING IN THE LAVATORY DURING A FLT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 11.5; Flight Attendant Total 11.5; Flight Attendant Type 15
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX BOARDED FLT AND REFUSED TO STOW LUGGAGE/WHEELS AND INSISTED THAT BE DONE BY ME. PAX DEMANDED 2 GLASSES OF CHAMPAGNE (PRE-DEP) FOR HER 'COLLEAGUE IN THE BACK.' SHE ALREADY HAD CONSUMED 2 GLASSES. DURING SAFETY VIDEO; PAX RANG CALL LIGHT WAVING HER GLASS FOR MORE CHAMPAGNE. SHE INTERRUPTED THE SVC; CONTINUOUSLY DEMANDING MORE WHITE WINE; OR CHAMPAGNE. THIS OCCURRED WHILE I WAS SERVING OTHER CUSTOMERS OR PERFORMING SAFETY DUTIES. THE FLT EXPERIENCED MILD TO MODERATE TURB. THE CAPT MADE A PA AND TURNED ON FASTEN BELT SIGN AND REQUESTED THE FLT ATTENDANTS TO BE SEATED. IMMEDIATELY; PAX JUMPED OUT OF HER SEAT; DASHED TO WHERE I WAS STRAPPED IN AND DEMANDED (AGAIN) MORE WINE. AT THIS POINT (4 1/2 HRS FLT TIME); SHE APPEARED INTOXICATED AND BELLIGERENT. I ASKED HER IF SHE HAD HEARD THE CAPT'S INSTRUCTIONS. SHE SAID 'YES' BUT DID NOT OBEY SAID INSTRUCTIONS. HER SPEECH WAS SLURRED; HER EYES WERE RED AND DEMEANOR WAS HOSTILE. I MADE A MENTAL TALLY OF THE ALCOHOL THAT I HAD SERVED HER. MY ESTIMATION WAS THAT SHE HAD CONSUMED AT LEAST 1 FULL BOTTLE OF CHAMPAGNE AND 1 FULL BOTTLE OF WINE. ACCORDING TO FAR'S AND COMPANY POLICY I CANNOT SERVE AN INTOXICATED PAX; AND DENIED THE ALCOHOL REQUEST. IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FAA; I ALSO REQUESTED SHE REMAIN SEATED WITH 'HER SEATBELT FASTENED.' AT THAT POINT SHE COMPLIED; HOWEVER COMPLAINING THAT I WAS GOING TO 'GET IN TROUBLE' FOR MY REQUESTS. SHE REFUSED TO RELINQUISH HEADSET DURING COLLECTION (25 MINS PRIOR TO LNDG).
column125: A B777 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT AN INEBRIATED PAX IGNORED THE SEATBELT SIGN AND OTHER CREW DIRECTIONS DURING AN OVERWATER FLT FROM LHR TO JFK.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FO AND I SMELLED CIGARETTE SMOKE IN THE COCKPIT. I CALLED THE FIRST FLT ATTENDANT AND NOTIFIED HER THAT SOMEONE WAS SMOKING. AT THE SAME TIME; DEADHEADING COMPANY PLTS AND FIRST CLASS PAX ALSO TOLD THE FIRST CLASS FLT ATTENDANT THAT THEY SMELLED THE SMOKE AND SAW WHO IT WAS. FLT ATTENDANTS TALKED WITH THE PAX; WHO DENIED SMOKING. WHEN THE FLT ATTENDANT ASKED HIM WHAT HE DID WITH THE CIGARETTE BUTT; HE TOLD HER IT WAS IN HIS POCKET AND GAVE IT TO THE FLT ATTENDANT. I CALLED DISPATCH AND HAD THEM NOTIFY OPS TO HAVE AUTHS MEET THE ACFT. PAX WAS TAKEN BY THE AUTHS TO BE QUESTIONED.
column125: AN MDS80 CAPT RPTED THAT HE CALLED THE PURSER AFTER DETECTING THE SMELL OF CIGARETTE SMOKE ON THE FLT DECK.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 5; Flight Attendant Total 5; Flight Attendant Type 40
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: APPROX 1 1/2 HRS INTO THE FLT; I HEARD SHOUTING IN MAIN CABIN. PAX IN QUESTION WAS IN AN ALTERCATION WITH FLT ATTENDANT #4; VERY LOUD; SCREAMING AT THE TOP OF HIS LUNGS. I STAYED IN FIRST CLASS BECAUSE I WAS WORRIED THIS MIGHT BE A DIVERSION. FLT ATTENDANT #3 TRIED TO INTERVENE TO DIFFUSE SIT. PAX THREW A PRETTY HVY MAGAZINE AT HER. IT HIT HER AT THE CORNER OF HER EYE. CAPT WAS INFORMED DURING THIS ALTERCATION. PAX WAS ADVISED IF HIS BEHAVIOR CONTINUED; WE WOULD DIVERT AND LAND. BECAUSE HE PHYSICALLY THREATENED AND ASSAULTED FLT ATTENDANT #3; THE DECISION WAS TAKEN TO HAVE AUTHS MEET THE FLT. DURING QUESTIONING; IT BECAME KNOWN THAT PAX HAD BEEN ASSAULTED; ROBBED; BEATEN IN MEXICO CITY. ALL HIS BELONGINGS HAD BEEN STOLEN. THAT MAY HAVE EXPLAINED HIS DISHEVELED APPEARANCE. HE WAS DIRTY AND SMELLY; CARRIED A FEW PLASTIC GROCERY BAGS WITH A FEW PERSONAL BELONGINGS. IT WAS ALSO APPARENT THAT HE MIGHT HAVE BEEN MENTALLY CHALLENGED SO FLT ATTENDANT #3 MADE THE DECISION NOT TO PRESS CHARGES; BUT PAX HAS BEEN BLACK LISTED ON OUR CARRIER. MY PERSONAL FEELING IS THAT FLT ATTENDANT #4 MAY HAVE PROVOKED PAX BY MAKING A COMMENT ABOUT PAX'S SMELLY FEET; LOUD ENOUGH TO BE OVERHEARD BY PAX SITTING AROUND HIM. WHILE SPEAKING TO SEVERAL PAX WHO WERE WILLING TO BE NAMED; WE WERE TOLD THAT THIS PAX HAD CAUSED A COMMOTION IN THE DEP LOUNGE PRIOR TO BOARDING; BEHAVING ERRATICALLY; SPEAKING TO HIMSELF; ETC. GATE AGENT APPARENTLY IGNORED THIS.
column125: B737 PURSER RPTED THAT A PAX BECAME VIOLENT DURING A FLT FROM MIA TO YUL.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 20; Flight Attendant Total 25; Flight Attendant Type 25

column121: PAX IN XO WAS SEEN EXITING THE LAVATORY AND CIGARETTE SMOKE WAS STILL EVIDENT IN LAVATORY. I APCHED CUSTOMER AS HE ENTERED AISLE. WHEN HE DID NOT RESPOND; I TAPPED HIS SHOULDER. HE TURNED AROUND AND I COULD SMELL SMOKE ON HIM AND SEE CIGARETTES IN HIS POCKET. I INFORMED HIM HE WAS NOT ALLOWED TO SMOKE DURING FLT AND I REMOVED HIS CIGARETTES FROM HIS POCKET. I GAVE HIM FIRST WARNING FROM PAX MISCONDUCT FORM; COMPLETED FORM AND GAVE TO CAPT TO COMPLETE. HE NEVER SMOKED AGAIN. FORM WAS SUBMITTED UPON ARR.
column125: A B777 FLT ATTENDANT DISCOVERED THAT A PAX HAD BEEN SMOKING IN THE LAVATORY DURING A FLT FROM LGW TO DFW.

column121: #1 FLT ATTENDANT ADVISED FLT DECK OF PAX BEHAVING STRANGELY. #1 FLT ATTENDANT ADVISED COCKPIT THAT PAX IN LAVATORY WAS NOT RESPONDING. FLT ATTENDANT AND ANOTHER MALE PAX OPENED LAVATORY AND WERE MET BY A COMBATIVE; DISORIENTED; AND SEEMINGLY INCOHERENT PAX WHO FELL OUT OF LAVATORY INTO FIRST CLASS GALLEY. WITH LOUD YELLING; SCREAMING AND BANGING; FLT ATTENDANT CALLED COCKPIT AND ADVISED. DECLARED MEDICAL EMER WITH ATC AND DIVERTED TO SHV. REQUESTED POLICE AND EMS TO MEET ACFT. PAX SEEMED TO COME AROUND; BUT WAS FINALLY TAKEN OFF ACFT BY EMS AND COMPANY SECURITY GUARDS.
column125: AN MD80 CAPT RPTED THAT A PAX SEEMED COMBATIVE AND INCOHERENT; CAUSING THE RPTR TO DIVERT TO SHV.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 16; Flight Attendant Total 16; Flight Attendant Type 10
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: WHILE WAITING ON THE TXWY TO TAKE OFF; THE RWY WAS CLOSED DOWN SO IT COULD BE REPLOWED (A BLIZZARD HAD JUST MOVED THROUGH THE AREA SOME DAYS BEFORE). AFTER THE CAPT MADE HIS PA; I RECEIVED A CALL FROM FLT ATTENDANT #2 THAT THE PAX IN X1 WAS BECOMING BELLIGERENT. THE PAX AROUND THIS MAN WERE BECOMING CONCERNED FOR THEIR OWN SAFETY. APPARENTLY; HE WAS SWEARING; POUNDING HIS FISTS; YELLING OUT PROFANITIES AGAINST AMERICANS (HE WAS SPEAKING IN A FOREIGN LANGUAGE SOMETIMES); AND AT ONE POINT HE SAID TO THE WOMAN IN X2; 'IF YOU THINK THIS IS FUNNY; YOU JUST WAIT.' WHEN I WAS INFORMED OF THIS; I CALLED THE CAPT AND THE DECISION WAS MADE TO RETURN TO THE GATE AND HAVE THE PAX REMOVED. NO PA'S WERE MADE ON THE RETURN SO AS NOT TO ALERT HIM AS TO WHAT WAS GOING ON. WHEN THE DOOR WAS OPENED; 2 MASSACHUSETTS STATE TROOPERS CAME ON BOARD AND TOOK HIM OFF WITH NO PROBS. AT THIS POINT; HIS BROTHER (WE DID NOT KNOW THEY WERE TOGETHER) IN FIRST CLASS STEPPED UP AND ASKED WHAT HAD HAPPENED. HE DID NOT SEEM TOO SURPRISED AND EVEN SAID; 'I'LL JUST HAVE HIM PUT AWAY FOR A FEW DAYS.' WE CHKED IF THEY HAD ANY LUGGAGE ON BOARD (THEY DID NOT). WE LEFT THE 2 PAX BEHIND WITH THE AUTHS.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT IN CHARGE RPTED THAT A PAX WAS SO BELLIGERENT DURING TAXI OUT AT BOS; THAT THE DECISION WAS MADE TO RETURN TO THE GATE.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge

column121: A MALE PAX IN FIRST CLASS SEEMED TO BE INTOXICATED; THEREFORE; WE DID NOT SERVE HIM ANY MORE ALCOHOL. HE ALREADY HAD 6 VODKA AND TONICS. ONCE REFUSED ALCOHOL; HE BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE CALLING ME AND THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANT 'BITCHES.' A NON REVENUE FLT ATTENDANT TOLD HIM TO TAKE HIS SEAT; WHICH HE DID. LATER ON; HE APOLOGIZED FOR HIS MISCONDUCT TO THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANT.
column125: A B737 FLT ATTENDANT IN CHARGE RPTED THAT AN INTOXICATED PAX BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE DURING THE FLT FROM LGA TO MIA.

column28: Class E ZAU.E; Class E C90.E
column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column118: General Physical Injury / Incapacitation; General None Reported / Taken
column121: ONCE PAX AND HER HUSBAND BOARDED THE ACFT IN CHICAGO; SHE WAS ASKED TO PLEASE STOW ALL LUGGAGE. SHE REFUSED AND STATED 'OH SWEETHEART; YOU CAN DO IT.' I CONTINUED WITH MY DUTIES AS PURSER AND FIRST CLASS RESPONSIBILITIES ASSISTING ALL OTHER PAX AND FLT ATTENDANTS. AFTER 5-8 MINS PASSED; I FOUND FEMALE PAX HAD STILL NOT STOWED ANY OF HER BELONGINGS AND HAD ANOTHER FIRST CLASS PAX SITTING ON OTTOMAN. I ADVISED HIM THAT 'IN A FEW MINS' HE WOULD HAVE TO RETURN TO HIS SEAT FOR TAXI OUT AND TKOF. THE FEMALE PAX SAID 'HE WILL STAY HERE AND YOU CAN'T MAKE HIM LEAVE.' HE SAID HE WOULD MOVE; AND WAS VERY COOPERATIVE AND GRACIOUS ABOUT COMPLYING. AFTER MALE PAX LEFT; SHE FOLLOWED HIM TO HIS SEAT. I THEN STOWED ALL HER CARRY-ON BAGGAGE. I PROCEEDED TO TELL FEMALE PAX THAT SHE MUST TAKE HER SEAT. SHE REFUSED. CABIN DOOR CLOSED. I MADE PREPARE FOR DEP PA. I ASKED HER AGAIN TO SIT DOWN. SHE SAID 'LEAVE US ALONE; THIS IS MY BROTHER.' I WENT TO COCKPIT TO ADVISE THAT PAX WERE UP IN BUSINESS CLASS AND 1 PAX IN FIRST CLASS THAT 'CABIN WAS NOT READY.' AFTER THE CAPT MADE A PA THAT ALL PAX MUST TAKE THEIR SEATS; THAT'S WHEN THE FEMALE PAX COMPLIED. I DID A FINAL WALK-THROUGH BEFORE TKOF. PAX STILL HAD NOT FASTENED HER SEATBELT. I ASKED HER AGAIN TO COMPLY. WE THEN WERE ADVISED; 'NEXT IN LINE FOR TKOF; FLT ATTENDANTS PREPARE FOR TKOF.' I TOOK MY JUMPSEAT AT 1L. ONCE BEVERAGE SVC BEGAN; THE MALE PAX CAME BACK AND SAT WITH HER ON HER OTTOMAN. I ADVISED HIM TO PLEASE FASTEN HIS SEATBELT. HE COMPLIED. I ASKED THE FEMALE PAX TO FASTEN HER SEATBELT. SHE BLATANTLY REFUSED. ONCE AGAIN SHE TOOK MY L HAND (THIS TIME) PULLING IT TOWARDS HER L UPPER FOREARM STATING THAT 'YOU (MEANING ME) ARE TO LEAVE US ALONE.' THE MALE PAX ROLLED HIS EYES AND VEHEMENTLY DENIED HE WAS HER BROTHER. HE SAID 'I MET SHE AND HER HUSBAND IN A BAR AT THE ARPT.' SHE THEN PROCEEDED TO TAKE HER R STOCKING FOOT AND RUB IT UP THE CENTER OF THE MALE PAX'S LEG. HE THEN SAID THAT HE WOULD FASTEN HER SEATBELT; IN WHICH I THANKED HIM. TURB STRUCK AFTER DINNER SVC. I ASKED THE MALE PAX TO PLEASE RETURN TO HIS SEAT. HE DID. SHE FOLLOWED. I ASKED HER TO PLEASE TAKE HER SEAT AND FASTEN HER SEATBELT. SHE REFUSED. I ASKED AGAIN; SHE COMPLIED BUT REFUSED TO FASTEN SEATBELT. I PROCEEDED TO GALLEY TO ANSWER CALL FROM CAPT. I CALLED OTHER GALLEYS AND ADVISED OF CONTINUING TURB. I THEN ASSISTED FLT ATTENDANTS #5 AND #6 TO LATCH AND SECURE FIRST CLASS GALLEY. MY #6 FLT ATTENDANT STATED THAT THE FEMALE PAX WAS UP OUT OF HER SEAT WALKING BACK AND FORTH TO BUSINESS CLASS GALLEY. FLT ATTENDANT #6 ASKED HER TO BE SEATED AND FASTEN HER SEATBELT. PAX COMPLIED! BUT ONLY FOR ABOUT 20 SECONDS. BUSINESS CLASS GALLEY FLT ATTENDANT SPOKE TO HER AND PAX SAT DOWN. ABOUT 1 MIN LATER; PAX WAS UP AGAIN. ALL OF THIS TIME; CAPT WAS WITNESSING FROM CREW REST. I ADVISED HIM OF SIT. I TOLD HIM THAT THE SIT PREVENTED FIRST CLASS AND BUSINESS CLASS MEAL SVCS TO BE ACCOMPLISHED; AS SHE WAS BEGINNING TO SHOUT AND GETTING HOSTILE. I RETURNED TO THE FEMALE PAX TO ASK HER TO PLEASE REMAIN SEATED WITH SEATBELT FASTENED FOR HER OWN SAFETY. SHE THEN TURNED AROUND TO FACE ME; TAKING HER R HAND AND GRABBING BTWN MY LEGS; PULLING ME TOWARDS HER. I FELT INTENSE PAIN TO MY TESTICLES AND FELT HER FINGER TEAR THE CROTCH OF MY PANTS AND PULLING ME CLOSER. SHE THEN TOOK HER LEFT HAND AND SCRATCHED MY L ARM ABOVE MY WRIST (DRAWING BLOOD). SHE LAUGHED LOUDLY. THE CAPT THEN CAME OVER TO TALK WITH HER. I WENT TO LAVATORY TO CHK FOR INJURIES; WHICH I FOUND 4. WHEN OUT OF LAVATORY; DID NOT SEE THE FEMALE PAX OR THE CAPT. I WAS TOLD BY #4 FLT ATTENDANT THAT THEY WERE IN BUSINESS CLASS GALLEY. FLT ATTENDANT #4 SAID CAPT TOLD HER TO STOP YELLING; SIT DOWN; OR ELSE PLANE WILL LAND. AFTER I REACHED BUSINESS CLASS; I ASKED BUSINESS CLASS FLT ATTENDANTS WHO HER HUSBAND WAS. HER HUSBAND WAS IN BUSINESS CLASS. I ASKED CAPT IF HE WANTED ME TO AWAKEN HER HUSBAND. CAPT REPLIED YES. ONCE I ESCORTED HER HUSBAND TO BUSINESS CLASS GALLEY; THE FEMALE PAX BEGAN SCREAMING AT HIM; HITTING HIM; SCRATCHING HIM. I ASKED HER HUSBAND IF SHE WAS ON MEDICATION. HE SAID 'NO.' HE WAS VERY COOPERATIVE AND EXTREMELY APOLOGETIC TO ALL OF US IN BUSINESS CLASS GALLEY. THE FEMALE PAX THEN TOLD HER HUSBAND SHE WAS 'HAVING AN AFFAIR WITH A SPANISH MAN.' HER HUSBAND STILL INSISTED SHE CALM DOWN AND HE TRIED TO HOLD HER. SHE THEN BECAME VERY HOSTILE; LOOKED AT ME AND SAID SHE WAS 'GOING TO SUE ME OR KILL ME.' AT THAT POINT; 3 OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS; THE CAPT AND MYSELF FLEX-CUFFED HER. I THEN PAGED (AT CAPT'S REQUEST) FOR AN 'MD; DO; RN; LPN; PARAMEDIC.' AN RN RESPONDED. HE IMMEDIATELY STATED THAT SHE APPEARED TO BE PSYCHOTIC AS SHE ALSO THREATENED HIM. A DOCTOR; WHO WAS AN MD; CAME AND OBSERVED HER AND ASKED ME IF WE HAD A MEDICAL KIT. ONE OF THE FLT ATTENDANTS HAD ALREADY BROUGHT THE ENHANCED MEDICAL KIT; REGULAR MEDICAL KIT; AND AED FROM FIRST CLASS GALLEY. THE DOCTOR TRIED TO CALM AND WORK WITH PAX. THE DOCTOR TURNED TO ME AND STATED 'SHE IS ACUTELY PSYCHOTIC. I NEED TO SEE WHAT IS IN THE ENHANCED MEDICAL KIT.' DOCTOR STATED THAT IT SHOULD BE A INJECTION FOR FAST RESULTS; AS HER BEHAVIOR WAS TURNING 'MALICIOUS.' DOCTOR ADMINISTERED; BY INJECTION; 10 MG OF DIAZEPAM. AFTER ABOUT 12-15 MINS WITH NO RESULTS; DOCTOR INJECTED 5 MG MORE -- TOTAL 15 MG OF DIAZEPAM. FEMALE PAX CONTINUED TO SCREAM AND YELL FOR 45 MINS TO AN HR. SHE THEN BEGAN TO 'STABILIZE' (DOCTOR'S WORDS). WE RESEATED HER IN FIRST CLASS WITH ANOTHER NURSE AND A FLT ATTENDANT WHO WERE WATCHING AND SITTING WITH HER. I FILLED OUT 'INFLT DISTURBANCE RPT.' I WAS CALLED TO COCKPIT BY CAPT. HE SHARED WITH ME AN ACARS MESSAGE THAT STATED 'PAX'S HUSBAND IS VERY FREQUENT FLIER.' I ASKED THE CAPT 'WHAT DOES THIS HAVE TO DO WITH HIS WIFE'S SIT OF THREATS; INTIMIDATIONS; PHYSICAL PULLING AND HITTING?' CAPT SAID THAT 'CUSTOMER SVC PROBABLY WANTS US TO KNOW HOW MUCH HER HUSBAND FLIES WITH OUR COMPANY.' I AGAIN STATED THAT THE ACARS MESSAGE WAS NOT RELEVANT TO SIT. I STATED THAT 'I PERCEIVED IT AS A THREAT FROM COMPANY MGMNT NOT TO PROCEED WITH HAVING THE FLT MET.' I TOLD CAPT I WOULD ADVISE CREW (FLT ATTENDANTS) OF MESSAGE AND THAT I WANTED A COPY. THE FLT LANDED IN EGLL WITHOUT INCIDENT. LONDON POLICE AND PARAMEDICS MET FLT. THE FLT ATTENDANTS; INCLUDING MYSELF; DECIDED NOT TO PRESS CHARGES AS A RESULT OF COMPANY'S INTERFERENCE AND WHAT WAS PERCEIVED TO BE THREATENING IF WE WERE TO FILE. WE WERE; AND STILL ARE; AFRAID THAT THE COMPANY WILL POSSIBLY DISCIPLINE US OR EVEN FIRE/TERMINATE US FOR RPTING AN INCIDENT WHICH INVOLVED A HIGH VOLUME FREQUENT FLYER. THE HUSBAND WAS ALWAYS CORDIAL AND APOLOGETIC; NEVER MENTIONING THAT HE WOULD TAKE HIS BUSINESS ELSEWHERE. SIMPLY PUT; IT IS MY OPINION THAT COMPANY WAS NOT GOING TO BACK US; THAT COMPANY WAS DISCOURAGING US FROM PRESSING CHARGES. COMPANY'S INTIMIDATION TACTICS WORKED! WE DID NOT FILE CHARGES. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 604607: ALL FLT ATTENDANTS IN BUSINESS CLASS AGREED SHE SEEMED TO HAVE A MENTAL PROB AND FLT ATTENDANT PUT AWAY ALL GLASS IN THE GALLEY AS A PRECAUTION. PURSER INFORMED ME SHE HURT HIM AND TOLD US TO GET OUR HANDCUFFS OUT. HER HUSBAND FROM BUSINESS CLASS WAS WITH HER AT THIS TIME AND SHE SCRATCHED HIM TO THE POINT YOU COULD SEE BLOOD. THE MALE NURSE STAYED WITH HER FOR OVER 1 HR AND FOLLOWING DOCTOR'S RECOMMENDATIONS. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 604608: THE PAX CAME FLYING DOWN THE AISLE TO HER HUSBAND SCREAMING AND YELLING AND HITTING HIM. THAT'S WHEN FLT ATTENDANT #2 TOOK MY FLEX CUFFS AND PUT THEM ON HER WITH THE HELP OF FLT ATTENDANT #6. I PUT MYSELF OUT IN THE CABIN; WALKING THROUGH TELLING PAX THE SIT WAS UNDER CTL AND NOT WORRY. ALL THIS TIME SHE WAS YELLING AND SCREAMING AWFUL THINGS TO HER HUSBAND AND CRYING. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 604610: I WAS WALKING FROM COACH CABIN TO BUSINESS CLASS. I ASKED IF I COULD BE OF ANY ASSISTANCE. I TOOK THE FLEX CUFFS FROM #8 FLT ATTENDANT AND STOOD BY READY TO RESTRAIN THE PAX. THE PURSER SAID TO DO IT AND I CUFFED THE PAX. A MEDICAL DOCTOR WAS PAGED. IRETURNED TO MY CABIN FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE FLT. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 604613: SHE WAS NEVER COMPLETELY COHERENT. SHE RANTED AND RAVED ABOUT VARIOUS TOPICS WHICH MADE LITTLE OR NO SENSE. THE WHOLE CREW WAS SHOCKED WHEN WE RECEIVED AN ACARS MESSAGE FROM DISPATCH SAYING THAT PAX'S HUSBAND WAS A VICE PRESIDENT FOR A PROMINENT COMPANY. I AND THE REST OF THE CREW FELT THAT THIS MESSAGE WAS MEANT TO CONVEY TO US THAT PAX SHOULD NOT BE ARRESTED OR PROSECUTED. WHEN WE ARRIVED IN LONDON; THE POLICE TOOK STATEMENTS FROM SEVERAL OF THE CREW THEN LET MR AND MRS X LEAVE ON THEIR OWN.
column125: A B777 PURSER AND SEVERAL CABIN CREW MEMBERS RPTED FEMALE PAX'S BEHAVIOR WAS DISRUPTIVE DURING A FLT FROM ORD TO LHR; THAT SHE INJURED 2 FLT ATTENDANTS AND WAS PRONOUNCED AS ACUTELY PSYCHOTIC BY THE ATTENDING PHYSICIAN WHO INJECTED HER WITH DIAZEPAM.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 16; Flight Attendant Total 16; Flight Attendant Type 95
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FLT ATTENDANT #4 INFORMED ME; FLT ATTENDANT #1; THAT THERE WERE 11 FIRST CLASS PAX INSTEAD OF THE 10 LISTED ON MY FINAL PAPERWORK. SO I CALLED OUT NAMES ON MY LIST AND MATCHED THEM WITH ALL PAX EXCEPT FOR ONE IN SEAT X1. SHE TOLD ME HER NAME; WHICH WAS ALSO THE WOMAN'S NAME IN X2. SO; I ASKED TO SEE THEIR BOARDING PASSES AND X2 HANDED ME THE ONE FOR HER CONNECTING FLT FROM DFW TO CALIFORNIA. SHE SAID SHE DIDN'T HAVE THE ONE FOR THIS FLT. SO I ASKED FOR HER IDENT AND I VERIFIED THAT SHE WAS WHO SHE CLAIMED TO BE. I THEN ASKED THE GIRL IN X1 FOR HER IDENT AND SHE SAID SHE DIDN'T HAVE IT. I TOLD HER SHE DID OR SHE WOULDN'T BE ON THE PLANE. I CALLED THE CAPT AND HE SAID SHE HAD BETTER SHOW SOME IDENT NOW OR WE WERE GOING TO RETURN TO THE GATE. SHE GOT OUT OF HER SEAT AND STOOD DIRECTLY IN FRONT OF ME AND SAID QUIETLY; 'OH; I'LL SHOW YOU SOMETHING.' SHE THEN VERY SLOWLY LIFTED THE FLAP OF HER PURSE AND PULLED OUT HER IDENT. SHE WAS NOT WHO SHE CLAIMED TO BE. I ASKED HER IF SHE HAD BEEN DRINKING AND SHE SAID 'WELL YEAH.' SO; I HAD HER SIT BACK DOWN BECAUSE SHE WAS SWAYING AND MOVING/TALKING VERY SLOWLY. I CALLED THE CAPT AGAIN TO INFORM HIM OF HER BEING DRUNK AND LYING ABOUT WHO SHE WAS. HE SAID THE AGENTS WERE MEETING THE PLANE BACK AT THE GATE. AFTER OPENING THE ACFT DOOR THE AGENTS TOLD ME TO HAVE THEM BOTH GATHER THEIR BELONGINGS AND EXIT THE AIRPLANE. AS THEY WERE GETTING UP THE REAL PAX IN X2 BENT DOWN AND PICKED UP A BOARDING PASS FOR THE INEBRIATED PAX AND SAID; 'OH HERE'S YOUR BOARDING PASS.' I SAID IT DIDN'T MATTER NOW BECAUSE SHE HAD LIED TO ME ABOUT HER NAME; HER BOARDING PASS; AND HER IDENT AND THEY WERE DRUNK. AS THE INEBRIATED PAX EXITED THE AIRPLANE SHE TURNED TO ME AND SAID; 'OH; WHAT A SAFE AIRLINE.' AND I SAID; 'WE TRY TO KEEP IT AS SAFE AS POSSIBLE; GOODBYE.'
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT IN CHARGE DISCOVERED THAT 2 PAX CONCOCTED A STORY SO THEY COULD SIT TOGETHER IN FIRST CLASS. THE CAPT RETURNED TO THE GATE AT ATL.

column118: Flight Crew Diverted; Flight Crew Landed As Precaution; General Maintenance Action
column121: DURING CLB; WE NOTICED A FLICKERING MASTER CAUTION LIGHT; BUT COULD NOT DISTINGUISH WHAT WAS CAUSING IT. IT CONTINUED AND AT CRUISE; WE SAW A VERY DIM AND FLICKERING R OIL FILTER CLOGGING LIGHT; ALONG WITH MASTER CAUTION. COMPLETED PROC FROM FOM BOOK. LIGHT CONTINUED TO INTERMITTENTLY SHOW ITSELF. DECIDED SAFEST COURSE OF ACTION WAS TO LAND AT MCO AND HAVE IT CHKED OUT. NORMAL LNDG THERE. AFTER GATE ARR; 1 PAX HAD DIFFICULTIES WITH HAVING TO REMAIN ABOARD THE ACFT DURING ITS MAINT. AFTER CHATTING WITH HIM; NO FURTHER PROBS WITH HIM OCCURRED. I LATER PUT TOGETHER THAT HE AND HIS SISTER REALLY WANTED TO HAVE A SMOKE.
column125: CAPT AND FLT ATTENDANT OF MD-80 RPTED AN OIL FILTER PROB CAUSED THE CAPT TO DIVERT TO MCO.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 14; Flight Attendant Total 30; Flight Attendant Type 30
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: WAS DOING GENERAL BRIEFING ASKING PAX TO REVIEW BRIEFING CARD. PAX HAD SEAT POCKET FULL WITH LAPTOP COMPUTER; WATER BOTTLE AND ONE OF OUR BLANKETS. ASKED PAX TO REMOVE ITEMS FROM SEAT POCKET AS THEY WERE BLOCKING EXIT. I REMOVED BLANKET AND HE GOT MAD. HE FELT 'HOLDING' ITEMS IN HIS LAP WAS 'FINE.' TOLD HIM HIS HANDS NEED TO BE FREE TO OPEN EXIT. EMER CARD DOES NOT COVER SEAT POCKET OR HANDS FREE. ANNOUNCEMENT COVERS ONLY SEAT POCKET. WOULD BE BENEFICIAL TO HAVE ON CARD.
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT MADE A SAFETY IMPROVEMENT SUGGESTION REGARDING THE READINESS OF PAX SEATED IN THE EMER EXIT ROWS.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 13; Flight Attendant Total 13; Flight Attendant Type 85
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING BEVERAGE SVC; PAX ASKED FOR 1/2 GLASS OF ORANGE JUICE WITH EXTRA ICE. SUSPECTING SOMETHING ODD; I ASKED HIM IF HE WAS PLANNING TO ADD ALCOHOL TO THE DRINK AND REMINDED HIM IT WAS AGAINST FAA REGS TO CONSUME ALCOHOL PERSONALLY BROUGHT ON BOARD; NOT SERVED BY A FLT ATTENDANT. PAX REPLIED; 'OK; I DIDN'T KNOW THAT.' HE THEN CONSUMED 3 BOTTLES OF VODKA FROM HIS LUGGAGE. THE CAPT WAS NOTIFIED AND FLT ATTENDANTS REQUESTED FEDERAL AUTHS TO MEET THE FLT. HE (PAX) APPEARED TO BE INTOXICATED. NO AUTHS MET THE FLT UPON ARR -- ONLY A CUSTOMER SVC REPRESENTATIVE. PAX WAS ALLOWED TO REBOARD FLT TO CONTINUE ON TO OKC; WITH SAME CABIN CREW.
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT AN INEBRIATED PAX CONTINUED TO DRINK FROM HIS OWN BOTTLE; YET WAS ALLOWED TO CONTINUE ON THE NEXT LEG OF FLT WITH THE SAME CABIN CREW AFTER INTERVIEW BY COMPANY SVC REPRESENTATIVE.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12; Flight Attendant Total 12; Flight Attendant Type 98
column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WERE A MARRIED COUPLE WHO SAT DOWN IN FIRST CLASS AND ORDERED CHAMPAGNE FOR PREDEP. WHEN AGENT CAME TO CLOSE DOOR; THE PAPERWORK SPECIFIED THAT WE ONLY HAD 1 PAX IN FIRST CLASS. #1 FLT ATTENDANT ASKED TO SEE BOARDING PASSES TO DISCOVER THEIR SEATS WERE ACTUALLY IN COACH. JUST AT TKOF; THE MAN GOT UP AND GOT IN THE SEAT IN FRONT OF HIM. THEN; WHEN I TOLD HIM HE NEEDED TO STAY IN HIS SEAT; HE GOT UP AND MOVED BACK TO COACH. AFTER TKOF; WE STARTED BEVERAGE SVC AFT AND FORWARD. THEY WANTED TO PURCHASE COCKTAILS. I TOLD THEM NO. THE MAN SAID; 'OK; OK;' BUT THE WOMAN CONTINUED TO ARGUE AND REFUSED TO TAKE NO FOR AN ANSWER. SHE SAID TO THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT; 'OH; WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO; THROW ME OUT?' #1 FLT ATTENDANT THEN CALLED TO CAPT TO HAVE SECURITY MEET THE FLT. #1 FLT ATTENDANT HAD TO TELL HER 4 TIMES TO TAKE HER SEAT.
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A MARRIED COUPLE SAT DOWN IN FIRST CLASS; ORDERED CHAMPAGNE BEFORE DEP; BUT WERE ACTUALLY ASSIGNED TO COACH SEATING. THEY CONTINUED THEIR ANTICS THROUGHOUT THE FLT WHICH WAS CONCLUDED WITH A MEETING WITH ICT POLICE.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 6; Flight Attendant Total 6; Flight Attendant Type 35
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX IN MAIN CABIN WAS DRINKING AND FLIRTING WITH THE ALL FEMALE CABIN CREW DURING THEIR SVC. PAX CONTINUED TO GET OUT OF HIS SEAT (WHEN SEATBELT SIGN WAS ON); HANGING OUT IN THE BACK GALLEY AREAS (AFTER BEING TOLD NOT TO); AND IN GENERAL DISTURBING THE FLT ATTENDANT'S SVC. PAX; AT ONE POINT; CORNERED ONE FEMALE FLT ATTENDANT AND TRIED TO KISS HER. AFTER TELLING THE PAX; 'NO;' AND PULLING HIM BACK; FLT ATTENDANT TOLD ME ABOUT IT OVER THE PHONE. I WENT BACK TO PAX'S SEAT AND TALKED TO HIM. I TOLD HIM HE WAS CUT OFF FROM DRINKING AND ONE MORE OUTBURST; OR NOT LISTENING TO THE FLT ATTENDANTS; I WOULD HAVE HIM ARRESTED IN ZZZ. I FEEL ALCOHOL DEFINITELY PLAYED A LARGE PART IN THIS; AS WELL AS PAX'S DISREGARD OF FLT ATTENDANT'S INSTRUCTIONS. PAX FELT HE WAS ABOVE THE RULES OR THEY DID NOT APPLY TO HIM.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED ON A DRUNK PAX WHO CORNERED AND ATTEMPTED TO KISS A FLT ATTENDANT DURING THE BEVERAGE SVC DURING A FLT TO LAX.

column28: Class B JFK.B; Class E N90.E

column121: UPON DSCNT; PAX IN MAIN CABIN; CTR SECTION OF ACFT; WOULD NOT COMPLY WITH FLT ATTENDANT INSTRUCTIONS. HE WOULD NOT PUT TRAY TABLE UPRIGHT OR FASTEN SEATBELT FOR LNDG. FLT ATTENDANT DISCOVERED AN EMPTY BOTTLE OF ALCOHOL NEARBY PAX. HE (THE PAX) SPOKE ARABIC TO THE #8 FLT ATTENDANT WHO IS FLUENT IN ARABIC. IT TOOK 3 MALE FLT ATTENDANTS TO RESTRAIN PAX TO HIS SEAT. FLEX CUFFS WERE REQUIRED FOR THIS. I WAS NOT DIRECTLY INVOLVED; BUT WITNESSED THE EVENT. POLICE MET THE FLT IN JFK.
column125: AN A300 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED ON A PAX WHO DREW ATTN TO HIMSELF BEFORE LNDG AT JFK WHEN HE WOULD NOT COMPLY WITH FLT ATTENDANT'S INSTRUCTIONS. AN EMPTY ALCOHOL CONTAINER WAS FOUND NEAR HIS SEAT.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: MALE PAX BOARDED ACFT WITH AN OPEN ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE IN HIS HAND. HE WAS LOUD AND SLURRING WORDS; 'IT LOOKS LIKE I AM ON THE BACK OF THE BUS; BUT I DON'T WANT TO SAY THAT TOO LOUD.' I TOLD HIM HE COULD NOT HAVE THE COCKTAIL AND TOOK IT FROM HIM. HE SAID; 'YOU CAN TAKE IT;' AGAIN LOUD AND SLURRING. FLT ATTENDANT #2 CALLED FROM THE BACK AFTER HE WENT TO HIS SEAT TO SAY HE WAS DRUNK AND NEEDED TO BE TAKEN OFF. CAPT AGREED. AGENT CAME AND TOOK PAX OFF QUICKLY.
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT SHE LET AN OBVIOUSLY DRUNK PAX WALK PAST HER; ONLY INTERCEPTING HIS OPEN ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE; AND THEN ALLOWING HIM TO GO TO HIS SEAT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 20; Flight Attendant Total 20; Flight Attendant Type 80
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX MADE RACIAL COMMENTS TO OTHER PAX AND ABOUT OTHER PAX; DRINKING ALCOHOL FROM BOTTLES THEY BROUGHT ON BOARD. BELLIGERENT TO FLT CREW; DISRUPTING SVC AND OTHER PAX. USED CELL PHONE INFLT. CREW SPOKE WITH PAX ABOUT MISCONDUCT. ALSO; GAVE PAX FORMAL WRITTEN WARNING. HAD MEXICAN POLICE MEET THE AIRPLANE IN MMUN.
column125: B757 FLT ATTENDANT OBSERVED PAX MAKING RACIAL SLURS AND DRINKING ALCOHOL FROM THEIR OWN BOTTLES. THE CAPT HAD THE FLT MET BY MMUN AUTHS.

column121: INCIDENT OCCURRED DURING A FLT FROM BJX TO DFW. THE PAX IN QUESTION HAD A BOARDING PASS WITH SEAT IN COACH AND ASKED WHERE HIS SEAT WAS. THE MOMENT HE SPOKE I COULD SMELL THE LIQUOR ON HIS BREATH. HE CONTINUED TO SPEAK LOUDLY AND ACT FUNNY. I QUICKLY INFORMED THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT WHO WENT TO INVESTIGATE. SHE RETURNED AND INFORMED THE CAPT. THE CAPT REQUESTED THE GATE AGENT WHO; IN TURN; REQUESTED THE SUPVR. THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT AND I EXPLAINED VERY CLRLY THE SIT TO THE SUPVR; HOWEVER; THE SUPVR MADE ME GO TO THE BACK AND IDENT THE PAX PERSONALLY; EVEN THOUGH I GAVE HIM THE SEAT NUMBER. I DID SO UNDER PROTEST. I FELT I WAS BEING PLACED IN THE MIDDLE OF A SIT THAT COULD HAVE GOTTEN OUT OF HAND. FORTUNATELY; THE PAX DEPLANED WITHOUT FURTHER INCIDENT. THE PAX WAS WITH 2 OTHER PAX WHO ALSO DEPLANED.
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT; AFTER DETECTING A DRUNK PAX AND SEEKING THE HELP OF THE GATE AGENT; SHE WAS FORCED BY THE SUPVR TO PERSONALLY IDENT THE INEBRIATED PAX; WHICH SHE FELT WAS INAPPROPRIATE.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 34; Flight Attendant Total 34; Flight Attendant Type 99
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: A PAX IN FIRST CLASS MADE A VERBAL THREAT TO FLT CREW. THE PLTS WANTED TO COME BACK TO USE LAVATORY ABOUT 2 1/2 HRS INTO THE FLT. I BLOCKED THE FORWARD ENTRY WITH A MEAL CART. THE PAX WAS STANDING UP AFTER I PULLED CART OUT. I ASKED HIM TO PLEASE BE SEATED TWICE; WHILE THE PLTS WERE OUT OF THE COCKPIT; BUT HE DID NOT COMPLY. AFTER THE PLTS RETURNED; THE PAX CAME TO THE GALLEY; IN FIRST CLASS AND SAID; 'THOSE PLTS ARE A BUNCH OF ARROGANT BASTARDS. I WOULD LIKE TO POP THOSE PRINCES.' I DISCUSSED THIS WITH THE FLT CREW AFTER THE PAX SAT DOWN. A MUTUAL DECISION WAS MADE TO HAVE POLICE OFFICERS MEET THE PAX IN PDX. ALL THE PROPER FORMS WERE FILLED OUT AND DISTRIBUTED TO THE CORRECT DEPTS AND THE PAX.
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED TO THE FLT CREW THAT A FIRST CLASS PAX MADE A THREATENING REMARK REGARDING THEM PERSONALLY; WHICH PROMPTED A VISIT FROM THE PDX POLICE UPON ARR.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 14; Flight Attendant Total 14; Flight Attendant Type 80
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX BOARDED ACFT WITH DOG DRAPED OVER THE BACK OF HER SHOULDER. FLT ATTENDANT #4 APCHED PAX STATING THAT DOG MUST BE IN CARRIER. PAX SAID SHE WOULD ONCE SHE GOT SETTLED IN SEAT. THIS WAS DURING BOARDING PROCESS. DURING SAFETY DEMONSTRATION; FLT ATTENDANT #2 NOTICED THAT DOG WAS STILL OUT OF CARRIER. PAX SAID SHE WOULD COMPLY. AFTER TKOF; DURING BEVERAGE CART SVC; FLT ATTENDANTS #4 AND #2 NOTICED THAT PAX STILL HAD DOG'S HEAD FULLY OUTSIDE OF CARRIER. FLT ATTENDANT #4 THEN INFORMED PAX THAT DOG MUST BE COMPLETELY INSIDE CARRIER AT ALL TIMES. PAX MADE ATTEMPT TO COMPLY BUT DID NOT FOLLOW THROUGH. ON 4TH APCH; AFTER SVC; FLT ATTENDANT #4 CHKED ON PAX COMPLIANCE. PAX STILL HAD DOG'S HEAD FULLY OUTSIDE OF CARRIER. FLT ATTENDANT #4 STATED THAT COMPLIANCE WAS NEEDED AND ALSO ISSUED AN INFLT DISTURBANCE RPT. OBTAINED PAX'S ADDRESS; ETC. ALSO OBTAINED WITNESS NAME/PHONE/ADDRESS.
column125: AN MD82 RPTED THAT A PAX TRANSPORTED HER DOG IN A MANNER NOT IN COMPLIANCE WITH FARS.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 18; Flight Attendant Total 18; Flight Attendant Type 80
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: AFTER PARKING A CART IN THE AISLE; IT BLOCKED A PAX. HE THEN HIT MY ARM WITH CLOSED FIST AND SAID 'HEY; MOVE IT.' I REPLIED; 'JUST SAY EXCUSE ME; YOU DON'T HAVE TO HIT ME.' HE THEN SAID; 'I DIDN'T HIT YOU; (EXPLETIVE).' I THEN ALLOWED HIM TO PASS AND FILLED OUT A PAX MISCONDUCT FORM AND CALLED THE CAPT. NO ACTION WAS TAKEN AFTER THAT BY THE COMPANY.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A PAX STRUCK HER WITH A CLOSED FIST BECAUSE THE CART WAS IN THE AISLE AND THE PAX WANTED BY ON A FLT FROM SJU TO ORD.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 34; Flight Attendant Total 34; Flight Attendant Type 50
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WAS CALLED BY AFT GALLEY FLT ATTENDANT (AT 1 1/2 - 2 HRS INTO FLT) AND INFORMED PAX WAS INTOXICATED AND THAT SHE WAS 'CUTTING HIM OFF' ALCOHOL. I SAID 'OK; KEEP ME INFORMED.' SHORTLY AFTER THAT; FLT ATTENDANT #6 CAME UP TO ME AND SAID PAX WAS LOUD AND BELLIGERENT; DEMANDING MORE DRINKS; AND THAT HE HAD PUSHED FLT ATTENDANT #2 TO TRY TO FORCE HIS WAY INTO GALLEY FOR MORE DRINKS. 3 FLT ATTENDANTS IN BACK WERE TRYING IN A VERY CALM AND PROFESSIONAL MANNER TO CALM HIM DOWN; WITHOUT SUCCESS. I CALLED CAPT AND INFORMED HIM OF SIT AND TOLD HIM I WOULD GO BACK TO ASSESS THE PROB. HE PUT ON 'SEAT BELT' SIGN AND HE MADE A PA. WHEN I GOT TO BACK; PAX WAS STAGGERING; HIS EYES WERE GLASSY AND UNFOCUSED AND HE WAS CURSING LOUDLY. I EXPLAINED SEAT BELT SIGN WAS ON AND THAT CAPT ASKED ME TO MAKE SURE HE SAT DOWN. HE POINTED HIS FINGER IN MY FACE AND TOLD ME; '(EXPLETIVE) THE CAPT. I WANT THE CAPT HERE RIGHT NOW! HE CAN'T DO ANYTHING TO ME.' I GAVE HIM THE PAX DISTURBANCE FORM TO READ AND HE THREW IT AT ME. CAPT WAS INFORMED AND WE DIVERTED TO SJU TO REMOVE PAX.
column125: A B767 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT AN INTOXICATED PAX WAS SO DISRUPTIVE; THE CAPT DIVERTED TO SJU TO OFF-LOAD THE PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 17; Flight Attendant Total 17; Flight Attendant Type 40
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX IN COACH APCHED FORWARD PART OF ACFT WHEN FO WAS OUT OF COCKPIT AND INSISTED THAT FO EXPLAIN BATHROOM/LAVATORY POLICY IMMEDIATELY. HE WAS AGITATED AND SPOKE IN LOUD VOICE FOR FIRST CLASS PAX BEHIND HIM TO HEAR. WAS ASKED 3 TIMES BY FO TO SIT DOWN AFTER EXPLAINING POLICY TO HIM. BUT HE (THE PAX) REMAINED BY COCKPIT; EXTREMELY UPSET. I KEPT MY HAND ON COFFEE POT READY TO THROW AT PAX IF HE CAME ANY CLOSER TO COCKPIT AREA OR MADE MOVE ON THE FO. VERY BELLIGERENT PAX BEHAVIOR! LATER; NOTICED ON PAPERWORK THAT PAX DID NOT GET HIS FIRST CLASS UPGRADE; SO PROBABLY BOARDED ACFT ALREADY UPSET. NOT HAVING SOME SORT OF DIVIDER BTWN FIRST CLASS AND COACH (WHERE CURTAIN USED TO BE) IS CAUSING MANY PROBS AS WELL AS HAVING ONLY 4 FLT ATTENDANTS WORKING FLT THIS LONG AND FULL! SHOULD'VE BEEN 5 FLT ATTENDANTS.
column125: A B737 FLT ATTENDANT POINTED OUT THAT THE ABSENCE OF THE CURTAIN DIVIDING FIRST CLASS FROM COACH HAS CAUSED A NUMBER OF PROBS FOR FLT ATTENDANTS AS WELL AS THE REDUCTION IN THE NUMBER OF THE FLT ATTENDANT CREW ASSIGNED TO THIS ACFT. PRIMARY PROB WAS CAUSED BY DISRUPTIVE PAX.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 20; Flight Attendant Total 20; Flight Attendant Type 100
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Electronic Device; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WAS FLT ATTENDANT #1 ON FLT FROM PHX-ORD. DURING BOARDING; WHILE PREPARING MY GALLEY; A MALE PAX BOARDED AND AN ALARM SOUND WAS COMING FROM HIS CELL PHONE. MOMENTS LATER; I ASKED THE #4 FLT ATTENDANT IF SHE HEARD IT ALSO AND SHE DID. I ASKED HER TO KEEP AN EYE ON HIM. AFTER WE PUSHED FROM THE GATE; FLT ATTENDANT #4 INFORMED ME THE PAX'S ALARM ON HIS PHONE WAS CONTINUING TO SOUND AND SHE ONCE AGAIN INSTRUCTED HIM TO TURN OFF THE PHONE. I INFORMED THE CAPT OF THE PROB AND HE INSTRUCTED ME THAT; IF IT WENT OFF AGAIN; TO TAKE HIS PHONE AWAY AND REMOVE THE BATTERY AND KEEP THE PHONE IN THE GALLEY DURING FLT. AFTER TKOF; A PAX CALL LIGHT CAME ON. THE #4 FLT ATTENDANT PROCEEDED TO ANSWER THE CALL. A PAX SEATED NEXT TO THE MALE WAS COMPLAINING THAT THE ALARM WAS GOING OFF. #4 FLT ATTENDANT BROUGHT PHONE TO FIRST CLASS GALLEY. WHEN I TOOK THE BATTERY OUT OF THE PHONE; WHITE PAPER FELL OUT. I INFORMED THE CAPT. HE ASKED IF THE PAX WAS BELLIGERENT OR UNRULY. #4 FLT ATTENDANT SAID THE PAX GAVE HER THE PHONE WITHOUT ANY DISRUPTIVE BEHAVIOR; BUT SEEMED A 'BIT OFF.' SHE COULD NOT DETECT ANY ALCOHOL SMELL. AS WE CONTINUED ON THE FLT; I WENT TO COACH CABIN TO PICK UP AND NOTICED THE PAX HAD HIS HEAD ON HIS TRAY TABLE. THEN; HE QUICKLY LIFTED HIS HEAD AND STARED INTO SPACE. I INFORMED THE CAPT. THERE WERE NO MORE DISRUPTIONS ON OUR FLT. SECURITY MET OUR FLT IN CHICAGO AND ESCORTED THE MALE PAX AND HIS PHONE OFF THE ACFT.
column125: A DC9 FLT ATTENDANT IN CHARGE NOTICED PAX BEHAVIOR WHO DID NOT SEEM TO BE AWARE HIS CELL PHONE ALARM WAS GOING OFF. CELL PHONE CONFISCATED BY FLT ATTENDANT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 15; Flight Attendant Total 15
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FIRST CLASS PAX WAS TOLD BY FLT ATTENDANT TO RETURN TO HER SEAT AS SHE KEPT WALKING THROUGHOUT FIRST CLASS GALLEY TO USE LAVATORY. PAX WAS INSULTED. FLT ATTENDANT #6 WENT BACK TO APOLOGIZE. PAX NOW BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE. FLT ATTENDANT #6 WALKED AWAY TO AVOID CONFRONTATION. AT THAT POINT; PAX UNBUCKLED HER SEAT BELT AND LITERALLY RAN AFTER HER THROUGH OUR GALLEY AND UP THE OTHER AISLE WHERE SHE GRABBED FLT ATTENDANT #6 BY THE BACK OF HER BELT AND SPUN HER AROUND TRYING TO HIT HER. PAX IN FIRST CLASS HELD ON TO THE WOMAN TRYING TO STOP HER. I INTERVENED AND TOLD HER TO STOP. I EXPLAINED SHE WAS INTERFERING WITH CREW MEMBERS AND HAS COMMITTED A FEDERAL OFFENSE. I EXPLAINED THE CAPT WOULD LAND AND HAVE HER ARRESTED HAD SHE NOT IMMEDIATELY SAT DOWN. FLT ATTENDANT #6 WORKED COACH AFTER INCIDENT. SHE FOLLOWED MY INSTRUCTIONS AND NO FURTHER INCIDENTS TOOK PLACE. FLT ATTENDANT #6 WAS BADLY SHAKEN AND PULLED FROM THE NEXT LEG. LAPD AND FBI MET US UPON ARR IN LAX.
column125: A B767 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED A PAX WAS SO DISRUPTIVE; ANOTHER PAX HAD TO INTERVENE. PAX WAS DETAINED UPON ARR IN LAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 34; Flight Attendant Total 34; Flight Attendant Type 50
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column119: Environment - Non Weather Related; Human Factors
column121: PAX HAD 4 DRINKS IN THE FIRST HR OF FLT. HE BECAME VERY INEBRIATED AND IRRATIONAL; WOULD NOT SIT DOWN AND PUSHED ME INTO THE GALLEY; DEMANDING MORE TO DRINK. 3 OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS BECAME INVOLVED AND WE ALL TRIED TO CALM HIM DOWN. AFTER AN ALTERCATION WITH THE PURSER; THE DECISION WAS MADE TO PUT DOWN IN SAN JUAN AND HAVE HIM REMOVED. WE DID THIS; THEN CONTINUED TO ARUBA. THE MAN WAS VERY INTIMIDATING AND FOUL. HE KEPT INSISTING WE COULDN'T DO ANYTHING TO HIM.
column125: A B767 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT; DURING A FLT FROM JFK TO AUA; A PAX BECAME SO DISRUPTIVE THE CAPT DIVERTED TO SJU TO OFFLOAD THE PAX.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12.33; Flight Attendant Total 12.33; Flight Attendant Type 70
column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FEMALE PAX SEATED IN EMER EXIT ROW WAS CONSUMING WINE (WHITE) FROM HER OWN BOTTLE AND EXCHANGING CUPS WITH COMPANION; A MAN; ACROSS THE AISLE. BOTH PAX WERE SEATED IN EMER EXIT ROWS. THE WOMAN BECAME BELLIGERENT WHEN ALCOHOL WAS CONFISCATED. PER CAPT; PURSER; AND FLT ATTENDANTS; SHE WAS DENIED ALCOHOL INFLT AND BECAME VERBALLY ABUSIVE BY USING PROFANITY TOWARDS ME. PAX WAS ISSUED 'INFLT DISTURBANCE FORM' AND ASKED TO STOP HER BEHAVIOR. SHE REQUESTED TO SPEAK TO CAPT DURING THE FLT. CAPT WAS AVAILABLE FOR PAX AFTER LNDG IN STX. PAX OPTED NOT TO SPEAK TO CAPT AND LEFT. PAX REFUSED TO GIVE THEIR NAMES. CAPT CALLED DISPATCH TO DENY PAX RETURN TRAVEL ON OUR COMPANY.
column125: A B737 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED 2 PAX DRINKING FROM THEIR OWN BOTTLE AND BECAME BELLIGERENT AFTER THEY WERE CUT OFF FROM FURTHER DRINKING DURING A FLT FROM MIA TO STX.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: ACCORDING TO THE FLT ATTENDANTS; ONCE WE LEFT THE GATE; PAX SITTING IN FIRST CLASS GOT UP TO GO TO THE BATHROOM. DURING THIS TIME; THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT NOTICED THAT HIS FIRST CLASS PAX COUNT DID NOT MATCH HIS PAPERWORK. AFTER CONFIRMING ALL PAX; PAX CAME OUT OF THE LAVATORY AND TOOK A SEAT IN FIRST CLASS. THE #4 FLT ATTENDANT CHKED THE PAPERWORK AND NOTED THE PAX BELONGED IN COACH. HE BROUGHT THIS TO THE ATTN OF THE PAX WHO HOTLY DENIED THAT HE BELONGED IN COACH. HE INSISTED THAT HE HAD PAID THE AGENT $100-$150 FOR AN UPGRADE TO FIRST. IT WAS AT THIS POINT THAT THE #4 FLT ATTENDANT NOTICED THE ALCOHOL ON PAX'S BREATH. THIS INFO WAS RELAYED TO ME AND I CONTACTED MIA OPS TO CONFIRM. I WAS TOLD THAT PAX WAS; IN FACT; ASSIGNED COACH; PLUS HE WAS A STANDBY PAX. I INSTRUCTED THE FLT ATTENDANTS TO REQUIRE PAX TO RETURN TO COACH; FOR HIM TO COOPERATE TOTALLY WITH THE FLT ATTENDANTS; AND TO SERVE HIM NO LIQUOR DURING THE FLT. HE WAS NOT HAPPY; MADE THAT FACT KNOWN; BUT RETURNED TO COACH. PRIOR TO LNDG; PAX REQUIRED THAT A MGMNT TYPE MEET THE ACFT SO HE MIGHT LOG A FORMAL COMPLAINT. DURING THE ENTIRE EVENT; PAX WAS TREATED WITH RESPECT. THE EXCHANGE ON THE TXWY RESULTED IN A 10 MIN DELAY FOR TKOF. WE CAME VERY CLOSE TO RETURNING TO THE GATE AND LEAVING HIM AT MIA.
column125: MD-80 CAPT RPTED BEHAVIOR OF A COACH PAX WHO 'UPGRADED' HIMSELF TO FIRST CLASS UNTIL THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT INFORMED THE CAPT DURING TAXI OUT FOR DEP FROM MIA.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 15; Flight Attendant Total 18; Flight Attendant Type 30
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING BOARDING; A FAMILY OF 5 WITH A NANNY -- 3 BAGS AND CAR SEAT -- BOARDED JUST BEFORE CABIN DOOR WAS CLOSED. WE HAD TAKEN A 2 HR DELAY DUE TO WX. FAMILY WAS STILL IN AISLE WITH BAGS AFTER MAIN DOOR CLOSED. I APCHED AND ASKED THEM TO PLEASE SIT DOWN. THEY TOOK THEIR TIME AND EVENTUALLY GOT SETTLED. ONCE WE REACHED CRUISE; I WAS IN AISLE SELLING HEADSETS WHEN I GOT TO THEIR ROW. THE HUSBAND SAID; 'DON'T YOU THINK YOU WERE OUT OF LINE EARLIER?' I REPLIED; 'I WAS DOING MY JOB.' HIS WIFE THEN GOT UP AND ASKED FOR MY NAME. WHEN I REFUSED TO GIVE IT TO HER; I TURNED AND PROCEEDED UP THE AISLE AND NOTICED SHE WAS BEHIND ME AND SHOUTING; 'TURN AROUND AND DEAL WITH ME.' SHE KEPT SHOUTING THAT AS I WENT UP TO FIRST CLASS AND CALLED THE CAPT. SHE WAS VERY THREATENING AND INTIMIDATING AND INTERFERED WITH MY DUTIES AND FAILED TO COMPLY WHEN I REQUESTED FOR HER TO GO BACK AND SIT DOWN. THE SEAT BELT SIGN WAS STILL ON. SHE WAS IN MY FACE; SHOUTING. A LOT OF PAX WERE VISIBLY UPSET BY THIS. THE CAPT DID NOT WANT TO GET POLICE INVOLVED; BUT I INSISTED AND 5 POLICE MET OUR FLT IN EWR. THEY TOOK MY STATEMENT AND HERS AND TOLD ME THEY WOULD FORWARD A COPY TO THE FAA AND IT WOULD BE UP TO THE FAA IF ANY ACTION IS TAKEN. I GOT SERVED WITNESSES' INFO.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED AN ARGUMENT WITH A MARRIED COUPLE DURING A FLT TO EWR AFTER BOARDING PROCESS WAS COMPLETE.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 20; Flight Attendant Total 20
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Smoke / Fire / Fumes / Odor
column121: WHILE SERVING DINNER TO THE FIRST CLASS PAX; I NOTICED A YOUNG MAN EMERGE FROM THE FIRST CLASS LAVATORY. AS HE WALKED THROUGH THE CABIN ON HIS WAY TO HIS SEAT IN MAIN CABIN; MYSELF AND SEVERAL PAX DETECTED A VERY STRONG CIGARETTE SMOKE ODOR. AT THE SAME TIME; THE CAPT CALLED ON THE INTERPHONE AND ASKED ME WHY HE COULD SMELL CIGARETTE SMOKE IN THE COCKPIT. I IMMEDIATELY CHKED THE LAVATORY BUT FOUND NO FIRE OR PHYSICAL EVIDENCE OF THE PAX HAVING SMOKED IN THERE; JUST A VERY STRONG SMELL. MYSELF AND A MAIN CABIN FLT ATTENDANT BROUGHT THE PAX FORWARD AND QUESTIONED HIM. HE DENIED HAVING SMOKED; HOWEVER; HE RETURNED TO HIS SEAT AND THEN CAME TO US WITH A BROKEN PIECE OF CIGARETTE AND TOLD US THAT WAS WHAT WE HAD SMELLED. HE CLAIMED THAT HE NEVER LIT IT. THE MAIN CABIN FLT ATTENDANT THEN NOTICED HE HAD A PRESCRIPTION BOTTLE AT HIS SEAT WHICH HE HANDED OVER TO HER WHEN SHE ASKED FOR IT. IT WAS FOR XANAX. WE GOT HIS NAME OFF THE PRESCRIPTION BOTTLE; NOT THE PAX MANIFEST AS IT WAS INCOMPLETE. HE CLAIMED TO HAVE TAKEN SEVERAL XANAX. MEANWHILE; THE CAPT HAD CONTACTED DISPATCH ABOUT THE INCIDENT AND HE WAS HAVING THE AUTHS MEET THE FLT. THE PLT MANUAL STATES THAT AUTHS MUST BE NOTIFIED IF THE PAX IS SUSPECTED OF SMOKING IN A LAVATORY -- THIS IS NOT THE SAME WORDING THAT IS IN OUR MANUAL. OURS STATES WE ARE TO ISSUE A 'PAX INFLT DISTURBANCE RPT;' WHICH WE DID. MCO POLICE OFFICERS MET THE FLT; ASKED ME TO DESCRIBE THE INCIDENT AND POINT OUT THE PAX TO THEM. THEY QUESTIONED HIM AT LENGTH. THE CAPT AND I BOTH FILLED OUT A RPT FOR THE POLICE OFFICERS. BECAUSE WE WERE AT 'ORANGE;' THE MCO POLICE TOLD US THAT THE FBI HAD TO BE NOTIFIED AND THAT THEY (THE FBI) WOULD ULTIMATELY DECIDE WHAT TO DO WITH THE PAX. THEY WERE IN THE PROCESS OF CALLING THE FBI WHEN WE WERE ALLOWED TO LEAVE FOR OUR HOTEL.
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A PAX WAS SMOKING IN THE FORWARD LAVATORY WHICH WAS DETECTED BY THE CAPT ON THE FLT DECK DURING A FLT FROM ORD TO MCO.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WAS ALLOWED TO BOARD ACFT INTOXICATED. PAX SVC SUPVR WAS ALERTED OF SIT; AS WELL AS THE CAPT. CAPT INFORMED ME; AS FLT ATTENDANT #1; THAT THERE WAS NOTHING HE COULD DO TO REMOVE THIS PAX. PAX WAS INTOXICATED AND INCOHERENT. PAX INSISTED; DURING FLT; TO BE SERVED ALCOHOL; WHICH WE REFUSED. PAX WANTED TO GET TO THE COCKPIT TO TALK TO THE CAPT BECAUSE WE WERE REFUSING TO SERVE HIM ALCOHOL. PAX INFORMED ME THAT TSA TOOK ALL OF HIS ALCOHOL IN SECURITY THAT DAY. WE HAD TO INTERVENE WITH THE PAX SEVERAL TIMES AND HAD TO ASK HIM TO SIT DOWN ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS. PAX INSISTED TO STAND IN BACK OF ACFT. PAX WAS INFORMED ABOUT HIS BEHAVIOR AND THAT HE NEEDED TO COMPLY. AT THE MOMENT OF BOARDING; SEVERAL PAX MADE US AWARE ABOUT THIS PAX'S BEHAVIOR OUTSIDE IN THE WAITING AREA. THIS ALL COULD HAVE BEEN PREVENTED IF THE AGENTS AND CHICAGO ARPT WOULD HAVE DONE THEIR JOBS. IF THE PAX APPEARS TO BE INTOXICATED; AND IN THIS CASE IT WAS OBVIOUS THAT HE WAS BECAUSE HE COULD NOT ANSWER ANY QUESTIONS ASKED; WHY DID THEY ALLOW HIM TO BOARD? FURTHERMORE; WHY DID THE CAPT LEAVE US WITH THE PAX ONBOARD? HE IS THE FINAL AUTH (I GUESS NOT).
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT IN CHARGE NOTICED A MAN WAS INTOXICATED DURING BOARDING IN ORD; BUT THE GATE AGENT SUPVR AND CAPT REFUSED TO HAVE HIM REMOVED.

column121: AFTER TKOF; PAX X NOTIFIED THE FA THAT SHE HAD WENT THRU SECURITY WITH A HAND GUN IN HER PURSE. GUN WAS PUT IN FA'S SUITCASE AND LOCKED. FLT RETURNED TO MBPV. AFTER RESCREENING THE PAX; AND CHECKING THE CABIN; FLT CONTINUED WITHOUT FURTHER INCIDENT. FLT WAS NOT OVER WT FOR LANDING. CREW DID NOT DECLARE AN EMER. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 607846: ON A FLIGHT FROM MBPV TO ZZZ WE RETURNED TO MBPV DUE TO FEMALE PAX TURNED OVER HER HAND GUN TO FA AFTER TKOF. PAX REPORTEDLY ADVISED FORGOT SHE HAD A GUN IN HER BAG. FLT DECK WAS NOTIFIED AND ITEM WAS SECURED IN COCKPIT. FLT RETURNED WITHOUT INCIDENT. ITEM WAS REPORTEDLY RESCREENED IN ORIGINAL BAG. MACHINE DID PICK UP ITEM. SCREENER REPORTEDLY MISSED THE GUN AGAIN. ACFT/PAX RESCREENED WITH DIFFERENT SCREENER PERSONNEL. FLT RE-DEPARTED.
column125: A B757-200 FLT AND CABIN CREW RPTED A FEMALE PAX WHO HAD MADE IT THROUGH SCREENING AT MBPV WITH A HAND GUN WHICH SHE PRESENTED TO A FA AFTER DEP. THE CAPT RETURNED THE FLT TO MBPV FOR ACFT AND PAX RE-SCREENING.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX IN COACH; A WOMAN; WAS LOUDLY ARGUING WITH HER MALE TRAVEL COMPANION SITTING NEXT TO HER. HE PUNCHED HER ON THE CHEEKBONE AND A BRUISE FORMED. SHE WAS EXTREMELY UPSET; CRYING AND SOMEWHAT HYSTERICAL. MR X; HE WAS VERY CONFRONTATIONAL WITH MYSELF; COACH FLT ATTENDANTS; AND CAPT. WE SEPARATED THE COUPLE; BUT HAD TO WATCH HIM THE REMAINDER OF THE FLT. HE TRIED; ON NUMEROUS OCCASIONS; TO GAIN ACCESS TO THE WOMAN PAX. HE COMPLIED WITH CREW MEMBER INSTRUCTIONS; BUT IT WAS STRESSFUL FOR THE FLT ATTENDANTS IN THE MAIN CABIN; WHO HAD TO PERFORM THE BREAKFAST SVC WHILE CONSTANTLY MONITORING THE COUPLE. POLICE MET THE FLT IN LONDON. THE WOMAN WAS WORRIED ABOUT HER SAFETY. BY THE WAY; THE MAN WAS SERVED ABOUT 3 DRINKS; INFLT; PRIOR TO INCIDENT.
column125: B777 PURSER RPTED THAT A COUPLE GOT INTO FISTICUFFS DURING A FLT FROM ORD TO LHR; RESULTING IN POLICE MEETING THE FLT.
