column121: THE PA TO DISCONTINUE USING ELECTRONIC DEVICES WAS ALREADY GIVEN SEVERAL TIMES. I WALKED THROUGH THE CABIN TO MAKE SURE NOBODY WAS USING THEIR ELECTRONIC DEVICES AND THAT THE ONES OUT WERE OFF SO THAT FLT ATTENDANT #1 COULD SHUT THE COCKPIT DOOR. WHEN I WENT BACK TO MY STARTING POS FOR THE SAFETY DEMONSTRATION; PAX SEATING IN FRONT OF ME IN COACH; WAS USING HIS BLACKBERRY. I TOLD HIM ALL ELECTRONIC DEVICES NEEDED TO BE OFF. HE SAID IT WAS OFF; BUT CONTINUED TO SCROLL AND TOUCH ICONS (I GUESS TO OPEN DIFFERENT MENUS). ACR HAS NOT KEPT THE FLT ATTENDANTS UP-TO-DATE ON ALL THE NEW ELECTRONIC DEVICES. I ASKED HIM IF IT WAS OFF; THEN HOW IS HE STILL USING IT? HE TOLD ME; ONCE AGAIN; THE PWR WAS OFF. I DIDN'T FALL FOR IT. MEANWHILE; THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS HAD STARTED WITH THE SAFETY DEMONSTRATION. WHEN I REALIZED PAX WAS NOT GOING TO COOPERATE; I GAVE THE FLT ATTENDANTS THE 'CUT' SIGN SO THEY WOULD STOP THE DEMONSTRATION. AFTER FURTHER DISCUSSION WITH PAX; HE FINALLY SAID; 'WELL; THE WIRELESS PART IS OFF' AND HE SHOWED ME. I TOLD HIM THE DEVICE NEEDED TO BE TURNED COMPLETELY OFF AND THAT HE NEEDS TO LISTEN. HIS REPLY WAS; 'WHAT?' THEN THE PAX ACROSS THE AISLE TOLD PAX THAT HE NEEDS TO LISTEN. FINALLY; THE DEVICE WAS TURNED OFF. THE DEMONSTRATION WAS DONE. NO FURTHER PROBS. TO HELP CORRECT THIS; WE NEED TO GO BACK TO TURNING OFF ELECTRONIC DEVICES 10 MINS BEFORE DEP INSTEAD OF WHEN THE ACFT DOOR CLOSES. ALSO; WHEN I AM FLT ATTENDANT #1; I FIND I HAVE TO WALK THROUGH THE CABIN TO MAKE SURE ALL ELECTRONIC DEVICES ARE OFF; LEAVING MY 2 ARMED DOORS UNATTENDED. SO; IT WOULD ALSO BE SAFER.
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT MADE A SAFETY SUGGESTION THAT PERSONAL ELECTRONIC DEVICES (PEDS) BE TURNED OFF PRIOR TO BOARDING ACFT AFTER A CONFRONTATION WITH AN UNCOOPERATIVE PAX ON A FLT FROM IAH TO DFW.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 13; Flight Attendant Total 21; Flight Attendant Type 70
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX REQUESTED COMPLIMENTARY UPGRADE WHICH WAS REFUSED. SHE WAS VISIBLY UNHAPPY. AFTER MEAL SVC; SHE PUT HER TRAY ON THE FLOOR IN THE AISLE AND WHEN FLT ATTENDANT #6 ASKED HER FOR IT; SHE REFUSED. AS FLT PROGRESSED; SHE WAS VISIBLY ANNOYED WITH PA SAFETY ANNOUNCEMENTS; EVEN TELLING ME TO 'SHUSH' DURING A SEATBELT ANNOUNCEMENT. TOWARDS END OF FLT; FLT ATTENDANT #8 ASKED HER TO PASS THE TRAY AND SHE KICKED IT TOWARDS HER AND TURNED HER BACK ON HER. FINALLY; FLT ATTENDANT #6 ASKED HER TO GIVE THE TRAY TO HER OR SHE WOULD WRITE UP THE INCIDENT. THE PAX TOLD HER THAT THE FLT ATTENDANT WAS REFUSING TO DO HER JOB. FLT ATTENDANT INFORMED HER THAT HER JOB WAS NOT TO PICK UP THE TRAY FROM THE FLOOR. THE CAPT MADE A FINAL APCH PA AND I MADE; 'PREPARE FOR LNDG PA.' AS I WAS TAKING ITEMS INTO THE GALLEY; PAX CAME CHARGING FORWARD. I STOPPED HER AND ASKED HER TO TAKE HER SEAT. SHE STOOD IN FRONT OF ME AND WAVED HER FINGER IN MY FACE; DEMANDING FLT ATTENDANT #6'S NAME. I TOLD HER I WOULD GIVE HER MY BUSINESS CARD; BUT SHE MUST RETURN TO HER SEAT. SHE REFUSED. SHE THEN STARTED TO SHOUT AT ME; STILL WAVING HER FINGER IN A THREATENING MANNER. I ASKED HER SEVERAL TIMES TO SIT DOWN AND SHE SAID; 'YOU WORK FOR ME; NOT ME FOR YOU.' I SAID; 'NO MA'AM; I WORK FOR THIS AIRLINE.' SHE RESPONDED; 'AND WHERE DO YOU THINK THE MONEY COMES FROM?' I SAID; 'YOU NEED TO SIT DOWN NOW.' SHE TURNED AND WALKED AWAY SAYING; 'YOU'RE NOTHING BUT A BUNCH OF SKY WAITRESSES -- THAT'S WHAT YOU ARE.' I RESPONDED; 'NO MA'AM; WE ARE SAFETY PROFESSIONALS.' SHE SAT IN HER SEAT YELLING; 'YOU ARE JUST A BUNCH OF WAITRESSES IN THE SKY.' I CALLED THE CAPT AND ADVISED HIM THAT THE PROB WITH THE PAX HAD ESCALATED AND PLEASE HAVE AUTHS MEET ACFT. I FILLED OUT A PAX DISTURBANCE FORM AND PRESENTED THE LOWER PORTION TO THE PAX. I TOLD HER I WAS GIVING HER NOTICE THAT SHE HAD FAILED TO COMPLY WITH CREW MEMBER REQUESTS AND THAT HER BEHAVIOR ON THE FLT WAS UNACCEPTABLE. SHE STARTED TO ARGUE WITH ME AND I TOLD HER SHE HAD BEEN DISRUPTIVE; DISRESPECTFUL AND RUDE. AS SHE DEPLANED ACFT; I DIRECTED HER TO THE STATE POLICE WHO WERE WAITING FOR HER. I THEN BRIEFED THE STATE TROOPER ON HER BEHAVIOR.
column125: AN A300 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED ON A DISRUPTIVE PAX WHO WAS ANGRY ABOUT NOT BEING UPGRADED DURING A FLT FROM SJU TO BOS.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 14; Flight Attendant Total 14
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING THE FLT; AFT FLT ATTENDANT CALLED TO INFORM ME THAT SEVERAL CHILDREN WERE JUMPING FROM SEAT TO SEAT AND THAT SURROUNDING PAX WERE GETTING UPSET. I SPOKE TO ONE OF THE PARENTS FROM THE GROUP. HER RESPONSE; 'THEY ARE KIDS. WHAT DO YOU WANT ME TO DO?' THE SEATBELT SIGN WAS ILLUMINATED DUE TO TURB THROUGHOUT THE FLT. HOWEVER; THE PARENTS WERE NOT COMPLYING WITH CREW MEMBERS' INSTRUCTIONS. THE CHILDREN; AS WELL AS THE PARENTS; WERE UP AND ABOUT. UPON ARR INTO LA GUARDIA; WE HAD TO WAIT FOR A GATE. I RECEIVED A CALL FROM MAIN CABIN INDICATING THAT THE CHILDREN WERE RUNNING IN THE AISLE. I MADE 4 ANNOUNCEMENTS IN REGARDS TO SEATBELT SIGN IS ILLUMINATED; BUT NO ONE COMPLIED. AFTER SEVERAL CALLS FROM MAIN CABIN; I PROCEEDED TO MAIN CABIN AND THAT WAS WHEN PAX JUMPED UP IN A VERY INTIMIDATING WAY AND SAID 'WHAT THE (EXPLETIVE); OUR SEATBELT IS ON.' THE VERBAL ABUSE WAS TOO MUCH FOR ME TO HANDLE. I THEN INFORMED THE CAPT. HE MADE AN ANNOUNCEMENT THAT IF THE CHILDREN WERE NOT SEATED; HE WOULD MAKE THE PARENTS RESPONSIBLE. THAT WAS WHEN MAIN CABIN CALLED AND SAID THAT THEY WERE CHANTING A PHRASE; AND THAT THEY SHOULD GET ARRESTED. THEY DIDN'T CARE; AT LEAST THEY WOULD GET OUT OF THE ACFT FIRST. AS THE AIRPLANE WAS TAXIING; I NOTICED THE CHILDREN WERE STILL STANDING IN THE AISLE. I INFORMED THE CAPT AND SECURITY WAS CALLED. WHEN POLICE ARRIVED; I INFORMED THE OFFICER THAT THE GENTLEMEN; WHO VERBALLY ABUSED ME WITH PROFANITY; SHOULD BE ARRESTED FOR NOT FOLLOWING CREW MEMBERS' INSTRUCTIONS; AND EXPLAINED THE FEDERAL OFFENSE OF THAT CONSEQUENCE. ALSO; THEY WERE INTIMIDATING THE CREW. WHEN THE GENTLEMEN CAME OFF THE ACFT AND WAS QUESTIONED BY THE POLICE; HE PROCEEDED TO POINT AT ME AND STARTED SCREAMING AT ME; 'YOU SHOULD BE THE ONE TO GET (EXPLETIVE) ARRESTED FOR LETTING US SIT THERE; YOU (EXPLETIVE).' AGAIN; PORT AUTH POLICE DID NOTHING. AT THIS POINT I WAS ESCORTED TO MY NEXT FLT; WHILE THEY WERE BEING QUESTIONED. THEY STILL (THE GROUP) PROCEEDED TO SCREAM AT THE CREW; INCLUDING PROFANITY WORDS. THE NEXT DAY I CALLED THE FAA TO RPT THIS INCIDENT. THE PAX SHOULD BE FINED AND OR PENALIZED FOR THEIR ACTIONS; TO THE FULL EXTENT OF THE LAW.
column125: A B767 PURSER RPTED THAT CHILDREN; BELONGING TO A GROUP; WERE UP WHEN THE SEATBELT SIGN WAS ILLUMINATED. INTERVENTION WAS MET WITH PROFANITY AND UNWILLINGNESS TO OBEY THE CABIN CREW. POLICE WERE INEFFECTIVE; UPON LNDG.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12; Flight Attendant Total 12; Flight Attendant Type 60
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: 2 STEPS INTO THE ACFT; MALE PAX DEMANDS TO FLT ATTENDANT #1 TO HAVE HIS FUR COAT HUNG UP. SHE KINDLY EXPLAINED TO HIM THAT ONCE HE WAS SEATED; WE COULD COME AND HANG IT UP FOR HIM. I FOLLOWED HIM BACK TO HIS SEAT AND STAND AT CLOSET; HANGING A PAX'S COAT THAT I HAD PICKED UP ON THE WAY BACK. WHILE I WAS MARKING THE TAG; MALE PAX WITH FUR COAT; FIRST CLASS; LITERALLY THROWS HIS FUR COAT ONTO THE FLOOR OF THE COAT CLOSET AND PUTS HIS BAG INTO THE OVERHEAD BIN. HE REMARKS 'THAT IS $10000 LAYING ON THE FLOOR.' ONCE HE GETS HIS BAG IN THE OVERHEAD BIN; HE STARTS TO MOVE INTO HIS ROW. I ASKED HIM IF HE WAS GOING TO PICK HIS COAT UP AND HAND IT TO ME OR IF HE WAS JUST GOING TO THROW IT AND LEAVE IT ON THE FLOOR. HE STARTED YELLING THAT HE CAN'T PICK IT UP BECAUSE HE HAD TO PUT HIS OWN BAG IN THE OVERHEAD BIN. I GO IMMEDIATELY TO THE CAPT AND TELL HIM WE HAVE A PROB WITH THIS PAX AND THAT I WOULD KEEP HIM UPDATED. A NON-REVENUE FLT ATTENDANT IN UNIFORM BOARDS THE ACFT. PAX ASKS HER LOUDLY IF 'THE HEAD CHEESE' WAS AT THE TOP OF THE JETBRIDGE BECAUSE HE HAD A COMPLAINT. SHE REPLIES THAT IF HE HAS A COMPLAINT; HE COULD TALK TO A GATE AGENT. HE GETS OUT HIS CELL PHONE AND CALLS SOMEONE TO GET THE NUMBER FOR CUSTOMER SVC FOR COMPANY. HIS TONE OF VOICE IS VERY LOUD. HE IS BASICALLY YELLING THAT 'THIS STEWARDESS' WOULDN'T PUT HIS BAG UP AND HANG HIS COAT. HE WAS TRYING TO INTIMIDATE AND THREATEN ME WITH HIS LOUD WORDS AND VERBAL ACTIONS. HE KEPT ON AND ON; SO I LEANED OVER TO HIM AND TOUCHED HIS ARM AND SAID; 'SIR; I HATE TO TELL YOU THIS; BUT I AM NOT AFRAID OF YOU...CALLING CUSTOMER SVC. IF YOU ARE UNHAPPY WITH THIS FLT YOU ARE MORE THAN WELCOME TO TAKE ANOTHER FLT.' HE YELLS; 'HOW DARE YOU TOUCH ME. DON'T TOUCH ME! SHE IS THREATENING ME; SHE IS THREATENING ME!' AT THAT POINT; I WENT STRAIGHT TO THE CAPT AND TOLD HIM ABOUT THIS MAN'S BEHAVIOR. HE WAS REMOVED FROM THE FLT BECAUSE HE WAS DISTURBING THE PAX AND INTERFERING WITH THE CREW MEMBER'S DUTIES.
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A FIRST CLASS PAX BECAME DISRUPTIVE AND RUDE AFTER SHE INITIALLY REFUSED TO HANG UP HIS FUR COAT DURING BOARDING.

column96: Flight Crew Last 90 Days 90; Flight Crew Total 20000; Flight Crew Type 800
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING TAXI; THE PURSER ADVISED THAT SHE HAD A PCFA (PERSON CARRYING FIRE ARMS) ON HER LIST WHO HAD NOT IDENTED HIMSELF TO ANY FLT CREW MEMBER. A US MARSHAL WAS ASKED IF HE HAD ANY PAPERWORK AND PRESENTED HIS 'NOTICE TO ARMED INDIVIDUALS AND PRISONER ESCORTS' FORM. AFTER BRINGING IT TO THE FLT DECK; WE CONTACTED OPS AND SPOKE DIRECTLY WITH THE BOARDING AGENT AND TICKET AGENT WHO SIGNED THE FORM IN ORDER TO DETERMINE HIS VALIDITY. IT WAS MUTUALLY AGREED BY ALL TO CONTINUE THE FLT AND SPEAK DIRECTLY WITH THE MARSHAL UPON LNDG. HE DENIED THAT HE HAD BEEN TOLD TO TALK TO ANYONE ON BOARD AND APOLOGIZED. THIS BREACH OF SOP IS AN OBVIOUS SECURITY CONCERN AND AGENCIES SHOULD ENSURE THAT PCFA'S ALWAYS IDENT THEMSELVES TO FLT CREW MEMBERS UPON BOARDING. HE CLAIMED THAT OTHER AIRLINES DO NOT HAVE THIS POLICY.
column125: A B757-200 CAPT RPTED THAT A US MARSHAL DID NOT FILE THE REQUIRED PAPERWORK TO CARRY A FIREARM AFTER THE FLT HAD ALREADY PUSHED BACK.

column96: Flight Crew Last 90 Days 180; Flight Crew Total 15000; Flight Crew Type 12000
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: THE FLT CREW WAS PLACED IN AN EXTRAORDINARILY UNCOMFORTABLE AND POTENTIALLY VERY DANGEROUS SIT. FLT WAS DELAYED FOR BAD WX IN PHX AND LAS. WE BOARDED 1 1/2 HRS LATE. BOARDING PAX WERE VERY ANGRY AND UPSET BY THE DELAY. APPROX 30-40 PEOPLE IN THE BACK OF THE ACFT WERE PARTICULARLY RUDE AND OBNOXIOUS. THEY WERE SWEARING; YELLING AND CHANTING; INCLUDING CHANTING DEMANDS FOR FREE DRINKS. THE FLT ATTENDANTS; FEARING AN OUT OF CTL MOB; APCHED THE FLT DECK CREW AND RELAYED THEIR FEAR OF THE SIT. THEY SAID THE UNRULY PAX WERE EXTREMELY ABUSIVE; DID NOT TAKE DIRECTION; AND WERE GENERALLY OUT OF CTL. THE FLT ATTENDANTS ALSO STATED THAT THEY SMELLED ALCOHOL. FEARING A POTENTIALLY VIOLENT DISRUPTION; I HAD THE OPS AGENT CALL FOR CSA (CUSTOMER SVC AGENT). 3 CSA'S AND 3 POLICE OFFICERS ARRIVED WITHIN 1 MIN. THEY SPOKE WITH THOSE IN THE BACK OF THE PLANE AND PLACED 1 PAX IN POLICE CUSTODY. THE FLT ATTENDANTS; POLICE; CSA'S AND OPS AGENT ALL AGREED THAT THERE WERE BTWN 30-40 PEOPLE ACTING OUT OF CTL. I WAS CONCERNED THAT ONCE THE AUTHS LEFT THE ACFT; AND WE PUSHED BACK FROM THE GATE; THESE SAME PEOPLE WOULD AGAIN BECOME OUT OF CTL. THE SIT COULD JEOPARDIZE THE SAFETY OF FELLOW PAX; FLT ATTENDANTS AND THE ACFT. I FELT COMPELLED TO SEEK THE GUIDANCE OF THE CHIEF PLT ON DUTY CONCERNING CONTINUATION OF THE SCHEDULED FLT. HE ADVISED ME TO SPEAK WITH THE PAX AND PROCEED WITH THE FLT. I MADE A PA AND EXPLAINED TO EVERYONE ONBOARD THAT BECAUSE OF WX THE SEATBELT SIGN WOULD REMAIN ILLUMINATED FOR THE DURATION OF THE FLT. ALSO; BECAUSE OF MY CONCERNS WITH THE CONDUCT OF CERTAIN PAX; NO ALCOHOL WOULD BE SERVED DURING THE SHORT FLT. I EXPLAINED THAT ANY INFLT DISRUPTIONS OR OTHER INTERFERENCE WOULD RESULT IN THE FLT RETURNING TO PHX. I FURTHER ASKED IF ANYONE NEEDED CLARIFICATION. IT WAS IMPOSSIBLE FOR ME TO DISCERN THE PARTIES WHO HAD BEEN MISBEHAVING FROM THE OTHER PAX. SOME PAX (ONE MAN IN PARTICULAR) WERE ANNOYED BY BEING GROUPED WITH THE MISBEHAVING PAX. WE PROCEEDED WITHOUT FURTHER INCIDENT. UPON ARR IN LAS THE PAX WHO HAD NOT MISBEHAVED ACTED UPSET AND RUDE AND ABUSIVE BEHAVIOR. SEVERAL THREATENED TO RPT ME. A CSA CAME TO THE ACFT ABOUT 5 MINS AFTER OUR ARR. I LATER LEARNED THAT CSA'S; OPS AGENTS AND THE ARPT POLICE IN PHX HAD BEEN OBSERVING THESE PEOPLE IN THE GATE AREA BEFORE BOARDING. CSA'S; OPS AND POLICE WERE AWARE OF THE SIT BUT DID NOT INFORM THE FLT CREW. BOARDING THE ROWDY MOB REMOVED THEM FROM THE GATE AREA; BUT PLACED THEM IN A MORE DANGEROUS ENVIRONMENT. I FEEL STRONGLY THAT THIS ACTION PLACED THE CREW AND FELLOW PAX IN JEOPARDY AND CREATED A POTENTIALLY VERY SERIOUS SIT. HAD THE PAX BECOME VIOLENT INFLT THEIR NUMBERS WOULD HAVE ASSURED DISASTER. EVERY EFFORT SHOULD BE MADE TO ASSURE THIS SIT DOES NOT OCCUR AGAIN.
column125: A B737-700 CAPT RPTED THAT A LATE BOARDING IN PHX CAUSED 30-40 PAX TO BE DISRUPTIVE BEFORE PUSHBACK; YET THE FLT CONTINUED TO LAS.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 38; Flight Attendant Total 38
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: AFTER THE CAPT SAID; 'FLT ATTENDANTS; PREPARE FOR TKOF;' A YOUNG MAN SEATED IN XA GOT UP AND WALKED RAPIDLY TO THE LAVATORY NEAR DOOR 3L. I IMMEDIATELY MADE A PA; TELLING HIM TO SIT DOWN; BUT HE WENT INTO THE LAVATORY. I NOTIFIED THE CAPT WHO HELD THE ACFT ON THE RWY (WE HAD NOT BEGUN OUR TKOF ROLL). FLT ATTENDANT #2 KNOCKED ON THE LAVATORY DOOR; BUT THE MAN REFUSED TO COME OUT. AFTER FLT ATTENDANT #2 AND I ADVISED THE CAPT; HE OPTED TO RETURN TO THE GATE. THE PAX LEFT THE LAVATORY AFTER ABOUT 2 MINS. WE WERE MET BY COMPANY SECURITY AND MASSACHUSETTS STATE POLICE. THEY TOOK THE MAN OFF THE AIRPLANE AND HE WAS SUBSEQUENTLY ARRESTED. THE LAVATORY AND HIS SEAT AREA WERE SEARCHED BY MAINT AND THE BOMB SNIFFING DOG. THE PAX'S BAGS WERE REMOVED AND WE DEPARTED APPROX 1 HR LATE.
column125: B777-200 CREW RETURNED TO THE GATE AFTER A PAX URGENTLY NEEDED TO GO TO THE LAVATORY; JUST BEFORE TKOF.

column96: Flight Crew Last 90 Days 225; Flight Crew Total 11100; Flight Crew Type 6700

column116: Automation Aircraft Other Automation; Person Flight Crew
column118: Air Traffic Control Issued New Clearance; Air Traffic Control Provided Assistance; Flight Crew Executed Go Around / Missed Approach
column121: WE WERE AT 2000 FT MSL ON A HDG CLRED TO MAINTAIN 2000 FT TILL ESTABLISHED AND CLRED FOR THE ILS RWY 13 AT JAX. THE LOC CAME ALIVE AND THE FO WHO WAS FLYING BEGAN A DSCNT TO 1700 FT WHICH WAS THE GIA. JUST AFTER BEGINNING THE DSCNT; THE LOC BEGAN TO PING FROM SIDE TO SIDE ON BOTH CAPT AND FO'S INSTS. WE INFORMED JAX APCH OF THE PROB; CLBED BACK TO 2000 FT AND WERE GIVEN ANOTHER VECTOR AS WE HAD GONE THROUGH THE COURSE. THERE WERE NO FLAGS AND THE IDENT WAS GOOD. APCH THEN SAID IF WE CONTINUED TO HAVE A PROB WITH THE ILS; WE WOULD BE GIVEN A SURVEILLANCE TO RWY 7. I ASKED IF ANYONE WAS IN THE CLR ZONE AND WAS INFORMED THAT THERE WAS NOT. ADDITIONALLY; THE ACFT PRECEDING US AND BEHIND US HAD NO LOC PROBS. WE CONTINUED TO HAVE DIFFICULTY WITH THE LOC AND ENDED UP FLYING THE SURVEILLANCE TO RWY 7. THE ILS SEEMED TO OPERATE FINE ON THE GND AND SINCE WE HAD NO PROBS WITH IT EARLIER; I THOUGHT PERHAPS SOMEONE HAD USED SOME ELECTRONIC EQUIP IN THE CABIN DURING OUR APCH. I CHKED WITH THE FLT ATTENDANTS AND; IN FACT; A GUY HAD OPERATED A PALM PILOT OF SOME SORT DURING THE APCH. WE WERE UNABLE TO TALK TO THE PAX BECAUSE HE HAD ALREADY LEFT THE ACFT BY THE TIME WE TALKED TO THE FLT ATTENDANTS. I ASSUMED THAT WAS THE PROB AND ADVISED THE CREW WHO TOOK THE ACFT AT JAX WHAT HAD OCCURRED. I DID NOT WRITE UP THE OCCURRENCE IN THE LOGBOOK. AFTER FURTHER REFLECTION; I PROBABLY SHOULD HAVE BECAUSE THERE IS NO WAY I CAN PROVE THE PALM PILOT WAS THE CAUSE.
column125: B737-300 CREW HAD ERRATIC LOC SIGNALS ON ILS RWY 13 AND RWY 7 AT JAX. A PAX WAS USING A 'PALM PILOT' AT THE TIME.

column28: Class E MIA.E; Class E ZMA.E
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FEMALE PAX BOARDED ACFT CURSING AND ANGRY THAT HER BAGS WOULD NOT MAKE THE FLT TO FLL. HER FLT FROM HAWAII WAS LATE ARRIVING; THEREFORE SHE WAS TOLD HER BAGS WOULD NOT MAKE OUR FLT. SHE PACED UP AND DOWN THE AISLE; SAT ON HER ARMREST; BOTH WHILE THE SEATBELT SIGN WAS ON/OFF. SHE ASKED ME FOR ALCOHOL AND I TOLD HER I WOULD NOT SERVE HER ANY DUE TO THE FACT SHE WAS SO FRUSTRATED. I FELT LIKE SHE WAS ALREADY ON 'SOMETHING.' I TOLD HER TWICE TO FASTEN HER SEATBELT. MIDDLE OF FLT; I SAW HER LAYING DOWN IN A ROW OF 3 SEATS. ANOTHER PAX ALSO SHARED HER ROW. SHE HAD HER FEET ON HIS TRAY TABLE RIGHT IN FRONT OF HIS FACE. HE DID NOT SPEAK ENGLISH; SO HE DIDN'T SAY ANYTHING TO HER. FEMALE PAX WAS NOT RESPECTING HIS SPACE. AFTER THE GEAR CAME DOWN; FLT ATTENDANTS IN JUMPSEAT FOR LNDG; PAX GOT UP TO USE LAVATORY. I TOLD HER TO RETURN TO SEAT AND FASTEN SEATBELT. SHE BEHAVED LIKE A CHILD.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT AN AGGRESSIVE PAX WOULD NOT COMPLY WITH THE SEATBELT SIGN DURING A FLT TO FLL.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 12; Flight Attendant Total 18
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: ON FLT FROM SJU TO FLL; PAX WAS TOO BUSY WITH HIS CELLULAR PHONE AND REFUSED TO STOW HIS 2 CARRY-ON BAGS. AS WE WERE PREPARING FOR CLOSING THE DOORS AND PUSHBACK FROM GATE; PAX HAD HIS LUGGAGE ON FLOOR IN FRONT OF MY JUMPSEAT AND IN FRONT OF 2R DOOR (EXIT-EMER EXIT). AFTER REQUESTING PAX TO STOW HIS LUGGAGE SEVERAL TIMES; HE INSISTED HE WOULD DO IT LATER. WE COULD NOT GIVE CAPT 'THE CABIN SECURE' RPT FOR DEP. WE COULD NOT PUSH BACK OR CLOSE DOOR OF ACFT. I EXPLAINED TO PAX HE WAS NOT FOLLOWING FAR/FAA PROCS BY NOT STOWING HIS BAGS AND BLOCKING AN EMER EXIT; ALSO. HE STILL WOULD NOT FOLLOW MY REQUEST; AND WOULD NOT STOW HIS BAGS. I THEN PUT HIS LARGE SIZE BAG OUTSIDE ACFT TO BE CHKED; AND HE BECAME VERY VERBAL. THE CAPT WAS THEN INFORMED ABOUT INCIDENT AND GAVE THE PAX AN ULTIMATUM. HE WAS TO STOW HIS BAGS; OR HIS BAGS WERE GOING TO BE CHKED. HE COULD STAY AND BEHAVE PROPERLY; OR GO WITH THE BAGS ON THE NEXT FLT. PAX THEN AGREED TO CHK HIS BAG. INFLT; PAX WAS SERVED WITH PAX DISTURBANCE/MISCONDUCT RPT BY FLT ATTENDANT #2.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT AN AGGRESSIVE PAX; SEATED IN AN EMER EXIT ROW; REFUSED TO STOW HIS BAGGAGE; DELAYING PUSHBACK.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FLT DEPARTED DFW NORMALLY. AFTER XING THE BAHAMAS; WE COULDN'T GET OUR MEALS OR WATER BECAUSE A MALE PAX PASSED OUT IN THE LAVATORY NEXT TO THE COCKPIT AND WE HAD TO GET HIS WIFE IN THERE TO WAKE HIM UP AND RETURN HIM TO HIS SEAT. NEXT; PAX IN FIRST CLASS SHOWED OBVIOUS SIGNS OF INTOXICATION TO MULTIPLE FLT ATTENDANTS AND THEY ASKED ME WHAT TO DO. I TOLD THEM TO CUT HER OFF FROM MORE LIQUOR AND SHE BECAME ABUSIVE AND PURSUED THEM TO THE GALLEY IN A VERBAL TIRADE. I OBSERVED THIS FROM THE PEEP HOLE. I INSTRUCTED A NON REVENUE UNIFORMED CAPT TO PROCEED TO THE FORWARD GALLEY. I SENT A MESSAGE TO DISPATCH TO HAVE SECURITY MEET THE ACFT AT SJU. I INSTRUCTED THE FLT ATTENDANTS TO ISSUE WRITTEN INSTRUCTIONS TO THE PAX TO STAY IN HER SEAT AND DESIST FROM FURTHER DISRUPTIVE BEHAVIOR. SHE RELUCTANTLY COMPLIED. MY CONCERN IS THAT THESE INDIVIDUALS PROBABLY SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN BOARDED IN THE FIRST PLACE AND PLACED THE ACFT IN A JEOPARDY SIT. MY CONCERN ALSO IS THAT MGMNT AGENT MET THE AIRPLANE AT SJU INSTEAD OF SECURITY. WE HAVE ONLY 1 CAPT ON AN ACFT AND I PROPOSE A CHANGE TO PART ONE THAT CLARIFIES ARMED LAW ENFORCEMENT OR MGMNT WHEN I REQUEST SECURITY TO MEET THE ACFT. I DO NOT ADVOCATE HAVING TO CALL ATC FOR SECURITY AS THAT WILL TRIGGER A HOST OF UNNECESSARY EVENTS. THIS SIT COULD HAVE EASILY GOTTEN OUT OF HAND AT THE GATE WITH AN INJURY TO A FLT ATTENDANT AS THE LADY WAS QUITE MAD AT BEING CUT OFF FROM LIQUOR. I ALSO WANT SOME FEEDBACK THAT WE ARE NOT REWARDING HER FOR HER BEHAVIOR. WE COULD CREATE A MORE BELLIGERENT PAX BY LETTING HER GET AWAY WITH IT.
column125: A B757 CAPT RPTED A SERIES OF PAX MISCONDUCT INCIDENTS DURING AN OVERWATER FLT WHICH CULMINATED IN MISHANDLING BY THE COMPANY'S GND PERSONNEL.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WENT BACK TO MY CREW REST SEAT FOR MY CREW BREAK. I ASKED PAX TO GO BACK TO HER SEAT IN FIRST CLASS. SHE ASKED ME TO SIT SOMEWHERE ELSE. I REPEATEDLY TOLD HER THAT THIS WAS MY 'REST SEAT' AND THAT SHE NEEDED TO GO BACK TO HER SEAT. FINALLY; SHE DID. SHORTLY AFTER THAT; HER HUSBAND CAME BACK AND CONFRONTED ME HOW RUDE I WAS TO HIS WIFE. HE SAID HE WAS GOING TO WRITE TO MY ACR AND I SAID I WOULD BE WRITING IT UP ALSO. HE GOT VERY ANGRY AND SAID MEAN THINGS TO ME; THEN HE TURNED AROUND AND WALKED ABOUT 5 ROWS; TURNED AROUND AND SAID SOMETHING ELSE TO ME (HE DID THIS 3 TIMES!). ON THE THIRD TIME; HE GOT ABOUT 5 INCHES FROM MY FACE AND I FELT (ALONG WITH ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT) THAT HE WAS GOING TO HIT ME. I FEEL THAT IF FLT ATTENDANTS HAD CONFIDENCE WITHIN THEMSELVES WHEN A PAX CONFRONTS THEM; THAT THE FLT ATTENDANTS WOULD BE ABLE TO STARE THEM DOWN AND THE PAX WOULD NOT ATTACK THEM BECAUSE THEY WOULD REALIZE THE FLT ATTENDANT HAS NO FEAR AND WOULD NOT PUT UP WITH THEIR ACTIONS.
column125: AN ACR FLT ATTENDANT; ATTEMPTING TO UTILIZE THE OFFICIAL CREW REST SEAT FOR HER DESIGNATED BREAK; WAS OBSTRUCTED BY A PAX WHO REFUSED TO MOVE. AFTER REPEATED REQUESTS; THE PAX MOVED. THE PAX'S HUSBAND THEN CONFRONTED THE RPTR AND WAS VERBALLY ABUSIVE.

column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I HAD JUST COME IN FROM MIAMI TO CANCUN AND WENT OVER TO MY FLT TO COME BACK TO MIAMI. THE AGENTS HAD ALREADY BEGUN BOARDING. I WENT AHEAD AND GOT ON AND; AS I WAS GETTING ON; I NOTICED A COUPLE IN FRONT OF ME; WHO WERE TALKING TO THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT. THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT WAS SHAKING HIS HEAD NO AGAIN AND AGAIN. WHEN I GOT ON AND GREETED HIM AND THE #3 FLT ATTENDANT; I ASKED HIM WHAT THE MAN HAD SAID. HE HAD ASKED #1 FLT ATTENDANT IF HE COULD UPGRADE TO FIRST CLASS; BECAUSE HE WAS ON HIS 'HONEYMOON;' PLUS; 'HE WAS A POLICEMAN IN NYC.' OF COURSE; #1 FLT ATTENDANT TOLD HIM HE COULD NOT; THAT IT WAS THE AGENT ONLY; WHO COULD DO THAT. AFTER PUTTING AWAY MY BAGS; I WENT BACK TO BUSINESS CLASS TO MEET THE FLT ATTENDANTS THERE. I WAS STANDING IN ABOUT ROW XXX; WHEN THIS SAME MAN CAME TO THE BACK; LIGHTLY TOOK MY ARM TO GET MY UNDIVIDED ATTN; AND ASKED ME THE SAME THING WITH THE SAME STORY. HONEYMOON; POLICEMAN; ETC. I TOLD HIM THAT I HAD NO AUTH TO UPGRADE HIM; THAT ONLY THE AGENT OR THE PURSER COULD DO THAT. HE ASKED IF HE COULD GIVE #1 FLT ATTENDANT A 'COUPLE OF DOLLARS' TO UPGRADE HIM. HE'D DONE THAT WITH THE AGENT ON THE WAY DOWN TO CANCUN TO GET UPGRADED TO FIRST CLASS. HE ASKED ME IF I THOUGHT IF HE WENT TO THE FRONT AND ASKED THE PURSER AGAIN; PERHAPS HE'D LET HIM AND HIS 'WIFE' UPGRADE TO FIRST CLASS. I TOLD HIM I DIDN'T THINK SO; BUT HE KEPT ASKING ME OVER AND OVER; SO I TOLD HIM TO GO; JUST TO GET HIM AWAY FROM ME. HE WENT TO THE FRONT; BUT #1 FLT ATTENDANT TURNED HIM DOWN AGAIN. THIS MAN WAS VERY PERSISTENT. I DID THE BEVERAGE SVC; AS THE #5 FLT ATTENDANT; FORWARD-AFT. THIS MAN; AND HIS 'WIFE' HAD ONLY SOFT DRINKS. I NEVER SMELLED ANY ALCOHOL. HE RANG HIS CALL LIGHT SEVERAL TIMES DURING THE FLT. ONCE FOR ANOTHER FORM; THEN ANOTHER TIME; I WENT TO ANSWER THE CALL LIGHT; AND ALL HE SAID WHEN HE LOOKED AT ME WAS; 'PEN.' I TOLD HIM I DID NOT HAVE ONE. AFTER PICKUP; I WENT TO THE BACK AND SAT DOWN. I NOTICED HIS 'WIFE' TALKING TO #2 FLT ATTENDANT. THEN THIS WOMAN WALKED ALL THE WAY TO THE FRONT TO TALK TO #1 FLT ATTENDANT. #1 FLT ATTENDANT HAD MADE THE PA ASKING EVERYONE TO STAY IN THEIR DESIGNATED CABINS AND NOT CROSS OVER; FOR SECURITY REASONS. OBVIOUSLY; THIS WOMAN DID NOT THINK THAT APPLIED TO HER. SHE WENT UP AND TALKED TO #1 FLT ATTENDANT. I WATCHED HER WALK UP THERE; BUT DID NOT HEAR THE CONVERSATION. SHE CAME BACK TO HER SEAT AND SHORTLY THEREAFTER; THE MAN WALKED UP TO FIRST CLASS TO TALK TO #1 FLT ATTENDANT AGAIN. THIS WAS IN THE MIDDLE OF THE FLT. 1 HR AND 10 MINS FLT! I DID NOT HEAR THAT CONVERSATION; BUT IT MUST HAVE MADE THIS MAN VERY ANGRY. HE RANG HIS CALL LIGHT AGAIN AND I ANSWERED IT; AGAIN. HE TOLD ME THAT HE DIDN'T SPEAK ENGLISH VERY WELL; THAT HIS 'WIFE' DID SHE WAS HISPANIC; AND HE MAY HAVE SAID SOMETHING THAT HE THOUGHT WAS SOMETHING ELSE. HE CALLED #1 FLT ATTENDANT A BAD NAME IN SPANISH. JUDGING FROM THIS MAN'S PERSONALITY; HE KNEW EXACTLY WHAT HE WAS SAYING. HE TOLD ME THAT HE WANTS THAT GUY'S NAME AND BADGE NUMBER. HE WANTED TO TALK TO THE CAPT AND IF THERE WAS A FEDERAL AIR MARSHALL ON BOARD; HE WANTED TO TALK TO HIM; TOO. I TOLD HIM THAT ALL THIS WOULD BE SETTLED ON THE GND; AFTER WE LANDED; AND I WALKED AWAY. THIS DID NOT SATISFY HIM IN THE LEAST. THE PA WAS MADE TO PREPARE FOR LNDG. WE PICKED UP THE REMAINING SVC ITEMS AND DID OUR SAFETY CHK. #2 AND #4 FLT ATTENDANTS WERE JUST STRAPPING INTO THEIR JUMPSEATS. I WAS IN THE BACK GALLEY. THIS MAN CAME STORMING TO THE BACK AND JUST STOOD THERE; WAITING FOR ONE OF US TO LOOK AT HIM. I DID NOT WANT TO; AS I'D JUST DEALT WITH HIM; AND HE WAS OBVIOUSLY QUITE ANGRY. #4 FLT ATTENDANT; ACKNOWLEDGED HIM. THIS MAN SAID HE WANTED TO SEE HIM AND EVERYONE; INCLUDING THE CAPT; ON THE GND. HE SAID THIS IN A VERY ANGRY; DEMANDING VOICE. #4 FLT ATTENDANT TOLD HIM 'FINE; NOW GO SIT DOWN.' THE MAN SAT DOWN AND I WENT TO MY JUMPSEAT FOR LNDG. NOT LONG AFTER WE LANDED; THIS MAN'S CALL LIGHT WENT ON AGAIN. I REFUSED TO ANSWER IT; AS I KNEW IT WAS THIS ANGRY MAN. #3 FLT ATTENDANT WAS ON THE PHONE TO THE PLT. WE HAD TO WAIT FOR OUR GATE FOR A FEW MINS; AS THERE WAS TFC IN THE ALLEYWAY. WHEN WE ARRIVED AT THE GATE; #1 FLT ATTENDANT MADE AN ANNOUNCEMENT TO STAY SEATED UNTIL ANOTHER ANNOUNCEMENT WAS MADE THAT IT WAS SAFE TO LEAVE. I LOOKED OUTSIDE AND THERE WERE SEVERAL TSA AGENTS; POLICEMEN; AND MY MGR. THEY OPENED THE DOOR AND ASKED #1 FLT ATTENDANT WHAT HAPPENED. THEY ASKED FOR US TO IDENT HIM WHEN HE GOT OFF. WHEN I SAW HIM APCHING; I JUMPED OUT; ONTO THE JETBRIDGE AND TOLD THEM THAT IT WAS A BIG; BLOND HAIRED MAN; WITH A BLUE SHIRT ON. THEY DETAINED HIM AND HIS WIFE. WE ALL GOT OFF THE PLANE AND 3 OF US GAVE THE AUTHS THE INFO THEY ASKED FOR. WHEN THE MAN AND HIS 'WIFE' LEFT; FOR IMMIGRATION; THEY PASSED RIGHT BY US AND HE GLARED AT #1 FLT ATTENDANT'S IDENT TRYING TO GET HIS NAME; NUMBER; ETC. I TOLD HIM TO GET AWAY AND GO ON. #1 FLT ATTENDANT HAS TOLD ME HE IS PRESSING CHARGES.
column125: A FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT AN AGGRESSIVE PAX MISBEHAVED DURING A FLT FROM MMUN TO MIA WHICH REQUIRED A POLICE RESPONSE AT THE GATE.

column96: Flight Crew Last 90 Days 180; Flight Crew Total 6500; Flight Crew Type 1200
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other ACFT SECURITY
column121: PRE-BOARDING; A PAX; MR X; WAS IDENTED AS HAVING BEEN DRINKING BEFORE THE FLT. MYSELF; THE PURSER; A CSR SUPVR; AND THE FO CALLED HIM OUT TO THE JETBRIDGE TO ASSESS HIS CONDITION. HE ADMITTED TO 'HAVING A COUPLE OF DRINKS' BUT DID NOT APPEAR TO BE INTOXICATED TO ME; NOR WAS HE BELLIGERENT TO THE CREW. HE WAS COHERENT; ANSWERED ALL OF MY QUESTIONS IN AN ARTICULATE MANNER; AND WAS VERY POLITE. HE WAS ADVISED HE WOULD NOT BE SERVED ANY ALCOHOL DURING THE FLT. HE SAID 'THAT IS FINE WITH ME; I JUST WANT TO GET HOME.' HE SAID 'I WILL NOT BE ANY TROUBLE.' HE SEEMED TO ME TO HAVE A FEAR OF FLYING; AND HAD THE DRINKS TO CALM HIMSELF. THE JOINT DECISION WAS TO ALLOW HIM TO BOARD. AFTER 30 MINS OF FLT; THE AFT FLT ATTENDANT ADVISED ME MR X HAD LEANED OVER AND TOLD THE PAX NEXT TO HIM; 'I LOVE YOU.' THIS COMMENT ENRAGED THE OTHER PAX; AND HE COMPLAINED TO THE FLT ATTENDANT. THE AFT FLT ATTENDANT ALSO THOUGHT MR X HAD TAKEN SOMETHING AFTER BOARDING; AS HIS DEMEANOR HAD CHANGED AFTER 30 MINS OF FLT. HE DID NOT EXHIBIT ALCOHOL INDUCED BEHAVIOR; HE SEEMED TO BE 'ON SOMETHING' TO HER. THE PURSER ADVISED MR X TO 'SETTLE DOWN;' AND HE DID FOR 30 MINS. WE DECLARED HIM TO BE A LEVEL 1 SECURITY RISK AT THIS TIME. AS A PRECAUTION; I HAD THE PURSER FIND AND BRIEF 'HELPER' PAX IN THE EVENT MR X BECAME DIFFICULT; AND TO RESTRAIN HIM IF NECESSARY. AFTER 30 MINS; MR X REPEATED THE COMMENT; 'I LOVE YOU' TO THE NEIGHBORING PAX; AND AN ALTERCATION OF WORDS BEGAN. THE PURSER ADVISED MR X AGAIN TO SETTLE DOWN; OR HE WOULD NEED TO BE RESTRAINED. AN OFF DUTY POLICE CAPT IDENTED HIMSELF TO THE PURSER (UNARMED) AND TOGETHER THEY ADVISED ME RESTRAINTS WOULD BE A GOOD IDEA AS A PRECAUTION. THEY THOUGHT WITHOUT RESTRAINTS; MR X MIGHT GET PHYSICAL. WE ALSO HAD A PCFA ON BOARD. HE WAS PRIVATELY ADVISED OF THE SIT; AND REMAINED COVERT DURING THE SIT; AND NEVER BECAME INVOLVED. WHILE UNRESTRAINED; WE VIEWED MR X TO BE A LEVEL 2 SECURITY POSSIBILITY; AND WE ADVISED THE COMPANY. ACFT HANDCUFFS WERE PLACED ON MR X AND HE BEGAN CURSING LOUDLY. THE POLICE OFFICER THEN DUCT TAPED HIS MOUTH CLOSED. THIS ACTION COMPLETELY CALMED MR X DOWN AND THEREFORE THE DECISION NOT TO DIVERT TO CHICAGO WAS MADE BY THE CREW. THE SECURITY LEVEL WAS THEN DECLARED TO LEVEL 1 FOR THE DURATION OF THE FLT. THE TAPE REMAINED ON FOR 20-30 MINS; AND WAS REMOVED. AFTER ANOTHER 45 MINS TO AN HR; THE HANDCUFFS WERE MOVED TO THE FRONT OF MR X'S BODY FOR COMFORT; AND HE WAS ALLOWED TO USE THE RESTROOM (ESCORTED BY THE POLICE OFFICER). MR X WAS CALM FOR THE DURATION OF THE FLT AND WAS QUIET AND DOCILE WHILE BEING REMOVED BY THE AUTHS IN DENVER. HE APOLOGIZED TO ME WHILE LEAVING THE AIRPLANE FOR HIS COMMENTS; AND WAS ONCE AGAIN VERY POLITE. SINCE MR X NEVER BECAME PHYSICAL; DID NOT INTERFERE WITH THE FLT CREW; NEVER MADE ANY THREATS; THEREFORE HE WAS NOT CHARGED BY THE FBI; AND WAS TAKEN BY THE DENVER POLICE TO 'DETOX.' I ADVISED THE ATTENDING DENVER POLICE OFFICER MR X SEEMED TO HAVE TAKEN DRUGS DURING THE FLT. HE ADVISED ME THEY WOULD SEARCH HIM FOR ILLEGAL SUBSTANCES.
column125: AN UNCOOPERATIVE COACH PAX HAS TO BE RESTRAINED BY HANDCUFFS AND DUCT TAPE WHEN MISBEHAVING TO A LEVEL 2 SECURITY ON AN A319.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX FAILED TO COMPLY WITH CREW'S REQUEST TO TURN OFF CELL PHONE. ONLY AFTER 3 VERBAL REQUESTS SHE LOST SIGNAL; DID SHE DISCONNECT AND THEN AFTER I WALKED AWAY SHE BENT OVER BTWN SEATS; TURNED PHONE ON AGAIN; AND BEGAN TALKING; THEN WAS TOLD 4TH TIME. FINALLY COMPLIED; THEN TRIED TO INTIMIDATE CREW WITH FACIAL GESTURES AND REQUESTS FOR NAMES. SUMMARY: 1) ANNOUNCEMENT MADE. 2) 3 VERBAL REQUESTS MADE. 3) 4 VERBAL REQUESTS MADE. THE CAPT REQUESTED SUPVR MEET FLT IN BOS. NO ONE MET FLT. PAX LEFT. MET SUPVR IN OFFICE. THEY WERE PLANNING ON MEETING FLT. THE PAX WAS GIVEN A PAX INFLT DISTURBANCE FORM; AND ASKED IF SHE UNDERSTOOD IT. SHE REPLIED 'YES.'
column125: MD80 PAX WAS TOLD CELL PHONE USE ON THE ACFT WAS PROHIBITED. THE PAX CONTINUED TO USE THE CELL PHONE. THE CAPT REQUESTED A PAX SVC REPRESENTATIVE SUPVR MEET THE FLT. NO ONE MET THE FLT.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PRIOR TO TKOF; FLT ATTENDANT ADVISED THE FLT CREW SHE HAD A PAX IN FIRST CLASS THAT DID NOT WANT TO FASTEN HIS SEATBELT. SHE SOON CALLED BACK AND SAID EVERYTHING WAS FINE AND HE COMPLIED WITH HER INSTRUCTIONS. CONTINUED FOR GGG. AFTER TKOF; SHE INFORMED US HE WAS VERY DISRUPTIVE TO HER AND THE PAX AROUND HIM. SHE WAS NOW RESEATING THE OTHER PAX AND DISRUPTIVE PAX IN FIRST CLASS APPEARED INTOXICATED. AFTER SEVERAL CONVERSATIONS WITH FLT ATTENDANT; IT WAS APPARENT THE PAX HAD NOT VERBALLY THREATENED OR PHYSICALLY THREATENED ANYONE OR THE FLT ITSELF. APPEARED INTOXICATED AND WAS RUDE AND DISRUPTIVE. THE FLT ATTENDANT INSISTED THAT LAW ENFORCEMENT MEET THE FLT. THE FLT WAS VERY SHORT; SO WE RADIOED TO GGG OPS. ADVISED OF OUR SIT AND TO HAVE POLICE STANDING BY. THE FLT ATTENDANT THEN WANTED THIS PAX REMOVED. WE NOTIFIED TWR OF OUR INTENTIONS AS OPS WAS UNREACHABLE. NO FURTHER PROBS DEVELOPED.
column125: AN SF3 CAPT RPTED THAT A COMBATIVE PAX CAUSED THE FLT ATTENDANT AND PAX GREAT CONSTERNATION DURING A FLT FROM DFW TO GGG AND POLICE WERE ASKED TO MEET THE FLT AT THE GATE.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Electronic Device; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: APPROX 1 HR INTO FLT; I WAS INFORMED THAT A PAX WAS BEING A 'PROB' AS HE APPEARED INTOXICATED AND WAS CAUSING A DISTURBANCE IN THE CABIN. HE WOULD NOT STOP TRYING TO USE HIS CELL PHONE INFLT UNTIL A FLT ATTENDANT TOOK IT FROM HIM. HE TOOK OUT HIS CIGARETTES AND; WHEN TOLD HE COULD NOT SMOKE; HE TOOK HIS CIGARETTE AND WENT INTO THE LAVATORY. HE SPILLED HIS FOOD TRAY AND 'ORDERED' THE FLT ATTENDANT TO CLEAN IT UP. WHEN NOTIFIED OF THIS BEHAVIOR; I SENT AN ACARS MESSAGE TO DISPATCH THAT I MAY HAVE TO DIVERT IN ORDER TO HAVE THIS PAX REMOVED FROM THE FLT; AS HE WAS USING PROFANITY AND WAS A POTENTIAL SECURITY THREAT. THE FLT ATTENDANTS BELIEVED THAT HE WAS BOARDED IN AN INTOXICATED STATE AND HE WAS TAKING PILLS INFLT. THE FLT ATTENDANTS HAD TO TAKE A BOTTLE OF ALCOHOL FROM HIM AS HE PROCEEDED TO DRINK FROM IT. THE FLT ATTENDANTS WERE EVENTUALLY ABLE TO CTL HIM AND I ELECTED TO CONTINUE TO JFK. EMT'S WERE REQUESTED TO MEET THE FLT; AS THE PAX COULD NOT GET OFF OF THE ACFT UNASSISTED.
column125: A B757-200 CAPT RPTED THAT A PAX WAS SO DISRUPTIVE THAT HE ARRANGED TO DIVERT. HE CONTINUED TO THE DEST; JFK; ONLY AFTER THE CABIN RPTED THAT THEY HAD THE PAX UNDER CTL.

column105: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: 2 PAX; YOUNG MEN; BOARDED AND TOOK SEATS NEXT TO EACH OTHER IN COACH. ONE OF THE PAX HAD A DRINK IN HIS HAND. THEY WERE BEING LOUD AND ROWDY -- SPEAKING IN SPANISH-ONLY THE WHOLE TIME. #5 FLT ATTENDANT WAS OUR SPANISH SPEAKER (THE ONLY ONE ON THE CREW THAT SPOKE SPANISH) AND WAS LISTENING TO THE 2 GUYS TRYING TO ORGANIZE SOME KIND OF DEMONSTRATION TO TAKE PLACE IN THE EVENING. WELL AFTER WE WERE IN THE AIR; THEY PLANNED TO STAND UP AND BANG ON THE OVERHEAD BINS. HE APCHED THE 2 MEN; ADVISED THAT IT WILL NOT BE ALLOWED OR TOLERATED ON THE ACFT. THE 2 MEN ARGUED BACK. OTHER SURROUNDING PAX THEN SPOKE UP IN DEFENSE OF THE 2 MEN AS #5 FLT ATTENDANT INSISTED THAT THEY BEHAVE OR THEY WILL BE REMOVED. THE ARGUMENT ONLY GOT BIGGER AND HEATED. THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT CAME BACK; GOT INVOLVED; INSISTED THE 2 MEN BE TAKEN OFF. THEY REFUSED. WE ASKED THE CAPT FOR REINFORCEMENT. NEITHER OF THEM WANTED TO COME BACK AND BE INVOLVED. THEY (COCKPIT) CALLED FOR SECURITY OR POLICE TO COME ON BOARD. FINALLY; I BELIEVE A CUSTOMS AGENT CAME ON AND WALKED THEM OFF. AIR MARSHALS WERE ON BOARD BUT WERE NOT INVOLVED.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT SHE OVERHEARD 2 INTOXICATED PAX; DURING BOARDING AT SVMI; PLOTTING AN INFLT DISTURBANCE. SHE AND THE OTHER FLT ATTENDANT WHO OVERHEARD THIS CONFRONTED THE PAX WHO WERE EVENTUALLY REMOVED FROM THE FLT.

column105: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I FIRST ENCOUNTERED THIS PAX AFTER THE DOOR TO THE ACFT HAD CLOSED AND FLT ATTENDANT #1 SAID PREPARE FOR DEP. AFTER HER ANNOUNCEMENT TO THE PAX; I DID MY SAFETY CHKS AND ASKED THIS GENTLEMAN TO PUT HIS SEAT IN THE UPRIGHT POS FOR TKOF AND TURN OFF HIS PHONE. DOING A WALK-THROUGH; I AGAIN ASKED HIM TO PUT HIS SEAT IN THE UPRIGHT POS AND THEN AGAIN AFTER THE SAFETY VIDEO HAD FINISHED -- A TOTAL OF 3 TIMES. DURING PREDEP; HE HAD ASKED FOR A GLASS OF WATER. I WITNESSED THAT HE TOOK SOME MEDICATION. AT THIS TIME I DID NOT SMELL ALCOHOL ON HIM AND BECAUSE OF THE MEDICATION; ATTRIBUTED HIS NON COMPLIANCE WITH THE SEAT BACK AND CELL PHONE TO HIS MEDICATION. AFTER TKOF; WE BROUGHT THE CART UP AND I PREPARED TO OFFER HIM A BEVERAGE. HE ASKED FOR 2 BEERS. AT THIS TIME I EXCUSED MYSELF AND WALKED TO FIRST CLASS TO CONFER WITH FLT ATTENDANTS #1 AND #3. I DID NOT WANT TO SERVE HIM ANY ALCOHOL BECAUSE I SAW HIM TAKE MEDICATION AND HE SEEMED SLOW IN RESPONSE TO MY REQUESTS FOR SEAT BACK AND CELL PHONE REQUIREMENTS. THEY WANTED ME TO SERVE HIM; SO WE SETTLED ON 1 BEER. AFTER THAT BEER; HIS RESPONSIVENESS AND APPROPRIATENESS TO FUNCTION DECREASED DRAMATICALLY. HE WAS SEATED IN THE AISLE AND A FEMALE PAX WAS AT THE WINDOW. HE PROCEEDED TO LAY ON HER. SHE WAS FORCED TO MOVE TO ANOTHER SEAT BECAUSE HE DISREGARDED HER PERSONAL SPACE. HE CONTINUALLY TURNED ON HIS CELL PHONE UNTIL IT WAS FINALLY TAKEN AWAY FROM HIM. I INFORMED THE CAPT AFTER THE FIRST BEVERAGE SVC AND CONTINUALLY I OR #1 FLT ATTENDANT TALKED TO THE CAPT DURING THE FLT TO KEEP HIM AWARE OF THE SERIOUS PROB THAT COULD ESCALATE AT ANY MOMENT. WHEN WE DID OUR SECOND SVC WITH MEALS; HE WAS LAYING DOWN ON THE SEATS AND REQUESTED #1 FLT ATTENDANT TO LAY HIS FOOD TRAY ON HIS STOMACH. SHE ASKED HIM TO GET UP. HE DID NOT. SHE PLACED THE TRAY ON HIS STOMACH. HE MOVED AND THE TRAY SPILLED INTO THE SEATS. HE REFUSED TO PICK IT UP AND SWORE VULGARITIES AT #1 FLT ATTENDANT. I ASKED HIM IF HE WANTED A BEVERAGE. HE DID NOT RESPOND. HE WENT TO THE RESTROOM (LAVATORY) TWICE DURING THE FLT; BOTH TIMES BEING DISORIENTED AND HAVING DIFFICULTY WALKING; OR EVEN FASTENING HIS BELT. HE LEFT THE LAVATORY DIRTY; WITH TOILET PAPER EVERYWHERE. BOTH TIMES A FLT ATTENDANT REQUESTED HE RETURN TO THE LAVATORY TO CLEAN UP AFTER HIMSELF. HE DID SO. WE TALKED TO PAX SITTING AROUND HIM AND FOUND OUT HE WAS ACTING IN THIS MANNER IN THE LOBBY WAITING FOR THE FLT; MAKING PHONE CALLS AND SWEARING TO THE PERSON ON THE PHONE. DURING THE FLT; AFTER HIS PHONE HAD BEEN TAKEN AWAY FROM HIM; HE CONTINUALLY LOOKED/SEARCHED FOR HIS PHONE. ABOUT 1/2 WAY THROUGH THE FLT; A NEIGHBORING PAX HIT HIS CALL LIGHT. #1 FLT ATTENDANT WENT TO SEE WHAT THE PROB WAS. THE INTOXICATED PAX WAS DRINKING JOHNNY WALKER OUT OF A 750 ML BOTTLE AND 3/4 OF THE BOTTLE WAS GONE; THUS CONFIRMING HIS INTOXICATION. #1 FLT ATTENDANT TOOK THE BOTTLE AWAY FROM HIM. UPON ARR; WE CONFERRED WITH THE PLT TO HAVE MEDICAL MEET THE FLT. AFTER LNDG; THE PAX TRIED TO GET UP WHILE WE WERE STILL TAXIING TO THE JETBRIDGE. AFTER THE CAPT SAID PREPARE FOR ARR; I HAD TO STAND IN THE AISLE BESIDE HIS SEAT TO KEEP HIM SEATED UNTIL THE MEDICS CAME ABOARD TO DEPLANE HIM. THE PAX AROUND HIM WERE VERY GRACIOUS IN COMPLIMENTING OUR CREW WITH A JOB WELL DONE; AND CAPT WAS VERY SUPPORTIVE AND READY TO TAKE ANY ACTION FOR THE SAFETY OF OUR CREW/PAX/PLANE.
column125: A FLT ATTENDANT RPTED AN ABUSIVE PAX DRINKING FROM HIS OWN BOTTLE AND SELF-MEDICATING DURING A FLT FROM LGB TO JFK.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX WOULD NOT STOW BAGGAGE. FLT ATTENDANT #2 ASKED HER AND PAX GOT BELLIGERENT AND ABUSIVE. I THEN PUT BAG AWAY AFTER FLT ATTENDANT #2 BROUGHT IT TO THE CAPT. FLT ATTENDANT #2 WANTED THE DOOR REOPENED; BUT THE CAPT ASKED IF WE COULD PLEASE HANDLE THE SIT SO WE WOULD NOT TAKE A DELAY. SO I DID.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A CAPT DID NOT SUPPORT HER NOR THE #2 FLT ATTENDANT AFTER RPTING THAT A PAX; REFUSING TO STOW HER BAG; WAS BECOMING BELLIGERENT.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX REFUSED TO GIVE NAME OR IDENT. KNOCKED ME OVER; GETTING OUT OF SEAT; RUNNING TOWARD FRONT OF ACFT. WATCHED HIM GO IN MID LAVATORY. WHEN HE RETURNED; I ASKED HIM TO PLEASE TAP ME ON THE SHOULDER TO LET ME KNOW; I WOULD LET HIM BY. I TOLD HIM HE KNOCKED ME OVER PRETTY GOOD. HE REPLIED HE ENJOYED IT; TOO. I REPEATED; 'NEXT TIME; TAP ME ON THE SHOULDER; SO I CAN BE AWARE TO MOVE.' HE REPLIED THAT I WAS TOO SENSITIVE. NEVER APOLOGIZED. HE THEN WANTED MY NAME; ETC; WHICH I GAVE TO HIM. I ASKED HIM FOR HIS INFO; BUT HE IGNORED ME. WHEN DEPLANING; BOTH HIS FELLOW PAX ON HIS ROW GAVE (OFFERED) ME THEIR IDENTS FOR WITNESS TO HIS ACTIONS: KNOCKING ME OVER; PURPOSELY NOT FOLLOWING FLT ATTENDANT'S INSTRUCTIONS; AND NOT PUTTING CARRY-ON ITEMS UNDER SEAT FOR LNDG (SEATED IN EXIT ROW); PURPOSELY MAKING A DANGEROUS SIT. PAX SEATED NEXT TO HIM AS WITNESSES TO THE EVENT SAID THEY SAW HIM KNOCK ME OVER. MY BACK WAS TO HIM; SO I COULDN'T TELL IF HE WAS TRYING TO KNOCK ME OVER TO GET TO COCKPIT. NOTIFIED CAPT IMMEDIATELY OF EVENT.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT SHE WAS KNOCKED OVER BY AN AGGRESSIVE PAX; WHICH WAS WITNESSED BY OTHER PAX.

column95: Flight Crew Multiengine; Flight Crew Instrument; Flight Crew Commercial
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other Screening Incident
column119: Environment - Non Weather Related; Human Factors
column121: YOUNG SON HOME FROM SCHOOL PUT A SMALL TOY GUN INTO MY PACKED SUITCASE. IT WAS DISCOVERED BY TSA SCREENERS VIA X-RAY. THE TOY WAS CONFISCATED AND I WAS ALLOWED TO CONTINUE.
column125: A B757-200 FO ENRTE TO HIS FLT ASSIGNMENT IS DETAINED BY TSA WHEN A TOY GUN IS NOTED IN HIS SUITCASE DURING SCREENING WITH OTHER PAX AT STL; MO.

column95: Flight Crew Commercial; Flight Crew Instrument; Flight Crew Multiengine
column106: Flight Crew Instrument; Flight Crew Multiengine; Flight Crew Commercial
column113: Aircraft Equipment Problem Less Severe; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct; Other INCORRECT RWY DATA
column119: ATC Equipment / Nav Facility / Buildings; Aircraft; Airport; Company Policy; Environment - Non Weather Related; Human Factors
column121: LAST MIN RWY CHANGE RESULTED IN A REQUEST FOR A NEW TPS THROUGH ACARS WHICH WAS FURTHER COMPLICATED BY AN EXTREMELY SHORT TAXI. I WAS THE FO AND WAS STILL ENTERING DATA AND CHANGING FLAPS WHEN CAPT ACCEPTED A POS AND HOLD CLRNC. I RUSHED TO COMPLY AND IN COMPLETING THE BEFORE TKOF CHKLIST COMPLETELY SKIPPED OVER THE FACT THAT WE HAD NOT RECEIVED A LOAD CLOSEOUT. FIRST TIME I BECAME AWARE OF THIS WAS WHEN THE RELIEF PLT HANDED ME AN ACARS MESSAGE FROM DISPATCH ASKING IF WE HAD RECEIVED A LOAD CLOSEOUT. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 614399: THIS FLT WAS DELAYED OVER 12 HRS AND AS A NEW CREW WE WERE FACED WITH ANGRIER PAX; FLT LATE AND 3 SHORT. WITH 20 MIN TO GO WE HAD NO CATERING; FUEL WAS AT MIN; CLRNC WAS HARD TO GET; ONE PROB AFTER ANOTHER. WE FINALLY GOT ALL THE FLT ATTENDANTS THEN HAD TO PULL BAGS FOR MISSING PAX. WE WERE AT GATE WITH A SHORT TAXI TO RWY 27R ONLY TO FIND OUT IT WAS CLOSED AND TOLD TO GO TO RWY 26.
column125: MISSED LOAD CLOSEOUT AND UNAUTH RWY USE FOR TKOF BY FLT CREW OF A HVY B777 WHEN DELAYED OVER 12 HRS FROM SCHEDULED DEP AT MIA; FL.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: ON GND AT BOS; #1 FLT ATTENDANT INFORMED ME OF UNUSUAL/SUSPICIOUS BEHAVIOR OF WHAT APPEARED TO BE 4 FOREIGN MEN IN FIRST CLASS CABIN. AFTER MUCH CONFUSION AND DISCUSSION BY GND PERSONNEL IN BOS; CAPT MADE DECISION TO HAVE ALL 4 MEN REMOVED FROM FLT FOR SAFETY/SECURITY REASONS. EVENT WAS DEBRIEFED AT FLT OFFICE WITH CREW; UNION AND CPR SECURITY AT LENGTH.
column125: B757-200 PURSER INFORMED THE CAPT THAT 4 PAX WERE ACTING IN AN UNUSUAL; AND SUSPICIOUS MANNER. PAX WERE REMOVED FROM FLT.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 17.5; Flight Attendant Total 17.5; Flight Attendant Type 25
column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX STUMBLED AND WAS DISORIENTED WHEN SHE GOT ON BOARD AND WAS SUSPECTED OF BEING INTOXICATED BY FLT ATTENDANTS AND PAX. COCKPIT AND AGENT WERE NOTIFIED AND CUSTOMER SERVICE CALLED. THE GENTLEMAN WHO CAME ON BOARD TO EVALUATE HER (UNKNOWN TO US) TALKED TO THE WRONG PERSON. HE NOTIFIED FLT ATTENDANTS AND PLTS THAT HE FELT SHE WAS OK TO FLY -- SHE DID NOT SMELL OF ALCOHOL; SHE DID NOT SLUR HER WORDS AND MADE EYE CONTACT WHILE HE SPOKE TO HER. PAX IN SAME ROW MOVED SEATS. DURING THE SAFETY VIDEO; THE PAX WHO WAS ORIGINALLY NEXT TO THE PAX; CALLED ME OVER AND TOLD ME THAT THE 'MAN WHO CAME ON TO TALK TO THE DRUNK LADY' SPOKE TO THE WRONG PERSON. I TOLD THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT AND SHE CALLED THE CAPT. HE STOPPED TAXIING AND ASKED US TO EVALUATE THE SIT. I WENT TO THE DRUNK PAX AND ASKED HER IF SHE WAS OK AND IF SHE HAD HAD ANYTHING TO DRINK. SHE SEEMED A LITTLE OUT-OF-IT; BUT DID NOT SMELL OF ALCOHOL; TOLD ME SHE HAD 1 GLASS OF WINE BTWN FLTS AND SHE WAS JUST VERY TIRED. WE DECIDED TO TAKE HER AT HER WORD AND CONTINUED ON OUR WAY TO LAS; BUT NOT SERVE HER ANY ALCOHOL. DURING THE FIRST BEVERAGE SVC; SHE ORDERED A DIET SPRITE AND A RED WINE. I TOLD HER THAT SHE COULD HAVE THE DIET SPRITE; BUT I WOULD NOT BE ABLE TO SELL HER THE WINE. SHE ASKED WHY. I TOLD HER I FELT SHE PROBABLY SHOULD NOT HAVE ANYTHING TO DRINK ON THIS FLT. SHE INSISTED SHE WAS NOT DRUNK. I TOLD HER THAT SHE WAS STILL NOT GETTING ANY ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES ON TONIGHT'S FLT. SHE ASKED WHY AGAIN AND CONTINUED TO GET MORE ARGUMENTATIVE. SHE ASKED ME WHO MADE THE DECISION. I TOLD HER IT WAS A CREW DECISION BASED ON HER ACTIONS DURING BOARDING. SHE STARTED TO DEMAND TO KNOW WHO 'TOLD ON' HER. SHE SAID HER HUSBAND WAS A LAWYER AND WE WERE GOING TO HEAR ABOUT THIS. I TOLD HER THAT HE WOULD PROBABLY BE ABLE TO EXPLAIN TO HER THAT IT IS AGAINST THE LAW TO SERVE ALCOHOL TO ANYONE WHO APPEARS TO BE DRUNK AND HER BEHAVIOR WAS REINFORCING OUR DECISION NOT TO SERVE HER. SHE CONTINUED TO ARGUE WITH ME OVER 'WHO TOLD' AND 'WHY.' I TOLD HER THAT IF SHE CONTINUED TO ARGUE WITH ME; WE COULD RETURN TO STL AND SHE COULD CONTINUE THE DISCUSSION WITH AUTHS THERE; BECAUSE AS FAR AS I WAS CONCERNED; THE CONVERSATION WAS OVER. I TOLD HER IT WOULD BE BEST IF SHE WERE TO TAKE HER SEAT AND DISCONTINUE HER RANTING. SHE AGAIN TAP-TAP-TAPPED ME ON THE SHOULDER 'JUST WANTING TO KNOW WHY SHE WAS DENIED THE WINE.' I TOLD HER SHE NEEDED TO STOP; HER ACTIONS WERE INTERFERING WITH MY DUTIES AND I GOT HER IDENT TO ISSUE HER A PAX DISTURBANCE FORM AND TOLD HER AGAIN IT WAS NOT TOO LATE TO GO BACK TO STL. WHEN I WENT TO GET THE FORM SHE GOT OUT OF HER SEAT AND GOT IN THE FACE OF THE PAX WHO MOVED FROM HER ROW AND WAS ACCUSING HER OF COMPLAINING. I FILLED OUT THE FORM AND GAVE THE PAX HER COPY. SHE CONTINUED TO ASK WHAT THIS (THE FORM) MEANS. I TOLD HER THAT IT MEANS SHE IS CREATING A DISTURBANCE AND INTERFERING WITH THE DUTIES OF A CREW MEMBER WHICH IS AGAINST THE LAW AND (AGAIN) IT WOULD BE BEST FOR HER TO STOP. SHE SAID SHE WAS NOT INTERFERING WITH ME. SHE WANTED TO KNOW WHAT WAS GOING TO HAPPEN WITH THE PAPER (INFLT DISTURBANCE FORM). I TOLD HER (AGAIN) IT DEPENDED ON HER ACTIONS. WORST CASE SCENARIO WOULD BE LNDG AT THE NEAREST ARPT AND HAVING HER REMOVED; BEST CASE SHE WOULD RETURN TO HER SEAT AND DISCONTINUE HER DISRUPTIVE BEHAVIOR. IN BTWN; WE WOULD CONTINUE TO LAS WHERE SHE WOULD BE MET BY AUTHS. PAX IN ANOTHER ROW SAID HE SAW HER DRINK 3 WINES ON THE PERVIOUS FLT. OTHER PAX ADDED SHE WAS DISRUPTIVE AND ACTING STRANGELY BEFORE THE FLT. DRUNK PAX WENT BACK TO HER SEAT AND WAS KICKING THE SEAT IN FRONT OF HER. PAX GOT THE ATTN OF THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT AND TOLD HER THAT DRUNK PAX WAS CONTINUOUSLY KICKING HIS SEAT. THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT REMOVED HIM AND HIS TRAVEL COMPANION UP TO FIRST CLASS. LATER; I WAS IN THE FIRST CLASS GALLEY AREA GETTING INFO TOGETHER FOR MY RPT. DRUNK PAX COMES INTO THE GALLEY AREA AND SAID SHE WAS IN THE TRANSPORTATION INDUSTRY AND WAS SUPPOSED TO BE MOVED TO FIRST CLASS BUT THE AGENT TOLD HER IT WAS TOO LATE. SHE WANTED TO KNOW WHY THOSE MEN WERE UPGRADED AND SHE WASN'T. I TOLD HER THAT IT WAS NONE OF HER BUSINESS. I ALSO TOLD HER THAT THE SEATBELT SIGN WAS ON AND SHE NEEDED TO RETURN TO HER SEAT. THEN SHE STARTED RAMBLING ON. I TOLD HER THERE WAS NOTHING TO DISCUSS AND FOR THE THIRD TIME; THE SEAT BELT SIGN IS ON AND SHE NEEDED TO RETURN TO HER SEAT. SHE GOT MORE ARGUMENTATIVE. AT HER SEAT; SHE WENT ON AGAIN ABOUT 9/11; MERCURY POISONING; ETC. DURING THE INCIDENT IN THE FIRST CLASS GALLEY; THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT WAS IN THE COCKPIT UPDATING THE CAPT. UPON ARRIVING IN LAS NO ONE BUT THE AGENT MET THE FLT. HE (THE AGENT) SAID IT WAS NOT HIS PROB. THE AGENT WOULD NOT TAKE THE GND COPY OF THE INFLT DISTURBANCE FORM. THE DRUNK PAX TURNED TO THE #3 FLT ATTENDANT AND LAUGHED AND LEFT TO ENJOY HER LAS VEGAS VACATION.
column125: A B757-200 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A DISRUPTIVE BEHAVIOR PAX WAS ALLOWED TO LEAVE THE ACFT AT LAS; AFTER SECURITY HAD BEEN REQUESTED TO MEET THE FLT.

column113: Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Other / Unknown; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column118: Air Traffic Control Provided Assistance; Air Traffic Control Issued New Clearance; Flight Crew Landed As Precaution; Flight Crew Diverted; General Physical Injury / Incapacitation
column121: FLT ATTENDANT #1 CALLED TO ADVISE ME THAT A PAX HAD GRABBED AND TWISTED THE ARM OF FLT ATTENDANT #6 WHO REQUESTED THAT LAW ENFORCEMENT MEET THE ACFT UPON ARR AT EGLL. AN ACARS TEXT REQUEST WAS SENT AND RPTED ACCOMPLISHED BY DISPATCH. THIS PAX (IDENTED AS THE OCCUPANT OF SEAT IN COACH) WAS RPTED TO HAVE BEEN WALKING BTWN CABINS AND DISTURBING OTHER PAX IN DEFIANCE OF REPEATED WARNINGS BY SEVERAL FLT ATTENDANTS. HE WAS RPTED TO APPEAR TO BE INTOXICATED AND THEN TO HAVE FALLEN ASLEEP. I DIRECTED FLT ATTENDANT #1 TO PREPARE AND ISSUE THE INFLT PAX DISTURBANCE FORM AND SUGGESTED THAT SHE CONSIDER IDENTING AND ALERTING PAX OF APPROPRIATE PHYSIQUE TO ASSIST SHOULD RESTRAINT SUBSEQUENTLY BECOME NECESSARY. AS WE APCHED THE COAST OF IRELAND; I WAS ADVISED THAT THE DISRUPTIVE BEHAVIOR HAD RESUMED AND INCLUDED SHOVING 1 FLT ATTENDANT AND FORCING OPEN AN OVERHEAD COMPARTMENT SO THAT SOME OXYGEN MASKS WERE HANGING. I DIRECTED FLT ATTENDANT #1 TO GET ASSISTANCE AND TO ATTEMPT TO RESTRAIN HIM. SEVERAL MINS LATER (IN OBVIOUS AND FAIRLY SEVERE DISTRESS) SHE RPTED THAT A NUMBER OF SUCH ATTEMPTS HAD FAILED AND THAT THE SIT WAS GETTING OUT OF HAND. I INITIATED A DIVERSION TO LAND AT EISN ABOUT 1 HR SHORT OF EGLL. DURING OUR DSCNT; IT WAS FIRST RPTED THAT HE HAD BEEN RESTRAINED AND THEN THAT HE WAS NO LONGER RESTRAINED. LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL MET THE ACFT UPON ARR AND TOOK 2 INDIVIDUALS INTO CUSTODY. IT WAS AT THAT TIME THAT I LEARNED THAT THE OCCUPANT OF THE SEAT IN COACH WAS ALSO INVOLVED AND HAD BEEN THE ONE WHO RELEASED THE OXYGEN MASKS. THE AUTHS REQUIRED STATEMENTS FROM 4 INVOLVED FLT ATTENDANTS AND FROM ME. WHILE THAT WAS BEING ACCOMPLISHED; THEIR BAGS WERE LOCATED AND REMOVED AND THE FLT WAS CONTINUED TO EGLL. UPON ARR AT EGLL; ANOTHER STATEMENT WAS TAKEN FROM FLT ATTENDANT #1 BY COMPANY SECURITY PERSONNEL AND COPIES WERE MADE OF OUR STATEMENTS TO EISN AUTHS. FLT ATTENDANT #1 WAS RPTEDLY INJURED IN THE STRUGGLE TO SUBDUE THE PAX AND I RECOMMENDED THAT SHE BE EXAMINED BY COMPETENT MEDICAL STAFF BEFORE LEAVING THE ARPT.
column125: A B777 CAPT DIVERTED TO EISN WHILE ENRTE TO EGLL DUE TO 2 VIOLENT PAX.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 16; Flight Attendant Total 16; Flight Attendant Type 50
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX SEATED IN FIRST CLASS; MALE AND FEMALE; THROUGHOUT FLT REPEATEDLY ASKED FOR MORE COKES AND DIET COKES. IT WAS SUSPECTED AT LNDG THAT THEY WERE POURING THEIR OWN ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES. THEY WERE BEING DISRUPTIVE TO OTHER PAX AND WORDS WERE BEING EXCHANGED. I SMELLED RUM IN GLASS OF MALE PAX AT TIME ALL SVC ITEMS WERE PICKED UP IN PREPARATION FOR LNDG. ALSO; MALE PAX WAS SEEN BY OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS WITH HIS HAND IN THE BLOUSE OF THE FEMALE PAX. ON LNDG; I HAD TO GET OUT OF MY JUMPSEAT TO TELL THE FEMALE TO REFASTEN HER SEATBELT. SHE WAS INEBRIATED (TO THE EXTENT THAT WHILE DEPLANING SHE WAS STUMBLING). THE MALE PAX TOLD ME TO GO SIT DOWN. 'AREN'T YOU SUPPOSED TO BE IN YOUR SEAT?' WHEN I; PRIOR TO LNDG; TOLD THE MALE THAT IT WAS UNLAWFUL TO DRINK FROM THEIR OWN ALCOHOL SUPPLY HE IGNORED ME CONTINUING TO SPEAK TO FEMALE COMPANION. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 616469: WE RPTED THE PAX TO THE AGENT AND WE STATED OUR CONCERN FOR THE CREW AND OTHER PAX IF THEY WERE ALLOWED TO RETURN ON OUR AIRLINE. A RPT WAS FILLED OUT; AND WE SENT A MESSAGE TO THE COMPANY.
column125: A B757 FLT ATTENDANT CREW RPTED THAT A MAN AND WOMAN IN FIRST CLASS WERE DRINKING FROM THEIR OWN BOTTLE AND VIOLATING OTHER FARS ON A FLT FROM MIA TO LAS.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 25; Flight Attendant Total 25; Flight Attendant Type 99.9
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column119: Human Factors; Incorrect / Not Installed / Unavailable Part; Company Policy
column121: ABOUT 3 HRS INTO FLT; PAX ASKED FLT ATTENDANT IF THERE WERE ANY 'SNACKS; LIKE PRETZELS; PEANUTS.' WHEN INFORMED THAT THERE WERE NO SNACKS AVAILABLE; HE BECAME HOSTILE AND; FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE 6 OR SO OTHER MEN HE WAS TRAVELING WITH; SAID IN A BELLIGERENT MANNER; 'NO PRETZELS; CRACKER JACK....' FLT ATTENDANT AGAIN SAID THERE WERE NO SNACKS AND CONTINUED PICKING UP CABIN. APPROX 30 MINS LATER; CAPT SAID TO PREPARE FOR LNDG; AND AS FLT ATTENDANT MADE HER WAY THROUGH CABIN CHKING FOR COMPLIANCE; THE PAX CALLED OUT 'OH; DON'T WORRY ABOUT THESE SNACKS YOU XXXXX.' FLT ATTENDANT INFORMED CAPT THAT SECURITY SHOULD MEET FLT. UNFORTUNATELY FLT WAS MET BY PAX SVCS. AS THIS WAS A VIOLATION OF FEDERAL LAW; SECURITY SHOULD HAVE BEEN INVOLVED INSTEAD OF PAX SVC PACIFICATION.
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT WAS UNABLE TO PROVIDE AN AGGRESSIVE PAX WITH FOOD WHO LATER USED PROFANITY TOWARD HER ON ARR TO ORD. SECURITY WAS REQUESTED BUT DID NOT MEET THE FLT.

column19: MD-80 Series (DC-9-80) Undifferentiated or Other Model
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Electronic Device; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: DURING TAXI OUT IN MSP; THE #1 FLT ATTENDANT CALLED THE COCKPIT TO TELL US THAT THERE WAS AN UNRULY PAX IN FIRST CLASS. HE WAS BEING CRASS AND MAKING SEXUALLY SUGGESTIVE COMMENTS AND LEWD GESTURES. SHE STATED THAT SHE WENT TO THE BACK OF THE AIRPLANE TO GET AWAY FROM THIS PAX. SINCE WE HAD A MALE FLT ATTENDANT IN THE BACK; I SUGGESTED THAT HE SAY SOMETHING TO THE PAX. APPARENTLY; THE PAX THEN FELL ASLEEP. SINCE WE HAD EXTENSIVE DELAYS ALL DAY AND ESPECIALLY ON THIS FLT; WE WERE TAXIING FOR SOME TIME. THE FLT ATTENDANTS WERE FINE UNTIL THE PAX WOKE UP AND STARTED YELLING VULGARITIES. AT THIS TIME THEY SAID THAT IT WAS POSSIBLE HE MAY BE DRUNK. HE REFUSED TO TURN HIS CELL PHONE OFF WHEN ASKED BY THE FLT ATTENDANTS. I TALKED TO ALL 3 FLT ATTENDANTS AND NONE OF THEM FELT COMFORTABLE TAKING OFF AND FLYING TO ORD WITH HIM ON BOARD. THE CONCERN WAS THAT HE MIGHT POSSIBLY GO CRAZY AND DO SOMETHING STUPID. SINCE IT WAS A BAD WX DAY ANYWAY AND MORE DELAYS WERE LIKELY COMBINED WITH THE FLT ATTENDANTS' DISCOMFORT IN HAVING THIS PAX ABOARD; I DECIDED TO TAXI BACK TO THE GATE AND HAVE THE AUTHS MEET THE ACFT AND REMOVE THE PAX. APPARENTLY THIS PAX HAD A HISTORY IN HIS FILE AS THE AGENT THERE TOLD ME THIS WAS THE SECOND TIME HE HAD BEEN A PROB ON A FLT WITH MY COMPANY.
column125: AN MD80 CAPT RPTED THAT A PAX WAS SO DISRUPTIVE DURING TAXI AT MSP THAT HE DECIDED TO RETURN TO THE GATE TO OFFLOAD THE PAX.

column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Security; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Illness / Injury; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: PAX; A MAN ASSIGNED TO A SEAT; MOVED TO ANOTHER SEAT IN SAME ROW AND STARTED TO FONDLE AND THEN BITE THE BREAST OF PAX SEATED NEXT TO HIM. A MAN IN THE SEAT DIRECTLY BEHIND THE WOMAN WITNESSED ALL OF THIS; THEN ASSISTED THE FEMALE PAX BY RESTRAINING THE MALE PAX WHO WAS ATTACKING HER. THAT IS WHEN THE FLT ATTENDANTS BECAME INVOLVED. THE PERPETRATOR WAS EXTREMELY INTOXICATED AND WAS IN AND OUT OF CONSCIOUSNESS. I ADMINISTERED OXYGEN WHILE 2 NURSES ASSISTED. THE PERPETRATOR WAS BEING VERY VERBAL WHEN AWAKE; MAKING STATEMENTS LIKE; 'I DON'T WANT TO GO TO JAIL' AND KEPT APOLOGIZING. HIS SYMPTOMS WERE CONSISTENT WITH ALCOHOL OR DRUG OVERDOSE OR A COMBINATION OF THE TWO. SO I SEARCHED HIS BAG ONCE PARAMEDICS HAD COME ON AND FOUND AN EMPTY 375 MILLILITER OF VODKA AND 2 EMPTY JUICE BOTTLES THAT SMELLED OF VODKA AS WELL. PARAMEDICS TOOK THE PERPETRATOR TO THE HOSPITAL. ONLY AFTER DEPLANING DID I HEAR ABOUT THE 'ASSAULT' TO THE FEMALE PAX. I RESPONDED TO THE MEDICAL EMER ONLY. NOBODY TOLD US WHAT REALLY HAPPENED UNTIL EVERYBODY HAD DEPLANED AND THE MALE WITNESS WAS CHANGING HIS SHIRT IN THE AFT LAVATORY; DUE TO VOMIT FROM THE PERPETRATOR. I NEVER WITNESSED ANY OF THE ABOVE STATEMENTS BECAUSE I COULD NOT SEE AROUND THE BULKHEAD IN FRONT OF ME.
column125: AN MD80 FLT ATTENDANT IN CHARGE RPTED THAT AN INEBRIATED PAX ATTACKED A FEMALE PAX AND WAS RESTRAINED ON A FLT FROM SLC TO DFW.

column118: Air Traffic Control Issued New Clearance; Flight Crew Executed Go Around / Missed Approach
column121: ON BEING VECTORED FOR ILS RWY 8 AT BUR; WE WERE GIVEN OUR FINAL LOC INTERCEPT HDG; AND CLRED TO INTERCEPT THE LOC. I WAS THE PF AND HAD THE AUTOPLT ENGAGED. THE MCP WAS SET UP IN THE HDG MODE. ONCE I TURNED TO THE INTERCEPT HDG USING THE BUG; I SELECTED VOR/LOC TO CAPTURE THE LOC. BOTH THE PNF AND I OBSERVED LOC CAPTURED AND THE ACFT TURNING TO INTERCEPT. AS THE ACFT APCHED THE INBOUND COURSE; I GLANCED AT THE ALTIMETER TO CALCULATE WHERE MY ALT CALLOUTS WOULD BE MADE. WHEN I LOOKED BACK OVER TO MY PRIMARY FLT INSTS; I NOTICED WE HAD FLOWN THROUGH OUR INBOUND COURSE; AND THE ACFT WAS IN A 30 DEG L-HAND BANK. I NOTICED IT SHOWED CTL WHEEL STEERING IN THE LATERAL MODE. AT APPROX THE SAME TIME I WAS CALCULATING MY CALLOUTS; THE PNF WAS TUNING IN THE TWR FREQ. WE BOTH LOOKED UP TO NOTICE THE DISCREPANCY AT THE SAME TIME. I IMMEDIATELY INITIATED A 30 DEG BANK R-HAND TURN BACK TOWARD THE INBOUND COURSE. WE WERE APPROX 30 DEGS OFF COURSE. BEFORE WE COULD TELL APCH WE WERE GOING TO MISS THE APCH; THE CTLR IMMEDIATELY ASSIGNED A CLB AND HDG. WE WERE VECTORED BACK AROUND AND EXECUTED AN UNEVENTFUL ILS RWY 8 AND LANDED WITHOUT INCIDENT. I FEEL THE MOST IMPORTANT FACTOR WAS THE FACT THAT I ALLOWED MYSELF TO BECOME DISTR DURING A CRITICAL PHASE OF FLT. WE ALL HAVE SEEN THE AUTOPLT CAPTURE A LOC NUMEROUS TIMES WITHOUT INCIDENT; AND I FEEL THIS LEAD ME TO TAKE IT FOR GRANTED. I SHOULD HAVE DONE ALL MY CALCULATIONS BEFORE BEGINNING THE APCH. I AM NOT SURE WHY THE MCP WENT FROM A VOR/LOC CAPTURE TO CTL WHEEL STEERING MODE. WE LATER TALKED TO THE FLT ATTENDANTS; AND THEY OBSERVED A PAX WHO MAY HAVE BEEN USING THEIR CELL PHONE. I SUPPOSE RADIO INTERFERENCE IS POSSIBLE. I BELIEVE THIS INCIDENT HAS TAUGHT ME TO TAKE MY ALREADY HEIGHTENED SENSE OF AWARENESS TO A HIGHER LEVEL. ESPECIALLY DURING A CRITICAL PHASE OF FLT. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 619585: I SAW THAT THE ACFT WAS STILL IN A 30 DEG L BANK AND THE HDG HAD GONE THROUGH LOC COURSE AND WAS PASSING 030 DEGS. I NOTICED SOME LOC NEEDLE MODULATIONS ON THE MISSED APCH. IN TALKING WITH THE FLT ATTENDANTS; THEY STATED THAT THEY SUSPECTED A PAX OF HIDING BELOW SEAT LEVEL AND USING HIS CELL PHONE DURING THE APCH. I AM NOT CERTAIN THE CAUSE OF THE EVENT BUT; I SUSPECT THAT AS THE AUTOPLT HAD THE ACFT IN A 30 DEG L BANK TO INTERCEPT THE LOC; CELL PHONE INTERFERENCE CAUSED THE LOC NEEDLE TO DEFLECT FULL SCALE TO THE L. THE AUTOPLT CONTINUED THE TURN; TRYING TO INTERCEPT THE DEFLECTED NEEDLE AND WHEN THE NEEDLE SWUNG BACK TO A FULL R DEFLECTION; THE AUTOPLT REVERTED BACK TO CTL WHEEL STEERING; LEAVING US IN A 30 DEG BANKED L TURN.
column125: A B737-700 AUTOPLT GOES INTO CTL WHEEL STEERING MODE DURING AN ILS-LOC COURSE INTERCEPTION. FLT CREW EXPERIENCES A HDG TRACK DEV AND A MISSED APCH FROM SCT CTLR 9 MI W OF BUR; CA.

column94: Flight Attendant (On Duty); Flight Attendant In Charge
column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 19; Flight Attendant Total 19; Flight Attendant Type 90
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FLT ATTENDANT #7 CAME TO FIRST CLASS TO TELL ME THAT PAX IN BUSINESS CLASS HAD GRABBED HER ARM AND REPEATEDLY THRUST HER OPENED PALM OF HER HAND INTO FLT ATTENDANT #7'S FACE DUE TO THE FACT THAT FLT ATTENDANT #7 HAD TOLD HER THAT SHE HAD NO EXTRA BUTTER TO GIVE TO HER DAUGHTER. I WENT BACK AND INFORMED PAX THAT SHE WAS NOT TO TOUCH ANY MEMBER OF MY CREW AT WHICH TIME PAX THRUST THE PALM OF HER HAND AT MY FACE. I REPEATED 2 MORE TIMES IN A LOUD; STERN VOICE THAT SHE WAS NOT TO TOUCH ANY MEMBER OF MY CREW FOR ANY REASON; WHATSOEVER. SHE CALMED DOWN AND ASKED ME TO LISTEN TO HER. SHE TRIED TO TURN IT AROUND AND ACCUSED FLT ATTENDANT #7 OF GRABBING HER. PAX SITTING BEHIND PROB PAX WAS SHAKING HIS HEAD 'NO' AND POINTING AT PAX; MEANING 'SHE DID IT.' I APOLOGIZED TO PAX THAT; INDEED; WE HAD NO EXTRA BUTTER AND INFORMED HER THAT IF THIS CONTINUED; I WOULD HAVE TO HAVE ANOTHER FLT ATTENDANT SERVE HER. NO FURTHER INCIDENT ON BOARD. ON THE GND; I LOOKED AT PAX'S PNR AND SAW IN THE RECORD THAT SHE HAD BEEN VERBALLY ABUSING A RESERVATION AGENT. HER HUSBAND AND DAUGHTER WERE TRAVELING WITH HER UNDER DIFFERENT NAMES. IN HUSBAND'S RECORD; IT ALSO NOTED ABRUPT CONVERSATION WITH RESERVATION AGENT INVOLVING AN UPGRADE.
column125: A B777 FLT ATTENDANT IN CHARGE RPTED THAT ONE OF HER FLT ATTENDANTS WAS ACCOSTED BY AN ANGRY PAX WHO DEMANDED; BUT DID NOT RECEIVE; EXTRA SVC DURING A FLT FROM EGLL TO ORD.

column94: Flight Attendant In Charge; Flight Attendant (On Duty)
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: FLT ATTENDANT #3 CAME TO ME DURING BOARDING AND SAID A PAX IN AN EXIT ROW WOULD NOT ACKNOWLEDGE HER ABOUT THE EXIT BRIEFING. I WENT BACK AND HE SAID MOVE SOMEONE ELSE NEXT TO HIM TO DO IT. I EXPLAINED HE HAD TO ALSO ACCEPT THE RESPONSIBILITY AND ASKED IF HE KNEW HOW TO OPEN IT. HE SAID; 'TRAIN ME.' HE MENTIONED BEFORE HE SITS THERE ALL THE TIME AND NO ONE ASKED HIM HOW! I EXPLAINED PROC AND HE STILL COULD NOT REPEAT IT. I WAS NOT COMFORTABLE WITH HIS ABILITY AND ASKED THE AGENT TO MOVE HIM. HE THEN REFUSED SAYING HIS KNEE WAS BAD AND HE NEEDED THE ROOM. THE CAPT HAD TO GO BACK TO ASK HIM TO MOVE; CASING A SLIGHT DELAY. SUPPLEMENTAL INFO FROM ACN 621144: I WAS BRIEFING EXIT ROWS. PAX IN EXIT ROW WOULD NOT ACKNOWLEDGE ME. HE REFUSED TO ANSWER. I TOLD HIM HE HAD TO ANSWER. HE TOLD ME HE DIDN'T WANT TO THINK ABOUT IT AND THAT I SHOULD TRAIN HIM. HE THEN TOLD ME TO SEAT A PERSON NEXT TO HIM SO THAT PERSON COULD OPERATE THE EXIT. I TOLD HIM HE WOULD HAVE TO MOVE FROM THE EXIT ROW. HE REFUSED. I THEN WENT FOR THE PURSER BECAUSE SHE GETS THE 'BIG BUCKS' TO DEAL WITH THESE SITS. AFTER 2 OTHER FLT ATTENDANTS AND THE RELIEF PLT AND THE AGENT TALKED TO HIM; HE FINALLY CHANGED ROWS.
column125: A B767 CABIN CREW RPTED PAX'S UNWILLINGNESS TO ACCEPT RESPONSIBILITY FOR THE EMER EXIT DOOR DURING A FLT FROM DFW TO HNL.

column96: Flight Attendant Total 35
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural Published Material / Policy; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: RELIGIOUS OFFICIAL WENT TO BACK GALLEY AREA AND BROUGHT ALL HIS PRAYER THINGS AND STARTED PRAYING (WE WANTED TO STACK OUR MEAL SVC). WE ASKED THE CAPT TO TURN ON THE SEATBELT SIGN; SO THE PAX WOULD GO BACK TO HIS SEAT. HE IGNORED THE FLT ATTENDANTS WHEN THEY ASKED HIM TO GO BACK TO HIS SEAT. THE PURSER CAME BACK AND DID THE SAME -- HE WOULD NOT STOP PRAYING AND IGNORED US ALL AND WAVED HIS HAND 'NO' IN FRONT OF PURSER'S FACE. HE STAYED THERE FOR AT LEAST 20 MINS; NOT PAYING ANY MIND OR ATTN TO OUR REQUEST THAT HE SIT DOWN. WHEN HE FINISHED; HE WENT BACK TO HIS SEAT; BUT LEFT ALL HIS PRAYER THINGS ON OUR BACK JUMPSEAT. HE DISRUPTED OUR SVC AND REFUSED AND REFUSED TO TAKE ANY REQUESTS BY A FEMALE FLT ATTENDANT.
column125: A B767 FLT ATTENDANT RPTED THAT A RELIGIOUS OFFICIAL REFUSED TO LISTEN TO ANY OF THE FEMALE FLT ATTENDANTS WHEN THEY ASKED HIM TO LEAVE THE GALLEY AREA DURING A FLT FROM LAX TO JFK.

column96: Flight Attendant Airline Total 38; Flight Attendant Total 38; Flight Attendant Type 100
column113: Deviation / Discrepancy - Procedural FAR; Flight Deck / Cabin / Aircraft Event Passenger Misconduct
column121: I WASN'T DIRECTLY INVOLVED IN THIS INCIDENT; BUT KNOW A LITTLE BIT ABOUT IT. IT INVOLVED A COUPLE AND THEIR TODDLER IN MAIN CABIN. AS WE WERE BACKING OUT FROM THE GATE; THE MOTHER; WITH CHILD; GOT OUT OF THEIR SEATS TO GO TO THE RESTROOM. I SAW THIS FROM MY JUMP SEAT AT 3R; BUT THEY WERE HEADED FORWARD TO LAVATORY AFT OF BUSINESS CLASS ON B767-200. I KNOW A BUSINESS CLASS FLT ATTENDANT SPOKE TO THEM; BUT DON'T REMEMBER IF THEY RETURNED TO THEIR SEATS OR USED THE RESTROOM. THE NEXT INCIDENT WAS ABOUT THE FASTENING OF SEAT BELTS WHEN SIGN WAS TURNED ON AND THERE WAS DISCUSSION ABOUT THIS. THE COUPLE AND CHILD WERE SEATED IN SEATS ABOUT 1/3 AFT OF FORWARD PART OF MAIN CABIN. I REMEMBER THAT #1 FLT ATTENDANT WAS CALLED TO COME BACK AND SPEAK TO THEM. LATER; AFTER WATER SVC; THE CALL LIGHT WENT OFF ABOVE THEIR SEAT AND FLT ATTENDANT #2 WENT TO ANSWER IT AND COME BACK TO REAR OF PLANE. THEN THE HUSBAND CAME TO BACK OF PLANE AND ACCUSED #2 FLT ATTENDANT OF NOT LIKING CHILDREN; WANTING HER FULL NAME; ETC. HE WAS 'HEATED' AND NOT NICE. THEN CALL LIGHT LATER KEPT RINGING ABOVE THEIR SEATS; SO I WENT TO ANSWER IT. THE CHILD WAS THE ONE RINGING IT. THEIR RESPONSE WAS; 'WELL; CAN'T YOU TURN THE BELL OFF SO IT DOESN'T RING?' I TOLD THEM THAT COULD NOT BE DONE IN THE EVENT SOMEONE NEEDED US FOR AN EMER. THE MOTHER ALSO KEPT TAKING THE CHILD UP TO BUSINESS CLASS TO SEE A CHILD THE SAME AGE. (THIS WAS AFTER ALL SVC WERE COMPLETED IN BUSINESS CLASS.) I JUST FELT THESE WERE VERY PERMISSIVE PARENTS WHO FELT THE PLANE WAS THEIR CHILD'S PLAY PEN AND THAT OUR RULES DIDN'T APPLY TO THEM. WITH THEIR ATTITUDES AND ACTIONS; BOY ARE THEY IN FOR A PROB CHILD DOWN THE LINE.
column125: A B767 FLT ATTENDANT DESCRIBED THE ANTICS OF PARENTS AND THEIR CHILD'S RINGING OF THE FLT ATTENDANT CHIME DURING A FLT FROM JFK TO LAX.
